title: Good experience
text:
Top pillows and mattress, giant long size bed, top comfort
At the end of the afternoon there were very good cookies for free at the reception
Reasonable breakfast
Good view of the empire
10 minutes walk from Times Square, we did all the attractions on foot, and it was peaceful

title: The Best Experience with Staff
text: I never usually write a review, but after spending the night with my 2 young children and Mother we were really thrilled with our stay and the staff. First, the location of the hotel is really convenient and the room was great! But most importantly the front desk staff especially Deidra were super friendly and helpful! She went out of her way to help with subway directions, when we came back the next morning the valet man asked how we enjoyed the Yankee game! You don’t always get such kind and genuine people greeting you at a hotel and this was so refreshing to see! My only negative thing was the breakfast was cold, but the poor woman was running around frantically trying her very best to clean up and keep refreshing the food and you could tell it wasn’t her fault!! Great Job Staff!

title: In the center of everything - with a few downsides.
text: I stayed here with a team of 35 people here for work in March. Proximity to everything is excellent. Train station, bus/subway access, plenty of delis and a 7/11 all within one block of the hotel. The hotel breakfast was not particularly athlete-friendly but also not bad, which saved a lot of cash. Rooms very small but tidy, bathrooms could use fix-ups and a deeper clean. What stressed us the most was 1) finding out upon arrival that there is a 300 USD deposit on every single room rented, which unexpectedly showed up on one of our staff's credit cards two days after check-in, and 2) the two lifts are extremely slow, janky, and small. Waiting for the lift on the 30th floor took on average 10-15 minutes (no exaggeration) and even once we got in the elevator, we hit every single floor on the way down almost every time. Some of our team got stuck in the elevator for an hour at night and got to meet FDNY, which is maybe a unique tourist experience. ALL IN ALL: expensive, but some perks and the location is great. If you're just sleeping in the hotel and nothing more, it's probably perfect. Plan for extra time and extra cost.

title: Never mind
text: Quite old and poorly renovated hotel, small and noisy room. Even though I qualified as a Hilton gold tier, I was given a room near the servants' warehouse resulting in loud noises at all hours, not to mention the view of the rooftop from the breakfast room. If we want to talk about breakfast then the score could be even lower, being lactose intolerant I asked if they had vegetable milk and the answer was that they didn't know what I was talking about. The only positive note is the location.

title: Nice stay
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights in February. Were a family of 4 and this is our 5th time visiting so we're fairly experienced when it comes to hotels in NYC.
If you want to be near Time Square then this hotel is great.
There is amazing breakfast served every morning and the staff really are amazing and cannot do enough for you, there is also coffee available 24/7.
The rooms are quite small but unless you want to pay thousands that's very standard for NYC.
Overall we had a great experience and would definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointed
text:
Unfriendly staff, the room was only cleaned twice in a week. The breakfast really left something to be desired. I recommend having breakfast outside. The only positive point is that the hotel is well located
I do not recommend this hotel

title: hotel in general
text:
The hotel is not recommendable
Wifi was bad, no hot water for the shower and the hotel staff is not friendly. 
Breakfast nothing special and no buffet or fresh selection
The hotel is rather unkempt and the staff did not always make the bed. For the price we paid and it wasn't very expensive but still too much.

title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER
text:
This is the very WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE that I have ever experienced in my life, and I am in the hotel business. 231 East 43rd St., On the 1st night checked that we checked in Manhattan, New York, everything seamed to be fine. We went out and that evening we came back to the room and it was cold in our room. So we turned the heater up to about 72 degrees, and called the front desk and asked for extra blankets, we were told that they were in the drawer. Obviously they expected problems in this room. We were very cold that night because the heater was not working properly, even after we turned it up to 80 degrees. The next morning before we went out we asked for extra blankets and informed them that the heater was not working, they stated that they would send maintenance up to repair the heater. We returned that afternoon and at this time the heater was working, it was set to 85 degrees, but extremely hot in the room so we turned it off. Before we went out to dinner, when we returned the room it was cold again, so we turned the heater back on to 80 degrees went to bed Around 9pm, we realized that the room was still very cold, so we turned the heater off, and used the extra blankets. 
About 10pm the heater came back on and started to blow cold air automatically all though it was switched off. Then we disconnected it from inside the heater unit, 
but the heater still would not turn off. The outside temperature was between 18 - 24 degrees and it was snowing. Then my wife called the front desk and spoke to the front desk night manager Victoria, my wife tried to explain the situation and Victoria and she continued to speak over her, and would not listen. Victoria then said that she would send up a maintenance guy up at 10:15 pm. My wife attempted to tell her that it was after 10 pm and her husband was trying to sleep, due to an early morning flight. This would have been very inconvenient due to the fact that we were in bed. After all of the commotion my husband was woken up, Victoria the night desk manager then hung up on my wife. 
Then my husband called down to speak with her and Victoria did the same to him, speaking over him and not listening to what was going on with the heater. 
The next morning we came down stairs to go to the airport, a very nice young man was very apologetic. We then left, after returning home my husband made several calls to the general manager Brianna, but he received no response. I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone, due to the VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE, 
and as I stated I am in the hotel business. 
I then contacted the corporate office of Hampton with little luck due to this Hampton was a franchise. DO NOT go to this hotel.

title: Great hotel
text:
Last time we were 3 generations going, this time me and my girlfriend. We must say that the hotel has a great location, the staff is friendly, the rooms are nice (get one on the top floors if you can). Breakfast is good - but be there early if you dont want to much waitingtime.
The only bad thing we can point fingers at is that there are only 2 elevators and that cause lots of waiting time, especially in rush hours. The hotel have 32 floors and if you are located up high, you dont normally use the stairs, so you are forced to wait. But besides that, its a great hotel and well come back some other time.

title: Usual Hampton Inn
text: This was a basic Hampton Inn.  Rooms were average and the elevators were always packed.  Breakfast was a bit of a zoo, it was simple and well stocked.  I think it catered to the budget business segment as well as family tourists.  Location is not bad at all and it was quite central to walk around Manhattan.  The street that the hotel is on was usually pretty crowded and safe.

title: Standard but okay!
text:
Our stay with Hampton Inn was standard. It’s definitely a budget hotel and priced accordingly. The heating/fan in our room was rubbish and we’d wake up in the night having to turn it off, change settings etc.

Our room was cleaned every day which was nice. However the bedding was not good quality and made me and my partner develop itchy patches on our skin. 

Breakfast was terrible but we only tried it once and didnt go back. However you didn’t have to pay for this! 

Our security deposit was paid promptly after leaving.

title: Choose somewhere
text:
People from this hotel are fraud, The charge double and do not refund your deposit Never, Took our 150 USD deposit never refunded.  So be care  and choose other hotel, Very rude staff, Dirty Room. 
Several days same breakfast, never they clean our room while staying three nights. Very poor customer Service,

title: ottimo albergo! qualità prezzo top!
text:
ero scettica viste le ultime recensioni, anche su booking..e invece io cocciuta ho rischiato e prenotato qui! e devo dire che sono rimasta molto soddisfatta! Ottima soluzione a un prezzo più che valido. Camere piccoline con letti molto comodi, buona colazione varia ed abbondante, personale cortese,soprattutto il cameriere, gentilissimo! (non ricordo il nome, ma vorrei fargli un saluto e ringraziarlo perchè ogni mattina ci preparava i waffles x tutta la famiglia! 
La posizione è molto centrale e vicina alle più belle attrazioni turistiche.
lo consiglio assolutamente!
era indicato in fase di prenotazione che le pulizie venivano fatte ogni 4gg e invece nel ns caso sono venute il secondo giorno e pure gli altri, senza aver fatto nessuna richiesta particolare! altra cosa indicavano deposito 75$/notte e invece ci hanno trattenuto come deposito solo 150 (noi abbiamo fatto 5 notti!)
io sono rimasta piacevolmente sorpresa da tutto e soddisfatta della scelta!
molto comodo anche il deposito bagagli il giorno di partenza!

title: Disappointing
text:
The only good thing about this hotel is the location.  The wifi was terrible. 
The wait for the elevator was brutal.  Many times when we finally got on the elevator...staff would hold the elevator between levels while having conversations with other staff members on those levels.  I felt it was very disrespectful to guests.  We even got an eye roll from a staff member when our elevator was full and she couldn't get on it.  Aside from one staff member, I found the staff unfriendly.  They did offer free cookies one night during our stay and they were pretty tasty.  But even with the good location and cookies...I wouldn't stay here again.

title: Hotel muito bom e boa localização
text:
O hotel é bem.localizado a 12min andando para a Times Square.
O café da manhã é gostoso.
Tem frutas, iorgute, waffle,omelete, ovos cozido e mexidos,suco, cafe, leite,paes, bolo.
Para um hotel americano o café estava bem farto.
Os 2 elevadores estavam funcionando normalmente  e o  quarto era grande, o chuveiro sai pouca água mas nada reclamar.
A noite na recepção tem uns cookies de cortesia maravilhosos.

title: Will look for other options next time
text: We stayed here Friday and Saturday. We are Hilton Honors members so we stay at Hampton Inns very frequently. We did not have the best experience and will look for other options when traveling to NYC next time. The rooms are very small. Two small elevators for all the floors so there was usually a line. They do have stairs which are only accessible when an employee unlocks the door. The room beside us on the second floor we are assuming was being used for housekeeping. There were stacks of towels, housekeeping carts, and continual loud noise. We only had warm water one day when my daughter showered at night. For $600/night, I feel that we should have at least a warm shower in the morning. I checked out a day early and was told that we would not be charged. I never received the receipt email like I normally do. When I went back to the hotel a couple hours later to question it, I was never checked out the first time. Thankfully they did not  charge me the third night.

title: Going downhill
text: This place seemed tired and overextended compared to previous stays. Elevators took forever, room cleanliness was so so and breakfast was light. Staff ranged from disinterested  to lacking skills. The lady dragging chairs on the floor in the breakfast room says it all. Disappointing !

title: They never refund your deposit , Be Care while booking this hotel
text:
We have stayed this hotel on June 20 to 22nd, -2023,  They have never refunded our 150 USD Deposit with many phone call as well as many emails,. which was swiped by my card. Every call they say our manger is out for now. Shouting while reply, 
Very poor service, No value of money. Be care with this fraudulent, Absolutely not recommended.

title: Disappointing customer service !!!
text: Friend of mine and I stayed at this hotel 20th -22nd June 2023 during our start of US trip.Booking was made via Hilton Honor official website. Hotel room was small breakfast was very basic. When we checked in they took $150 USD security deposit from my card even my stay prepaid in advance. They supposed to hold the deposit but they charged on my card. I may have made 30 phone call to reception and manager. Until now my $150 USD security deposit is not refunded back to my card. Hotel is highly dishonest. I can't believe this kind service I didn't expected from service from Hilton hotel. I kind of give up I contact Hilton hotel headquarter their respond is bland. They are not helpful either solving the issue. Every-time I call them they told me to call back 11:00am which 11:00pm in Nepal. It really cash hungry hotel. I highly recommend other travelers to avoid this hotel. You might be another victim by the hotel management.

title: Very poor hotel for the price
text: SO many problems with this hotel. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash bottles all empty upon arrival.  When I asked for them to bring it up, they said there was no one to do that and I had to come down.  When I went down, they then said they had none.  Then a guy finally brought some and instead of installing them on the wall, he handed them to me. Although asked for many times, did not get housekeeping until night 3 and even then, they did not install them, so I am thinking they never even look int he shower to clean anything.  Toilet seat practically falling off the toilet.  So, if they cleaned the toilet, they should have seen this.  Chair in room was disgusting with all sorts of gross stains all over it.  Sticky residue left on nightstand from previous guest.  I don't even want to know what it was.  Room itself was so small you can hardly get past the bed to get to the bathroom without stubbing your toe.  And to charge 80,000 points per night for this hotel is an insult.

title: Una ottima esperienza !
text:
Ottima soluzione a un prezzo accettabile dopo gli aumenti degli ultimi anni. Camere rinnovate con letti comodissimi, buona colazione varia ed abbondante,  personale cortese , biscotti nel pomeriggio, the e caffè sempre disponibili.
Avevo letto delle brutte recensioni ma tutto si è dimostrato non vero. 
La posizione è centralissima e vicina alle più belle attrazioni turistiche.

title: Worn Hotel but Pricey - Not Hampton Inn Level
text: This is a very outdated hotel for a Hampton Inn.  And it was quite expensive.   I stayed here three nights.  Before coming, I picked my room as the Hampton Inn allows.  I chose Room 204.  However, they gave me a room several floors higher.  They told me that is not an actual guest room but a storage room.  He also said this is always a problem since guests select this room.  It seems like Room 204 should not be a choice then.  Had this not been a choice I could have chosen another second floor room. I usually choose a low floor due to some hotels having slow elevator service.  And the elevator service was terrible.  Also, the lights for many floors would not light up in the elevators.  The two elevators were slow and there is no space for guests to wait by the elevators.  The lobby and area by the elevators is quite tight.   I usually took the stairs but a staff member had to unlock the door to take the stairs up so that was not so easy.   The room was rather small, worn and dated.  There were used bars of soap in the shower.  The water from the faucet was warm so I brushed my teeth with warm water.  It was difficult to get warm water in the shower.  Perhaps I should have brushed my teeth in the shower where I got cold water.  The staff was polite and helpful.  Housekeeping stopped by when I was in the room two days though I did not need nor request anything.  The housekeeping staff I interacted with was good.  The breakfast was very good though that area is not spacious but it did not get crowded so I was happy with breakfast.  The lady running that area did a great job.  The location is great in some ways (close to Penn Station, Times Square, subway, etc.) and not so good in other ways (homeless people sleeping on the block and not clean).   I am surprised that this is still a Hampton Inn.  I would have given it a slightly higher star rating if it had not been so expensive for when one gets.

title: Not up to the Hampton Inn standards
text: Comfortable room, but difficult access due to elevator limitations. Breakfast was fine but coffee unavailable through the rest of the day. TV system failed completely for our last full day. Limited lobby staff so no concierge advice.

title: I Paid Extra To Leave Early, Never Coming Back
text:
I was recently in NYC for a work event, and chose this hotel because it was literally on the same block as the venue, and I was anticipating a fair amount of travel between the two, multiple times a day.  

Because it was a work trip, I set the bar for my lodging expectations fairly low:  I need a private bathroom, a comfortable bed, good wifi to get work done, and some way to acquire breakfast (either within the hotel, or very close by).  That's it.  And while I *technically* did experience these things (which is why this is not a one star review), the quality of each was so sub-par, I wound up shortening my trip and checking out out early.  My sliding shower door barely slid and required significant force (and I say that as someone who is 5'10" and works out regularly).  The toilet handle was not attached to the tank, and was just hanging out the side.  The pillows were each so flat, I could ball one up and grip it in my hand.  Good luck with breakfast if you don't eat meat or are trying to limit carbs.  And the clincher--that is the worst wifi connection I have experienced in YEARS.  Oh, but wouldn't you know it, for $5, I could have a "premium" connection; I shouldn't have to pay extra to simply browse the internet and respond to emails.  I couldn't *function* in this room.

I could look past the occasional cosmetic issues--inexplicable stains on the mirrors, chipped furniture, etc (I don't think anyone staying here is expecting luxury), but there were enough to notice that collectively, the room felt very worn and tired.  I found the staff cold (with the exception of one maintenance worker I kept bumping into), with zero acknowledgement that I was a Hilton Honors member (I should note that I personally don't need this acknowledged, but in the after-stay survey I was emailed, this was a detail about which they asked).  When I checked out early, the woman at the front desk was visibly confused, asked another employee for assistance, who curtly and without any eye contact or acknowledgement that something might be amiss to require the early departure, simply said, "yeah, it's fine."  No goodbye, no thank you, nothing.  Just, "ok, that's it."

There are two other hotels on this block, and when I return for the same work event next year, I will be staying elsewhere.  I was willing to spend an additional $125 to move my flight early just to avoid staying in this hotel any longer than I had to.

title: excellent position
text: I stayed in the hotel many years ago: comfortable hotel near Times Square, friendly staff, very close to the subway, excellent breakfast, our room was large with nice touches of class with a decent view of the city recommended

title: Don’t come here if you do avoid Adnan J
text:
Had the worst service ever from the reception manager Adnan j (would not tell me their full name) came to this hotel because it was a celebration of my sisters life a trip of a lifetime. The hotel and booking was originally for my sister and mother they had been saving for a while to travel first class and go to New York. My sister had sickle-cell and shortly after her 38th birthday she past away. Not wanting to cancel the trip we paid to change the name and rebook the rooms and flights for October. We got the booking confirmed with booking.com got an additional room for myself and my partner. Fast forward to the arrival asking the receptionist we have a booking for two rooms under our surname, says the normal pleasantries and begins searching the system, then calls his manager over and continues searching 3-5 minutes go by, either of them have not looked up from the computer screen. I then ask what is there a problem, to then be told we have only booked 1 room although we have the confirmation they have rejected the booking as “reservations are none refundable or moveable” hotel policy. Although we have documentation showing it had been refunded and rebooked. The staff mainly Adnan j then say we need to call booking.com and get a refund from them and then book with the hotel to get the additional room we have already paid for. 

We then call booking.com they say don’t worry we will sort this out and call the hotel, they then reject the reservation again and say we need to get a refund and book again with them? 

I then asked, as they requested us to call booking.com to resolve the issue they called you and again you cancel or reject the reservation. 

I am not happy to be honest I came here to send off my sister and this has changed my whole outlook on New York as it was my first time here and it’s just incompetence booking.com where fantastic said they would pay again no additional charge to us etc and the staff reject it.

title: Great location just of Times Square.
text: Was very impressed by this hotel,even though some of the reviews were negative.But we had nothing but good memories from our stay,and the fact that the breakfast was available every morning was a great start to each day,allowing us to enjoy the sights a lot quicker every morning instead of trying to find somewhere for food.Hotel was clean,could do with a refurb somewhat,but did not affect our impression on our stay.Would definitely go back without a doubt! As for everyone's comments on the lifts,we had no issues whatsoever.

title: Good location, hotel is VERY worn
text:
tThe staff are friendly and helpful. Alonso was on top of luggage and very helpful in managing the multitude of people. The rooms are small, the internet is crap, the elevators are slow and I felt like I was checking into a hostel. The room was typical NY size, small but adequate. The bathroom felt a bit dirty but the sheets seemed changed, let's hope they were. 

Breakfast Air conditioning was fine. For one night, it was okay but for USD $800, I'd book elsewhere (Motto, Ace hotel or Hoxton in Williamsburg). We only booked here because of a lack of availability in NY that night and had no choice. The Hilton brand in NY has been a serious disappointment, go with Marriott if you were to switch chains.

title: CENTRAL, CLEAN AND BREAKFAST INCLUDED.
text:
WE ARRIVED EARLY EVENING FOR A 3 NIGHT STAY.  ONE OF THREE ELEVATORS WAS BROKEN SO ALL THREE SHUTDOWN FOR AN HOUR.  TWO
BACK IN SERVICE, ROOM QUITE SMALL BUT CLEAN WITH NICE SHOWER BATHROOM.  DECENT BREAKFAST WITH DAILY CHANGES OF HOT DISHES BUT ARRIVE BEFORE 8:00 AM TO AVOID ELEVATOR CRUSH!  NICE STAFF, TEA & COFFEE IN LOBBY AS WELL AS PRE-PACKAGED FOOD & MICROWAVE TO HEAT UP.  VERY CLOSE TO TIMES SQUARE AND HOP ON HOP OFF BUS.

title: Had to give it another try!
text: Tried this hotel again after an earlier stay did not work out so well. We like the central location and appreciate the quick walk to nearby Times Square,  42nd St and all of the eateries.  We arrived midday Thursday for a two day stay. A few front desk clerks were on to handle the checkins and we were on our way to the room in no time. Both elevators were functional and the lobby had popcorn and refreshments. Room was fresh, clean and well stocked with towels, pillows etc. Showers were hot and had dispensers of body wash, shampoo and conditioner.  Comfy bed too. Breakfast each morning was plentiful, delicious and had both hot and cold options.  Fresh brewed coffee was constantly replenished as needed. All staff members were smiling and friendly and willing to please. Looking forward to our next visit.  Enjoy!

title: Perfettamente perfetto
text: Materasso comodissimo, per non parlare dei cuscini super soffici! Posizione ottima, comoda alla metro e dal bus. Ottima colazione, ogni giorno diversa.Camera con vista mozzafiato!! Dalla finestra empire a sinistra e edge a destra!

title: Health Violations, Unresponsive Management
text: We checked in on Thursday. There were 2 used bars of soap left in our shower. One on a shelf in the shower the other on top of the shower door trac. We went to the front desk several times between checking in and Sunday, asking for our shower to be cleaned so we could use it.  Housekeepers did not understand what we were saying even when we were using google translate to communicate with them. And front desk staff just kept saying they would pass it on to housekeeping. One housekeeper came and removed one of the 2 used bars of soap but did not have any cleaning supplies with them, just a garbage bag. On Sunday evening my kids made a fort with the comforter on the bed which we discovered was covered in someone elses blood on the underside. We went back to the desk and the supervisor, head of housekeeping and one other staff member came to our room so we could show them. Sunday evening our bedding was changed and the remaining used soap removed and body wash refilled but the shower was still not cleaned with cleaning supplies. I asked the desk for a print out of all our requests to have our shower cleaned but he just verbally read them to me. I am uterly disgusted with the lack of sanitation with this hotel, and the seriousness of blood soiled bedding being left for the next occupants. We have several photos of the bloody blanket, the used soaps, the mold in the shower which they did have someone remove as soon as they saw it. (The 3 staff noted they could smell it themself as they walked in the bathroom with us.) Hygene and sanitation are overlooked and guests are put at risk because of it. I am disiponted in the lack of action from management in dealing with this seriously hazardious situation.

title: Two Days in New York City
text:
We arrived on 7/5.  I was travelling with my grandson, and this was his first visit to New York.  The young man at the desk, in the evening, was amazing.  And he had the very best smile.  Very kind.  The young lady the next morning was very kind.  Was very nice to assist in directions and information.  

We had an issue where our door jammed.  Maintenance was there in no time to help us get back in our room.  And was very quick to fix it.

I was very PLEASANTLY surprised to have housekeeping during our visit.  This was the first time since Covid that my room had been cleaned during my visit on the very first day of my visit.  Very much appreciated.

Breakfasf was pretty good.  We only ate the first day.  There was scrambled eggs with chives, breakfast potatoes.  It was tasty.  There was also other options and fruit offered.  

It was a good visit and I'm glad I chose this hotel to stay at.

title: Inaccettabile
text:
Tralasciando commenti sul degrado della  zona circostante l'hotel poiché non responsabilità dello stesso, mi vorrei soffermare su alcuni elementi important: la pulizia mediocre della camera e soprattutto l'aria irrespirabile nella stessa hanno reso in mio soggiorno terribile! Al di là del costo della camera, trovarsi in una simile condizione non è accettabile, umanamente accettabile: odore di muffa misto ad umidità  persistente nonostante abbia aperto,  nei limiti del consentito, la finestra.  Ho pensato di richiedere la sostituzione della camera ma appena uscito dalla porta mi sono reso conto che l'odore era presente in tutto il piano.
Forse la Catena dovrebbe investire i sicuri ricavi in una dovuta ristrutturazione.
Nulla da dire sulla cordialità dei dipendenti e sulla colazione come da standard.

title: More like a motel
text: Hotel is very dated. Bathroom needs to be updated. With the number of rooms in the hotel, there are only two elevators. It takes a long time to get to the lobby, especially in the morning during breakfast or at checkout. The dining area for breakfast is quite small. Guests are literally on top of each other. Overall, we will not return. Not what we expected from a Hilton property. For the price of what we paid, we could have stayed at a better property.

title: Voto solo per la posizione
text:
Ho soggiornato 5 notti a questo hotel.
Oltre alla posizione veramente ottima, a 3 min a piedi da Times Square e di fronte la metro, non ci sono altri punti favorevoli per questo hotel.
Pulizia nella media MA non fanno le pulizie nelle stanze se non si richiesta e siccome non te lo dice nessuno alla reception quando fai il check in quando siamo rientrati dopo la prima giornata in giro per la city ho dovuto rifare i letti e sistemare il bagno…..
Un altro punto negativo va alla colazione
Poca pochissima scelta e di bassa qualità pochi posti a sedere e gente costretta a fare ore di fila per prendere il cibo..
Ultimo ma non meno importante aspetto negativo è la lentezza degli ascensori lenti lenti a salire e scendere sempre super affollato potevi passare anche 15 min prima che potessi riuscire a prenderlo…
L hotel  non è affatto economico e sinceramente si potrebbe trovare di meglio allo stesso prezzo.
Non lo consiglio se non per la posizione

title: Muy buen servicio
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado, habitaciones cómodas, limpias y bien equipadas , aire acondicionado funciona bien y no es ruidoso. El desayuno es bueno pero con mucha gente por lo que cuesta un poco encontrar mesa. Muy bueno en relación a calidad y precio.

title: Si no eres escrupuloso, es un buen hotel
text: Empezaré por lo bueno: el personal de cafetería y recepción, los desayunos y la situación (a 10 minutos de Times Square). Lo malo: suelo enmoquetado muy viejo, mal olor en la habitación, cortinas que no han sido lavadas en años, uno de los dos ascensores casi todo el tiempo roto, provocando colas de hasta 10 minutos, gente en la calle drogándose. Lo peor: la limpieza de las habitaciones. Algún día no la han limpiado y otros días han dejado en el WC un regalito: caca o pipí.

title: Close to all the action!
text:
We came as a small group to spend 7-9 days in NYC with a youth group.   We arrived on a Saturday.  Our first experience was that we could not all be on the same floor.   Then we noted that the elevator was out of service.  Service with the remaining elevator was slow.  On Monday, it became really hard as there was a worker operating it.  And, Friday morning it took over 30 minutes to get to breakfast even with both working.

The room was fine.  It had two comfy beds, some storage space and an awesome shower.  Our room was cleaned once even though I had the not to disturb sign out.  Breakfast was good.  Only challenge was they were out of OJ and it had cranberry juice.

The location was great, the elevator left a lot to be desired  - other than that, it was a good place for home base.

title: Ok
text:
Siamo una famiglia di 4 persone e abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 10 giorni.
Pro:
-  Ottima la posizione vicino a Time Square e alla stazione della metro.
-  Personale cordiale e disponibile.
-  Colazione discreta.
-  Camera piccola ma funzionale.
Contro:
- Ascensori sempre occupati! Soprattutto all'ora di colazione l'attesa a volte era lunga.
- Pulizia della nostra camera un po' approssimativa.
- Aria condizionata un po' rumorosa.
- Ci è stata chiesta una cauzione di 150$ e a tutt'oggi non abbiamo ancora ricevuto il rimborso. Ho provato a contattare l'hotel tramite mail ma ancora nessuna risposta.

Nel complesso un  hotel discreto. Visti i prezzi in zona, per quello che abbiamo pagato, ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo.

title: Don’t stay here
text: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Nothing works. Broken elevators,ice machines and inoperable room phones. I would never stay here again.  The hotel also has a strange smell. One whole floor smelled of vomit. A very overpriced room for a horrible experience.

title: Not sure how this hotel can be associated with Hampton Inn
text:
This had to be worst experience I have ever had staying at a Hampton Inn property.  Due to my job, I have stayed at multiple Hilton properties achieving Diamond Level in their Hilton Honors frequency program.  
Upon arrival, there was some chaos and commotion throughout the lobby with guests and luggage throughout.  We arrived after check in but rooms were not available for guests to be checked in which included ours.  The desk agent greeted me to share that we had a king room with three guests and I shared that I actually had 4 guests and would need a room with two beds.  She mentioned that the hotel was sold out and I questioned how the reservation would have been handled even with 3 guests in a king room.  Eventually I was checked into a room and I asked specifically whether the room had two beds and was assured that it did.  
Upon going up to the room, I was not surprised to find that the room did NOT have a second bed but did have a sofa which I found actually was a sofa sleeper.  When I pulled out the mattress, there was no linens on the mattress and noted that there were multiple issues (stains, marks, etc.) with the mattress but since two beds appeared to be an issue with the hotel, we would do what we needed to do to make it work.  I attempted to call down to the front desk to ask for linens but the phone did not work, no dial tone although it was connected to the jack in the wall outlet.  
We returned to the lobby to ask for linens, a shower curtain (there wasn’t one) and some additional towels.  Upon our return to the room after a light snack, we had a shower curtain although it was about 18” from the floor as we had a handicap accessible shower and the attendant arrived shortly after with linens for the sofa bed.  Since they provided additional sets of linens, we used them all wrapping the mattress with multiple layers to try and make it comfortable.  
Shortly after our return, we realized that the toilet took approximately 20 minutes to refill after flushing so we ended up using an ice bucket to fill from the sink and then placing into the toilet tank (it takes 5 ice buckets to fill).  Eventually we realized that the hand shower wand from the shower could also reach the toilet tank so we just used that to fill the toilet – was much quicker and since there were 4 of us in the room, we needed to be able to refill quite frequently.  
Since our bathroom was handicap accessible, there was water everywhere after taking showers.  We attempted to create some level of a towel barrier to try and keep some of the water contained plus we limited the amount of water shower time for just the beginning and end of the shower experience.  We couldn’t just leave the water run like you would when taking a normal shower.  
The building is 32 floors and they only have two elevators so it is chaotic getting up and down stopping on every floor.  Thankfully we were on the top floor so when the elevator reached our floor it was empty but it would stop at every floor going down and would be full by the 30th floor and you would have to stop at every single floor going down taking 15-20 minutes to reach the bottom lobby floor.  Taking the stairs down from that high up didn’t appear to be a possibility.  
All in all, I would never stay at this property again.  I’m surprised that it can continue to operate under the Hampton Inn name as the brand consistency was definitely not in play during our visit to this location.

title: God beliggenhed
text:
Vi var 3 personer afsted en uge og boede på Hampton Inn.
Stedet ligger supergodt - tæt på mange ting, ikke mindst på busterminalen når man kommer fra lufthavnen (kun 150m væk).
Værelserne er fine, og bliver ordnet hver dag. Der er morgenmad på hotellet. Den er basic og udemærket men ofte kaotisk da mange skal spise på samme tid og der indimellem ikke er nok pladser.
Og så er der kun 2 elevatorer hvilket er i underkanten mellem klokken 8-16. Overordnet ellers et godt sted - vi kommer gerne igen🤩

title: Great location, needs some improvement for cleaning
text: I stayed for 3 nights with the family. We walked to main attraction areas and easy get out location. Breakfast was very good with limited seating. I enjoyed the hotel but compared to other Hampton Inn hotels, needs maintenance and needs to improve their cleanliness approach.

title: Summer Vacation
text: The hotel itself is fine. The rooms are smaller than what I’m used to, but I assume that’s just New York. The location is great; very close to Times Square, Broadway, and the subway. The elevators are slow, so we used the stairs in the morning; that’s was t an issue for us. Breakfast was typical of a Hampton, but it gets very busy, and the area is small. It’s not easy to take breakfast back to your room because of the elevator issue. The only real issue was that there was no cold water in our room. The first two days weren’t too bad, but the third day, the water was scalding. We reported it, and the next day the water was scalding again. We reported it again, and then the water was tolerable. There still wasn’t any cold water. The hotel was perfect for us since we just wanted a place to sleep at night.

title: Worst Hilton experience ever
text: Lets suffice it to say I have never this was potentially my worst hotel experience ever and definitely my worst Hilton experience ever.  I booked this hotel months ago to arrive at roughly 11AM.  Knowing room would not be ready but staff offered to store our luggage and ask we return between 3 and 330.  We returned just after 3 to be told our room had been canceled by Expedia.  After a call to Expedia I was told they still had an active reservation.  We then called the credit card company to find no attempt at a charge to the card.  The hotel was overbooked.  Expedia did not cancel my room the staff at the hotel did.  This was part of a graduation trip for my daughter and I now get to find a hotel in NYC near Times Square on the night i need to start a 3 night reservation.  Shout out to Adnan Javed the Front Office Manager for leading the cancelation of my room at 3pm after storing my luggage at 11 AND making no call to me nor to Expedia to inform of any issue before cancelation of reservation.  I would like to commend him for his commitment to excellence and his sincere lack of care for those attempting to stay at his hotel.

title: Faster check-in would be appreciated
text:
I will start with the positives. The hotel is located a short walk from Times Square and the Empire State Building. The breakfast was really good - exactly what you would expect from a Hampton Inn. My room was clean, but the furniture was outdated and the bathroom sink was cracked. The price seemed quite high for what they offered, but I won't complain about the price because I will get reimbursed anyway. 

The check-in was the worse though. I arrived quite late, I was hungry and tired and I didn't want to wait forever for a room key. There was nobody at the front desk, there was no bell, and I could not see anyone in the back. My efforts to draw attention were useless. I eventually approached a group of guests in the lobby (they were discussing plans to visit NY) and asked them whether they know where the receptionist was. Surprisingly, the receptionist was talking to them and (quite unprofessionally) she saw me entering the lobby, waiting to check in and completely ignored me. To top it off, she asked me to be patient until she finished offering advice to the group she was talking to.

title: Si salva solo per la posizione centrale
text: In posizione molto centrale quindi molto comodo per visitare la città, ma stanze piccole e la pulizia lascia molto a desiderare. I dispenser per il bagnoschiuma vuoto dal 1° giorno e la doccia scomoda, l'asta era in alto quindi non potevi spostarla e x non bagnarsi i capelli dovevi fare delle acrobazie  Per quel che riguarda la colazione inizia dalle 6 l'unico orario in cui riesci a fare colazione tranquillamente dopo c'è il caos più assoluto, sala troppo piccola rispetto al numero delle stanze e dei clienti. Non mi sentirei di consigliarlo

title: Location compensates the worn out look of the hotel
text:
Looks better in the pictures, but actually the hotel is quite old and outdated. Everything was anyway ok, and the location is perfect for a tourist in NYC.
You could leave your luggage to the reception on the last day. Breakfast quite simple but ok.

title: No running water
text: I checked in Sunday July 2nd 2023 and out on Wednesday July 5th.  I paid with Hilton Honors points, but have to tell you, somethings just are not worth "free".  I will say that the airconditioner in the room worked great.  The bed was also comfortable.  The staff were friendly.  However not one single morning did the water work.  No shower, toilet flushing or teeth brushing.  It would be fixed when you returned in the evening and then back to square one each day.  Left for the airport feeling icky - no shower, no clean hair.  They need to get to the root cause immediately.  Between waiting on elevators, and the over crowded breakfast area, business or pleasure this is not the place to stay.  If you need a comforatable bed for one night - then ok.   No comp of anything on check out.  Just plain dissapointment.

title: au coeur de Times Square
text:
Hôtel globalement satisfaisant très bien situé petit déjeuner compris(6h/10h) correct mais à prendre très tôt pour éviter le monde dans une salle de restaurant très petite
prix raisonnable en plein cœur de Manhattan

title: Terrible!!!
text:
Worst hotel stay ever!  

No water in entire hotel when we arrived and person at the desk never bothered to even let us know. Many things in the room were broken: the shower door was totally off it’s track and immovable, towel rod only partially on the wall, temperature control didn’t work and panel broke off, spotty internet, spotty  TV and terrible picture on most channels, no water a 2nd day, no AC in hall and 5+ min wait for elevators, staff was intentionally trying to overload elevators with almost double the capacity.  

Because of a long elevator wait in the lobby I was going to take the stairs but couldn’t even access the stairs because it required keycard access. Me and 2 other guests tried and none of our cards worked.  

While waiting to speak to someone at the front desk the person in front of me was very upset because more than once staff keyed into his room without even knocking!!  Hotel managers response to him was to tell him to put the latch on the door so even if someone keyed in the wouldn’t be able to get I got he room.  Seriously?!?!?

The block the hotel is on is not the best.  We had to always walk on the opposite side of the street to not have to walk through the middle of 5-6 junkies and step over their hypodermics.  

Spend whatever it costs to stay anywhere in the city but here!!!

title: DA INCUBO !  NEPPURE LE CAMERE RIFATTE
text: Mi meraviglio come Hilton possa avere un hotel 3 stelle del genere : sporco, squallido, con ascensori lenti e fantomatici, con una sala colazione degna ,si fa per dire , di una stazione di terza categoria, e poi, ciliegina sulla torta, le stanze non venivano rifatte e neppure i bagni puliti durante il soggiorno.  Mi dicono che e' la nuova politica Usa di alcune catene: invito booking.com ,che rivende il prodotto, a segnalarlo all'utenza e quindi BOICOTTARE queste catene di hotel . Colazione al minimo sindacale e personale inesistente. E pagare quasi 300 euro al giorno. Un disastro !!!!!!

title: Unprovoked the headboard literally fell off the wall
text: My son sat on the bed and the headboard literally fell off the wall. Thankfully his older brother caught it. Parking info on website is inaccurate. They are not contracted with any of the garages as the front desk and website claimed.

title: Excellent Stay, Great Location
text:
The Hampton Inn Manhattan/ Times Square South is situated in a great location close to everything around Times Square plus the Subway and Port Authority Bus Station.

Very friendly and helpful staff, we found our rooms to be clean and comfortable, maybe not the biggest of rooms but more than adequate for our stay.

Breakfast ticks the box and although not the greatest of choice it certainly sets you up for the morning.

title: Sketchy internet
text: Internet bounced continuously when it was working.  I had to keep requesting decaf for our room.  No decaf at breakfast on the last day and they ran out of oatmeal.  Also, my onyx necklace went missing from our room.

title: Decent hotel but the price you pay you expect a more upmarket room and showers to work properly
text: The hotel room was clean and tidy and the bed was very comfy. However when you pay in excess of £2,000 your expectation is the room to be quite upmarket however I would describe it as a premier inn or travelodge level room.

title: Not bad for a short stay.
text:
Good: Clean, efficient, nice staff.  Room was well laid out - efficient for a short stay.   Good bed.  

Not good:  Location is okay but a little marginal for the theater district.  Elevators are fast but there are just 2 for almost 200 units; be ready to invest time in waiting for the next one if you're going down.  Breakfast is not worth counting on - very token and crowded, not a great way to start your day.

Overall value was okay; we'll probably plan to spend a little more next time for location.

title: Non recommandable
text:
Sur 3 chambres, pas de produits toilettes, ménage imparfait ( cheveux dans le lit, miroir sale)
Pas d'eau froide de tout le séjour, ni pression.
Et pour couronner le tout un accueil exécrable, aucun effort pour que l'on puisse se comprendre et le pompon l'hôtesse nous a passé 3 retraits supplémentaires sur nos cartes bleues.
Je suis encore à ce jour dans l'attente d'un remboursement d environ 1300 euros
Alors non je ne recommencerai surtout pas cet hôtel avec ses sans abris devant et tout autour.

title: Accueuil horrible et escroquerie!
text: Accueuil horrible, hôtel sale, pas de gel douche dans les chambres et géré par des escrocs. Effectivement lors decmon séjour, prétextant que mon opérateur n'avait pas réglé la chambre que j'avais réservé, la réception m'a demandé à 2 reprises ma CB soi disant pour prendre une empreinte. Et en fait ma carte à été débitée 2 fois pour une chambre déjà payée! Réclamation faite à Booking (qui est intervenu auprès de  l'hôtel a informé qu'il refusait de rembourser!  Ne confiez aucun moyen de paiement en réception et fuyez tout simplement cet hôtel!

title: Disappointing service
text:
Biggest reason for this rating is we called down to the front desk and housekeeping twice to have items refreshed, as we are OK without housekeeping coming everyday, but that doesn’t mean we don’t need the basic necessities. 

The first night we asked for towels and the second we asked for coffee packets. Both times we were told they would be sent up, and neither time were they ever delivered.  

Just say “we won’t be honoring this request because we don’t take requests at all”, instead of making me wait for an hour for items that aren’t coming. This is noticeable because as a Diamond member, I’m used to these basics being handled by the hotel. I’m not asking for a lot. Just towels and coffee. 

Other than that, the accommodations were at par with a lower level Hampton Inn. I’ve stayed at nicer, but this met the bare minimum requirements. I get that Hilton is taking all measure so cut costs to maintain its bare minimum for their lowest level brand in an expensive location… I’m just stating for the record that it shows… definitely no ‘above and beyond service’ being offered here.

title: A ne pas réserver.
text:
A ne pas réserver sous peine d'être débiter sans raison de 1300 euros en environ de sa carte bancaire.
2 nuits sur 3 sans produits de toilettes.
4 jours sans eau froide.
Oreillers sales
Miroir sale
Personnel avec aucun effort de solliciter notre langue.
A éviter.
Nathalie (France)

title: Unfortunately, bad experience.
text:
Unfortunately, I am very dissatisfied with the hotel management, they overcharged me 163.93 $.
Since my arrival at the hotel and during my departure from it, they assured me that there was indeed a mistake, and that they would return the amount within 5 working days, and I had traveled and nothing had happened.
I sent many e-mails and they were not answered.

title: Shaikh
text: The hotel is old with small rooms, bathrooms, and short of elevators. Housekeeping is bad and not well organized. Hilton should not operate this kind of facility. Diamond Hilton Honors will be given a one time bottle of water with a snack for the whole stay!!! I will not stay there again.

title: Decent
text: Location is good, pub down road was great breakfast was decent but the whole building would smell of cooking fat. And the lifts were old fashion and slow so unless you wanted a long wait the stairs are a fitness test. Overall a decent place to stay for the value

title: Worst hotel
text:
We were very disappointed with the service and the instalations of the hotel. We cannot understand how Hilton has allowed this hotel to be part of the Hilton Chain.
Let me give you my experience:
When we arrived, the front desk clerk assigned us room #1603. When we openned the room, it was all dirty and the bed undonne.
We went to the front desk and we got assigned room #603.
The room was clean but the toilet was not working and it made a lot of noice because water was flowing constantly. We reported it to the front desk.
At night when we returned to the room, the toilet had not been fixed, so I had to move it to it stop the water flow.
The air conditioning was very cold, we tried to reduce it and it did not work so we froze all night.
The next day,  we mentioned it at the front desk and when we arrived at night, the air conditioning was in heater mode, so it was so hot that we could not sleep, we called the front desk at 2am to report it, the technitian came and said that he could not fix it. So we requested to have another room. They said yes, but not when. 15mins later we called again and the manager told me that she was not the an expert in air conditioning and that  they were checking the other room. Then we were assigned  to room #703.
The sink of this room had a leak so there was water all over the bathroom floor.
Two nights we stayed there, all rooms had maintenance problems and the worst thing was that we could not rest at all.

title: Should have been better
text: Nice hotel, great staff, excellent location. The breakfast is good. The quality of the internet connection is very poor however. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn’t require a strong and reliable internet connection.

title: Unresponsive staff. Dirty, dingy bedding, room and furniture
text: The room mirror was filthy as was the bedskirt and curtains.  The ottoman was stained and so was the headboard on one of the beds. It took 5.5 hrs and 4 calls to front desk to get blankets and pillows requested and they drill only brought one. I called to confirm accommodation could be made foe early checknin since I was bringing my mom, who is battling cancer for the 4th time and was told it wasn't a problem.  Our room was not ready until normal check in ! The internet was going in and out.  I will never away there again EVER !  I am a Diamond Elite member and that doesn't even matter.

title: Unhappy Hilton Honors Member
text: The restroom at the Hampton Inn Time Square in New York room 2403 had major flushing issues. Personnel came to our room 6 times to unstop the toilet. When I ask for another room it was granted but the room wasn't clean! I paid full price for a half price experience!

title: Don’t book this hotel
text:
Honestly I don't know where to start:
1- We spent more than an hour to check in when it was 10:30 pm
2- The Manager is not professional and very very very rude
3- I had already paid when I booked the hotel for a room with 2 double beds but I got only one bed, with answers from the manager like: “that's all that I have” and “I can't  help you” and she even refused me a compensation for the price between the two rooms
4- Two small elevators for 34 floors, during peak hours such as breakfast time, we wait up to 20min to be able to go down
5- Buffet  very modest for breakfast

title: Séjour agréable
text: Les + : Hôtel bien situé, literie confortable, petit déjeuner très correct, accueil chaleureux et agréable même à minuit, bagagerie gratuite le jour du départ, changement des serviettes SDB tous les jours. Les - : Vaisselle carton petit dej, les lits ne sont pas fait tous les jours, beaucoup de personnes droguées dans la rue de l'hôtel. Je recommande néanmoins cet hôtel, très bon rapport qualité prix.👍

title: Hotel Mal mantenido - Personal de recepcion desagradable - No volveria Jamas
text:
Durante nuestra estadia en vuestro hotel (mi esposa y nuestras 2 hijas), del lunes 20 al viernes 24 de marzo del presente año, nos encontramos con una diversidad de problemas en la 1er. habitacion que nos dieron:

1- No funcionaba el equipo de calefacción (aire acondicionado).

2- No funcionaba el telefono, para lo cual nos era imposible la comunicación con recepción.

Bajamos para realizar el reclamo, para lo cual nos indicaron que mandaron al técnico. El mismo se presentó a los minutos en nuestra habitación y constató el problema e indicó que no se podía reparar.  Para ello solicitaría que nos cambien de habitacion y que esperamos que nos avisaran.

Al pasar el tiempo y cuando nadie se presentó, volvimos a bajar a la recepción, y la Sra. Brookers nos atendió muy mal y nos indico que debíamos bajar de nuevo todo el equipaje y esperar la asignación de una nueva habitacion. Le solicitamos dejar las valijas en depósito para no seguir perdiendo tiempo de nuestras vacaciones. 

La misma se negó a ello y debimos esperar que nos dieran la nueva habitacion.

Con respecto a la habitacion de nuestras hijas, no funcionaba el secador de cabello, hicimos el reclamo, dejando el mismo en la recepción y nunca nos entregaron uno funcionando.

A medida que surgen los inconvenientes, se aumentaban los malos tratos de la Sra. Brookers y su desinteres claro en no atendernos y menos en resolver nuestros inconvenientes. Lejos de ello cada día fue mas grosera y poco servicial.

Consideramos una total falta de respeto y cordialidad por su parte, sintiéndonos discriminados con  su proceder.

Por otra parte, quiero comentar, que en el horario del desayuno se produce un caos tremendo por el uso de ascensores.  El hotel cuenta con solo 2 ascensores que son utilizados por el personal de limpieza con sus enormes carros y por los huéspedes a desayunar y los huéspedes con sus valijas que realizan el check out. Todos se movilizan en los mismos horarios de 7 a 10 hs.

Lamentamos la desagradable experiencia que vivimos en vuestro hotel. que aun mas grave, no fue solo nuestra, porque presenciamos la queja de muchos huéspedes.

title: Terrible experience
text: It is top of our worst hotel experience ever, do not recommend to anyone. Very dirty rooms, never changed sheet and pillows even though they confirm to change during our stay, very dirty corridors and long waiting time for elevators. Considering the amount we paid, the hotel is not worth for money .Not friendly staff.

title: buona struttura
text: ottima struttura a due passi da Times square, personale gentile e attento, vicinissimo alla metro, ottima colazione e caffe a tutte le ore, la nostra stanza era grandissima con una discreta vista sulla citta consigliato

title: Don’t recommend this hotel to anyone
text: Don’t trust when they tell you that the deposit is refundable. They charged me 75 dollars and on departure they promised that it will he refunded to my card which they didn’t do. After checking with booking.com the hotel replied that I used the parking space. This info was never shared with me neither on check in nor check out and besides that, booking.com communicated with the hotel 3 times and their reply was always the money was transferred to me which I proved their lies by sharing my card statement with booking.com before they came back with the story of the parking. It’s not matter of money but, matter of principle and honesty, which they lack.

title: Lower your expectations of a Hilton
text:
Set your expectations low
If you are a frequent Hilton guest then you are in for a disappointing treat. I’m not usually one to leave reviews but I feel I need to here. I would usually book direct with Hilton but it was cheaper through booking.com. The hotel is in major need of modernisation, nothing about this hotel screams Hilton apart from a few logs. I was put on the 4th floor next to the stairs door. There was a massive group of school children/teens and the shouting and screaming until 2.30am was too much even for the city that doesn’t sleep. The place was heaving the next morning as it looked like they were all checking out, but disrespectful doesn’t come close to the behaviour on that first night.
This Hilton is more like a hostel than a hotel. The rooms are fitted with electric heaters so loud it would be impossible to sleep. I was moved to the 20th floor which was quieter but the room still pretty much the same, I could smell cleaning products so it must have been turned around that day. The place was cleanish, the bathrooms could have had more attention but the room was ok. The higher up you go, the longer it takes to feed hot water so expect to run your shower for a bit.
Breakfast… well… if you are thinking this is going to be the typical feast that Hilton puts on, You are very wrong. Paper plates, paper cups, Plastic cutlery and cold food is what you will get. There is scrambled egg, sausage and mini potatoes from the “hot” selection, that’s it, then some bread to toast and cereal. Breakfast area is canteen like, find a seat if you can. 
In the room; the towels and paper coffee cups were branded with Holiday Inn logos and you are given powered milk. Maid service is just changing bins, don’t expect beds to be made or anything, it’s just bins being emptied. 
Had this have been a hotel chain I wasn’t use to I probably wouldn’t have left a review, but you pay for the brand and you don’t receive the brand, literally.. to have this hotel under the Hilton name is an embarrassment, worst Hilton I’ve ever stayed in and I’m a frequent guest. The money I paid I would have expected a lot more out of a Hilton, there are better hotels in the area for less, don’t waste your money here.

title: Great location :)
text:
This hotel was in an amazing location it was very clean and comfortable the only negative was that the room wasn’t ready when it was check in time, but everything else was great. 

We was on the 28th floor and got a great view of the empire state, we was a ten minute walk from Times Square, very close to the edge and lots of transport options. Tons of food places close by. 

It was my first time to New York and it was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel it was clean comfortable and spacious.

title: Parfait pour y dormir
text: Chambre petite mais nous ne fesions qu’y dormir donc c’était parfait! Vue sur l’empire state building de notre chambre! Petit déjeuner très bon mais il faut arriver tôt car vers la fin il ne reste plus beaucoup de choses. Personnel très accueillant et gentil.

title: Not worth the charges.
text:
Normally I would never dream of giving a review, let alone a negative one. 
The attitude of the staff upon check in was a bit rude, because of early arrival. The breakfast was nothing like shown in pictures which was disappointing and not worth the extra charge. The lift situation was just ridiculous. Waited ages only to have the lift be full and had to wait ages for another lift. I know there were stairs, took them once and got lost trying to get the lobby.
Was charged nearly $400 for damage insurance for a room that already had a stool with an iron mark, a chair with random stains and a ripped bed frame. Thankfully you get your money back when you check out.
 For some reason we were given IHG branded room cards, instead of the Hilton. 
If you want to visit time square, it's a bit of a trek for non-walkers, but if you have no problem walking and simply require a bed to sleep in, it's an alright place to stay.

title: New York
text:
El hotel está muy céntrico a 10 min de times squere y muy cerca de la parada de metro.
La habitación está muy bien, grande y cómoda. La calefacción va perfecta y la cama es muy grande.
El agua caliente tarda un poco en salir, y los ascensores en hora punta son un poco caóticos, pero con paciencia no hay problema. 
Ofrecen agua gratis en algunas plantas en una máquina con hielo también. 
Tiene muy cerca un súper económico por si necesitas algo.
El desayuno aunque es de cortesía, es muy repetitivo y no es muy europeo.
Hamburguesas…gofres( a veces), patatas fritas…
Pero hay sitios muy cerca para desayunar en caso de que te apetezca otra cosa. 
Van muy poco a limpiar la habitación, en 7 noches fueron una vez a hacer la cama y muy pocas a vaciar la papelera. Las toallas si que las cambian.

title: You will get chared for no reason and they will keep it secret
text: I was charged for parking but I did not have parking at all. I have no idea why I was charged so because when I checked out I was given a receipt which is attached to this email that does not have this charge. And all of sudden there are random charges on my card. for days I have tried to get some help at that hotel and no one does anything. just given the run around. This is unprofessional and unacceptable of a Hilton. I have been travelling frequently as of late and exclusively at Hilton's but this is the worst I've ever been to, only because of this. And it was booked on points like come on

title: Estadia 5 dias em família
text: Muito bem localizado. Zona calma sem muito barulho. Camas confortáveis. Quarto com 2 camas-casal pequeno, mas suficiente para família de 4. Pequeno-almoço com alguma variedade, sala pequena, convém chegar cedo. Trocam toalhas diariamente, só arrumam o quarto a cada 4 dias. Após check-out, guardam as malas. Sinal de wi-fi fraco, mas no lobby há uma sala com PC e impressora disponíveis, com acesso à internet, mais rápido que wi-fi.

title: EXPERIENCIA TERRRIBLE
text:
EXPERIENCIA TERRIBLE:

Había reservado cuatro habitaciones para ir con mi familia en navidad, como había hecho otros años. Por causa del fallecimiento de un familiar, tuve que cancelar, con cancelación gratis (probado) a través de Booking. El hotel, sin embargo, me cobró la 700$ en concepto de anulación, cuando la cancelación se había realizado bajo los términos correctos y legales. Llevo 21 correos ya tramitados desde el 2 de enero en los que me decían (a pesar de enseñarles mil documentos con las comprobaciones y hablar, aproximadamente, con 15 personas diferentes) TODAVÍA me falta una habitación por abonar, y ya ha pasado más de un mes, en concreto mes y medio. Una completa vergüenza la atención al público. 21 emails para que me hagan caso, recuperar mi dinero que había sido injustamente retirado y que me atiendan. TERRIBLE, ¡cuidadito!

title: Do not always believe the negative comments!
text:
Leading up to my trip, I read some reviews that gave me extreme cause for concern and left me nervous about my journey, especially those surrounding the elevators and how often they were not in use. I am pleased to advise I did not find that during my 4-day visit.

The hotel is neatly located far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Time Square but close enough that it is just a few minutes away by foot. The hotel lobby and elevator waiting area are small but good enough to accommodate foot traffic from the entrance door to the elections. Rooms were of no great size, but when you are out exploring all day, there is no need. Our room came with a lovely en-suite complete with a toilet, basin, shower (with great pressure and hot water) and all the towels/ complimentary toiletries you could need. The room also featured a large flat-screen TV and air conditioning/ heating.

During peak periods (such as breakfasts), you can be waiting for a lift for 10-15 minutes, but priority is given to those travelling up and having to walk down 14 floors in the morning was worth not having to wait 15 minutes to be taken down. Outside of the peak times 7:30am to 9:30am), the lift is more than readily available and quick to respond.

The breakfast buffet was to a good standard. It contained the majority of items expected for a buffet breakfast - cereal, porridge, toast, bagels, waffles, sausage, eggs, juice, tea and coffee were all available. The conservatory-style room where breakfast is served can be cold first thing in the morning, so a coat or jumper would be a wise choice.

All-in-all, this is a good adventurer's hotel. Do not expect multi-room suites with jacuzzi baths and a pasta chef at the ring of a bell. The staff are incredibly polite and friendly, the beds are comfortable to take the weight off your feet after a long day exploring the city, and the hotel is close enough to amenities (shops, pubs and restaurants). It is clean and tidy and has all the amenities you need.

Pop to 'Square Pizza' across the road for a little snack; the Garlic Rolls are amazing!

title: Excelente ubicación, desayunos de calidad, personal amable
text: Excelente ubicación a minutos de Times Square, a pasos de estaciones de tren. Desayuno esperaba mucho menos y quedamos más que encantadas! Personal muy amable, solo conocimos un joven que hablaba español muy amable pero los demás del personal en la medida posible trataron de comunicarse y ser amables.

title: Family trip
text:
I stayed here with my 2 teenage daughters. 
The room is small but your knly here to sleep so does the job, the beds were comfortable and room was clean. Are towels were changed everyday.
There was breakfast, not the biggest selection but something for everyone including my 2 fussy eaters of teenagers found something to eat.. this set you up for the day, a great start! 
The staff were very friendly and helpful as I had once request the night before we were leaving nd they helped me out without any hesitation. Always a smile when we were coming nd going throughout the day. 
The location was good, close to times square and port authority, other subway places so easy access to anywhere in manhattan. Yes there is people loitering around at the end of the streets at night but you find this everywhere.. we had no hassle duration of our stay here. 
I would definitely come back to this hotel wether as family couple or single.

title: Would stay again
text:
Stayed 5 nights in family room, with 2 teenage boys. Small, but comfortable. Well worth the price. Central to everything. Breakfast plentiful.
For families on a budget.. perfect!!
You don't go to NYC to stay in your room!!!

title: Excellent experience and very polite staffs.
text: The experience was excellent.  Very helpful staff and nothing seems too much for the staff to do. The breakfast was good and every breakfast staff were always helpful and around us in the  breakfast area to help. The lift was a bit noisy, as a result our sleep was disturbed most nights. Our room was close to the lift. Towels were changed everyday and the room cleaned. Very impressed.

title: Comfortable stay in a great location
text:
Just returned from a 3 night break at the Hampton Times Square South. After reading some reviews on here I was so worried I had made the wrong choice. But I needn't had worried. We arrived around 4pm our room on the 18th floor was ready and the lady who checked us in was lovely. No issues getting the lift on any day we were there and we used it at varying times. The room was fairly small but it served its purpose. The bed was very comfy and we had a partial Empire State Building view from our room. Our only gripe with the room was the shower pressure and the time it took to heat. However, from groups I am on this is a common problem with the tall old buildings in New York so we did not let it ruin our stay. The breakfast was perfect for us and set us up for our busy days ahead: bacon sausage and eggs then Muffins, cereal, fruit as well as toast, bagels and English Muffins. We could even make our own waffles (which yet at times had a que but that's to be expected)

On our last day our flight wasn't until the evening and it wasn't an issue leaving our cases at the hotel for the day. All of the staff members we encountered were lovely and very helpful.

Location was perfect for us easy to get to where we needed to go either by walking or getting the subway.

We would stay here again if we revisited New York.

title: Very bad hotel in a good location
text: Great location and the front desk is helpful, but the hotel is horrible. No hot water the first day and no water at all the second day. Shower so narrow I had to stand sideways because my shoulders were too wide. Elevators that take forever to arrive. Tiny lobby that is mobbed with people. Rooms are tiny and very sparse. We are very experienced travelers and I have stayed at even worse than this. But you expect  much more from Hilton. Hampton Inn needs to make a choice - invest some serious money to upgrade this hotel to Hampton standards or sell this place and stop letting it ruin your reputation.

title: Customer Service is Horrific
text:
I stayed at this hotel for two nights. I arrived at 10:30 AM and was very happy that I was able to check-in.

Service - 

Improvement needed! I have to tell you, I was shocked at the behavior of the female front desk agent who assisted me during check-in. She was miserable and so incredibly unprofessional. She was texting on her mobile phone when I entered the hotel. She stared at me and begrudgingly got up from where she was sitting and pointed to the station she wanted me to go to. She then continued to text while I was standing there. No smile. No polite interaction. No mention of Diamond status….literally nothing. Now I was not about to say anything because it appeared she was allowing me to check-in early, which I am very thankful for. But, wow. She was so perfunctory and rude. Definitely not someone who should be working at the front desk of a hotel.

Room - 

My room was very large (for NYC standards) and super clean. The king size bed was very comfortable. The AC / heating unit was quiet and worked great. Room had an armoire, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, mini-refrigerator, and safe. Complimentary wi-fi was awful. Not reliable and sometimes slow. Plenty of conveniently placed electrical outlets.

The bathroom was what I expected….pretty small. The walk-in shower with glass sliding door (very difficult to slide) was very small, but the water pressure was excellent and the water stayed hot which I love. Not much counter space, but a huge medicine cabinet with mirror was above the sink. This worked out great! Every time you flushed the toilet it sounded like a freight train was barreling towards you….literally. I have never experienced this at a hotel before. 

Hotel Information -

The hotel has 184 rooms and 32 floors. According to my records I have stayed here in the past, but I do not remember when or what my experience was like. 

Decent size lobby. Two elevators to access 32 floors. One was inoperable on my second day. Yes, you can imagine what a nightmare that is. Be prepared for long waits. Also, there is a slot for your key card in the elevator, but it does not work. So, not a very safe hotel. The hotel has a fitness center and business center. I never eat the free buffet breakfast at Hampton Inn’s because I find them to be gross, so I can’t comment on the breakfast.

Location - 

Located in the heart of the Garment District, a short walk to the Theater District, Hudson Yards, Hell’s Kitchen, and Chelsea. It is right around the corner from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. It is about a 15 minute / 0.7 mile walk to the center of Times Square. Hudson Yards is the same distance in the opposite direction. Bryant Park is about a 12 minute / 0.5 mile walk. 

While there were many positives of this hotel, the customer service I experienced was just inexcusable and shocking. This is the main reason for the average score.

title: Do Not Stay at this property!!!!!
text: Do not stay at this property!!! The first morning we were there the elevator stopped working and we had to walk down 31 flights of stairs!!  When we came back in the afternoon only one of the elevators were working and we had to wait over 15 minutes! We ended up in the elevator with an employee and I asked her if this was a common problem with the elevators. She said, yes. The stairs had a sign that said locked at the times for guest safety...it was never locked. The only time someone was at the front desk was when we checked-in on Sunday afternoon. The only thing the hotel has going for it, is the fact it was clean. Just a heads up it is not on Times Square, it is 3 blocks off Times Sqaure.
