title: Worst hotel - Do not even consider booking here
text: In all my travels this was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at.  In our first 10 minutes after arriving we witnessed a drug deal by the hotel.  There is a significant vagrancy issue by the hotel, and even had an incident where 2 people smoking crack cocaine by the hotel blew smoke toward myself and my 10 year old.  Breakfast was a joke.  There is limited space for seating and as a result there was a lineup for breakfast.  The staff cleared away the food promptly at 10am which meant a lot of people had to go buy breakfast.   The safe in our room was broken and could not be replaced because it would take to long.  Finally, there is no water pressure.  We could not have a daily shower due to water pressure.  Once shower was turned on (regardless if water flowed) the sink and toilet stopped working altogether.  Would have to wait several minutes for sink and toilet to work again.  When we reported the issue to front desk we blatantly informed that the hotel was full so we should not expect to have warm water or enough pressure to have a shower.

title: Beware of this hotel - Unless you want location only
text:
I read many of the reviews online and decided that I would make my own assessment during my five night stay.  Diamond member with 955 nights….
Overall, the location is perfect to Times Square, Broadway, and easy access to Metro station (Times Sq / 42).  The hotel had great staff.  I would like to especially call out Taya and Diedre at the front desk.  They were great helping with my problems experienced.
Problems….
1.	Elevator – Reviews and staff told me it is bad, but I stayed on second floor to avoid.  No concerns.
2.	Breakfast – Bad….Staff was great, but space and food was completely overwhelmed.  One waffle maker for entire hotel.  Ran out of waffle mix 2 of my 5 days.  Milk dispenser broken.  Food was empty often.  Space was overcrowded.
3.	Hot Water – Sink only had hot 4/5 days (no cold) – Could not get drinking water.  Shower – Only cold water 4/5 days.  Staff came up several times.  I head multiple reason (end of line, start of line from roof, control valve broken, too many people taking showers, system on front of building does not work well).  Front desk told me there was a water problem a week ago and still working on it apparently.
4.	Housekeeping – Storage room is next door to 205 – They start at 7 AM in morning.  We know this as it is LOUD….Lots of talking, laughing, etc.  Right in front of my door.  Woke us up almost every day.  Did not need an alarm clock.
5.	Room – TV remote buttons did not work, fan in bathroom did not work (did not need with cold water), bathroom door in lobby did not lock – I walked in on housekeeping using it.
6.	Finally – Calling the hotel in advance was impossible – I called twenty times and got the front desk once and the operator three times.  If you don’t believe me – Try it…..Impossible to reach them.

The staff are doing their best to cover the problems.  Management needs to step up.

title: TOTAL DUMP
text: Took the front desk clerk more than an hour to get me my room at check in 8pm…was given a key card for a room that was already occupied..elevators are a disaster don’t work properly…hallways are narrow and carpet looks like it’s 100 yrs old even though they claim that the hotel was newly renovated,,,was promised a discount for the inconvenience but never received it…check out clerk a black girl was very hostile…this property is a fire hazard ..DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY

title: Cheap But Still Not Worth It
text:
Avoid.  Booked two rooms, pre-selected and pre-checked in on the app to be adjacent for myself and two adult kids.  HHonors Diamond.

One of the rooms was available when we arrived at 2 (before scheduled check-in time), which was great.  We dropped off our things and went out to explore NYC.  When we returned to check into the other at 6, they had given the other room away.  The kids ended up 8 floors away.

Breakfast was a disaster.  Only a few hundred square foot porch for a 32 floor hotel.  Most items were perpetually out.  The staff was doing a valiant job trying to keep up, but it just wasn’t physically possible given the small space and large crowds.

Elevators a bigger disaster.  Only two fairly small elevators for a 32 floor hotel, and I think one of those was broken.  10 to 15 minute waits minimum, made worse by the fact that because of the waits, the call button in the halls had been pressed on nearly every single floor.  Most people ended up taking the stairs going both up and down, including my son climbing from the lobby to get to his room on the 32nd floor.  Ahh, to be 19 again.  I am not 19 and still walked up to my room on the 24th.  Passed a young family in the stairwell coming down, the dad carrying a large stroller, mom carrying the  baby with a young toddler following on her own behind.  That’s how unusable the elevator was.

To the positive, the rooms were modern and clean, the hotel was convenient and cheap.  Still not worth it.

Wouldn’t say again.  Spend the few extra bucks and go elsewhere.

title: Worst hotel I have stayed in
text: This hotel is one of the worst I have ever had the misfortune to stay in.  Lots of issues in the room including a broken phone, safe and the room was dirty.  Marks on furniture and carpet.  Dirt on mirror and windows.   However, the worst part was checking out.    I went to the desk to have the security deposit retuned to my credit card for the two rooms I had booked. That seemed to be quite straightforward but the receptionist said I owed the hotel 8 cents.  I asked how this was even possible as the booking had been with Booking.com and had been paid some weeks ago.   Did not buy anything at the hotel.   Tried to pay the 8 cents in cash but this was not possible.  Receptionist told me it has to be on my card.   As we were going for our flight I reluctantly agreed to let her have the payment.  However, I had only stepped away from reception when my credit card fraud department texted to ask if I had made a payment of £1460.23p as this hotel had taken that amount from my card.  I replied saying  NO I hadn’t.   I spoke to the hotel Manager who couldn’t give any explanation as to why this had happened.  She did send an email after I returned home saying a refund had been made but refuses to respond when I ask the amount.  Customer services were really poor and didn’t seem to have access to details from the hotel.  Credit card company say no refund received by them.  Oddly enough the 8 cents has never appeared on my credit card.   Result is now hassle.    I will NEVER stay in a Hilton Hotel again.

háganse un favor y no se alojen ahí, al menos que quieran perder su dinero del deposito.

title: Not returning anytime soon!
text: This was a comedy of errors from start to finish. I am loyal to the brand and booked three rooms for 2 nights. The first checked in to a 17th Floor room about 2pm without delay only to find that one of their two elevators were not working causing a longer than average wait time. We inquired and were told crews were working overnight to fix it. Went out for a bite and returned to welcome friends who were standing in a long line at counter (one person working and credit card machine broken, so all rooms stayed on reserved card). While they waited to check in, I waited for the elevator. I chose to walk up and down the 17 flights to put our leftovers in fridge. We then waited about an hour for them to check in, get elevator to 19th floor and come back down. The safe in our room was broken, I asked for service but no one ever came to repair/replace it. The bathroom outlet in one room was unaccessible, it was behind the medicine cabinetThe wifi was unreliable, the treadmill in gym was broken. Each person we spoke to about the issues were honestly concerned and empathetic but seemed like their hands were tied. The straw that broke the camels back was on our second day we were up to freshen up and start our day and we had No HOT WATER, not cold water waiting to get hot but no water only air through our sink or shower. Once again I spoke with a gentleman who said he would send someone up. We waited 1.5 hours and noone ever came. The 2nd elevator remained broken. The lobby was filled with people complaining about wifi, elevator and no hot water. Everyone we came in contact with on property was a pleasure and well aware of the shortcomings. It is time for upper management/ corporate to step in to update/repair/renovate/ replace what needs to be done.  The staff is awesome but are  limited. Unfortunately, we will not return to this Hilton unless things change. Reaching out to Hilton Customer Service once home!

title: BMW TRUCK DAMAGED
text: my bmw truck was damaged valet didn’t say anything about no truck parking but they took my car key anyway. frontdesk unhelpful about it when we initiated the concern. elevators not working we had to take stairs the entire stay.

title: Broken Elevator and Assigned Room Not Cleaned
text: The elevator! Only one of the two elevators worked. Plus at certain peak times in the day, someone employed at the hotel would disable the button that is pushed to request an elevator on each floor. That way, you could take the elevator up to your floor but it would never stop to pick up anyone waiting for an elevator to take down. After waiting and pushing the button continuously for more than 20 minutes, my husband and I walked down the stairs from the 30th floor to the lobby. Totally unacceptable. In addition, the first room we were given hadn't been cleaned. We then had to wait at least 15 minutes to get back down to the front desk due to issues with the elevator. The second room was fine except that the remote did not work the television. We usually stay at Hampton Inns and have never experienced any issues. Our one night stay at this one was dreadful.

title: Horrible Experience
text: We arrived on the 21st December in the hotel. The first thing gone wrong was the lift. It didn’t work, so we had to take the stairs with our luggages, we walked for 19 floors. We asked for helping and no one helped us, so we had to carry all by ourself. We thought this problem could take just for one day maximum, but we were in the same situations on the checkout day , the 25th, so we had to carry all the luggages for 19 floors again. During these 5 days they didn’t make our beds and they didn’t clean up our restrooms. The water machine on the floors didn’t work, our fridge in the room didn’t work as well. the safe box was broken so we had to go out in NYC with our money cash risking everyday to be robbed. The last two days we had to have breakfast with scarf and coat because it didn’t work the heating system of the canteen. We are not satisfied at all because everything was not clean, our room included! They didn’t change our trash bin too.

title: Friendly staff , hotel needs work! Crowded elevators , shower didn’t work
text: I am a Hilton honor member and also got the credit card because I like Hilton hotels but this one is very different , as we got to the room there was no heat on one of the coldest nights in nyc and I called the front desk and they were very nice and switched us to a different room , after that we went to sleep and woke up next day I wanted to shower and that room the shower didn’t work , there was no water pressure only few drops of water and on the bathroom sink there was no hot water , very upset as a gold member I been so loyal to Hilton hotels and this hotel really let me down , also one of the two elevators didn’t work and and we had to wait 7 elevators to get downstairs from floor 17 , they were all packed and couldn’t get in. I will never stay there again and hopefully this doesn’t happen to other people because it’s really upsetting since all the other hotels have been very clean and never had an issue

title: Horrible customer service
text:
I stayed one night on business and supplied my tax exempt paperwork. It didn't get processed but I was assured it would happen with the night audit.  That did not happen.

I have called the hotel numerous times and get hung up on if someone answers.  One person did put me on hold and after 20 minutes I gave up.

I've never had such a challenge getting someone to even answer a question. Finally someone gave me the email address of the GM, we'll see if that solicits any response.

I didn't find the property a problem, but trying to get help when calling was a challenge that was unbelievably frustrating.

title: Fire General Manager
text:
Planned a Christmas Special overnight for 6 year old granddaughter, Daughter, Son-in-law (who never visited NYC) and wife. Overnight included train ride to NYC, breakfast at Perishing Square, 4 pm Rockettes Show, Dinner at Ocean Prime, touring Stuytown, 911 memorial, Gramercy Park, Union Square, riding subway. breakfast at The Smith,

Then the general manager told the front desk woman I needed to pay $75 in addition to the 140,000 points used. I replied my points through Hilton covered the rooms and no additional $$$ was required. I even showed the front desk woman a copy of my Hilton email showing no additional $$$ required. The General Manager via phone told the front desk woman he or she did  not agree and I must pay in order to gain access to the one room that was ready. I had to engage the Hilton Diamond desk to call the General Manager and resolve their problems. 1 hour passed during the whole ordeal. We left the hotel at 3:50 for the 4 pam Rockettes show.
Upon returning later that evening, my son-in law tried to use their tv and discovered  the remote batteries were dead. Calling down to the front desk, he was told Engineering would not be in until 8 am and there was nothing they could do. No batteries kept in the office or take a remote from another room. 
We checked our bags at check out for the day and upon returning the bell hop was indisposed and 4 other staff personnel did not jump in to retrieve our bags for 20 minutes.    
The General Manager never called me or met with me. 
I advised Hilton fi I was the owner I would walk the GM to the curb

title: Don’t stay here
text: Hotel was run down. Did not match the photos. It was not very clean. We had to take the stairs as the elevator was too busy and there was not  room . I carried my bags 7 floors down due to the inadequate elevator service. Totally disappointed as i am a Hilton loyalist. Do not stay here!!!!

title: Average.

title: Great hotel
text:

Room: Big modern room, good sized bathroom, bed massive and comfy.
Cleaned every day if you want.

title: Très moyenne
text: Hôtel de base sans plus, un sac contenant des achats pour environ 100 dollars a disparu, malgré plusieurs signalement rien n'a été fait ! A par la proximité de la plupart des sites ,rien n'est très attrayant, beaucoup de monde pour 2 ascenseurs. Je n'y retournerai pas !

title: Very poor service and customer complaint response
text:
Stay - Hampton Inn from 21st October until 27th October. 

1.
We arrived early evening on the Friday to be informed there was an issue with the lifts and if that was, okay? The impression given was it was temporary and that engineers were on site to resolve the issue.
No alternative hotel was offered or solution other than we would have a delay.
We checked in under impression it was not going to be a long term issue.
One lift was out of order for the whole period and the other had intermittent periods where it did not work at all or waiting up to 45 minutes was required at different intervals. We were on the 26th floor so not easy to just use stairs.
I totalled a time of 3 hours and 52mins waiting for the lift over our near week stay. This is unacceptable. We ended up staying away from room to avoid disruption.
 
2.
On the Saturday night we encountered a loud noise which was coming from the pipework behind our room – the whole wall vibrated, and it seemed that the toilet was also vibrating. If you put your hand to the shower wall you could feel the vibration and hear the very loud buzzing – like air trapped or plumbing blockage. This occurred at 3.15am and at first it was so loud we thought it was a fire siren in the hotel. It lasted 20 minutes and woke both my partner and I.
We reported this Sunday am and was told an engineer would investigate it.
We were out all-day Sunday and due to lifts returned late Sunday Evening – we were again woken at 4.10am and 5.45am with the plumbing noise Monday morning.
We reported a second time on the Monday and were told it would be looked at and feedback given – upon our return Monday we asked if it had been looked at and were told they were unsure if it had been, but everything should be sorted and if not to come back and inform them.
Monday night at 11pm we had the noise again and then on Tuesday at 7.32am.
Reported again Tuesday and assured it would be sorted. Played receptionist audio of noise.
Wednesday morning, we reported that it had again been keeping us awake and only at this time did we get offered an alternative room if they could not fix it – Wednesday night was our last night, and it seemed a little late to be offering solutions. Played further recordings of noise.
Wednesday night further instances at 2.10am, 3.00am and 6.20am all for durations of 5 minutes each.
Thursday, we reported to reception, and they asked us to email you regarding the issues and as they admitted there was an issue and we had raised it numerous times and they apologized for the inconvenience with one staff member commenting “I do not know how you have slept these past 6 nights.”
Total of over 8 instances where the noise woke us up.
I attach a couple of the sound recordings made and played to staff. These were made in room – much louder in bathroom and you can hear the vibrations caused.
 
3.
Due to the lift issues – our bed was only made once during the 6-night stay.
Room service did not happen on 2 of the days at all.
Towels and bathroom were done on 3 days but once it was evening when we returned, and it was being done.
Staff were friendly and helpful, but it was obvious with the lift issues that staff could not move round and clean and replenish rooms.
 
4.
Breakfast staff were excellent however the routine was very cramped and overcrowded – probably due to lift being manned by engineer with groups of 8/9 or so at a time – though signage says max 5.
3 mornings we had breakfast standing or just grabbed and went as we could not get a table and to take anything to room required a lift que and wait to go up and then return down to exit.
Therefore, we had a scant breakfast not what was included in the price we paid.
 
5.
We raised with staff that there was a gentleman hanging around on our floor and then he got in lift and kept getting in and out at different floors – we thought at first, he may have been lost and we asked if he needed help. He brushed us off and as soon as we reached the ground floor he rushed out and straight out the main doors. This was on route to breakfast. As we departed to go on trip that day, we noticed him hanging on street opposite hotel this is when we reported to a staff member just as precaution.
With the lift out of action we did not have to use key card to access guest floors  as it was maned by an engineer who asked what floor and that is all and the fire doors to the stairs and toilets were open at all times with no need for card access – surely this present a security risk to the staff and guests as there were no check on people entering hotels or accessing guest only areas.
 

The maintenance issues were obviously hampering staff in providing the level of service expected and they seemed out of depth and overrun by issues. On one day we waited in reception for 38 minutes for the lift to be in use as both were fully out of order and witnessed who we perceived to be a manager having a very vocal argument with engineers and reception staff about who was doing what to sort situation.
 
As a Hilton member I went with the brand seeking some quality assurance for our first trip to NY and the USA. We were sadly disappointed and would like a response to the issues so that other travellers do not experience the same issues.

We have emailed and used customer contact form and via expedia - no response from hotel. Expedia responded to say the hotel refund policy does not cover our issues and nothing can be done according to hotel.

title: Never ever again
text:
Don't even think about booking this terrible and very outdated hotel. We visited NY mid October. We had a room at 27th floor. Only one elevator was working - if it worked! So we had to walk up and down from 27th floor several times - and with small kids. If it worked we could wait 20 -25 min for the elevator to come as all the guests at the hotel had to use this only one.
At the breakfast the handdispenser was down - so it was not possible to disinfect hands. The toaster was out of order and so was the machine with milk. The staff didn't even try to fix it - they just rolled their eyes when told.
At the reception the staff wasn't very friendly - one tried to, but hard when all guests where angry. Some off the staffs had a hard time taking off their eyes from their phone. 
The rooms are very small. We booked at room for five - they'd told us we could have an additional bed in the room - but when we arrived it was not possible - so we had one lying on the floor for 5 days! And even if we were only four it was very very small.
I would really never recommend this place to anyone

title: Stay away!
text:
terrible experience: I can write about the old facilities, poor maintananace  etc, but the most imporatnat thing: the 
hotel didnt honor our Booking reservastion price:They acutally overcharged us with 
more than 20%!
we had to wait a few hours for the assitant manager and then to manager himself, who still refused honoring the Booking price quote.
As far as Booking.com -they have acknowledge the probelm and refunded us the diffrence.

title: Basic Hotel but in a great location
text:
Ok. So this place is basic.  No frills. Old, dated.  Breakfast is terrible.  Safe in our room was broken, HOWEVER the room was clean and had a hairdryer, clean towels daily, iron/ironing board.  We never had an issues with the lift.  Bed was comfy.  Area felt safe.  

The best thing about this hotel is the location.  Literally 5-10 mins walk to Times Square, 2 mins from the NewYork Times building. Very very good location, and 10 min walk from Penn Station which is really good for connection to JFK etc.

title: Bad, Bad, Bad
text: There was only only one of two elevators working - sometimes.  I was there for three nights and was on the 17th floor and it always took a minimum of 20 minutes to get downstairs. On the morning of my checkout I waited 45 minutes, but could not squeeze on an elevator with my bags. So I put my bags back in my room, squeezed in the next elevator and asked them to retrieve my bags and I would pick them up at 4pm. When I got back at 4pm, the bags were still in my room and it took me another hour to get them downstairs. Ridiculous. Don't know what would happen in the case of an emergency. Oh, and that last morning, half way through my shower the water shut off. Cold water came on about 10 minutes later. I was not offered any compensation what so ever.

title: séjour décevant
text: J'ai séjourné dans cet hôtel 10 nuits (en septembre dernier), très décevant ! En plus, suite à plusieurs problèmes, ils m'ont promis un remboursement que je n'ai jamais reçu, malgré des e-mails, l'envoi de la facture confirmant le remboursement ; et même mes menaces n'y ont rien fait, je pense qu'ils comptent sur le fait que je vais laisser tomber, car je suis à 6000 kms (France). Le prix, par rapport à la qualité du séjour est lamentable ; je pense que j'aurais été plus satisfaite dans un autre hôtel, moins cher avec un meilleur service.

title: Elderly People Needed to Walk up Flight of Stairs!!
text: This 32 story hotel had only 1 working elevator with a capacity of 5 people.  Hotel guests including the elderly were forced to walk up and down the stairs and even carry their luggage.  The hotel is a disgrace to Hilton.  What makes it worse is that Corporate Hilton is unresponsive to complaints and has allowed a situation to continue that puts hundreds of guests at risk.  This undermines and dishonors the integrity and reputation of Hilton and makes us hesitant to ever stay at another Hilton Hotel.

title: PLEASE BEWARE
text:
***READ THE OTHER REVIEWS TOO***
If I could give it a Zero, I would. The staff was rude, unaccommodating, and completely unprofessional. The hotel was broken down and EXTREMELY dirty. Service was poor.
Our trip started with one working elevator that may or may not stop on your floor when you call it. Required to climb 13 flights of stairs to get to my room.
After finding bodily fluids and other stains on our comforter, the hotel front desk sent someone to deliver a new one. That staff proceeded to enter our room unannounced while we were naked inside. No knock, no warning.
Then the next day we needed new towels and toilet paper because we were running extremely low. It took 8 hours, several calls to the front desk, and an irritated staff member in-person conversation to get our needs kinda met.
I will NEVER stay at this location again. They will be receiving a lawsuit.
It was sooo BAD that we called corporate to check out early and move hotels.

title: Do not stay here
text:
I’ll start by saying read all the most recent reviews and please don’t stay here. I stayed here with a friend for the marathon this year for a few days. This property can only be Hilton brand in name because they certainly don’t come close to Hilton quality. I’m not sure where to start. The description above about the hotel says it’s new remodeled, it definitely is not. The whole hotel has a weird smell like old garbage and bad ventilation. We were lucky that both elevators were working but they were tiny, often full, and reeked of garbage. Also, the light to several different floors didn’t work on the elevator.  
Our room was not great at all. First the carpet, which I think was supposed to be blue, was tinged brown from dirt. The bed hardboards are fabric and they were obviously dirty and stained. Our sink didn’t drain, our shower didn’t drain. Our toilet ran. The pillows were so flat that I needed 4 on top of each other to make a normal size pillow. 
The worst part: something (I really hope it wasn’t the toilet) from the room above us was leaking through the light in the ceiling in our bathroom. It would pour water all over the floor and everything in there, leaving a layer of water in the floor. We informed front desk multiple times about it and they kept saying they “called someone” or “sent someone”. That “someone”  never showed.
For a hotel that costs over $300 a night, this was disgusting and unacceptable.

title: Un buon hotel, specialmente se è la prima volta nella Grande Mela!
text:
Un buon hotel, ci tornerei, ma sento di dover spendere due parole sui pro e contro. Cominciamo dai pro: wifi veloce e stabile, ottima posizione (la metro è praticamente dietro l'angolo), colazione abbondante e gustosa, camere silenziose e dai letti comodi. Passiamo ai contro: pulizie un po' pressappochiste, sarebbe bene che venissero svolte con più cura (invece di nascondere i ciuffi di capelli dietro alle porte!). La sala dove viene servita la colazione è un pò troppo piccola rispetto al numero di ospiti, di conseguenza conviene andare a fare colazione verso le 6:30. Uno dei due ascensori non funzionava, quindi potete immaginare che caos dover arrivare al 2oesimo piano; spero che nel frattempo lo abbiano riparato, perchè nei sette giorni che siamo stati lì non si è mai visto il tecnico!
Ad ogni modo, è un buon hotel, lo consiglierei specialmente per chi visita New York per la prima volta.

title: Disgraceful
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights Oct 21-23. When we checked in we were told they were working on the elevator and to just call the front desk and they will send it up. Lies!  The elevator has been down for 6 weeks and they are not telling guests when they book. 

We tried to called the front desk to send the only working elevator but they didn’t answer. After numerous attempts we called housekeeping who transferred us. It’s a joke. The elevator was always full. It clearly states max 5 people but there were always a full load more like 10+. It is a safety hazard. It’s only a batter of time before that elevator breaks down under the strain.  One of the people in our group had mobility issues and had no choice but to wait until she could squeeze in when there was a little bit of room. My daughter had to walk down 16 flights of stairs. Someone is going to get hurt. Don’t book here!

title: A disgrace to the Hilton brand
text: Absolutely awful hotel that is a disgrace to the Hilton brand. I stayed here May 27th - June 5th 2022, the terms and conditions clearly stated daily housekeeping was included, but on arrival this was not the case and the room was only cleaned once during a 9-night stay, which with a one-year old meant dirty nappies were in the room for a number of days creating an awful smell. Notices in the room clearly state housekeeping is available on demand, but this was not the case and when the complaint was raised with front desk, they could not provide terms and conditions which stated otherwise. This was a clear breach of contract. Additionally the breakfast was of an awful quality, with a lack of healthy options. All cereals were heavy in sugar content, Frosties, Fruit Loops and another I cannot recall. The fruit was bad with bananas and apples swollen and stale. The lifts and public areas were in a very grimy condition and clearly had not been professionally cleaned for a number of months or years. This hotel should be blind audited as part of internal quality checks. I raised formal complaints and despite the breach of contract have not received any compensation. A very dissatisfied customer.

title: Worst Hilton chain hotel have ever stayed in!
text: Wow where to start, one phrase “avoid like the plague!” Reassured to see other recent reviews so not just me who had such a poor experience. Funny to see the Manager has time to post polite and apologetic replies online but when you ask to see her in hotel she is never available. I guess spends all her time online replying to guest complaints! Was staying 25-30 October. Ridiculous only one elevator working. Gave up waiting for elevator and used emergency stairs to exit. Asked to speak to Manager multiple times and she never responded or contacted me. Staff just smile but incapable of follow up. Gave up trying to get GM and now speaking to Hilton Customer Services to request at min a discount if not full refund since scandalous that they were charging me USD399/night, Had colleagues staying in the real Hilton Midtown at USD320/night. Shower barely the size of a closet, Asked 5 times in one day for clean towels and housekeeping to service room. They never showed. Cleanliness in public areas very poor and did not even bother to try breakfast since stuck in a small back room packed out with people. Toilet in my room was broken when checked in and room safe would not work, told all hotel room safes inoperable! A lousy hotel, poor staff follow up and to be avoided if given a choice. Oh and no laundry service, walked my laundry round to a colleague’s real hotel round the corner! In summary spend your money on another hotel , at least if something goes wrong the staff can treat guest complaints more seriously. Tried to attach some photos but system not loading them, trash dumped daily outside front entrance, why no bins, the infamous hotel elevator queue and common areas clearly not being vacuumed over several days.

title: Disappointing stay
text: Our room had 2 issues. 1 the coffee machine was missing a piece so was unusable and we had a squeeking toilet that kept us up the whole night the first two nights. I informed the lady on the desk who was very apolagetic and organized for a tech to come and look at it within 10mins however the guy came in and started looking at the shower. I explained it was the toilet that was faulty but all he did was flush the toilet and because the squealing noise didnt happen for the 3 minutes he was there he assumed he had fixed it even though i explained it was nothing to do with flushing the toilet and it was happening every 5-6 minutes. I also showed him a video i took that proved how loud the noise was and that it was nothing to do with flushing. We were kindly moved to a new room for the remaining 2 days of our stay however there were 3 issues with this room. The coffee machine in this room was also missing a part and was unusable. The safe was missing the locking mechanism and i was told at reception there were numerous rooms with the same issue. And lastly there was a faulty vending machine right outside our room which was making a loud clunking noise throughout the night again keeping us awake. Lastly 1 of the 2 elevators was out of service for our whole stay and the 1 working one sometimes didnt come when called so we had to walk up/down stairs for the majority of our stay. Overall we were rather disappointed with the whole stay.

title: One lift partially working for last 07 days
text:
We have been staying here since 22nd.Oct.22 and are meant to stay here for 07 nights.

We moved our room and the staff can’t find my expensive Hoody which I left in the room. we moved because the room had a broken safe and we needed to use it to keep our passport etc.

New room we were moved to wasn’t hoovered properly as my young daughter’s feet had a cut because of some cut nail left behind on the carpet, maybe the hoover didn’t suck it.

Everyday we have to wait for more than half an hour for lift to go down from our room.

I had left a message for the manager to get in touch with me, though no one bothered for more than 48 hours.

I approached the receptionist who claimed to be a FOH manager Adil and we were told there are 100’s of customers in the hotel and no one else complains, for a 32 story hotel building not to even have one lift working properly is a real concern. we were offered to check out with out any charges as there was nothing the manager could do it’s beyond his  control.

We were promised first nights stay will be refunded to us still waiting for this email.

I do not have any expectations anymore from this hotel anymore.

title: Da evitare
text: Pessima hotel livello di servizi pari a 0… 1 sola ascensore per 32 piani di albergo usata contemporaneamente da centinaia di clienti e personale delle pulizie, a tutte le ore. ogni giorno almeno 20-30 minuti di attesa tra salire e scendere. Pulizia della stanza con riassetto dei letti 1 volta solo in 7 giorni.. Sala colazione piccola e quindi sempre super affollata a meno che non vogliate mettervi la sveglia alle 6 per fare colazione comodamente. Camere piccole, ok ci puo’ stare come in tutta manhattan.,la nostra aveva la cassaforte sfondata abbiamo segnalato piu’ volte ma senza soluzione. La key card funzionava 1 volta su 3 quindi altra fila al desk (dove lavora 1 sola persona) per farla rigenerare piu’ volte durante il soggiorno. Un giorno tra attesa dell’ascensore e fila al desk per fare rigenerare la chiave che non funzionava siamo riusciti a rientrare in stanza dopo un abbondante mezzora da quando abbiamo rimesso piede in albergo. Ridicolo…

title: Do you like walking up 32 flights of stairs?
text: This 32 floor hotel only has had one working elevator for days. The staff was professional but there was nothing they could do. Room never cleaned or trash taken away. Only a trickle of hot water and clanging heater. Breakfast room jammed and dirty. Bad scene.

title: Dishonest Hotel Management
text: Unable to provide a 0/5.  NEVER stay at this hotel.  They are dishonest allowing people to check in without informing guests that the elevators are out of order.  We were placed on the 16th floor and had to walk up and down the stairs to get to our room.  The room was small and dirty. The refrigerator did not work properly and we had to through out our food.  After 2 nights, we had to waste an entire day of our vacation to change hotels.  By the way, this includes carrying all of our luggage down 16 flights of stairs.  The manager offered us with Hilton points for our inconvenience.  This is unacceptable.  I am still waiting for Hilton to resolve my case over 1 week later.

title: Très mauvais hôtel à part l'emplacement
text:
Les chambres sont sales, beaucoup de poussière, le lit taché et petits quand vous êtes à 3 ou plus .
Les chambres et lit ne sont pas faits pendant tout le séjour, ils vous changent simplement les linge et vides les poubelles et c'est tout. Très très peu de rangements et très bruyant. Chambres petites. 
Il y a qu'un ascenseur pour plus de 30 étages et en plus toujours très occupé même pas le personnel de l'hôtel et quand il est en panne je ne vous explique pas la montée des escaliers.
Le personnel pas plus agréable que ça, ne veulent pas comprendre.
Vraiment beaucoup trop cher pour ce que c'est 
Je ne le recommande à personne

title: Take the stairs
text: Had to walk up 17 floors since only 1 of 2 elevators were working.  With luggage our stay was not satisfactory.  Some  Electrical outlets did not work.  Rooms were the size of s large closet.  Would not stay there again.

title: 2 star at best in NYC
text: Average wait time for elevator is 8 minutes. There are 2 elevators but the staff and housekeeping have to share it with guests. With over 30 floors this is an extreme hassle. I waited 10 minutes on average just to get downstairs from my room. When I get off the lobby there’s at least 7 people waiting to get into the elevator all having waited 8-10 minutes as well. The elevators keep stopping at floors where housekeeping can’t even get in bc they have their cleaning carts and the elevators are full with guests. AC controller didn’t work well because it  had to be manually moved closer to the AC unit for it to read the controls. Breakfast staff was helpful but my room wasn’t ready til 40 minutes after checkin avail probably bc of the elevator situation. Some people paid $425 to stay here due to Comic-Con and I feel very bad for them. Not worth any price over $200

title: Not what I expected from a Hilton property.
text: There are 32 floors in this property and only one working elevator, so make sure you allow plenty of time to go up or down.  During peak hours in the morning, they have a maintenance man in the elevator so that they can move their carts around.  So if you push the button and it lights up, keep watching, if the light goes out,  he's in there turning it off.  It can take up to 22 minutes to get a ride in the elevator.   They have a breakfast buffet,  it's crowded and filthy. They aren't doing room services, but they are changing out towels.  Getting a hot shower can be challenging, two days it never got warm.   The  bars of soap they offer are the smallest and very thin..   Requesting assistance isn't easy unless you actually meet with someone in person, other than the front desk person who won't even acknowledge your presence.   As a long time loyal Hilton member, I will never stay at this property again.

title: Elevator broken- DO NOT STAY ON HIGH FLOOR
text: There is only 2 elevators for the entire hotel- which is 36 floors i believe. We were on floor 24 and any time we needed to ride the elevator it took a minimum of 15 minutes to get on. In the morning a maintenance man was controlling the elevator, only taking guests from the lobby to their floor- so to even get downstairs I had to walk down 24 flights of stairs. Most desk staff were extremely rude and dismissive. Location was sketchy- did not feel safe around the area. Recommend staying further from times square. Would not book this property again.

title: No vayan a este hotel
text: La primer noche en el hotel a las 22 hs. personal de mantenimiento intento ingresar a nuestra habitación sin importar que estábamos adentro durmiendo, menos mal que había colocado la traba en la puerta, me levante asustado y a los gritos, no tenían registrado nuestro ingreso al hotel por culpa de la conserje de turno y le habían asignado la misma habitación a otro huésped... por otro lado es un hotel sucio, viejo, feo, malo el desayuno... en pocas palabras... DESASTROSO... NO VENGAN.

title: Maintenance issues
text: The toilet in the room leaked on the floor. The staffs remedy was to wipe it up vs fix the issue after being told able the problem twice. Only one working elevator for 30+ floors. Front desk staff did not seem to care about the complaints being made. We had to compete with the housekeeping staff for use of the elevators because there are separate freight elevators.

title: Not good. Be prepared to walk up a lot of steps.
text: I’m not super picky so it takes a lot for me to be bothered enough to write a review. The only two elevators were broken.  One didn’t work at all and the other stopped every third floor regardless if someone was there. The elevator was backed up with people waiting day and night. Some resorting to walking with bags or food up as many as 32 floors. The room was not great either. There were stains on the sheets and the chair in the room was filthy.  We found a used face mask under the desk. Breakfast was as to be expected.  One positive was the staff who were all very friendly.

title: DO NOT STAY PLEASE
text:
We arrived early morning and firstly the reception manager was absolutely awful attitude and u helpful.
We got given our rooms x2 . First room AC was full of dust we turned it on an a puff of black smoke came out there were dirt marks on the bedding bathroom was as if they just wiped down after the last use absolutely awful. Bearing in mind we had a 17 month baby there was no way I was going to sleep after that.
Room 2, opened the waldrobes and the safe was broken into which made us feel unsafe again dirty AC and this room we had 4 children under 7.
We walked out and went to reception where the guy was rudeee. Said we would have to pay cos we check in we didn’t even stay in the room for 5 mins forget checked in.
Anyways finally he said fine will refund us for our 5 nights and guess Wht till today no refund ( he stated he has put this through and can take 7/12 working days to receive refund). 3 months later still nothing.
Customer service keeps saying they looking into it. 
So meaning we lost £2000 plus the extra we had to pay to find another hotel to stay in whilst we were there.
It’s unbelievably shocking hotel. Nothing like the images.
Please don’t waste your money or time!!

title: Hampton Inn Manhattan south Times Square
text:
Cet hôtel extrêmement bien situé est digne d'une étoile à peine. Sale. Ménage fait tous les 5 jours seulement dans la chambre.  Lits jamais dits. J'ai du tirer le bureau, une de mes affaires était tombée derrière... un lot d'immondices s'y trouvait,  vêtements des précédents touristes, papiers et déchets divers. Petit déjeuner que l'on prend dans des assiettes et verres en cartons  couverts plastique.
Bref, bien que très New-York étant très cher, il faut fuir cet hôtel

title: More like Hampton Roadside Motel
text: The condition of the room was deplorable. It felt like a motel and not a nice one at that. There were gnats all over, stain on the bed sheet, shower sliding door broken, mold in the shower, food under the desk, a/c vents extremely dusty, musty smell, and the list goes on. Not what I expect from a Hilton property.

title: Una buena opción con problemas de limpieza
text:
Relación calidad precio adecuada. Estupendo desayuno, habitaciones confortables aunque algo pequeñas y excelente ubicación. 
Terrible problema de limpieza: en una semana no limpiaron ni la habitación ni el baño.  Mero depósito de toallas y punto. Un cambio de sábanas.

title: Le plus degeulasse des hiltons!!!
text: Horrible, sale comme pas possible, elle a 4 étoiles filantes , a notre arrivée ca sentais les égouts a la réception, ensuite on est monté a notre chambre du 25 ieme, le tapis sentais mauvais, odeur de cigarettes et de pieds, les rideaux tous sales, fenêtres encore plus sales, la climatisation etait remplie de saleté et poussière. J‘ai levé le matelas il y avait des toiles d’araignée et des  petite bête morte. La chasse de la toilette fonctionnait a peine! Honte a Hilton!!! Honte a hamptonn, j‘ai pris mes valises et quitté l’établissement sur le champ, je ne sais pas si ma caution va m’être remboursée! Je vais voir. Zéro pointé!!!

title: 1st trip to NYC
text:
Location was good based on sites, shopping, restaurants. Not too far from Theater district. While hotel seemed to have "enough staff", the room cleaning policy was inconsistent as was the stocking of vending machines. Room keys needed to be reprogrammed nearly every day, as hotel staff admitted had been a problem for a long time. Breakfast was ok...fairly typical.
Overall stay was fine, but not enough to have me return - will try another hotel in future.

title: Not bad
text: The only ice maker working was on the lowest level. There were only 2 elevators and my room was on the 23rd floor. The wait time for an elevator was long at times. The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Amazing Visit
text: we had such a great experience with the overly helpful and friendly staff , from taking our bags to giving directions, Deidra went above and beyond!!!! The hotel is a perfect location and quick and easy walk to Times Square!!!

title: DA EVITARE !
text:
L’hotel non ci e’ piaciuto. Caro, stanze piccole al limite del passaggio, mai viste così. 
Poco pulito e le camere con i bagni vengono riadattate a loro dire ogni 4 giorni. 
Posizione centrale ma lontano dalla metto. 
La colazione e’ forse l’unica cosa decente…

title: Won’t be retuning
text: Dated property. Not very clean at all. Stayed here for one night for my wife’s birthday and will not stay again. Shower door was broken, there was a used bandaid left in the bathroom, and the front desk clerk gave me a new key card without verifying my identity.

title: Disappointed this is a Hilton property
text: I was amazed at check-in when the line was almost out the door and there was only one person checking guests in and no manager on site.  One of 2 rooms wreaked of marijuana as did the nearby stairwell.  I immediately went to the front desk where the line was longer than before and when asked the valet to speak to the manager was told there was no one except him and the woman at front desk.  I said there is an issue with the room.  He went to the neighboring hotel and got a manager.  He offered to clean the room and provide an ozone machine.  The carpets and furniture were filthy and the mirrors appeared to have coffee stains on them.  The shower doors didn't close easily and the shower floor was not as pristine as expected in a hotel.  The hallway had not been vacuumed or cleaned for a significant amount of time.  I noted it was finally vacuumed that last day we were there as there was the same debris all week.  When showering, I didn't have hot water the first night and it only became luke warm the following nights.  The next morning, I went to breakfast.  That was another disappointment.  There was a hair in my eggs, the milk machine didn't work and there was a milk container on the counter but was not iced down.  A portion of the juice machine didn't work either.  The bagel and muffin containers were empty and only a couple of slices of bread and no condiments.  At that point I went to the front desk and asked if it was possible to change hotels.  Was told, I needed to speak to a manager and there wouldn't be one on site for a few hours.  When I was back to the hotel later that afternoon, the manager was already gone for the day. After day three, I gave up on trying to reach a manager to switch hotels as I was only there for 5 nights.  All in all, I believe the staff was friendly and did what they could but the hotel itself was subpar and should not be part of the Hilton group.  I will not be staying at this Hampton Inn again.  I have stayed at other Hampton Inns in Times Square as well as other Hiltons and all were substantially better than this one.

title: Dirty room, abysmal customer service
text: My family checked in at 11pm May 20 after a long day of travel only to be told one of the two rooms was not clean. 2 hours later, my wife sought out the manager and was told the room was now clean. The room was littered with drink bottles, pizza boxes and ladies' clothing. A 1 am call to the manager got the trash gathered and deposited in a trash bag outside the room door. The next evening, after a long day of sightseeing, my family wanted to relax and enjoy an in-room movie. Neither television worked in the two rooms. Calls to the manager to repair or replace the TVs proved fruitless. I moved my family out that night to another hotel, Hilton Midtown Manhattan, which proved to be clean and have excellent service.I have tried multiple times to have my 463,294 Hilton Honors points refunded, but the hotel's management refuses to refund them.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE
text: Disgusting rooms, horrible staff. Missing/stolen items from our room, blood on bed sheets, staff still owes us compensation for stolen items, it has been a month. Do not stay here, you will be incredibly disappointed.

title: Incompetent and spiteful front desk staff, go somewhere else
text:
Showed up at 2:50pm and was third in line for 3:00pm check-in.
Clerk let the first person add two more people to the line and extra rooms to an incomplete reservation, then the second person in line turned into a group of six people that each required a double room that was not booked.
Spent over an hour waiting for these to complete, the lobby was hot, full of people with a line out  to the sidewalk. 
When it was my turn it was after 4:00pm, clerk then said I was all set, ran my credit card and then told me that they did not have any rooms left after I just paid for my room. 
So I asked for a refund and was told he didn’t know how to do that.
Completely unprofessional.
Do your self a favor and go to another hotel, the double tree nearby was very nice and accommodating.

title: Hampton Not Good
text: Our very first trip to NYC. Thought Hampton would be a trusted name. Rooms are very small….just so you’re aware. However, the main issue was our toilet never worked from the get go. Guy came in to work on it but didn’t solve the problem. Elevators totally broke for several hours and no one seemed to know anything about getting them fixed. Most people working there were literally just warm bodies without answers. When I went down the next morning to cancel the rest of our stay the lady at the from desk was the most helpful. (Blonde older lady) would never stay here again and Hampton should be embarrassed by this property.

title: Horrible customer service and no regard to their guests.
text: First when we walked into the lobby no one greeted us. Then there was a problem with our reservation and Abnan the manager was rude and could careless of helping us! We used our Hilton Honors points and somehow the reservation was a day early Sunday through Tuesday and we were not even in town Sunday, we were there Monday through Wednesday. Whicheant we didn't even check in and he refused to do sosaid to call hilton honors so i did and they said itwas up to the managerto move it. So we went back to talk to Abnan and he said no and if we wanted to stay Monday night fine but Tuesday night we needed to get a room because they were filling up fast and he could not guarantee us aroom which later finding out was a liedue to knowing someone who worked for Hilton. All we were asking is to move the day for Monday to Wednesday instead to Sunday to Tuesday because we were not even in the state. We also contacted Laurie his manager and she never responded but once asking for our itinerary and then never heard a word back.We are Hilton Honor members and stay in Hilton owned places alot and NEVER have ran into this issues ever. The only nice and friendly person they have on staff that we came in contact was a man named Alex. The facility was dirty, our room only 2 plugs worked and the shower was stained at the bottom really bad that we wore flip flops to shower. We would never recommend the facility ever.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE - FILTHY, NO HOUSEKEEPING
text:
DO NOT STAY HERE. The hotel is filthy and clearly extremely understaffed. We didn’t get body wash, shower caps etc. My bath towel had holes in it. My fiancé and I couldn’t even each have a shower because there was no hot water about 1 min into my shower. We checked into our room and it was so dirty we had to ask for a different room. The first room we were in also smelled extremely musty. The hotel has 32 floors and only 3 of them have operational ice machines. We had to wait about 5 mins anytime we wanted to get the elevator. Hallways clearly do not get vacuumed or cleaned. We checked into a different room and it was also filthy. We were told there is no housekeeping services. We asked the hotel front desk to send someone to clean our room and they promised someone would come immediately. The room had not been touched when we came back… same hairs in the shower etc. They never came. Our curtains didn’t close, so we have had to hide in the bathroom to change. My fiancé and I were in NYC for our honeymoon and we spent part of it cleaning our own room… yes, we literally had to go buy cleaning products because housekeeping wouldn’t do it. We also had to collect and take out our own trash. 

Free breakfast doesn’t mean much when you can’t get any food! Unless you went at 6am when it opened they ran out of everything only about halfway through the breakfast time. The breakfast room was dirty and nobody was there to clean it. 

Absolutely despicable “service.” Part of paying for a hotel is to get a clean room with housekeeping service. No. We had to ask even for the basics (soap, body wash)… insanity. Never ever stay at this hotel. It turns my stomach to think of the hundreds of dollars we had to spend on this hotel.

title: Very Bad Hotel. Please avoid.
text:
We are Hilton Honors members and had been staying in this hotel since we first came to NY 10 years ago. We had always been staying with Hampton Inn Times Square South on 337 West 39th St each time I visit NY. I was looking forward to the stay since it was my first trip out since borders reopened after 2 years. 
The entire stay this time was a complete disaster. 
I checked In on 21st June (Tue).

1- we were assigned a room meant for elderly/ disabled. Bathroom had no ledge to prevent water from spilling out so floors get wet. Ok so that’s fine. Didn’t complain or request to change room. Just accommodate.

2- We were told the next day housekeeping is only on every 4 days. Meantime a “houseman” will come to clear soiled towels and replace fresh ones. I placed my request 3 times over the stay. NO ONE turned up.

4- One morning I saw some housekeeping  staff outside at the corridor and asked them to help take out the wet towels. They asked me to “ask the boss” and pointed to someone in the store room. So I went and asked. The “boss”. The lady was rude and repeated to me housekeeping is every 4 days and a houseman will come to clear. I told her I did but no one came. She said she is busy. I said any of the girls can just come and take the towels- won’t take more than 5 minutes and there were 5 of them standing around waiting, and my room was just around the corner!  The “boss” argued that they are each assigned tasks already. I insisted. She had no choice and told one girl to come and clear the wet towels and trash. It took 2 minutes to complete the job.

4- I asked about housekeeping on Friday (Day 4). Staff said they will put in request. Again, no one turned up.

5- I had to go to front desk to get my own fresh towels. Used towels were piling up, primary to dry the wet floors and prevent slipping accidents. 

6- the Main sliding door was not working one of the evenings when we came back and failed to open. Some guests behind us and we were all waiting for the door to open. We knocked. No one. We knocked again, a little louder this time. Then front desk staff heard and opened it, and said we were “not supposed to do that” and that “he will impose a $5000 fine” if we do it again (??!!) what? Door malfunction at 5pm, staff not paying attention, we knocked because crowd was building up behind, and staff threatened to impose a fine? 

7- amenities given in the room had 2 miserable bars of soap that is smaller than my pinky finger. I had to ask front desk for the proper soap. 

8- when I checked out, there was a housekeeping cart parked right at the lift landing along the narrow corridor. I had to slowly squeeze the luggage through to get to the elevators. The staff came by, excused herself to squeeze through me, take her item and walked away. She did not even apologize for putting the cart in our way, or pushed the cart aside for me to get the luggage through!

title: El peor hotel que he estado.
text:
Hotel con pésimo servicio de housekeeping, en 6 días no hicieron aseo en la habitación.
Personal poco interesado en ayudar, solicité aseo en la habitación en 3 ocasiones y no se preocuparon que el aseo se hiciera. Uno llegaba al final del día y se encontraba la habitación desordenada y sin limpiar.
Desayuno con poca variedad.
Habitación sucia, con olor a humedad y marihuana. Habían pelos en el baño.

title: Birthday trip
text:
Great rooms, Joseph the Bellman held our luggage while we went to lunch then came back to checkin. He made our trip less stressful . The rest of the staff were very helpful as well. Made for a very fun trip.
Thank you Joseph

title: Fine for the essentials - don't expect luxury
text:
I was part of a large tour group that stayed at the Hampton Inn on W 39th in mid-June, 2022. The hotel is in a good location for exploring Times Square or the Herald Square area, getting to the subway stop at the Port Authority to get to other parts of the city, and giving quick access to the restaurants along 9th Ave. The staff was always available at the front desk and helpful when our large group needed some assistance - especially departure day when they turned the hotel's lobby into luggage storage while we waited for our ride to the airport well after checkout time.

People traveling to NYC and staying in chain hotels like the Hampton are often shocked they are not the same as the hotels in the chain they'll find along the interstates. The rooms are notably smaller with a living space big enough to fit a couple beds, a desk, a dresser, and not much else. The bathroom is similar. Expect to bump into the wall and shower door as you take a shower.

The biggest problem this hotel has is the elevators. Two slow, small elevators serving 33 floors and probably around 180 rooms. During the hours of highest demand - morning for breakfast, check-in/check-out times, and the like - expect a long wait for an elevator up or down. It's almost worth asking for a room on a lower floor if you can tolerate stairs. High demand hours also hit the hotel in other ways. Others in our group shared stories of showers not working in the morning. The latter hours of breakfast can be challenging as well as the staff works to keep up with demand. 

Those issues aside, our room was fine for what we needed it for - a place to sleep and get ready in the morning. I'm not one to give a hotel room the white glove treatment on arrival. Ours didn't have any immediately noticeable cleanliness issues and I didn't go looking for some. If you want something better than the essentials in midtown Manhattan, you'll want to upgrade to a bigger-name hotel. If you just need a place to sleep at night and shower, this place is adequate.

title: Lost my bag
text: I left my bag with hotel front desk after I checked out to be picked up later in the day.  Came back in the afternoon and they could not find my bag so I left for airport without my bag.  The hotel later found my bag and told me they were going to ship to me and after 1 week still do not have my bag.  I continue to call the hotel and no one is able to tell me where my bag is located and if it has even shipped.  I continue to call and get the run around.  I used to stay at this hotel a lot but I will completely avoid this hotel in the future.

title: This is not a Hilton.
text:
I stayed for four nights with my wife and daughter. 

Good news. 

Excellent location. Breakfast is good and comparable to other Hampton locations. 

Bad news. 

I know that the hotels in NYC are smaller but this Win that category.

I overall I don’t feel that this hotel belong to Hilton.

Bathroom and room in bad conditions and extremely very tiny. 
No housekeeping during my stay due to a rule to clean the rooms every four days. 

Broken lamps and bathroom accessories are part of this room. Uncomfortable and tiny double beds. 

If you need towels, toilet paper, soap, shampoo and conditioner,  you need to request it by phone.  Nevertheless never appear so is  better to visit the front desk during the day. Not during the night since the staff are rude. 

Breakfast area dirty and just one employee fill the pans and try to maintain all in order. 

Hilton honor benefits did not exists.

title: Way below expectations!
text: This hotel fell way below expectations for a Hampton Inn. Mildew in the bathroom ceiling and just dirty. The entire hotel room smelled of mildew. The hotel elevators were broken, resulting in long waits to up and down in the building.  Overall I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Convenient & Clean
text: One-night stay was very good. Asked for a delayed checkout and was able to get it complimentary that morning which was wonderful. Room was very clean and hotel is conveniently located in really the bottom of Hell’s Kitchen / south of Time Square. Bed was very comfortable. Only problem was very hot sink water and the AC was a bit noisy, but we did not report either. Great eatery Nitti’s is down the block on 9th.

title: Cold shower, used amenities and a shrug from the front desk
text: Booked a good rate well in advance of my visit.   The rooms are small, at 220 sf and stuffed pretty tight with king bed and desk.  The main failure of this stay was a cold shower.  The mixing valves were  not set properly in my room as the shower couldn’t really produce hot water and the sink struggled to produce cold water.  To compound the misery in the shower, housekeeping left a three quarter consumed shampoo bottle instead of replacing.   Front desk apologised, but it was more of a shrug and then I left, certain to never return to this property.

title: Great location. Too small for us.
text: Me, my husband and daughter stayed in room 3206 5/16/22-5/25/22. Location of hotel is great, walking distance to many things. The room appeared to be recently remodeled and it was very clean. Comfortable beds, pillows, linens. Average or slightly below towels, tp, toiletries. Probably would not stay here again for the following reasons: Space between beds and dresser is only about 22 inches. Shower is only about 22 inches wide very uncomfortable for my husband. Breakfast was mediocre and constantly out of stock. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful

title: Not being able to reach the front desk through phone!
text: Despite the overall experience was fine everything was totally ruined by the very last service. I forgot a small suitcase in the limo which I ordered through hotel front desk. When I realised at the airport I was trying 5 times to reach the front desk of Hampton Inn to get contact for the driver. The only chance was to call the only one given number 212 967 2344 which was a call center. They tried to put me through but no one picked up even after 9 minutes. During my 5th call in a row I begged the operator to try herself which she did and confirmed that no one was picking up and asked if she can pass my call to manager. Shockingly enough even manager has not picked up. I completely admit that forgotten suitcase has nothing to do with service of a hotel but not being able to reach a front desk or manager in 25 continuous minutes of trying is just a shame.

title: Disappointing hotel experience!
text: We stayed as a family at this hotel from April 06-11. The overall experience was disappointing..not one we would expect from a Hilton chain. Our flight into New York was slightly delayed so we reached the hotel at 11 pm or so. We were greeted not by a smile and welcoming person but a curt abrupt staff at front desk. We were  told we had to pay ADDITIONAL USD 70 PER DAY as Incidentals! This amount was supposed to be refunded into our account in a matter of days after checkout. Till today no signs of our money. Our room was not cleaned for FOUR days. Only on the 5th ( our last) day did housekeeping clean the room and bathroom. Except for the location there is NOTHING positive about this hotel! Please avoid....

title: Excellent Accommodation
text: I was accommodated very well above what I expected. Since the room I booked for wasn't available when I was doing an early check in, I was given 2 room for the original price of my 2 double bed booking.

title: Not the best, you get what you pay for.
text:
I chose this hotel b/c reviews were decent & location. I anticipated the room to be small b/c it's NY, however, it was not comfortable for a family of 4. Beds were wall to wall and they were full size. No one slept comfortably. Very tight quarters, no where to place your luggage. 
The room was extremely dirty. The sheets over the box springs were stained which left me nausious and uncomfortable. The  carpet in the room was disgusting. I spilled water on the rug, my daughter accidently stepped on the spill with her white socks. The bottom of her socks literally turned black. I immediately threw the socks out and we made sure not to walk on the carpet barefoot. We threw all our socks out. 
Breakfast was mediocre. Cold and not many options. Empty pans, waiting for them to be refilled. People touching the food with thier hands despite the signs. The poor girl working there was by herself working. I know its a nationwide problem trying to find workers but it defintely affected breakfast. Tables weren't being cleaned as guests left, so people, including ourselves, had to wipe down tables between uses. 
One day, one of the elevatots didn't work, causing a  backup. We were waiting and waiting and waiting for the elevator. Our room was on the 25th floor. We were in a hurry, needing to be somewhere at a certain time, so we attempted to climb 25 flights. As we reached our room my husband and my 12 year old threw up from the tedious climb. Setting us back from our appointment quite a bit. .
If you are about cleanliness, this isn't the place to stay. FYI, they don't have maid service during your stay. They will bring you new towels and sheets upon request. One garbage can in the bathroom (no room for one in the room). So bring extra bags for back up if you stay here. 
The only positive it it was centrally located to most tourist stops and port authority, but I likely won't stay again. You get what you pay for I guess.

title: Avoid this particular Hampton Inn
text:
- This hotel really needs a facelift. Stayed at other Hampton Inns but this one is in disrepair
- Got a room with two double beds . Very very tight
- Bed sheets had some black ashy substance on them
-Staff is indifferent to rude. A house keeper yelled at a customer for entering the elevator before she could exit. It was a mistake but she went beserk. Front desk employees are not attentive and are engaged in personal conversations.
- If you decide to valet and then need to pick up your car at checkout, tell them 1 hour in advance
--Location is the saving grace and I guess that is the reason that everything else is being ignored

title: Theater trip!
text: Hotel staff were  super friendly, and the hotel was neat and clean. Easy 10 min walk from Penn Station, we were able to check in a little early and then head out into the city. Elevators moved quickly and quietly. Hotel was easy 10 min walk to Marquis theater, and plenty of great restaurants on the way to and from the hotel.  Breakfast was well stocked and plenty of dining room seating. Hand sanitizers in lobby and dining area downstairs and we felt safe and comfortable. They also offer a military rate which helped save on the cost of staying. I would stay here again.

title: Atende bem, mas a qualidade é razoável
text:
A localização não é das melhores, necessário caminhar trechos consideráveis para chegar nos pontos importantes. 
O banheiro extremamente pequeno, precisamos tomar banho de lado, esbarrando a todo momento na barra de acessibilidade. Porém, não é exatamente um problema, já que esse isso é um padrão em NY.
Café da manhã muito limitado, pouquíssimos itens, não tem sequer máquina de waffles como em outros hotéis da mesma rede. Decepcionante, pois escolhemos esse hotel justamente pelos waffles. Em alguns dias nem descemos para tomar. É fato que hotel com café da manhã em NY é bem raro de encontrar, mas entendo que quando se dispõem a oferecer, devem manter um padrão mínimo de qualidade, afinal, pagamos por isso no valor da diária.
As áreas comuns são relativamente sujas e sem manutenção. A limpeza do quarto só foi feita em uma única oportunidade durante as 6 diárias que permanecemos.
Há um microondas na recepção que ajuda em alguns momentos, mas é sujo e enferrujado.
Os dois elevadores não comportam a quantidade de hóspedes/andares. Em horários de pico, chegamos a ficar 20 minutos esperando e por fim descemos 16 andares de escada.
Os funcionários são bastante cordiais, forneceram toalhas quando pedimos, além de água grátis. Em alguns dias tinha chocolate quente e café grátis na copa.
O maior ponto positivo é o fato de não cobrarem taxa de resort, o que é quase impossível em NY. Além disso, também há cofre e frigobar no quarto, pontos positivos a serem considerados.
Para quem deseja um hotel apenas para dormir e não liga muito para conforto quanto aos itens acima, é um bom local sim.
Porém, no nosso caso, em uma próxima vez investiríamos um pouco mais e ficaríamos no RIU, hotel mais novo e bem localizado, com um café da manhã maravilhoso, além de uma vista linda.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado, a solo unos metros de la Estación 35 Herald SQ desde donde se puede llegar a cualquier punto de la ciudad. En el entrono más cercano se encuentra el Empire State y el Times Square. 

El servicio del hotel cumple adecuadamente con todo, limpieza de la habitación, desayuno variado hasta las 11 horas, gimnasio. Las habitaciones son amplias y equipamiento moderno. 

Volvería a este hotel.

title: A comfortable stay
text:
I was a little unsure what to expect from this hotel given some of the reviews. Overall, I was happy with my stay as ultimately the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, there was breakfast, and it was in a very convenient location, close to several subway lines, Penn Station, the Port Authority and the Megabus stop. The price was fair. There were also loads of places to eat, including a Pret A Manger in the corner. Just do your research going in, and know that certain hotel chains offer quite specific levels of service (and that other hotel brands in their group might offer more/less).

Staff were polite and efficient, and explained things at check in such as room cleaning is initiated on the 4th day of any stay, but that you can also request items from the front desk (e..g fresh towels, toiletries). They did store my bag for me before check in. It’s clear they don’t have a specific location for this as when I went back to collect it, they asked me where it was stored. I didn’t store a bag on check out and other reviews suggest this isn’t possible.

In terms of amenities, the room had a large screen TV with some HD channels and a lot of USB charging points. The bathroom had a hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner and bar soap. There are no glasses. There is a fridge and a coffee maker, but no tea bags and paper cups. You can get ice and water on specific floors and I found some were out of order. You can also find one in the basement. There is also a safe and iron. The heating was a little loud at times, but this is not unusual in older properties. Overall the room in good condition and a decent size (I was in a King).

The breakfast was adequate to fill you up for the morning and it’s fair to say it’s not the highest quality compared with some other hotels but it does the job. There is coffee and tea (black tea, no herbal tea bags) and hot chocolate sachets. There was also water and juice. Food wise, there was fruit (bananas, apples, oranges), yoghurt, bread, plain bagels and muffins with condiments (jam, peanut butter, butter, cream cheese). There is also porridge with cinnamon sugar, flaked almonds and dried cranberries, as well as cereals with milk (whole and 2%). There is no syrup or waffles. Hot food wise, there were breakfast potatoes, the style of which was slightly different on some days (e.g. include bell peppers) and sausage (e.g. patties or standard links). There is also a microwave in the breakfast area which can be used all day by guests, it wasn’t clean though. There is no room service nor coffee or tea at reception. 

The hotel is right next to a Candlewood Suite and a Holiday Inn Express if you are considering those. There is basically no difference in terms of location if you are trading off your choices. There are only two elevators and this did mean that there could be long waits at certain times of the day. It would also sometimes stop at floors when there were no guests/staff waiting and I suspect they either decided to use the stairs or that both elevators are not synced to know if the other has stopped on the floor. This is obviously not ideal, but realistically they aren’t about to add another elevator (it’s a narrow tall building), so it’s just something you need to be prepared for.  There is also a building site right next door and they did start work quite early, so be prepared for some drilling. Overall I would consider staying again.

title: Problem free stay
text: Great location, clean and problem free stay. Rooms are small, like any other hotel in the city. Close to everything, Times Square, restaurants, the Vessel and the river. Breakfast was nice. Safe area. I would stay again if the opportunity arises.

title: good for the price
text: This hotel is not fancy but it is good for the price.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The location is great - just a short walk to the Port Authority subway station and Times Square. They served a hot complementary breakfast in the morning (eggs, sausage, bread, fruit, coffee, yogurt, oatmeal) which was larger than we were expecting.  The only downsides are that the rooms are small (but we didn't spend much time there except to sleep) and they wouldn't hold our lugguage for a few hours after we checked out.

title: Nice stay for the price.  But….
text:
This hotel is clean, and comfortable, and they have a bit of a breakfast in the morning included in the room rate. 

Just be aware that they do not hold luggage for after you check out. Apparently…. they don’t have any staff to act able to store a bag, and find it later, anymore. They actually  send you to a neighborhood coffee shop that charges 20$ to hold your stuff!! 
Very unprofessional for a national, chain hotel… I’ve never, in 35 years travel …. had a hotel unable to hold baggage for a few hours after checkout.

title: Run for your life
text: Do not get into the elevator. The Tower of Terror ride in Disney World is safer and less scary. The doors don't close or lock properly. The $45 per night parking fee is actually $110 plus $20 in taxes.

title: This is the worst Hampton Inn I've ever stayed in. Avoid at all costs.
text:
I cannot believe Hilton Hotels attached themselves to this dump.  The line of complaints at the desk was a mile long. The "store" they advertised was completely empty.  Only one of two elevators (for a 25 story building) worked.  This led to over 20 people waiting to cram into one elevator (safety hazard), or waiting forever for one to come.  

The hotel itself is old, outdated, dirty and severely lacking in amenities.

None of the employees seemed to care in the slightest about any of this.

Hilton management needs to step in asap and take over and rectify these issues.  This is not the quality I expect from a Hilton Hotel, even if it is a Hampton Inn. I would never stay here again and would advise everyone to avoid it all costs.

title: Pire hôtel de New York.
text:
Déçu de cette hôtel, chambre jamais nettoyé.

Ascenseur hyper long, j'ai dû attendre jusqu'à 15 minutes dans les heures de pointe.

Chambres insonorisées, je me suis fait réveiller à 4h du matin par des gens qui rentrait de soirée . On entend toute les conversations à l'intérieur des chambres...

Petit déjeuner vraiment basic, pas de lait chaud. 

Les chambres sont très petites et poussiéreuse.

Pas de bagagerie  .

title: Excellent Stay!
text: This hotel was perfect in proximity to Madison Square Garden, Times Square, 5th Ave, and tons of other city places my family likes to visit. The price was also very reasonable for an overnight stay and for the quality of the room, which was very clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful both during my stay and during phone calls I made prior to booking to ask questions, which were all answered honestly and helpfully. The only complaint I have is our toilet had a little ring of grime in the bowl, but that honestly did not bother me too much as I did not spend much time in the bathroom! I would definitely come here again!

title: No hay servicio de limpieza diario
text: No hay limpieza diario, tampoco me limpian las toallas, tuve que ir a casa rato por toallas limpia que se iban acumulando diario; también pedía papel y solo me daban de uno. No sacaban la basura  etc… muy mal

title: Peor hotel que me he hospedado en la vida
text:
Hotel paupérrimo. Horrible a simple vista, desayuno asqueroso, habitaciones mínimas. Básicamente estuvimos hacinados los 4 días de estadía. 
Ubicación llena de drogadictos. Realmente la peor decisión fue haberme hospedado ahí. Nunca más!!!!

title: Clean, affordable, economical
text: The stat was clean and affordable.  No frills.  Location was great with daily breakfast.  Although they only had one attendant, who seemed to be overwhelmed. We did appreciate him.  I would have liked to have known in advance prior to booking that the hotel does not have space to hood luggage. We had to pay extra at a local convenience store to store our luggage. The front desk staff was great, cleaning staff was rude and not very helpful.

title: My not so satisfying experience in Hampton Inn Manhattan
text: The toilet water tank pressure issue and loud noise that it creates. The A/C is so filthy and full of dusts. Tiny room for an upgraded King Size bed. Location of the hotel and hot breakfast every morning both are perfect!

title: Great Customer Service
text:
Rooms were very clean, All of the Employees were very helpful and courteous. 
The free breakfast was good but just not enough to accommodate all of the guests during the time available.  Beds are a little hard but that’s expected with most hotels. Would definitely recommend.
