title: Great location, but had shower pressure issues
text: The shower pressure needs to be fixed. Also, we found an empty vodka bottle near the bed and another bottle as well.  Other than that, hotel is very close to action of Times Square. Would recommend for ease of access to anyone who wants to visit NYC and be close to Port Authority and Penn Station and attractions.

title: Pas terrible
text:
Les + : l’emplacement 
Les - : tout le reste
Ménage non fait les 7 jours, les poubelles non changées, serviettes non plus. Nous avons pourtant demandé. Seul les devinettes et poubelles ont fini par être changées une fois. Petite dej moyen nous déjeunons finalement dehors. Nous n’avions pas de chauffage et donc de la condensation dans la chambre. Nous avons demandé une intervention  mais personne n’est venu.
La chambre est minuscule, vous ne pourrez pas y entreposer vos valises, elles resteront dans le passage dans le couloir. Impossible de circuler à 4. Cette chambre ne servira qu’à dormir et se doucher.

title: Peu satisfaite
text:
Hôtel bien situé, 
chambre petite nous avions une chambre pour 4 difficile d’y circuler avec les valises… 
Nettoyage et changement de serviettes inexistant sur 6 nuits…😬 2 jours pour déboucher des toilettes 😫

title: Poor room quality
text:
Room was dirty, mostly bathroom. Shower had not been cleaned properly, hair in drain, black mold in shower, stained towels, wall outlets did not work, room safe not working.
We had a room with 2 double beds and very little space for luggage or to move around in the room.

title: good location, but some problems
text: Hilton app allows user to pre-select their room on day of check in, but hotel would not honor this. We were upcharged for higher floor but put on the lowest "high floor" with back view instead of front. Which was just a view into a bunch of other tall buildings. Room was fairly quiet but smell of marijuana was very strong. Breakfast was available but extremely long wait and all three days, they ran out of food. One day we only could grab one banana, one apple, and coffee. The staff was not outwardly rude, but definitely not kind or helpful or welcoming. No hair dryer, no daily cleaning during your stay. The  most annoying thing was my mattress was upside down! I was being poked by tiny sharp things like pieces of mulch. Realized the mattress was upside down around 2am so I stripped it, flipped it, and remade it. It was fine. I don't understand how that mistake was made as it is NOT a mattress that can be used on both sides.

title: Budget hotel
text: This location desperately needs updating. Ancient coffee makers, very dated bathrooms. Generally, unpleasant. Rooms need a deep clean. Didn’t try the breakfast as area was super crowded and chaotic. Look elsewhere.

title: Extremely pricy with no privacy
text: No privacy in the room. The curtain didn’t close completely and people from building across to ours could see what’s going on inside our room clearly. Also, There was a mold in the bathroom which made us feel little concerned. Rooms are extremely small for family. Breakfast was busy and didn’t had enough seating area.

title: Overall Good place to stay!
text:
Very convenient location,Friendly Staff,Room was clean as per expectation .All COVID protocols were implemented.
You are just few blocks away from tourist attractions .Lot of good Restaurant are nearby.

title: Mala experiencia
text: Necesitan mejorar sobre servicio y resolución de problemas. Además de la limpieza. El personal es amable pero no resuelven nada. Solo responde que disculpe “ya mañana resolvemos” y así pasaron 4 noches. Además que el aire acondicionado de la habitación hace un ruido terrible que no permite dormir y gotea agua.

title: Dirty
text: The carpets are soiled where you can visually see the dirt and stains. The towels were old and scratch. There wasn’t Enough soap for the time we were staying. The owners obviously do not take enough pride to put money back into the hotel and make it nice.

title: Very poor
text:
No room cleaning service. 
My phone charger was taken. 
Laptop charger taken. 
Filed a claim 
No return call. 
Difficult to reach hotel 
Will not stay there agin
Much better Hilton properties in nyc. 
Very disappointed

title: If going to shows on Broadway this is a great location!
text: Great location for shows and restaurants. Relatively quiet street. Our rooms on backside of building blocked much of the traffic noise. Beds very comfortable. Convenient to all midtown attractions, Moynihan Train Station.

title: Affordable and near many attractions
text: I came in town to see Beabadoobee and I love roaming through time square whenever I’m in New York. When I was in my room, didn’t hear noise pollution outside which was awesome. The complimentary breakfast Saved me some money. I did use digital keys majority of the time, except whenever I locked my phone inside of my hotel room. And I had to go downstairs with the physical keys to get them change order for me to open the door which was a minor inconvenience depending on how you look at it. But the overall experience, buying snacks or drinks from the Bobby, the complementary breakfast in the privacy but I had during my stay was top notch.

title: Pésima atención
text:
Estuvimos alojados, desde el 27/10 hasta el día de hoy 3/11, y la verdad es que me voy decepcionada de este lugar, dejando de lado la ubicación que es lo único que se salva.
Los de la recepción son muy mal educados, en especial dos personas  Wilmer y Camila, muy malcriados y fríos cero acogedores.
En cuanto a la limpieza  fue terrible darme con la noticia de que no hacían limpieza en los cuartos por coa del covid.  (increíble, ya que casi todos los hoteles  alrededor dan ese servicio). 
Y para terminar  con la cereza en la torta, encontré las toallas sucias y manchadas. 
NO LO RECOMIENDO.

title: Excellent Hampton hotel in Manhattan
text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The service was great, the place clean, I was very happy with the location and the price. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great experience and affordability.

title: Asqueroso hotel rateros
text: Pésimo hotel son unos rateros me tomaron de mi tarjeta 9500 pesos y dijeron q me lo regresarían al salir y fue mentira, ya pasaron dos semanas y no lo han echo RATEROS RATEROS, las habitaciones un asco nunca las limpiaron asquerosamente sucio, esta en un lugar decadente de nueva york, la recepción es un verdadero asco el trato q te dan, solo espero mw regresen mi dinero por q bastante pague por sus horribles habitaciones

title: Start of Fall Visit
text:
The hotel is situated in a safe environment, also nearby all the modes of transportation available. Port Authority Bus Station is just an 8min walk. 
The people are also courteous and helpful. Great location with decent breakfast and a quiet gym. Perfect room size, comfortable bed, quite a narrow shower but manageable. 
Pantry is available anytime. Always nice & clean.

title: Worst experience ever
text: Front desk staff should NOT be in customer service! Worst experience ever! Safe & tv didn’t work, maintenance man was the only friendly staff member! The other staff blamed everything on Covid! Thing we told us they cldnt help us with did for other people!

title: Poor conduct and service! Shame on the Hilton network
text:
We booked in advance, a single night and then 3 more nights. Beyond the location (good but not amazing) I have no good words. The staff is lacking, the manager lacks flight or creativity to solve problems, we ended the holiday with a sense of disappointment.
After a full day of touring Manhattan, we returned to the room to find that it had not been cleaned and no towels had been changed. At reception the answer was that they only clean on the fifth day. And they are sorry I did not know about that. It's clear to them, they forgot to inform the hotel guest. 
It was never explained even though it was the second check in at the hotel.
At breakfast, which should be until 9AM, stop serving half an hour before closing.
I got a broken room with low level maintenance, the safe was broken without a mechanism, the air conditioner without buttons that allow adjustment or on / off, and of course the room was replaced with another room.

Shame on the name of the Hilton chain. Do not book at this hotel.

title: Good, but with small issues
text:
+ The hotels staff are so sweet! They’re really involved to resolve any requests. The room was good with a city view, exactly what I asked for, with comfy bed and good wi-fi. Location is also pretty good and near to the Times Square.

- Unfortunately that street is full of hobos, I felt a bit scared there, but fortunately without any incidents. I didn’t have a room cleaning before I asked for it, then it has been scheduled for next day. Also breakfast was poor, I guess due to Covid-19, but no choices and many people in the small dining room. To visit it you have to be vaccinated, but honestly no one checked for it.

title: Horrible experience
text: Horrible experience I have explained the problems and concerns we had in the questions list it before this statement overall it was a bad experience I will never recommend this location again I am from Houston Texas and I stay at the Hampton pretty often I have never had this problem before it was horrible

title: son un robo!! te cobran el deposito y nunca te lo regresan
text:
pesismooooo, son un robo, me cobraron un deposito por las noches que estuve , diciendo que cuando hiciera el check out, lo regresarian, cosas que ya paso un mes y medio y es mentira. dicen que segun lo tienen mi banco y es mentira
son unos raterossss!!!!!! tengan cuidado

title: HOTEL MALO
text: Habitaciones pequeñas, mal servicio, no cambian sabanas por 8 días o tiempo de la estadía, desayuno malo, preferimos desayunar fuera a pesar de  estar incluido en el precio que se pago, no se como puede tener 4 estrellas en TripAdvisor, nos dejamos guiar por esas recomendaciones, definitivamente no recomiendo este hotel.

title: Birthday Trip Stay
text: I would recommend this hotel to stay the staff where polite. I felt safe it wasn’t to far from time square. The complimentary breakfast was great if you’re traveling for a special trip they will recognize you. Well at least the staff did for me.

title: Hotel is not maintained for its status and price range
text: Location of the hotel typically implies the level of service and quality of accommodation. This hotel does not meet any of these expectations unfortunately. Building is old and hotel not maintained. It urgently requires renovation. The rooms are tiny (two double beds barely fit in a room with enough space to fit one person walking by the bed), the ceiling is moldy, the bathroom mirror is loosing away it’s reflective surface and looks very old (not vintage).  I hope management takes immediate steps to fix the quality of the rooms offered as I personally would never come back to this hotel at the current price tag. The only plus is the personnel in the kitchen - those guys work super hard to make your breakfast experience the best part of the day!

title: Poor do not recommend
text:
You are literally just paying for the Hilton name. Nothing matches up to the standards and regret not booking somewhere else. The service was poor outside of one worker Alex. 

They seemed very incompetent and overcharged me and to date I haven’t received my refund or my deposit.

title: Worst Hilton experience so far
text:
Hotel was dirty - very slow drain in both sink and shower, bits of food and trash in room air conditioning, etc. 
Hotel staff was the worst I have dealt with. 
I have been a Diamond member for years, and this is the first time I am not sure why, but when I asked for some bottled water, I was told emphatically that they only gave them out during check in. 
Sure enough, a minute later, a non-Asian couple come, ask for water, and they are given a bottle each. 
Only then, was I reluctantly handed 1 bottle, even if we were 2 families traveling together. 
Also, when I checked out, all they did was take my key. 
Other non-Asian people check out, they are asked things like whether they wanted a receipt, emailed or printed. 
For both our room, nothing. They just take the keys from us. 
As a multi-year Hilton Diamond member, this was the worst experience I have ever had across multiple hotel brands. From service, room, etc. 

I am also a Titanium in Marriott, and soon a Globalist in Hyatt. 
No way am I ever going to a Hilton property again if I can help it.

title: Good Visit
text: Trip is after a COVID-19 year, so it is what it is. I think this NYC location is doing a great job  considering the year we had last year. Staff was friendly and helpful. Self Parking was not convenient but I understand the COVID rules.

title: Great location, poor condition
text: Location is excellent. Air conditioning didn’t work well the whole trip, so beds felt damp from the humidity. We wound up sleeping on top of the sheets in an attempt to stay cool (it didn’t work). We had water running down the bathroom wall from the room above, creating a puddle on our bathroom floor. That said, the location and lack of road noise would make this 9/10 if they fixed the a/c and water leak.

title: Buena ubicacion
text:
El hotel está bien, es para dormir, habitaciones pequeñas como la mayoría en NYC. Un poco viejo todo pero esta bien.
Por ahora sirven desayuno asqueroso de caja por la “pandemia” 
Esta cerca del metro y restaurantes

title: Bad Hotel
text:
No room service available should have told us prior when we booked the hotel booked it over the phone so they could have told us no breakfast no room service. A/C wasn’t working….
Carpet was very dirty

title: Disappointing stay
text: As I do with all our hotel stays, I do a black light cleanliness check to ensure Hilton’s “cleanliness guarantee”. Not so in this case. Room number one was not as clean as we expected plus the air conditioning was malfunctioning. I will admit that the staff was very proactive in addressing the AC issue. When we were moved to room #2, it was cleaner but not what we expected from a cleanliness guarantee. Again the staff was very proactive with changing out the comforter. In addition, when my wife was showering the shower shelf fell off and hit her in the foot. Overall not one of our better stays

title: Buena ubicación, desayuno regular, mal olor en todo el pasillo
text: El hotel tiene muy buena ubicación. Las camas súper cómodas. Obviamente por covid no hacen aseo durante la estadía. El personal muy amable. Desafortunadamente los huéspedes no siguen normas de higiene en cuanto a NO FUMAR. Durante toda nuestra estadía tuvimos que soportar en todo el pasillo y en nuestra habitación un fuerte olor a marihuana. NUNCA se solucionó el tema. El desayuno que proveen sigue siendo en caja. Un bagel, para el que le gusta ok. Un yogurt ok. Una naranja ok. Los huevos no nos gustaron, por supuesto, cocinados  y conservados en vinagre. Muy fríos. Preferiría fruta en lugar de éstos.  Parqueaderod cercanos al hotel. Todo cerca.

title: Horrible experience. Very dirty rooms
text: The room was EXTREMELY DIRTY!!! I feel like I got sick from the uncleared dusty rusted air vent. The mirrors in both of the rooms that I had ere filthy, there was a large stain on the bed sheets and the bathroom door had dirt drip marks. I will attach photos if I can. There was close to no amenities and the smell of the room and hotel reeked of mold. Definitely does not look how it does online. The view that is at vertices is that the view of the city that you will get. I was terrified walking back to this hotel at night. The strip is lined with bums and crazy crack heads ready to chase you, snatch your kids, or try and sell you dirty drugs. I won’t be coming back here.

title: Poor Service
text:
On April 23, 2021, I reserved this hotel for the dates of November 20-25, 2021 for a family vacation.  I received an email on June 2, 2021 from hotel management notifying me that they had to cancel my reservation to accommodate a "government group" with the city of New York.  

 This is very pathetic, insulting and disrespectful,  but they don't care.

title: I love the hotel but not my previous stay!
text: I love going to this hotel for the fact that it is one of very few that will let you stay if you 18 or older. It's close to every restaurant and has parking on occasion. During my recent stay my room was not cleaned, there was a condom wrapper on the floor, the sheets were dirty and much more. If I am paying $400+ for 4 nights I would at least expect the room to be cleaned.

title: The best hotel in the area. Excellent.
text:
The hotel is clean, and as soon you approach the front of the property you can smell the cleanliness. Best of all, the excellent service by the lady at the front desk. 
I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who want to have a great experience of hospitality. I used to stay at Doubletree and Holiday inn, not anymore, the best is Hampton Inn Times Square.

title: What a great hotel at a great price and friendly staff at the front desk
text: This hotel is a little out of the way but it's a great price the rooms are spotless the front desk clerk who I was grouchy with after a long trip was great before I was getting me up in my room in a timely way, it's a good location

title: Quality Pocket Hotel around the corner for the Port Authority Bus Station
text: Traveling Salesmen's budget choice. It is a slender pencil of a structure with 5 rooms per floor. The bedroom is only a bedroom with an adequate writing desk and a room filling, comfortable bed. The shower is a bit cramped.

title: First time in New York
text: Made my first stay in NY easy and pleasant . No complications and the service desk were so helpful and patient with us . Its in a great location. Parking was a little difficult but we mainly ubered which was a lot easier.

title: Never again
text: No hot water, room extremely small for two people, no valet had to park five blocks away. Then when we get to the hotel we are told no breakfast after I had paid for breakfast prior to coming. They was only giving out brown box with hard boil eggs bagel yogurt and fruit

title: Your Typical Hampton Inn - Clean, Comfortable
text: Typical Hampton Inn experience - clean, comfortable rooms, decent service.  Reasonably convenient location within walking distance to Times Square and 8th Avenue subway.  Good rates available currently due to the pandemic.

title: Refused to refund school choir trip for April 2020
text: My son's school choir had a trip planned for April 15-18, 2020 to NYC, and that trip included a stay at this hotel. The choir director has been trying for almost a year to get a refund since COVID required the trip to be canceled.  The parents paid money for this trip and the students did not get to go and the money was not refunded. I am a Hilton Honors member and I was extremely disappointed to hear that this hotel is not doing the right thing to refund the money for this stay. My son was a senior and his senior year was ruined by COVID. This is just extremely frustrating. It has been almost a year and the hotel is not making this right. I would love to discuss with anyone who can refund the money of the whole choir.

title: Average
text: Staff was amazing during these busy times with broken elevator. I did the 33 floors that gets old. Breakfast is included waffles were good. Eggs and sausage usually. Crowded during new year. Close to everything. Price was expensive for what you get. Should have done a rental apt.

title: Great!
text:
Stayed in october as part of a large group for sporting tournament. The fact breakfast is included is a huge help, breakfast was everything you could need, bagels, muffins, fruit, cereals, bread , meats and eggs. Help yourself to coffee and tea throughout the day also. Staff were brilliant, professional and friendly. 
Rooms were ok, size was but beds and pillows very comfortable.  Bathroom well equipped. 
Take the stairs, elevators were very VERY slow. Highlight was the girl who appeared in charge of the dining room, a group of 30 guys and she ran tight ship in keeping all in line with good humour and a sharp tongue. Hugs for us all leaving. Will be back. Great location also, quiet street and a shirt walk to times square.

title: Hotel funcional
text:
A experiência no hotel foi muito boa. Ele é muito bem localizado e fica perto de atrações como, museu de cera, carlos bakery, intrepid museum, times square, central park...etc. Nova York é uma cidade onde voce caminha e cada esquina é uma atração, você anda e não percebe. Assim, essa localização atende.
Os funcionários são bem simpáticos e ajudam no que for preciso. O único problema que tive foi no check out onde eu aguardava a van para ir embora. Precisei ir no banheiro e prontamente me deram uma chave para usar o banheiro da academia. O problema é que o mesmo estava ocupado por um grande periodo, acho que alguem não estava muito bem. Não havia outro banheiro e tive que esperar por vários minutos, pois não havia alternativa nenhuma.
O café da manhã é bom, porém muito lotado pra quantidade de quartos. Provavelmente vocé terá dificuldade em se servir e achar.um lugar.
Os quartos são limpos e funcionais, embora um pouco pequeno.
Mesmo em um hotel grande, apenas 2 elevadores atende. Eles são muito rápidos. 
Vale a pena.

title: Prima locatie
text:
Kamer was klein, wel goede bedden en goede douche. Alleen werd er een week lang niet schoon gemaakt. Handdoeken moest je steeds vragen. 
Ontbijt was ok, wafels erg lekker maar verder niet bijzonder.
Verblijf was prima, maar zou er niet zo snel weer boeken.

title: Decent, Average Hotel but I Had One BIG Issue
text:
Room 304. 

I'll get right to the issue I had: the water in the shower and the sink (both Hot and Cold) became scaldingly Hot. I was taking a shower and everything was fine but then the water became too hot. I tried to adjust it but it didn't become cool or cold. Just very hot. And I mean dangerously hot. Ok. Not great but I was able to sponge off the soap and figured I could wash my hair in the sink. Nope. The water coming out of the faucet was also only Hot. No cold. 

I called Front Desk from the hotel phone. Got connected to an operator named "Maria". She said an engineer would be up shortly. Called at 8AM and by 8:30AM, no one had come. So I dressed and went to check out. Front Desk person really didn't seem to take me seriously. Offered zero compensation. But he did say "Have a nice day." Very frustrating.

title: Convenient location
text:
Great location, you can walk to time square in 5 mins, MSG in 10 mins and there is a subway nearby for anything else.

Down side is that sheets were grubby and tatty and curtains wouldn't shut due to air con being in the way.

title: Pleasant stay
text: Cons- Lifts were slow. Breakfast choices were minimal. Rooms are not sound proof so you easily get woken up to the sounds of traffic. Pros- Good location for the hotel and fair price for the stay. Lovely rooms. Comfortable beds. I would consider staying here again in the future.

title: Business Trip in NYC 2
text: Κατά τη διάρκεια αυτής της εβδομάδας βρέθηκα στην NYC για επαγγελματικούς λόγους και επέλεξα να μείνω σε αυτό το ξενοδοχείο που είχα διαμείνει και κατά την προηγούμενη επίσκεψη μου. Εντελώς ξαφνικά και χωρίς καμία άλλη ειδοποίηση, πετώντας μας είναι χαρτί κάτω από την πόρτα, μας ανακοίνωσαν ότι σταματούν την καθαριότητα των δωματίων ως μέτρο πρόληψης κατά του κορωνοϊού. Αυτό ήταν ανεπίτρεπτο μέτρο γιατί το κυριότερο μέτρο για την καταπολέμηση του ιού είναι η τήρηση των βασικών κανόνων υγιεινής που στερηθήκαμε κατα την παραμονής μας εκεί. Όταν και αποχώρησα 2 ημέρες νωρίτερα από την προγραμματισμένη αναχώρηση μου και ζήτησα επιστροφή χρημάτων μου απάντησαν ότι δεν δικαιούμαι.

title: 4 night stay
text:
Pros 

- Location location location 
- Clean Rooms
- Friendly staff 

Cons
- 2 lifts 1 which wasn’t working, there were really long wait time for lifts - fine if on lower floors can use the stairs 
- Breakfast was so busy and overcrowded, mediocre food. 
- Average sleep, first night our alarm went off at 6am (i’m sure this was an accident) second  night some random guy banging on our door for 10 minutes at 4am (again not hotels fault) 

Overall great location would be the main reason to stay here!

title: Excellent Location
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights late February for our honeymoon.  

The location of the hotel is ideal.  9th Avenue next to it can look pretty run down but the places to eat around there are great!  We ate in the Westway and also Hudson's Bar and Grill.  Would recommend both of these, especially Hudsons.  We also had take away from the Lincoln Deli on the corner and it was amazing.   Just disappointed we chose this on our last afternoon. 

The breakfast is not extensive but is good enough to get you set up for the day.  I had bagels with Philadelphia or peanut butter and jam most days.  My husband opted for the eggs and sausages.  I was really disappointed that there was no bacon available the whole time we were there.  The coffee is really nice too and is available all day which is perfect for when you get back from a long day.  It is actually nicer than Starbucks!

We had issues with our room due to water coming into the bathroom from the room above.  Also on check in they asked us if we wanted our room cleaned every day or would we prefer a late checkout instead.   We opted for the late check out and just had to ask at Reception to get our bins emptied and towels changed.  We had to chase things up with Reception a few times and it looks like they either don't communicate with maintenance and housekeeping or maintenance and housekeeping don't listen.  

The room we had was absolutely fine and while it was small it was still ideal for what we needed.  A bath would have been a bonus after a long day out walking.  We had paid for a city view but the view we got was looking at the building across the road.  No city view at all.  I will take this up separately with hotel.com.  Also the noise from outside can be quite bad especially with fire engines and police cars.  I asked at reception for ear plugs and they were able to provide me with them.  Not the hotels fault at all, just the area it is in.

All in all if you are looking for a place to crash while you visit NY and don't want to spend a lot of money I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

title: Jugendherberge-Feeling anstatt 3-Sterne Atmosphäre!!
text: Bei der Buchung unseres Zimmers (Doppelzimmer mit einem Kingsize-Bett) habe ich angegeben, eine zweite Bettdecke haben zu wollen, welches mir auch vom Hotel bestätigt wurde. Diese zweite Decke war bei der Ankunft nicht vorhanden. Atmosphäre wie in einer Jugendherberge. Zum Frühstück gab es Plastikgeschirr sowie Pappteller und Papptassen. Wurst und Käse gab es überhaupt nicht. Alle Aufstriche gab es nur aus Plastikverpackungen. Da frage ich mich, ob man wirklich in einem 3-Sterne Tochterhotel von Hilton gelandet ist. Der Frühstücksbereich war für die Kapazität des Hotels viel zu klein und eng. Es ging zu wie auf einem Basar, Geramsche und Gedränge vom feinsten, auch bereits um 7 Uhr morgens. Regelmäßig mussten Gäste warten, bis überhaupt ein Tisch frei wurde! Laute Klimaanlage die mitten in der Nacht alle 5 Minuten anging und sich nicht abschalten ließ. Sehr großer Schlitz unter der Zimmertür, weshalb man alle Geräusche aus dem Flür extrem gehört hat und wodurch das Licht hereingelassen wurde. Trotz doppelter Fenster nimmt man die Außengeräusche in der Nacht extrem laut wahr. An Schlaf ist aus den oben genannten Gründen also kaum zu denken.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questa struttura fine febbraio 2020, ottima posizione in centro, personale cordiale e disponibile, camere pulite, unica critica che mi sento di fare, riguarda il rumore del riscadamento

title: Wonderful location and EXCELLENT Service!
text: Highly Recommend!  Lobby personnel greeted us every time we arrived and left.  Very friendly and helpful.  Issues were IMMEDIATELY addressed.  Would stay again!  The 24 hour coffee was very much appreciated since it was very cold in February. It was fresh and well kept!

title: Ótima opção em NY
text:
Hotel muito próximo à Time Square, não cobra taxa de resort. Problema com os elevadores é real. Muita gente para usar e somente 2 elevadores para atender inclusive a demanda do pessoal de serviço... Salão do café da manhã é realmente pequeno mas nada que atrapalhe... você consegue tomar seu café com uma dose de paciência, afinal, vc esta lá viajando e não correndo contra o tempo... Sobre o café, boas opções, mas nada comparado ao café servido nos hotéis do Brasil..
Atendentes da recepção super simpáticas e dispostas a ajudar o tempo todo.
Recomendo o hotel. É uma ótima opção em Manhattan, próximo à TS, metrô entre outros... 
Tive uma estadia super tranquila e confortável...

title: Boa localização
text: O hotel é bem localizado e oferece um bom custo benefício, considerando que fica na região da Times Square. Não cobra resort fee e inclui o café da manhã. O atendimento foi cordial e respeitoso, por parte dos recepcionistas, sem problemas. Ocorre que os elevadores ficam congestionados em determinado horário da manhã, e se tornam demorados. O café também fica tumultuado, não há lugares suficientes para todas as pessoas. Além de o espaço ser pequeno. Os quartos também são pequenos, para 4 pessoas fica um pouco desconfortável. Mas enfim, foi tudo ok. Acho que pelo valor pago os serviços ficaram ok.

title: Hampton Inn perfect location in Manhattan
text:
Great location, ridiculously friendly staff, amazing breakfast, big room for NYC (small for elsewhere but perfect in NYC). Compared to some "4 star or 5 star" hotels I've stayed in while in NYC this one has my vote. I will stay again for sure. 
Oh... and the cookies... mmmmmm

title: Atendimento muito abaixo do padrão Hampton Inn
text:
Durante o primeiro banho fui surpreendido com o ralo do box entupido, ocasionando vazamento de água para o restante do banheiro. Precisei relatar o problema duas vezes à recepção e à arrumadeira para, enfim, ser providenciado o desentupimento.
Apesar de sermos uma família de quatro pessoas havia a reposição de apenas uma unidade de shampoo e de condicionador. Pedi para que fossem deixadas sempre quatro unidades no banheiro durante a limpeza, mas todos os dias precisava pedir três unidades de shampoo e de condicionador, que eram fornecidos de má vontade, como se nos estivessem fazendo um favor.
Tínhamos muita dificuldade para encontrar mesa para a família no café da manhã. Precisávamos aguardar cerca de 15 minutos para conseguir uma mesa para quatro.  Na maioria das vezes descíamos por volta das 8:30 e estava sempre lotado e com uma fila de espera por uma vaga no restaurante.  Eventualmente tivemos que nos dividir e buscar horários alternativos para não ficar sem a refeição.
Na véspera da nossa saída informei que teríamos que sair cedo no dia seguinte para o aeroporto e perguntei se o hotel poderia chamar um táxi para mim. A recepcionista confirmou a possibilidade e disse que eu podia ficar tranquilo. 
No dia seguinte, às 7:30 durante o check-out, aconteceu a pior experiência: pedi o apoio da recepcionista para chamar um táxi e ela se negou, dizendo de forma grosseira que a pessoa que presta este tipo de serviço chegaria somente às 8:30. Tive, então, que sair para procurar um táxi e, com isso, quase me atrasei para o embarque. Quando consegui o táxi, ninguém se ofereceu para ajudar a levar as malas até o carro.

title: A quiet room and very comfortable.
text: By chance I received a handicap-accessible room, one of the largest I've had in years in New York. It was clean and very quiet. The front desk staff seemed especially friendly. I had business at the Javits Center and this location made it a mere 10-minute walk.

title: Outstanding service
text: My stay at this hotel was outstanding.The staff were very accommodating and obviously worked very hard.The location is excellent no matter where in Manhattan you want to go.Very Central. Couldn't recommend this hotel more!

title: Hôtel correct et recommandable
text:
Il s’agit d’un hôtel de moyenne classe, très propre qui propose une formule petit-déjeuner. L’hôtel est bien placé, le métro et Time Square sont à quelques pas.
Globalement, le séjour était très agréable.
A noter cependant, que l’hôtesse d’accueil ne fait aucun effort pour s’exprimer un peu plus lentement lorsqu’elle s’adresse à des personnes ayant une maîtrise approximative de l’anglais. Elle est parfois à la limite de l’agacement et de l’impolitesse lorsqu’on ne comprend pas tout de suite ce qu’elle dit. D’autre part, les bouteilles d’eau sont hors de prix à l’hôtel. Il faut débourser 5 dollars la petite bouteille, alors que le café et le thé sont à disposition gratuitement. Dernier détail surprenant, il n’y a pas de brosse dans les toilettes des chambres. C’est gênant.
Cela dit, c’est un hôtel tout à fait recommandable.

title: Broadway Bound
text: This hotel is located within a six block radius of Times Square, Penn Station and the Port Authority and many restaurants.  It is clean, well maintained and by NYC standards, the rooms are large.  The staff is very helpful and available 24 hrs.  The breakfast is a typical Hampton Inn breakfast (complete) and is well serviced.  From our perspective, the hotel was a great bargain at a prime location.

title: close to many activites
text: We were able to see soo much on the city by staying here and doing some walking.  Personnel very helpful in regards to places we wanted to see.  Many sites were within walking distane for our family.  We were dropped off at hotel and picked up as needed,

title: Bene ma non benissimo.
text:
Siamo stati in questo hotel per una vacanza a New York di cinque giorni nei primi giorni di febbraio io e mia moglie. Le note positive sono sicuramente la vicinanza alla metro e al centro di New York, la presenza della colazione che seppur non puramente europea è comunque una cosa positiva. Ma vi sono  alcune note negative che non mi fanno dare le cinque stelle. La camera da letto dove alloggiavamo era davvero troppo troppo piccola e con pochissimo spazio di movimento. La moquettes, come in tantissimi alberghi newyorkesi, non è certo una cosa che inspira pulizia. Quindi la sensazione generale della camera non è stata molto bella. È vero che in camera a New York ci sta forse poco, ma comunque credo anche dei piccoli Accorgimenti  non farebbero certo male per la clientela. La nota positiva rimane quindi la vicinanza al centro, la colazione e anche il the o caffè che si possono bere in ogni ora del giorno. Note negative la presenza della moquette che sicuramente fa storcere il naso a molti la camera troppo troppo piccola e forse una piccola mancanza della cura del dettaglio che comunque si nota. Il personale è gentile. 
Ringraziamo comunque per la vacanza che abbiamo passato.

title: Horrible
text: Had 5 rooms booked for my daughters 18th birthday. We traveled up from florida. We arrived at 11am rooms werent ready til 9pm. Staff was so rude. Wasted a whole day waiting for our rooms and all they say is....I understand that your upset but it's out of our hands. do your job and get people in their rooms. I will never stay here again

title: Awesome
text: There was a little bit problem but total service and room condition were nice! Smell from a heater was bad and the elevators came so late... but all staffs are so kind and super nice!! The location was pretty good.

title: Everything I needed was there when I needed it!
text: I used about every single amenity and benefit on this stay....fitness center, business center, Internet, fridge, microwave, free breakfast, apple from fruit bowl, 24/7 coffee and tea, lobby restrooms, room service delivery, free snacks/water (Diamond member benefit), electrical outlets, free tube of toothpaste (forgot to bring), along with all the other usual things. Everything was clean and THERE when I needed it. Everything worked. ALL staff encountered were nice and proactively helpful. From entrance to exit, no detail was missed, and all was perfectly smooth. Having worked 8 years in hotels, I know this kind of smooth perfection doesn’t happen by accident. Kudos to the management and staff of the hotel for creating the perfect HAMPTON INN experience. You nailed it!

title: Great location! Amazing staff!
text: Had an amazing stay! Gave it 4 only because the size of the rooms was a little small. Everything else was perfect about my stay. Location was within walking distance of most times square attractions and subway station to get outside of time square.

title: You get what you pay for, would stay here again, don't stay if you're an eco warrior.
text:
Great price, great location, great staff, free hot drinks 24hrs a day. 

The room we was fine with little noise, which we were grateful for being in times square. AMAZING SHOWER. Comfy beds. Room was a little small for two people, but it's fine as you don't spend much time in your room when you're in NY. 

The hotel is massive and with only 2 lifts which was a little annoying but being in NY you don't spend too much time at the hotel so wasnt an issue. 

The big issue for me was after agreeing to the go green policy at check in, (no housekeeping for duration of stay and you get a late check out as a reward, which I thought was great, as I'm all for the environment and late check outs) I was gobsmacked when it was evident that there was no go green policy whatsoever at breakfast. Paper plates which are not reusable, single use plastic knives and folks, single use coffee cups, is it too much to ask when I'm paying for breakfast to have a normal plate, knife and folk so I can cut my waffle? The breakfast itself was poor to say the least, but giving the cost of our stay I honestly cant complain, I simply grabbed a coffee and bagel and left. 

If you're looking for a  cheap stay in NY, if you need somewhere simply to sleep as you will be out all day and night, and don't mind going elsewhere for breakfast, Hampton inn is your hotel. But if you're environmentally conscious, maybe don't stay here.

title: Solo per la posizione
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel durante le vacanze di Natale. La mia scelta e’ stata determinata dalla posizione e in effetti è davvero comodissimo e vicinissimo sia alla metro che a Times Square. Per il resto l’albergo si presenta un po’ decadente, funzionava solo uno dei due ascensori e questo comportava attese lunghissime per la salita ai piani, mentre per la discesa ci facevamo 14 piani per le
scale di emergenza tetre, ripide e strette.
La colazione era in una sala che durante il giorno fungeva da deposito bagagli. Le camere strettissime e l’armadio senza mensole (quindi tutto restava in valigia).
Devo dire che, considerando anche la colazione inclusa, il prezzo è effettivamente basso per la media di NY ma non è certo un albergo di molte pretese.

title: Couple weekend
text: The stay was nice. I felt welcome. The room was nice. The only problem was the breakfast room. There was no seating for all guests and they did not have all foods available. No meats Saturday morning. Icemaker on the 25th floor did not work.

title: Clean comfortable
text: Rm 3204 Clean and in good repair.   Above the traffic noises. Great view-Empire State Building and cityscape. Professional, friendly, very helpful staff. Concierge service arranged my airport transportation. Front desk recommendations for restaurants were spot on. Will stay again.

title: DO NOT BOOK HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO HAVE UNAUTHORIZED CHARGES
text:
I stayed at this hotel to celebrate my mother’s birthday. At first, I was very pleased with this hotel and the staff, until i checked out. The day of check out I had 4 pending charges on my credit card: $60.00, $172.12, $126.88, and $126.88. When I went to check out I asked the front desk about these charges and she stated they will all be removed and I will only be charged for the night of $126.88. Days later I check my statement and I have been charged $126.88 PLUS $172.12. I called numerous times to the hotel and left voice messages until I finally got ahold of someone. They said that they will check and contact me back. I received an email stating that the safe (which i NEVER used or touched) was “broken” and that is why I am being charged the extra $172. I had to follow up multiple times before getting an answer. Both managers Wilmer and David were extremely dismissive, told me there was nothing they could do, will not return my money and to contact another hotline. I was extremely upset and frustrated that a reputable hotel can have the audacity to LIE, CHEAT, and steal (my money).

STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!!

title: Great Location!
text:
Went in January with my family. 3 thumbs up & 3 thumbs down:

GOOD:
1) Location, Location, Location. The hotel is just 4 blocks from Times square. The location is perfect (close enough to be there in just 2 minutes but far enough of the excesive noice)
2) The hotel employees (specially at the front desk and at the breakfast room) were  extremly polite all the time. I want to specially highlight "Vina" at the reception desk. She was extremly helpfull, always polite, smiling all the time and willing to help for every little detail. Fantastic!.
3) The breakfast was very good (not great, but good enough). You can find anything you want (muffins, bagles, cream cheese, apple or orange juice, coffe or tea, eggs, waffles, etc... very good breakfast if you compate to the medium range price of the hotel

Not good:
1) The elevators are horrible. It´s a 32 stories building with just 2 elevators There is always a long long line to use them and sometimies you need to wait extremly long time to go down to the lobby when leaving your room
2) Breakfast Room; Although the breakfast is good (the food) the Room to have it is extremly small for such a big building. Every morning you need to wait in line to get your coffe. Extremly small room for 32 stories and 5 rooms per floor
3) Rooms: This is a classic in all New York, but still Rooms are extremly small. They are good for 1 person, maximum 2. If you go with kids you will have to be very skinny, the room is very very small.

All in All is a good hotel, I do recomend it, and if I go back to New York I´ll definitely book it again!

title: Nice Hotel
text: The front desk personnel were super friendly and helpful.  The room was very clean and adequately sized for a NYC hotel; the bed was very comfortable.  The only negative is the breakfast area was very crowded and the staff struggled to clean off the tables as the patrons left.

title: Hotel muito bem localizado. Café da manhã ruim
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, quartos confortaveis, funcionários simpáticos. Café da manha ruim. Nao há leite quente, queijo e nem grill, caso queira fazer um sanduiche. Ha apenas uma tostadeira e maquina de fazer waffles.

title: Everything you want in NYC
text: Clean, updated hotel with a friendly staff right in the heart of Manhattan.  We were able to walk to Times Square, Herald Square, Central Park and the Theatre District. We had a wonderful weekend stay.

title: Skip this place
text:
I wasn’t expecting a spacious place but this place wasn’t just tiny, it was awkwardly designed. The staff will not be remembered for friendliness or smiling. 

The elevator situation is ridiculous. Two small elevators for the entire hotel. This includes what the staff use. The entrance to the elevators is a narrow hallway. The only hallway. Thankful I didn’t visit during peak season. During breakfast rush, the elevator stopped at almost every floor. 

The door to my hotel room was previously compromised. I included a photo in this review. It looks like someone took a crowbar to it to get it open. 

I wouldn’t recommend this hotel.

title: Consigliato!
text: Personale gentile e attento a ogni tipo di esigenza, camera pulita e spaziosa (unica pecca il bagno, non riscaldato e dunque freddo al mattino), colazione discreta, posizione da 10 con la metro e Times Square a 5 minuti di cammino.

title: sejour top
text: Hotel très bien situé ... à 2 pas de la station Port Authority... le petit déjeuner est juste excellent... et il y a un très grand choix ;  le staff s'occupant de ce dernier est très à l'écoute et très à l'écoute

title: Don't Get Your Hampton Caught
text:
The hotel is a good location although not in the nicest of areas. What drives me mad, and I never saw this in Queens, is that people randomly shout on the street. It's so annoying! The hotel receptionists exacerbate this problem by screaming "HAVE A NICE DAY" when you leave the hotel or "WELCOME BACK" when you return. It's annoying!

The hotel is 30 floors only served by two lifts. Utter madness and yes I had to wait long periods of time.

Breakfast was ok but too busy, assumes we know how to cook waffles ourselves, and the staff are frequently opening the door in the dining area to throw out the trash making the whole room FREEZING.

The cleaners are very nice. If any of them want to come back to England with me they are welcome! - #tripadvisorprivatemessage

title: Small but adequate
text: The room was small, as was the bathroom but the location was great for accessing NYC destinations. We had a few problems and inconveniences while there, but the staff were very helpful and worked to resolve them in a timely manner. Breakfast was crowded at times but there are many restaurants and other options nearby.  It was good value for the price paid.

title: Ótimo preço/benefício!
text:
A localização é ótima para os turistas em NYC , próxima a Times Square e a duas quadras da entrada do metrô. Ficamos num quarto king size, como quase todos os hotéis de NYC, o quarto não era grande, mas confortável. Como comodidades oferecem um cookie no final da tarde, tem um microondas, café e chá perto do lobby.
Pontos positivos para localização, limpeza, café da manhã variado e por não cobrarem a taxa de resort, como estão fazendo os outros hotéis em NYC.
Pontos negativos para o elevador, pois no rush pôde-se esperar muito para que ele chegar. O ar condicionado fazia barulho acima do que esperávamos.
Se gostou desse review de um like.

title: Price and location
text: Mixed feelings about this property. Stayed here recently for 4 nights. Location is so convenient. On a block with other properties, in fact there are 3 together 1 after another. All 3 are currently under refurbishment with scaffolding in front covering so a little difficult at first to see the correct entrance. Lobby is small(ish) but has a couple sitting areas. Check in desk is split by a large column, so creates a break in line of sight in case. Initial check in was rough, not the warmest welcome and actually a little standoffish. Follow up with all other staff was better. Welcomed back each time upon entering, hello from everyone! Breakfast was traditional HI offerings. Staff worked extra hard to keep it all clean and stocked in this smaller breakfast area and did a good job. As others have stated, seating is at a premium in the breakfast area. King room was fine for 1 but would be tight for 2 people to stash belongs and maneuver around the room. Closet contained ironing board and iron as well as the safe. Bureau had a couple sliding drawers on as well as concealed the fridge. Desk was appreciated. Loads of outlets all over, included wifi was fast and appreciated. Bathroom is small. Small. If the stall shower wasn't narrow enough, there is a grab bar smack in the middle of the wall. There was no way to not touch it constantly when showering. There are 2 elevators for this building. Arrival day, 1 was down and there was an operator working the 2nd. To come down, you had to call the front desk and they would come fetch you as no buttons were working. This was corrected during my stay and both seemed to be working properly. That said, I requested and received a room on a low floor (4th) and took the stairs most of the time to avoid the waits. That worked well until I noticed the handle from the stairwell to the 4th floor was off and laying on the ground. I let them know at the front desk and was told an engineer would be sent to remedy. Returned late that evening after walking the entire city to climb the stairs...to find no handle at all. Trudged back down and got in line for an elevator. Property has an excellent location just need to pay attention to the workings. That said, there was constant sawing and hammering all day everyday (thankfully not at night). Not sure if it was from this property or from next door.

title: Great location for a reasonable price
text: On our weekend birthday trip to NYC, we found this location to be ideal. The usual value and quality we expect from Hampton Inn were there. As far as the negative reviews are concerned, remember that this is located in the busiest spot in one of the world’s largest cities. There is construction, prices will be higher, there are poor people, hotel rooms in mid-priced hotels are smaller, and you may have to walk half a block to hail a cab. If you’re not a total rube, you’ll be fine. The staff was very friendly and helpful and there were ample vending machines, ice, free coffee/tea/hot chocolate 24/7. One of the elevators was out, but stuff happens. You squeeze yourself into the next available and have a good laugh. The rooms are clean and have coffee makers, a safe, a closet, a huge tv, free Wifi, an iron and board, outlets near the bed, a desk and chair, a refrigerator and an ice bucket. The bathroom was well-stocked. The rooms are smaller than other Hampton rooms we’ve stayed in, but keep in mind that we’ve stayed at another boutique hotel where the door barely cleared the bed when opened! Again, space is precious in this metropolis. Breakfast is free, but the eating area is small and cramped and the food is standard meh. On a busy day you can just take your food back to your room to eat or visit one of the various diners within walking distance. The only negative about the stay is that the staff could warn customers ahead of time that one of the elevators was out and to plan for an extra wait. Otherwise, this location was a good value for a nice experience.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE. Many more options at an equal price, better bang for your buck.
text: Stayed here for a conference at the Javits. Awful stay. Brutal. Elevator broken the entire stay - waited 15-30 minutes per ride. Hotel room was cramped at best, bathroom a shoebox and shower built for a child. I’ll never stay here again and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Location. Location. Location.
text: For couples seeking  a quality hotel at a reasonable rate, this is the perfect selection. Restaurants, theatre, shopping, and public transportation are just steps from this boutique hotel. The staff treat you as if they have known you forever. Every time we have visited New York, this is our “go to” hotel. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast holds a large variety of choices before heading out into the city each day.

title: Mid town
text: Staff was able to check me early which exceeded my expectations.  Room snd hotel were extremely clean!  Internet did not connect in the fitness room.  Breakfast was hot and ready by 6am which fit perfect in my schedule.

title: 2nd stay
text: This was my second stay at this hotel. I received a very kind note of appreciation. I think the hotel is the best value for the area. That is why I returned. It was easy to walk to our activities. The staff is very friendly and helpful! The rooms are small but I expected it. Very clean. I’d stay again in the future.

title: Great stay!
text: The rooms were very clean and comfortable, staff was very nice. The only improvement could be the breakfast. It was raining one day and the front desk person offered us umbrellas to borrow for the day. So nice!

title: Peor experiencia de alojamiento en mi vida
text:
Sirva la presente para exponer mi queja contra el Hampton Inn by Hilton Manhattan-Times Square South,  cuyo Gerente General es David Ruas. 
Día 1 – Domingo 29/12/19 – Llegada al hotel. 
Recepción poco cortés. El equipaje se quedó en resguardo porque aún no era hora del check-in. Se nos asigna el cuarto 1304 en el Piso 13
Al regresar por la tarde se nos informa que únicamente funciona un elevador y éste es manejado de manera MANUAL, por lo que deberíamos llamar a Recepción para pedir nos mandaran el elevador cuando quisiéramos bajar (tiempo de espera prometido: 5 a 10 minutos). 
Se pidió al Concierge una reservación para ese día para el tour Dyker Heights, la persona a cargo mencionó que no había reservaciones para ese mismo día, sólo para el día siguiente (lunes 30).  Los boletos los conseguimos por internet para el día domingo 29. 
Se le pidió información sobre el Drop Ball  a una persona de Recepción; este señor nos indicó que se podía llevar comida en una BackPack (objeto prohibido para la zona de Times Square para el evento). No tenía conocimiento de la dinámica de entradas a la zona. (“Le pregunta a un oficial por donde puede pasar.”)
Día 3 – Martes 31/12/19
Por la tarde, para bajar al lobby el elevador tardó más de 35 minutos después de haber hecho 3 llamadas desde la habitación. En la segunda llamada le comenté a la recepcionista que me sentía un poco mareada por el calor que se sentía en el corredor;  en la tercera hice la observación de que me sentía mal que por favor mandara por nosotras. Finalmente, bajé por las escaleras los 13 pisos. Al quejarme con las recepcionistas “Kay” y “Daniela” dijeron que no podían hacer nada y que el gerente no se encontraba en ese momento, que hablara con él al día siguiente. 
Al regresar más tarde había un señor en la Recepción. El me dio el nombre del Gerente General; David Ruas.
Día 4 – Miércoles 1/01/2020 – 
Para bajar a desayunar y bajar el equipaje la espera fue de 40 minutos (mi hija esperó por el elevador y yo bajé las escaleras por segunda vez), razón por la cual ya no alcanzamos a desayunar, ya que, aunque todavía había comida, las empleadas ya estaban trapeando y ya habían levantado las mesas, ya que en ese mismo lugar lo ocupa el hotel para el resguardo del equipaje de los huéspedes. 
Hablé con el Sr. David Ruas para explicarle y quejarme de las anomalías del hotel a lo cual me respondíó que la queja  tenía que hacerla directamente la Agencia de Viajes que había hecho la contratación del servicio. El señor mostró una actitud totalmente indiferente y su respuesta fue “Yo no puedo hacer nada. Se puede quejar con quien usted quiera.”
Por lo mencionado con anterioridad, la estancia en el hotel fue bastante decepcionante, su administración es un caos, los huéspedes no son importantes para ellos, no les interesa ofrecer un buen servcio, el personal de recepción poco atento, el baño que se encuentra junto al gimnasio estaba sucio, el espacio para desayunar es muy pequeño para la cantidad de huéspedes, el área de la regadera del baño en el cuarto es muy estrecho. 
Definitivamente el hotel no cumple con lo que ofrece en su totalidad. NADA RECOMENDABLE.

title: excellent location and great service
text: I am a longtime Diamond and we were coming in by train to Penn Station on a Friday late morning with Theater tickets for Saturday afternoon. Perfect location to walk to both. Easy access to the Subway and good suggestions from the front desk. We will stay here again. Standard room was smaller than we are used to but sufficient. Breakfast was OK - many options but seating was a premium.

title: Novembre a New York
text: Ho soggiornato con la mia famiglia,3 persone, in questo albergo a Novembre,la posizione e' eccellente molto vicino a Times Square e sopratutto alla stazione della Metro,fondamentale per girare la città',albergo pulito buona colazione e personale della reception molto disponibile, unica pecca le camere un po' piccole e i produttori di ghiaccio ,che sono situati su alcuni piani ,e che sono molto rumorosi, sicuramente da consigliare per il rapporto qualità' prezzo

title: boa localizaçao, serviço ruim
text: O Hotel é muito bem localizado, bem perto da estaçao Port Authority e perto da Times Square. O ruim foi o serviço. Nas 7 diarias, na segunda diaria o elevador quebrou e nao foi mais consertado. Sao 180 quartos, era inicio de dezembro, o Hotel estava lotado, imagina ter um elevador só?! Voce perdia muito tempo esperando. Muitas vezes desciamos de escada. Outro exemplo de falta de atençao foi no café da manha, o espaço é muito pequeno, algumas vezes tivemos que esperar para ter um lugar, mas ok, pois o Hotel estava local. O problema foi que das duas maquinas de waffle uma  quebrou na minha quarta diaria e nao foi substituida!! Ou seja ficavamos na fila de novo para fazer o waffle, ora, uma maquina nova nao deveria custar 40 US$, era para ter uma reserva ou na mesma hora o gerente ir numa loja ao lado e comprar outra, mas até meu check ou isto nao aconteceu. Os quartos sao pequenos, mas dentro do esperado para um hotel naquela regiao. Os funcionarios foram atenciosos, mas um dos funcionarios que passou a cuidar do unico elevador, foi negligente permitiu superlotar o elevador e ficamos preso dentro dele por alguns minutos. Ou seja, a localizaçao é muito boa, mas nao houve atençao nos cuidados do Hotel. Ou seja, pagamos muito caro pelo que recebemos. Uma decepçao pelo que se espera por um Hampton inn. Pelo preço irao encontrar opçoes bem melhores.

title: Scenda chi può
text: Sono stata qui con la mia famiglia una settimana nel periodo di Capodanno. Ottima la posizione e anche la pulizia delle camere ma ci sono stati almeno tre fattori molto negativi: il primo riguarda l’ascensore, infatti per un guasto tecnico uno dei SOLI DUE ascensori disponibili era fuori uso e l’altro non funzionava correttamente e questo ha portato a lunghissime code ed enormi tempi di attesa per poter salire o scendere dalla propria camera al piano terra, attese anche di oltre mezz’ora e il guasto non è mai stato riparato. Il secondo aspetto negativo riguarda la dimensione della camera: eravamo in tre e nella camera c’entrava a malapena una persona. Il terzo aspetto negativo riguarda la dimensione della sala adibita alla colazione, è minuscola: infatti in un albergo con oltre 30 piani è auspicabile la presenza di una stanza adeguata per poter contenere un corretto numero di persone e questo non si è verificato, con conseguente attesa per poter avere un tavolo libero.

title: Precio elevado para un mal servicio
text: Estuve dos noches en este hotel. La experiencia fue negativa en varios aspectos, pero el principal fue que el hotel tenía uno de los dos ascensores dañado, el tiempo promedio de espera para acceder era de 20 minutos ,había que llamar varias veces a recepción, a veces había que bajar a pie por la escalera   un desastre

title: Vergognoso
text: Siamo arrivati a New York per trascorrere il capodanno in compagnia di amici, devo dire albergo abbastanza pulito e posizione centrale, ma è inaccettabile che da 15 giorni uno degli ascensori non funziona e si attendono code per uscire dalla camera di 25,30 minuti e vergognoso e inaccettabile per un periodo poi di capodanno pieno di gente l’albergo e poi che dire delle stanze minuscole devo dire cari signori cambiate mestiere non si può fare così gli albergatori non accetta scuse mi dispiace.

title: Stay away!!!!!
text: First review of anything,  feel the need to tell anyone to stay away and stay anywhere else.  Elevator is broken and has been for over a week.  It takes a half hour to leave or more.  Confirmed Legionaries....we have 2 children a 5 and 6 year old who had pneumonia a month ago.  This dangerous and awful.  Had I known this before, we never would have come.  We stayed 1 night which was too long!

title: pas a recommander
text:
un seul ascenceur fonctionnait sur 2... pour un i,mmeuble de 32 etages … 10-15 minutes attente a chaque fois …
salle de petit dejeuner trop petite par rapport au nombre de clients... beaucoup d'attente pour avoir une table

title: Mitigé
text:
+ : très bon emplacement, personnel très sympathique, bonne literie. Il y a un petit espace pour boire un café tout au long de la journée gratuitement très sympa. 

- : chambre pas super propre. Le petit déjeuner en plus de ne pas être terrible, il est quasi inaccessible trop de monde pas assez de place, bruyant, on a préféré allez au "prêt à manger" au coin de la rue.
Grosse galère en ce qui concerne l'ascenseur attente très longue car un seul fonctionne.

title: Hotel comodo e posizione centrale per visitare Manatthan
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 4 notti verso la fine di ottobre 2019, la posizione della struttura è molto buona in quanto si trova nel quartiere di Hell's Kitchen a pochi passi da Time Square cioè il cuore di Manatthan.
Abbiamo trovato un buon livello di pulizia generale, personale gentile e disponibile e soprattutto il fatto di poter disporre di prima colazione inclusa ,che a NYC non è molto abituale nella maggior parte degli Hotel di fascia media come questo.
Come aspetto negativo abbiamo riscontrato la scarsa ampiezza della camera e anche del bagno,avendo occupato la nostra stanza in tre , abbiamo dovuto sacrificarci un po in termini di spazio e comodità personali, nonostante il buon confort dei 2 letti matrimoniali. Per quanto riguarda la prima colazione, in effetti la stanza adibita poteva sembrare un po troppo piccola per soddisfare la capienza totale dell'Hotel , ma per noi non è stato un problema in quanto eravamo molto mattinieri , all'apertura della sala alle ore 07 eravamo fra i primi clienti ad usufruire della colazione. Prima colazione di tipo prettamente continentale ,cioè molti prodotti salati e meno dolci , mancanza di caffè espresso, ma tutto sommato molto varia e abbondante, quindi soddisfacente per affrontare la fatiche dei molti passi fatti per visitare le innumerevoli attrazioni della città ed anche un modo per assaporare un tipo di colazione diversa da quella tipica all'italiana . ( Non succede niente se per qualche giorno si rinuncia ad espresso, cappuccino , cornetto ecc. ).

title: Hampton Inncompetence!
text:
The worst hotel experience ever.
Check in- My daughter checked in around 3 & was told the elevators weren't working, given a key to our room on the 5th floor and told to use the stairs. No help offered, drag your bags up 5 floors.I arrived 2 hrs. later & was able to get onto the one working elevator after waiting over 30 min. Then we had to rush to leave to get to a show after waiting another 20 min. to get back downstairs.
Breakfast- I am physically unable to walk up or down stairs unless I hold onto a rail,taking one step at a time. I tried to get an elevator for breakfast,called the front desk, waited in the hall 15 min., called again reminding them I can't do stairs, waited 15 min.more, called again & was told "we're very busy"! No apology even! Gave up on breakfast.

Maid service- Returned to room each day/night-no service,no new towels, no garbage emptied,no linens changed or beds made,no note?? When I inquired at check out, I was told they have a "green program" and (although I was unaware of it) we "signed up for it"! From reading other reviews,so did everyone else staying there that wknd.--certainly NOT by choice.
Never once, did any employee apologize to me or my daughter for ANY of the many inconveniences we endured at this hotel that wknd. In fact, we were treated like we were imposing on them, trying to get an elevator,wanting to get to breakfast, questioning the lack of housekeeping services.
I'm in my 70's and I've never seen such poor management. Usually hotel staff go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable and are apologetic when things go wrong. Not here. We paid $900. for our 3 night wknd in this hotel hell

title: Comfortable stay with great location
text: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights and used it as a base for all the sight seeing we needed to do. It was comfortable, small like all New York hotels but bigger than other New York hotels I’ve stayed in. Modern and clean. Staff were very helpful especially as we got in early before check-in. Great location for sight seeing. Being an ordinary Hilton Honours member didn’t qualify for any perks like water. I think free bottled water should be a basic perk for any hotel stay and perhaps cookies if you’re traveling with kids.

title: Unhappy Camper
text: The hotel has 2 lifts and upon my arrival, only one was in order and it was being run Manually. My key did not work a few times, I was lates for prayer, meets and transportation because I had I call for

title: Pésimo hotel
text:
No lo recomiendo en  lo absoluto. Tienen dos elevadores, uno estuvo siempre descompuesto, el otro funcionaba pero lo tenían que manejar manualmente, había que llamar a recepción para que lo enviaran al piso solicitado.
El comedor es sumamente pequeño y se satura fácilmente, no hay donde sentarse a comer. 
No regreso ahí ni lo recomiendo.

title: Best deal in Manhattan
text: Only a few blocks from Times Square this is still the best deal in Manhattan. Your state comes with free Internet and breakfast service coffee 24 hours a day it’s a great place to take the family and it’s in a safe neighborhood

title: This is the hotel Hilton forgot about.  What a mess!
text: This hotel is bad in so many ways.  We choose our room and paid for a city view.  We look directly into the rooms in the next hotel.  No city view at all.  There are two elevators.  One has been out of order for over a week.  The other one is so busy that they have someone manning it and you have to call downstairs to request it.  The waits can be as long as 30 minutes.  Not acceptable at all!  After a long day sightseeing, we returned to our room to find a pillow missing from our bed, we were left with one bath towel and no toilet paper.  In order to get these things, we have called housekeeping and over an hour later there is no response.  Our disappointment in this hotel is just huge and we paid NYC prices to stay here.  We are Hilton Vacation members and this place makes us feel we made a bad choice!

title: Tolle Lage, Frühstück ganz okay
text:
Das Hotel liegt super zentral direkt am Times Square. Man konnte viel zu Fuß ablaufen oder auch gemütlich mit der Subway fahren. Ein riesen Manko war der Fahrstuhl. Leider war bei uns ein Fahrstuhl defekt und wir mussten mit einem Aufzug klarkommen. Das bedeutete teilweise lange Wartezeiten, auch wenn sich das Personal immer größte Mühe gab, allen Gästen gerecht zu werden. Super war hingegen das 24-Stunden Angebot an Kaffee, Tee und Kakao. Dies haben wir täglich ausgiebig genutzt. Der Frühstücksraum war leider ziemlich kalt, weswegen wir fast jeden Tag im Vorraum gefrühstückt haben. Hier gab es genügend Auswahl, auch wenn man manchmal etwas auf das nachfüllen warten musste. Es empfiehlt sich vor 8 Uhr frühstücken zu gehen. Hier ist noch weniger los. 
Alles in allem hatten wir aber einen tollen Aufenthalt in diesem Hotel und würden es auch noch einmal besuchen.

title: Love this NYC Hotel
text: This is our 5th Year staying at this property in NYC for a girlfriend shopping trip for the holidays.  The staff is great, very accommodating and are always so nice.  There is an excellent pub just up the block, they don't mind storing luggage for late checkout and they are happy to make suggestions for restaurants.  It's also very easy to get an Uber from there.  We'll be back next year.  Shout out to Jim from his TN friends!!

title: A Sketchy Environment, Stay Away
text: The rooms at this hotel are the smallest rooms that we've ever experienced, be prepared. I wished now I would have read reviews before booking. The elevators were broke down 3 out of the 6 nights we stayed there. The construction noise coming from across the street along with noise coming from the hallway was bad, and lots of Pot smokers outside the front door, scary.

title: Not the Hilton
text: Once we found the entrance (behind the skips), we had to wait four and a half hours for our room to be prepared. For the wait we were given $4 of water. This should have prepared us for what was coming. Our luxury ($1000 / week) room had mistakenly been changed to a disabled person room. We were unable to change this. Upon arrival $300 was additionally charged to my card. A month later this is still not reimbursed. The elevator near our room was noisy all night. You could not put the aircon on if you wanted any sleep. There are no blackout curtains. There is no double glazing. The view is non-existent. The king size bed, I initially thought it was a single (very cozy). The room would have been good for a disabled person (on their own). Breakfast was included but paper plates? Mostly make your own waffles. It appears that anyone can go into breakfast, even vagrants off the street. And we saw meat on one day out of seven. In an entire week we saw room services once, our linen and towels needed changing but nobody came even when asked for. This is not the Hilton, but it is central and Carlos is just around the corner

title: Not  pleasant experience
text: Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South was not a good choice. The rooms are TOOOOOOOOOOO small; not much space to move around with just another person in the room. The only good thing is the location.

title: Very Disappointing
text: I booked  this hotel because I’m a loyal Hilton customer and have always found Hampton Inn’s to be a name that has less frills than other hotels in the Hilton Brand but still maintains the friendliness and cleanliness that I value. This was definitely not the case with this hotel. I arrived around noon on a Friday. I expected my room to not be ready as check in time was 3pm. As expected my room wasn’t ready however I was met with the rudest employee I have ever dealt with at a hotel (and I travel a lot). Eye rolls, loud sighs when asking to store bags and more really didn’t make me feel welcome. Upon arrival back at the hotel at 4pm my room was still not ready. I had pre-selected my room using the Hilton honours app so the staff switched me to another room within the same category. The room was on a lower floor and there really is no view to speak of so I didn’t object. It did bother me that I was not recognized for my Hilton gold status and that the staff charged the wrong credit card even though I made it clear which card I wanted processed. The elevator waits at the hotel are horrendous. At check in times the line stretches nearly out the building as only two small elevators service 32 floors of rooms. The rooms are small as is expected with NYC but adequate however the room was far from clean upon arrival. Stains on the carpet and mirrors, a dirty bathroom and a filthy air conditioner/heating unit makes one feel uncomfortable with staying in the room. The room has a small fridge and although I was assured it was stocked with water (another Hilton Honors perk) it was not. Upon checking out the room, I found all fixtures (towel racks, toilet paper dispenser etc) were loose and nearly falling off the walls, the TV did not work, nor did the ice machine on our floor. The location of the hotel and proximity to main tourist attractions such as Times Square is decent and is a short walk. I did not partake in the hotel breakfast mainly due to the extremely limited space in the dining area. The area holds about 12 - 15 guests comfortably and the hotel obviously holds far more even when at partial occupancy so it was just easier to walk to nearby offerings. All in all I was very disappointed in this Hilton experience. I spent a good deal of money and substantial honors points for a 2 night stay that did not live up to the Hilton brand. I will consider using another brand the next time I return to NYC.

title: Big apple bummer!
text: Location, mediocre (nearish to Times Square). Maintenance, mediocre (our sink didn’t drain).  Breakfast, mediocre (but the bagels were pretty darn good!). Rooms very small for three people. The staff was very friendly and helpful that make the stay tolerable. Breakfast staff was awesome.

title: Super séjour dans cet hôtel
text: Je vous conseille vraiment cet hôtel, non seulement il est proche de tout, mais le personnel est vraiment accueillant et le service est de qualité. Le rapport qualité/prix est très bien, j’y retournerai sans hésiter lors d’un prochain voyage à New-York. La chambre était propre, le lit super confortable, c’est appréciable après des journées bien remplies. Pensez à prévoir de payer une caution de 60$ par nuit à l’arrivée, mais elle est restituée dès le départ de l’hôtel.

title: Viaggio in famiglia a New York
text: Le stanze erano veramente piccole per quattro persone. La sala della colazione era troppo piccola per ospitare tutti spesso c’erano lunghe code per il buffet e per trovare un posto a sedere. Il personale era gente la posizione dell’hotel centrale. Tutto sommato era buona la pulizia della camera.

title: Perfekt
text: Wir haben das Hotel wegen der zentralen Lage genommen.  Es war perfekt  für uns. Das Personal war freundlich und sehr hilfsbereit  trotz unserem fehlenden Englisch Kenntnissen. Vielen Dank nochmals für die schöne Zeit in diesem Hotel. Wir können es nur weiterempfehlen.

title: Some good, some bad
text:
On the negative side:
When checking out I asked about a $6 charge on my credit card.  I was told that it was because we consumed two $3 waters in our room.  When I told the woman we did not touch them, she said the maid said it was marked down that two were consumed.  She then proceeded to get the maid's log to show me that the number 2 was written down for my room.  I had to tell her calmly TWO more times that we did not drink the water before she decided to remove the charge.  Why was it so difficult to believe I was telling the truth?
On the positive side:
It's not a fancy hotel (it's VERY narrow...but it's NYC!), but it is reasonably-priced, in a good location, and easy to get to from the Lincoln Tunnel.  They also have valet parking, which is best to get as a package deal.

title: Nice enough
text:
Pros: The hotel room was as expected.  Clean and small.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Welcoming snacks (I'm a gold member) were cute.
Cons: Gym was terrible.  It's ok it was small, but they should have up-to date machines.  They don't even have to buy so many because the room is so small.  Each machine should have its own monitor instead of one TV in the middle of the room which isn't particularly accessible from any of the machines. 
Breakfast was OK, but they had tons of people.  Staff was short.  They worked hard but couldn't keep up with the tables. We cleaned our own table with paper towels and water. Lines were very long.  I had to wait 10 minutes to use waffle maker because one broke down in the middle and the staff was too busy to attend to it.  The hotel knows the number of people.  They should staff accordingly.

title: Great Staff
text: A great stay, hotel is in a great place close to the subway and central to all the major attractions, the staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast was great, overall I can’t recommend this hotel highly enough thank you for a wonderful holiday.

title: Recepcionistas nota 10
text:
Proximo a muitas atracoes. recepcionistas bem atenciosos e educados. Especialmente o Sr Davi. Fala portugues otimo.
Quartos muito silenciosos. Pequenos, como todo hotel na ilha.cafe da manha otimo.
Voltarei.

title: Fantastic Budget Hotel
text:
Loved this hotel from start to finish, check in was great. we booked a king bedded room and asked to change to twin and it was done for us, no problem. Staff all so friendly, always smiling and greeting guests. Breakfast was a great bonus as was the free wifi and no resort fee
Highly recommend a stay here

title: Good hotel, perfect location
text: We only stayed for one night but we were totally satisfied. Good room, good service, perfect location. The breakfast, which was included was good and with a variety of choices. We could absolutely choose this hotel when we return to NY next time!

title: Not up to Hilton/Hampton inn standards
text:
Conveniently located for central Manhattan but the property is very tired and in serious need of refurbishment.
The bathroom in our room whilst serviceable was in very poor condition and the air conditioner whilst very effective both in heat and cooling requires a good service as it threw out loads of black soot like substance which covered the adjacent bed. The staff were very pleasant but also the approach on 39th street is not very encouraging as a large portion of the street currently is covered in scaffolding and appears slightly down at heel.
We won’t be returning

title: Great place for business trip!
text: Everything was excellent!  the staff was super accommodating for such a large group. The only problem was the elevators, the hallway to get in was always crowded and one of our guests had to wait 15 min before the elevator showed up. (I only had to wait around 8min). But it’s New York I expect cramped spaces and waiting for elevators for many floors of people.  The breakfast was lovely. I’m vegan and had a lot of help from the staff telling me the ingredients in certain items. Overall great stay! 👍🏻

title: Great location
text: Location is close Times Square, walking distance. Rooms are clean. Waiting for lift in the morning could be frustrating as only two lifts are available . The staff were friendly and helpful. Airport shuttle does not arrive on time. There was forty five minutes delay in our case.

title: Fail with Hilton
text:
Staff is the only positive thing about this hotel. Rooms are big,but  beds are  so uncomfortable, that my back was killing me after one night sleep. Luckly I have stayed here only one night. And breakfast ... disgrace. You can wrote a book with so many bad words about „food“ served in that „restaurant“. My fault that I choose this place, but still this is a Hilton property  and is located in the centre of the world. :O  
Another Hilton hotel in Midtown Manhattan that needs to be refurbish.

title: Good location and friendly staff
text:
Great location and considerable quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful.
Breakfast was included and lovely. Set us up for the day. Coffee available 24 hours. 
Only negatives no shower gel and the lifts could take a while but not surprising as there was 32 floors and only 2 lifts.

title: Good location and price, but don't use the hotel airport shuttle!
text: Great location, small but clean rooms.  Had a great stay until we took the airport shuttle.  Driver doesn't speak English, didn't know where he was going once at the airport.  Use Uber or Lift for the same price and less frustration!

title: Great hotel
text: After reading some of the reviews I didn’t know what to expect, I was pleasantly surprised as this is a great hotel, we booked a family room but they gave us 2 doubles which was a great start, the breakfast is great with a lot of choices, my children are fussy but they always found something they liked, the lifts can be an issue in the morning sometimes but that is the thing I can fault , the staff are friendly and very helpful and always had a smile on there faces , for a 3 star hotel I don’t know what people are expecting, if you are thinking of stay here then don’t worry about the reviews you will have a great time 👍🏻

title: Terrible, terrible, terrible.
text:
If you like terrible service, rude staff and bad food then this is the place for you.
