Having stayed at Hilton Hotels in both Dubai and London I’m honestly shocked they let their name be associated with this dump. I understand this is not a Hilton, but if you’re going to charge Hilton prices then you don’t expect student hostel facilities or service. 

I visited here as part of a group and don’t remember any one of my travel companions having anything positive to say about this place. 

Upon arrival the check in process was long and unnecessarily difficult. How can it take 30 minutes to check into a room? 

What they call a twin room here most people would call it a large wardrobe. To say the rooms are small is doing them an injustice. A toddler would find the room claustrophobic. 

The service staff were rude, but then I guess that was my fault for taking the only working elevator in the building to the 17th floor and interrupting there chat. That is when I could use it! Most of the time it seemed as if it was being used as a service elevator for god knows what. 
But I guess I owe them thanks as I walked up and down the stairs from the 17th floor I now have the legs of a rugby player. 
Just to clarify the other elevator was constantly out of order during our stay. 

Breakfast was a joke! I walked in on the first morning and picked up what I thought was a plastic decoration. To my amazement I was told it was an egg. It didn’t get any better when I was told the warm brown tasteless water was actually coffee. 

But what they don’t tell you about this hotel is when you stay here you will feel like an extra from Breaking Bad. The availability of drugs on the street just outside the door is unbelievable. In all honesty you’ve more chance of getting meth just outside the lobby than you have of getting a smile or friendly word from staff of this venue. 

Upon reflection knowing what I do now, I would have booked a room in the Holiday Inn just around the corner.

title: 3 stars?? Really?
text:
This hotel has a great location. For Times Square and general amenities. The Tit na N’og bar next door is its best asset BUT

Where do I start? 
Poor breakfast 
Poor service
Poor lifts
Poor reception
Poor information 
Poor rooms
Poor outside
Smelly
Crackheads on street outside

I stayed here a few weeks ago with a large group. On arrival I handed my card in to receptionist and was told that I could split with my room mate at theend of stay, this did not happen and in fact they debited my card 24hrs before departure.

The food was akin to  shawshank redemption without the marvellous acting of Morgan Freeman. At least there is a very nice sandwich shop next door that also had plentiful supplies of tablets in case you had the misfortune of eating a Hampton Inn sausage.

We were supplied with a double bed despite being too straight males, one of whom has severe IBS so not an ideal sharing partner in same bed. We had clearly stated that two single beds were required. Upon asking for this be resolved, we were threatened with expulsion from hotel if we didn’t conform. Not being the agreeable type, my insistence was eventually rewarded with a room with two beds. If one was less resilient than I then they may have had to sleep on the large scaffolding outside.
The lift scenario is un real, I now know how a hungover sardine feels. Two lifts for 30 plus floors, which staff can manipulate at will if they for example needed to bring a bin to floor 29 from 5. This isn’t a great situation. Thankfully my IBS prone room mate and I were moved to 7th floor so at least the stairs was an option,

Receptionist was very pleasant although the whole credit card scenario above wasn’t mentioned on arrival so gets a negative in my book for this!! 

Poor information regarding reduced beer/food next door.
The rooms were poor but very expensive even though I know NYC is expensive . Small wardrobe, lived from case so enough said.
The outside of hotel was a scaffolding site. We were treated to burly builders holding large pillars in place whilst we walked under 

The smell of cannabis and crack outside of hotel is overwhelming so if you like Breaking Bad then this hotel for you.

I love NYC but HAMPTON INN should be ashamed of this place. 

Very helpful cleaning lady on 7th floor though

title: Tommy M
text:
DO NOT STAY HERE 

The hotel it’s self was dingy the lifts/elevator were out of order and being on the sixteenth floor that was a massive issue, on speaking to the manager about this, he was a very rude and passive aggressive man, he should consider his career in the service industry... I may as well have tried to speak with the fire hydrant. 

The rooms were small and the housekeeping did NOT service the room every day, and the days they did it was a very poor effort.

The breakfast, well describing it as food could just about have passed the legal definition of food; however it was disgusting, cheap rubbish.

In short, this hotel is massively overpriced and I would not recommend it to my enemy’s

title: Hilton,  really ?
text:
This is a hotel to be avoided at all costs.i have no option to give a lower rating otherwise I would score this zero. I stay in hotels regularly for work and pleasure and this is the worst of them all. I had the misfortune to stay here for 5 days with a group of friends.
32 floors and 2 lifts. These lifts are also used by the staff. You therefore have to wait long periods of time for a lift, assuming they are working at all. I regularly had to take the stairs to and from 24th floor as the lifts were broken. Prior to arrival I did consider the option of an upgrade, I am so glad I didn't as it would have been on a higher floor.
Having got to our room, it was incredibly small for two beds. No chance to unpack as nowhere to put anything. Within 10 minutes two other people walked in to our room. They had also been allocated our room. It also meant that our room keys had been deactivated. I went to speak to the manager David Ruas. I calmly explained what had happened and my concern about my safety and security if they keep giving out room keys. He was not interested. He told me he didn't like my tone, and that I could always leave and find another hotel. I would have left but I was part of a large group and this would have caused further issues. To be fair to David he did apologise to me the next day and admitted it hadn't been his best day. 
The breakfast is a joke. Complete chaos for food which is very basic all in paper cups and plates and no space. I therefore had breakfast in nearby cafe. 
While in general the staff were pleasant there was a lack of information to guests as well as misinformation.  They didn't tell anyone that they were giving out vouchers for drinks in a nearby bar as compensation for the lift problems. It was only when you complained that a voucher was provided. As we were two guys sharing, I had secured the room on my credit card. The day before we left we spoke to reception about splitting the bill. She said that would be fine and even worked out how much we would each pay. However when we checked out the next day we were told it had already all  been charged on to my card. I again asked to speak to the manager and David spoke to me. Again no service recovery offered and a request from me for a reduction for all of these issues was firmly refused. He then however gave me his business card and assured me he would look after me next time I was in New York. I somehow dont expect I will be returning to this hotel.
In summary very poor quality, no customer service ethos and not a nice location even if it is close to Times Square. 
There is nothing going for this hotel and it not even good value. There are plenty more hotels in New York and I would urge people to avoid this.
The manager did little to resolve customers genuine grievances, however to be fair to him and his team you can't make a silk purse out of a sows ear.
As for Hilton, if this is a reflection of your standards I wont be staying in your hotels again.

title: Send for Basil!
text:
This hotel could be so much better. The rooms were on the small side but it is a three star so not unexpected. There were issues with reception at both ends of our stay and what ought to have been simple issues proved difficult to resolve. I am unsure whether this a because of a general malaise in the management of the hotel or inexperience of the particular staff involved.
These were however minor irritants compared to the absolutely abysmal breakfast experience. Coffee from machines in paper cups, paper plates and plastic cutlery which I admittedly didn’t have to use much due to the spectacularly unpalatable food. I have never experienced worse breakfast anywhere in the world!
We ended up one floor up in this multi story hotel despite having requested a high room and that having been acknowledged by the hotel in the booking receipts. In the event, when the room key was issued we walked into the room to find it already occupied. After a lot of heated negotiations with reception staff we eventually managed to secure a twin room as booked despite being repeatedly told they only had doubles left when we repeatedly explained the unsuitability of that for two straight male friends. The low floor transpired to be a blessing in disguise as there were continual lift problems during our stay resulting in some of our colleagues having to walk up and down over 20 floors.
My conclusion will probably mean little to Americans but Basil Fawlty running this hotel would be a vast improvement!

title: Poor
text:
Broken lifts in a 30 floor building, with no compensation. Occupancy of several hundred people with breakfast area for about 20. Awful breakfast choices. Dirty streets outside. 
Scaffolding being put up outside from 6am

title: Poor hotel
text: Worst hotel I’ve stayed in. Elevators not working, staff not helpful and unable to rectify complaints. Information not freely given. Rooms really small. This has put me off staying at any more Hilton’s

title: Horrendous
text: This is without doubt the worst hotel experience of my life. Staff at front desk were rude, elevators not working for duration of stay, bedrooms you couldn’t swing a cat in, breakfast was awful - I have no words for how bad this place is - avoid at all costs

title: Outstanding
text:
Stayed overnight and I can’t say enough good things about it.  Firstly, the location on 39th was accessible to everything we did. The rooms are compact, but clean and had what we needed. The free breakfast was lovely; had a huge variety of breakfast food and drinks and was very good.
Most importantly, the staff was outstanding. From the front desk, workers handling the luggage, the help in breakfast room, maids cleaning rooms, they were all so friendly, courteous and accommodating. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Sensacional!!
text: Equipe muito muito muito simpática, todos sem exceção. Café da manhã bom, quartos bem limpos e excelente localização. Perto da times square e ao mesmo tempo não há barulho, perto da principal estação de onibus e da linha azul, que leva até o museu de historia natural e world trade center. Voltaria com certeza

title: Sin duda regresaría
text: Excelente atención, habitaciones pequeñas pero muy limpias y cómodas, la ubicación perfecta a dos cuadras del metro, de la estación de autobuses, time square. Desayuno ligero incluído, todo el personal muy amable casi todos bilingües, lo recomiendo ampliamente, y sin duda regresaría!

title: Not our typical Hampton Inn Stay
text: We are Hampton Inn fans - we've stayed in almost every city.  Never been disappointed, particularly by the staff who always go out of their way.  Not only are the rooms really small - we couldn't walk past each other in our room - the elevators were slow - 6 rooms on each floor, 32 floors, 2 small elevators, but the staff was rude at the front desk from the moment we checked in, as well as the breakfast staff (who could not keep up with the crowds, no matter what time we came downstairs).  We won't be back- and we are in New York all the time.

title: Beware
text:
This is one of the worst places that we stayed at in the last few years of traveling. While riding the elevator it stopped and dropped a floor no one seemed to care, the cleaning of the room  was simply not done. No complimentary  coffee filling, no toilet paper filling, a broken hair dryer, not enough towels  (we were 4 in the room and they kept leaving only 3 towels). Even after speaking to the reception and the housekeeping manager nothing changed.
It seems that since we complained housekeeping told the reception that we smoked in the room and we are not a family of smokers. We were charged without our knowledge 300 dollars and now are fighting for a refund. The whole building has 2 elevator s that serve 32 floors of guest rooms and the cleaning crew so that you can wait for an elevator  for at least 20 minutes at a stone. The complimentary breakfast is a sham ten tables for 180 guest rooms (do the math)  it felt like a zoo. You had to push your way through the guests for food/coffee/table /chair etc.
After the shock the first morning we just ate out everyday even though breakfast was paid for  in advance . We cannot believe and/or understand how Hilton can take under her wing this kind of establishment!!

title: Эконом-класс
text:
Расположение у отеля отличное! Рядом за углом автобусная станция с прямым автобусом до Ньюарка, и также с междугородними автобусами, недалеко пешком до Таймс Сквер. Не далеко метро. Удобно. Но для проулок такой себе по чистоте райончик, запахи мочи всюду и много бездомных. 
Комнаты в отеле малюсенькие, в проходе между кроватями двоим не развернуться. 
Взяли номер на высоком этаже и оно как оказалось того не стоит, так окна на соседнюю близстоящую высотку, и не имеет значение там 25 или 10 этаж. 
Что убило на повал - одноразовая посуда на завтрак! За это прям 1 звезду б дала, но это особенность сети как поняли, везде у них так. Не заботятся о окружающей среде, и это печально. Завтрак стандартный, кофе, соки, овсянка, яйца, вафли, белый тостовый хлеб, какие-то сладкие булки, мармелад, масло. Сладкий йогурт (в отелях в Америке натуральный не принят почему-то). Яблоки. 
Шумный кондиционер. 
В целом за ту цену что он стоит в сравнении с конкурентами - не плохо.

title: Not worth the money.
text:
We paid almost $1,100 for  a three night stay and we opted for the "green" plan which meant we didn't have a housekeeping visit during the stay.  That's a lot of money with no special benefits.  On top of it all, the first night we waited almost 20 minutes for an elevator (there are only two) due to some malfunctions.

The breakfast was unremarkable but the service staff were terrific.  The front desk staff were also excellent.  The location is pretty central to many of the things we wanted to do and only a couple blocks from an MTA station.

Due to the ease of navigating the MTA (we didn't know going in) we would have secured a location in a more economical location and traveled to midtown.  

We also noticed the crazy presence of garbage on the adjacent sidewalks in that block (no fault of the hotel) each morning.  Never seen anything like it in the many major cities we've visited throughout the world.

title: This motel is very expensive for the price. We had garbage in front of our door for 24 hours. The elevator did not work,
text:
This motel is very overpriced. We had to walk through people smoking and sleeping on the sidewalk. We had a bag of garbage in front of our door when we arrived and was there when we returned from downtown. The elevators were not working. The room smelled musty and no one showed up to clean our room the first night. 
Don't stay her.

title: Amazing Staff and Great Location
text: The staff here will make your experience amazing!  Very friendly and welcoming and there for whatever you need!  The breakfast had a great variety and great team supporting that area.  The room was comfortable and worked for us.  It is smaller but manageable.

title: Business trip to NYC
text: Great location. Easy walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio city.  Employees cheerful and helpful. Free breakfast was decent. Room was small,bed was comfortable.  Concierge on duty in the lobby. Complimentary beverages was great to grab and go all day. Would return.

title: Convenient budget hotel, wonderful staff
text: The hotel was convenient for Times Square and just round the corner to Port Bus station.  Quiet location on a side street away from hustle and bustle of Times Square.  The room was clean and fine for the price paid.  The aircon was a bit noisy however.  We had free breakfast which was fine and we always found a table and good choice.  Breakfast staff were friendly and helpful.  We had problem with lost luggage on flight to JFK.  Vina the hotel receptionist was exceptional.  She helped me ring up about lost baggage and went well beyond expectations.  The hotel staff were so friendly, helpful and welcoming.  Whilst it is not the most glitzy or luxurious hotel such a great welcome and helpful attitude made our stay.

title: Perfect Location and Friendly Service.
text: We stayed at this property for New York Comic Con this past weekend. We are three women over 50 years of age each and we had a blast; staying at this hotel made the weekend that much more enjoyable. Perfect location for our needs, and the lobby staff, and truly every single staff member were warm, friendly, and welcoming. The property is clean, the towels are nice, and the glass-enclosed shower seemed brand new.  24 hour coffee, tea, and hot chocolate was a plus, and the breakfast had many choices.  Honestly, it’s the super-friendly staff that really made this hotel a great choice.

title: birthday trip
text:
On a long weekend trip to celebrate a birthday.  Location was good, just a few blocks from Times Square and walkable to several places.  We walked to not only Times Square but also to the Empire State Building and the "Vessel".  
Only problem we had was that the breakfast area was not big enough..... when we went down, it was difficult to find an open seat and the food was somewhat picked over.

title: Back to New York
text: L'ottima posizione e il prezzo elevato ma accettabile considerato il periodo sono due ragioni che hanno sicuramente pesato nella scelta di questa struttura pur consapevoli che ci saremmo trovati in una strada comoda come posizione, ma anonima e, come è stato, senza una vista panoramica come avvenuto invece in un precedente viaggio a New York. Anche l'affidabilità della catena di appartenenza ha avuto la sua importanza. Questo hotel è una struttura che ci sentiamo assolutamente di consigliare, oltre che per la vicinanza al centro turistico di New York, anche per una caratteristica che abbiamo riscontrato fin dal primo momento: la piacevole accoglienza riservata ai clienti, estremamente cordiale fin dal benvenuto pur rimanendo sempre attenta e professionale. Merito di una crew prevalentemente latina o di una precisa scelta aziendale? Non lo sappiamo, ma da clienti il clima che abbiamo trovato è stato sorprendentemente piacevole e ci ha fatto quasi sentire a casa. Il che in una città come New York non è qualcosa che trovi tutti i giorni. Questo ha reso migliore il nostro soggiorno in una struttura che non ha certo tra i suoi punti di forza la dimensione della camere e in generale degli spazi interni. La nostra al 29° piano era piuttosto piccolina e certo non ha aiutato aver richiesto un letto aggiuntivo. Letti tra l'altro comodissimi nella migliore tradizione USA! Con un po' di adattamento abbiamo sopperito alla modestissima capienza dell'unica colonna armadio disponibile. Una stanza piccolina dunque, ma pulitissima che ci ha assicurato comunque riposo e confort durante la nostra non brevissima permanenza a New York. In due stanze al piano terra viene servita una buona colazione all'americana con piatti caldi con assortimento che cambia di giorno in giorno. Una delle stanze funge da piccola lounge dove, H24, sono disponibili caffè e the caldo. A metà pomeriggio la direzione offre poi biscotti caldi o qualche altra piccola leccornia. E' verso quell'ora, infatti, che quasi tutti fanno rientro in albergo dopo una giornata trascorsa a scoprire i mille angoli della Grande Mela. Un caffè caldo prima di salire in camera è una piccola "coccola" che fa veramente piacere trovare. Anche se siamo a New York dove tutto e tutti corrono e sembrano non accorgersi della nostra esistenza!

title: VERGOGNOSO
text: Semplicemente IMBARAZZANTE. Camere minuscole senza spazio per muoversi o aprire una valigia, non insonorizzate; lenzuola e asciugamani puliti ma vecchi. Moquette sporca dappertutto. Colazione vergognosa in quantità e qualità; la stanza della colazione poi è minuscola per un hotel con oltre 500 camere (arrivi e non ci sono tavoli liberi). Personale scorbutico, sembra che gli fai un torto a chiedere qualsiasi cosa. Non hanno nessun tipo di servizio: no addetto che porti i bagagli, no deposito bagagli dopo il check out; avevo il volo alle 22 dopo il check out la mattina, non c'era nemmeno un bagno nella minuscola hall. State lontani da questo hotel, se siete a NY cercate dell'altro!!!!

title: Great location for walking
text: Location is walkable from Central Station. Rooms are super clean. Breakfast was good, coffee was good. However the doorman will not hail cabs for you and this can create travel issues when needing this service.

title: You will get old waiting on one of two elevators!
text: Ok...so, we booked two rooms, for two couples, my wife and I and two friends. The check in time was 3:00 pm, Saturday, September 28. We had dinner reservations and were looking forward to using the facilities in the rooms, and changing prior to dinner. 3 p.m came and went...so did 4...at around 4:40 I received a text that the rooms were now ready. Unfortunately this would entail us rushing back to the hotel and even had we done so we would not have made a 5:30 reservation on time. I complained to the front desk. They did the right thing for our friends by refunding half the room rate. I paid in points. The front desk personnel assured me that they would be returning half the 70000 points, or 35000 to my Hilton Honors card. I asked for a receipt and they gave me one for the cash but said they could not give me anything for the points. 24 hours later I received an email from the hotel advising me that they would not be crediting the points to my account and the refund for our friend's room was all they would do. I complained to Hilton Honors and was told they would circumvent the hotel and credit the points back to the card themselves. I have another 24 hours to go to see if that was done. Well, let me tell you a few more things about Hampton Inn Times Square South: The breakfast was lame. The eggs were powdered, the fruit ran out and was never replenished, the only breakfast "meat" was a sausage gravy to go with the biscuits...no bacon, no sausage, nothing else.And there were not enough tables to accommodate the throngs of guests who showed up to eat. After a very dissatisfying breakfast, we went to our rooms, packed up, and stood in front of the elevator (one of only two) for at least 20 minutes, during which time the elevator stopped on our floor (19th) twice. The first time the cab was packed and there was no room. The 2nd time, it was just slightly less packed so we sent our wives down and my friend and I walked the 19 floors down to the lobby. I would suggest staying at any other Hilton property except Hampton Inn, Times Square South, 337 39th St. The area is a little seedy too, as it is located near the Port Authority Bus Terminal.

title: AhhhMazingg
text: First.. Hold on to David who made my experience (as i am sure he made everyone he meets with) five star. He needs to train all hotel personnel in NYC. The rooms are small for 4 people.. I think 2 can fit comfortably but a family of 4 getting around is a bit tight. With that being said.. If you are coming to NY as a tourist you will never be in the room except to sleep which makes this hotel perfect. It says city view but expect to see another building if you are high up..we were on the 29th floor but again.. Who cares you are never there. Breakfast everyday was fresh. It isn't the best but it is ok to get you ready for the city. Also.. From la guardia to the hotel is almost 50 dollars by taxi or uber despite the hotel saying they offer shuttle service. You have to pay for the shuttle so its the same thing. The staff is super nice.. They welcome you when you come in and wish you a nice day when you leave. It was a great experience.

title: Trip to NY
text: This hotel was ok. Very small rooms. Only two elevators and the staff uses them all the time for work, so you can get stuck waiting to go up to your room or down to the lobby. The staff was very nice but not always overly helpful. When we asked about places or things around them some of them would give one word answers. Most of the staff was great always greeting you when you arrived.

title: Excellent service
text: Love the hotel. The rooms are clean, staff are super friendly, polite, and cheerful. Every time we stayed there, felt very welcomed. And I would like to say special thanks to manager David Ruas, and Crystal, Janina who helped me solved my difficult refund issue ( booked through third party). We greatly appreciate all your kindness, understanding, and help. Thanks again!

title: Great hotel within walking distance of Times Square
text: Traveled for business. Affordable, clean hotel within a few blocks of Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Lots of shopping and restaurants closeby. Hot breakfast included in your stay saves a couple bucks looking for something on the street.

title: Not bad
text:
Area well located but a little seedy. Vagrants sleeping on the street and garbage around. Rooms updated and small but quite comfortable. Rooms not serviced consistently. Not serviced until contacted after 5 pm twice during our stay. 
Nice hot and cold breakfast provided in comfortable area.

title: Decent stay
text:
Stayed for 7 nights. Not a bad hotel, close to Times Square & Broadway, it easy walking distance for all even a walk to 5th AVE.
Subway is just a short walk away to reach different lines.
A saver for this hotel is the free Breakfast, most foods for all & including hot & cold food. Depending on the time you eat depends also if you get a table, but we only waited at weekends.
Rooms are small, but most rooms in New York are.
My only serious side I did not like is the lack of wardrobes, we had 1 small wardrobe for 3 of us so the hanging garments were squashed+ creased, so not good, I brought this to the attention of the staff.
Staff were very courteous & helpful.
Freshly baked cookies were free in lobby with tea and coffee so very good.

title: No refund on deposit
text: We stayed at your hotel in August 2019 and have still not received our deposit back that we paid you! This is theft! I have sent numerous emails but get absolutely no reply from anyone at your hotel nor head office!

title: Turismo em Ny
text:
Gosto muito do hotel , e frequento sempre que viajo pois acho limpo, bem organizado , com pessoas simpáticas e custo beneficio muito bom .

E hoje , 22 de setembro de 2019, aconteceu algo que engrandecedor para esse hotel e o serviço de Shuttle do Sr Bill e Sra Benny.  

Eles me levaram ao aeroporto e no Checkin meu marido percebeu q tinha esquecido na van uma mochila com 
Os passaportes
Os cartões de crédito 
U$ 700 dólares

Nossa angústia e desespero foi tamanha que não conseguíamos discar o num do hotel, e como resultado perdemos o voo.

Voltamos ao hotel e solicitamos a recepção que nos ajudasse a falar c o responsável pelo transporte (Sr Bill e Sra) .   A funcionária foi extremamente solicita e ligou. explicou e suplicou p checarem a van q havia feito nosso transporte .

Após 40 minutos de espera recebemos a notícia q encontraram a mochila e estavam vindo p o hotel nos trazer .

Claro que nossa expectativa, principalmente pelos passaportes, foi imensa e ao adentrar no hotel , o Sr Bill se apresentou entregando a mochila .

Acreditem : tudo como deixamos ! Nossa vida de turistas brasileiros em Nova York estava ali ... 

Agradecemos muito e oferecemos U$ 100 de caixinha , mas ele recusou e pediu q conhecêssemos a Sra Benny e comentasse nas redes sociais , sobre a honestidade deles!

Realmente , parabenizo os pela atitude, agradeço muito por ter nos devolvido nossos documentos!

Equipe Bill & Benny , ótima ! Maravilhosa ! Recomendo e irei solicita lós qdo vier a Ny.

Gente honesta ! Obgda ! 
Hampton recepção , obgda!!

Adriana/Edson Gomes 
Brasil 🇧🇷

title: Viaje en familia de 10
text: Nos alojamos mi hermana y yo durante 1 semana y no tengo pegas. La habitación muy grande, la cama muy cómoda y aunque teníamos vistas a la calle, no se oía ningún ruido de fuera. El cuarto de baño siempre limpio y con toallas nuevas, con todo lo necesario. El desayuno, aunque un poco repetitivo, todo muy bueno. Echas en falta algo más de fruta (sólo había plátanos y manzanas) y algo de embutido tipo jamón York o pavo o algo de queso, pero lo demás muy completo, con yogur, pan, bollos... E incluso gofrera. Sin duda, un hotel para recomendar, y para repetir.

title: Some Concerns
text: As a fan of the Hampton Inn chain, this one did not live up to expectations.  Location is convenient for walking to shows and the subway.  However, West 39th Street is a very congested narrow street, even by Midtown Manhattan standards.  DO NOT stay here if you have a car.  It was heck just getting there and when I did, the spot to pull over for the valet parking was taken.  No one was stationed outside.  I had to pull over, run in to the desk and then someone came out.  Note that the hotel - for $65 per night with no in/out privileges - does NOT park the car.  Instead they use a third party contractor.  They told me that when I checked out to call for the car 45 minutes to an hour before needing it.  That's how long it takes to retrieve.  The hotel staff is pleasant.  The small room had a mini-fridge, a safe, and a small closet, all very convenient.  Lighting was good.  However, the room, and I have to be frank here, smelled like sweaty socks!  I would notice it each time I walked over a 3-day stay.  The included breakfast was a bit below par for a Hampton, and the small breakfast area was very tight and very crowded.  One of the 3 days I came down and they were temporarily out of coffee, out of half and half, out of fruit, and out of plastic forks.  However, the breakfast staff were all pleasant and helpful and replenished the items after I pointed out the need.  Another matter of concern were the very slow elevators.  There were always people waiting for the two small elevators serving the 30-story building.  On checking out, I waited 15 minutes with my suitcase just to get on an elevator.

title: Worst place to be at and a living hell
text: I have taken a pledge to close this hotel permanently. It’s horror to stay over here. I want this message to spread to as many people as possible. David Ruas ( General Manager) is an evil in all ways not only was he a terror to talk to but the way he told me to “LEAVE THE HOTEL RIGHT NOW” on my face was enough to prove that he is the most cheap, disgusting and a loser to talk to. We want more people to come forward to join our campaign as we want these people to suffer and ROTT IN HELL FOR THAT IS THE PLACE THEY DESERVE TO BE.

title: Redelijk hotel
text: Op zich een goed hotel, alleen te weinig kastruimte in de kamer en de ontbijtruimte was te klein en te weinig variatie, zou meer gericht moeyen zijn op europees ontbijt en geen koude gekookte eitjes, dat was jammer

title: Ottima posizione..consigliato
text: Sono stata in questo hotel dal 5 al 12 settembre 2019 con la famiglia e ci siamo trovati molto bene. Accoglienza e pulizia oltre alla posizione centralissima fanno di questo albergo la scelta ideale per soggiornare a New York. Inoltre avere la colazione in loco rende più semplice la vacanza in questa città. Unica nota stonata sono le camere troppo piccole...ma a New York ci si va per girare...quindi il problema è superabile. Il personale tutto, manutentori compresi, sono stati gentilissimi...abbiamo avuto un problema al condizionatore e hanno provveduto in 5 minuti. Bravi e grazie

title: Molto soddisfatta!
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel dal 4 al 10 settembre 2019, non mi aspettavo grandi cose considerando gli standard di NY invece mi ha stupita in positivo! La stanza era grande e il letto (stanza per due persone con letto king)  super comodo!! Sempre pulita! Colazione utilissima per iniziare la giornata al meglio! Inoltre erano disponibili 24h su 24h tisane/caffè, mele e biscottini. Posizione molto comoda vicino alla metro di Times Square che unisce tutte le linee. Lo consiglio!!

title: Good hotel for overnight
text:
If you come to NYC sightseeing and then to sleep, this would be a good hotel. Not really meant for hanging out in the room as they are small. It was perfectly situated near the Jacob Javits Center where I had my event - this was the plus.  

The hotel staff was friendly / attentive made you feel welcomed.  Plan ahead, elevator wait time is long.   Other than that it was a good experience.

title: Worst hotel ever...too small for $
text: Very small rooms.....please  check your rates because you might be paying more....not many options for breakfast....only two elevators so dont make a mistake like me and be on a high floor.make sure they get the approval from from NYC Health department before you go because some people were sick after ataying there just a heads up because i didnt find out until i got there

title: Weekend in Manhattan
text:
My wife and I celebrated our 45th weding anniversary with a weekend 
in New York.
We stayed at the Hampton Inn on 39th Street in Manhattan.
The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful.
We would definitely stay there again.

title: Really Bad!
text:
Sometimes I feel bad about leaving a bad review of an establishment. I mean, people work there and they have feelings. However...
Last week I was walking to visit Hudson Yards for the first time and I inadvertently walked past this place and all the bad memories came back. I was in town for a convention then and it was as close to the convention center as I could get a room.
Unless you have been living on the street you're not going to be happy you're staying there. The rooms are tiny. It's like they bought an old building with small rooms and decided to subdivide them. Narrow corridors - wouldn't want to be there in a fire. Elevators were small and slow. Trying to get out of there in the morning when everyone was trying to leave resulted in being passed numerous times by full elevators. Every single thing about this place says low end. However, the person at the front desk was very nice. 
There is no excuse for a national hotel operator to operate a place like this in NY. I was embarrassed that I had recommended a place like this to a colleague. He and his wife are still mad at me.
Regarding food service there - seriously, you think I would have eaten there? Really?

title: 1703 room
text: The room was small but that was fine. We don’t spend a lot of time in the room on vacation anyhow. The only thing that I didn’t like was how the carpet felt. It felt dirty and sticky. I do realize that this is NYC and the outside isn’t the cleanest.

title: Hotel gut, Personal na..ja
text: Ausser die Sache mit dem Personal hat mich eine Sache ziemlich geärgert und zwar kann es nicht sein dass man aus dem Zimmer bzw der Rezeption KEINEN international call machen kann, sprich es kann nicht sein, dass man in der international city International nicht telefonieren kann. Es hat sich eine Situation ergeben bei der wir nach Deutschland telefonieren mussten, es hat vom Zimmer aus nicht geklappt auch nach mehrmaligen nachfragen und aus der Rezeption auch nicht! Das geht wirklich nicht.

title: Happy stay, great location to restaurants, activities.  Would stay here again.
text: Bed comfortable, and having a small refrigerator in the room a plus.Choices at breakfast very good. Staff very helpful, and pleasant,and approachable. The hotel clean, and fresh smelling. Next trip I'll sign up for the rewards program.

title: Good value in Manhattan
text: Good value for a good hotel in Manhattan. Good location; theater district and 5th Avenue nearby. Hotel facilities overwhelmed by number of customers. Only two elevators for 32 stories of rooms, and breakfast area too small for number of guests.

title: Locatie goed voor alleen slapen
text: Wij reizen met een rolstoel. De 'aangepaste' kamer was zo klein dat ik bij het bed kon komen maar niet bij het buro of koffieapparaat. De badkamer heeft wel een douchezitje maar tegenover de kraan dus je kan je niet zelfstandig redden. 's Ochtends tijdens ontbijt krijg je de lift niet te pakken of je kan er niet bij. Het is zo enorm druk dat we een half uur hebben staan wachten op de lift en een plaats in de ontbijtzaal is ook niet te krijgen. Aangezien wij voor de stad kwamen hebben we het ontbijt maar overgeslagen en in de kamer toch alleen geslapen. Als je samen reist is het te doen. De locatie is zeer goed en de bedden waren prima.

title: Great Location
text: Close to Times Square, MSG, and all subway lines.  Friendly and helpful staff (esp. Will!).  Complimentary breakfast area gets extremely busy - food runs low, lack of seating, but many places to eat nearby.  Rooms are small, but clean; ‘city view’ limited.  Elevators (2) run extremely slow.  Be aware at night - the area does attract some interesting folks, but no troubles for us.

title: Great place!
text: Very clean rooms, extremely helpful staff. Great location, right off of the Lincoln tunnel and just a few blocks from Time Square. Breakfast is a bit busy so make sure to get there early. Would stay here again!

title: Great Staff! Don’t Pay for the City View..
text: Staff was really friendly & helpful! But paid extra for a “city view” on Booking.com & was notified that there weren’t any rooms with a “city view”. I would’ve booked the cheaper room & saved some money had I known.

title: Rude manager
text: Sadly I decided to stay at this hotel to save $50. The comforter was stained. I called the front desk. They didn’t apologize. They just offered to change the comforter. They moved me to a different room. Same dirty issues. I left to call my booking agent for a refund. This hotel refused. What I didn’t know was they went to my room to check out my concerns. They left my door ajar. When I called the manager, Henry, he asked, “What do you want me to do about it?” He told me to call Hilton if I had a problem. He then hung up on me. I took the money loss and went to another hotel that I always stay at in NYC. I don’t know if I can post the name, but Staybridge Suites is 100x better than this hotel. This month I was charged $400 on my credit card from Hampton Inn. I have spent time disputing the charge that is fraudulent.

title: Staff very friendly.
text: The staff is very friendly at this location which makes up for everything else. I typically stay here when in nyc for business. The location is convenient and rooms are decent. Elevators are always slow and some of the rooms have bathrooms that were not remodeled well. The outlets in some of the bathrooms are covered up by the mirrors and doors hit vanity top when closing.  Staff makes up for everything with their friendly attitude.

title: Enjoyed our stay
text: Stayed Sun-Wed on 27th floor (no view). Location was good. Staff was great. Breakfast was good, except one morning it upset our stomachs. We believe it was the potato-meat-thing. We would stay there again. Our stay came with a free all-day water taxi from Pier 83 to south end of Manhattan. Apparently, not many guests use it. DO IT!!! It is worth the money, but doesn’t start until 10am.

title: Good location, nice staff, crowded breakfast
text:
This is a nice hotel in a great location for sightseeing in NYC. The staff is all very friendly and professional.  The rooms are small (to be expected in NYC) but modern and clean.
My two issues are breakfast and valet. The only parking is valet andit takes over an hour to retrieve your car. The breakfast food is standard for a Hampton BUT the organization is bad. There are a lot of guests who are not familiar with an American style continental breakfast so the line is very long with people waiting for toast or who don’t know how to use the waffle maker. It was quite busy when we ate there (around 9 am on a Wednesday) so many things (fresh fruit, yogurt, toast) were out. I think the hotel would benefit from moving the toaster out of the way to some corner so people could move through the main line faster. I also think they should have more staff present to refill and to help direct traffic.

title: Peut faire encore mieux
text:
bonne localisation, très proche du métro
chambres trop petites et pas assez de rangements pour une famille de 4 pour une semaine
l'accès au petit déjeuner est très compliqué : trop de monde et pas assez de places

title: The staff is friendly and helpful. It is clean. Breakfast is good. Elevator wait is too long.
text: The staff is friendly and helpful. It is clean. Breakfast is good. I like the smoothie. However the space is squishy. Very often the elevator is too full to fit in people. Expect 5 to 10  minute wait for elevator during those peak times.

title: Good location but that's about it
text: Booked what I thought was a king room, when I got my confirmation it was a double. CHECK YOUR CONFIRMATION. Found out the hotel had an issue with Legionaire's Disease and that I was at high risk - there was a notice in our room. I told them at the front desk that I was high risk and they assured me the water system had been flushed and they have been inspected and all was ok but if I was uncomfortable I could check out the next day. I asked if they would help me move to another Hampton and the answer was no, this hotel is a franchise. I purchased masks to use while showering to try to help.  Then after reading the reviews I found out the notes were only in rooms where they found the issue and they didn't even move us to another room!! If I get sick, this will be a major court battle! Also, I would not use the concierge - she sent us totally in the wrong direction that we wanted to go and we had to figure it out ourselves - we lost at least an hour on what should have been an hour round trip. Otherwise we typically didn't have an issue with the elevators, breakfast was ok (really crowded - hard to find a seat) but really didn't live up to other Hilton properties I've stayed in which is alot (international business and national pleasure travel).

title: breakfast and elevator wait
text: this hotel has a good location and near times square. staff is awesome and friendly. prepare to wait in line for breakfast and elevators. i never walked up and down so much at a hotel using the stairs.

title: Welcoming staff
text:
What a fantastic find this NYC hotel was. Staff were so welcoming in both the reception and dining room. Free breakfast was a bonus with quite and array of choices including eggs, fruit, cereals, toast, waffles and fresh smoothies.
Rooms were spotless and we were offered either extra points or a late check out if we didn’t need beds made up and towel changes.
Free tea and coffee all day.
The only drawback was the amount of waste... plastic cups knifes spoons paper plates aghhh!!! Were these recycled, probably not as they were all soiled.

title: A Very Pleasant Surprise!
text: We were on our way home from Europe and our last leg of our flight got cancelled so we ended up having to spend the night in New York City. Initially, we were very tired and frustrated.  However, it  ended up being a wonderful little side trip, beginning with the Hampton Inn Times Square South.  General Manager, David Ruas, runs an excellent hotel!!! His entire staff was extremely welcoming, courteous, and very helpful.  David himself, was very friendly and went out of his way to make us comfortable.  While we generally stay at Hampton Inns, they are not all "created equal" and under David's management, this particular one is outstanding!

title: Super séjour!
text: Super hôtel très bien situé, personnel toujours souriant et attentionné, nous avons beaucoup aimé. Chambres un peu petites, mais jolies et très propres, avec 2 lits queen très confortables. Nous étions 2 adultes et 2 enfants (10 et 12 ans) et y avons séjourné 4 nuits. Superbe vue sur l'Empire State Building de notre chambre qui était située au 29e étage. Déjeuner très correct (inclus) et tout était frais. Nous  recommandons cet hôtel sans hésitation!

title: Clean, quiet with great shower
text:
Great location for the Javis conference centre.  Walking distance.
Breakfast area can get very busy and it can take ages to the elevator but because I got a great nice sleep every night the hotel was perfect for me needs.

title: Dirty linen
text: Our top comfortable was dirty and had not been changed from a previous checkout bad body ordor spoke to someone at the front desk and when we went back up to our room we saw the house keeper and she told us she would change it

title: Great Hotel
text:
Super friendly front desk staff!  Able to hold bags before and after check in.  Rooms updated and clean!
Breakfast was good (but didnt care for the eggs, too processed).
Great location.  5-10 min walk to train station, times square and broadway.  Great restaraunts nearby!

title: Friendliest staff ever!
text: This Hampton Inn is in a great location and just steps away from Broadway venues, Times Square and Midtown attractions.  The staff is absolutely the friendliest! Janina at the front desk had such a great smile and was so helpful.  Walter helped us with our car and luggage. The breakfast staff worked quickly to keep the food stocked and hot.  It was great for my girls and I.  We stayed for one night and it was perfect. We were only in our room to sleep because we wanted to take in as much of the city as possible! They certainly made the most out of the space in the room - and for NYC it was very affordable! Thank you Hampton Inn - Times Square South for making our stay so comfortable! Hope to see you soon!

title: Très bien placé, propre.
text: Hotel très bien placé, à trois blocs de Times Square et deux blocs du métro. Chambre propre. Petits déjeuners variés tous les jours. Personnel poli et souriant. Nous avons eu un problème d'eau chaude, très vite solutionné par le personnel. Ne parle pas le français mais ils sont à l'écoute du client et çà se passe bien. La chambre était un tout petit peu petite pour 4...mais çà se gère.

title: Hotel Was OK
text: The hotel only has 2 elevators, We waited 25 minutes one morning for it to stop on our floor.  We called down and said there is a problem and the girl said that she would send it up to us.  When it FINALLY stopped only 2 of us were able to get on it.  Me & my niece ended up walking down the 11 flights of stairs to the lobby.  So be prepared to wait or walk the stairs, no matter what floor you are on. The elevators are also used for the staff, luggage carriers, housekeeping cards.  When they refurbished the hotel, they should have put in a freight elevator!  The free breakfast was good, but make sure to get there early for a seat and hot food.  They run out of both FAST!!  The food is served in the same space as you are supposed to sit an eat in and it is EXTREMELY CROWDED!!!

title: water issuse
text:
We dealt with concierge service upon arrival and told her what we were looking to do, we were only there for less than 24 hours and she pressured us to buy a 48 hour tour package as we would miss out on things with the 24 hour package, saying the boat tour was not included.  Later finding that the boat tour was included with the 24 hour package and if we purchased with the company at the stop or online it was cheaper too. I was thinking the Hampton would have our best interest in mine.

I was shocked upon arrival there was a letter in the room stating 2 people have become sick with Legionnaires' disease and your water system has tested positive in over 6 room but not stating which rooms. I wish this was previously communicated on the site or when booking.  I have a child, 4yrs old,  that has a critical autoimmune illness.  I would have reconsidered or checked with his medical team before traveling to this hotel.  I didn't like that I had NO option to make informed choice about the health of my family or myself. 

Elevators were also an issue.  I would not recommend this hotel to others due to the wait time for elevators. At times, the wait could be 20 min. or longer.

title: Busy Hotel
text: Vacationed here with family. The rooms were small with only 1 chair in a room with double beds to sleep 4. Walking distance  to Times Square and Broadway. Nice breakfast, but get there early if you have a group that wants to sit together.

title: Nella media
text: Hotel pulito, camere nella media, personale attento. Camere piccole e poco luminose. Nella norma ma non troppo comode. Personale gentile e cordiale ma non molto attento a tutte le tue esigenze. Unico pregio la colazione inclusa. Abbondante ma tipica americana. Caffè americano non del tutto orribile

title: Da un hotel targato Hilton mi aspettavo molto di più.
text: Camere troppo piccole e anguste. Caos eccessivo nelle aree comuni. Personale non sempre cordiale. I posti a sedere per la colazione erano assolutamente inadeguati per le persone presenti. Non credo che tornerò.

title: Great location for sight seeing
text:
The rooms are small but comfortable but was just what we needed for a 4 day visit. This hotel is in walking distance of port authority and subways. 

One of the things I thought about when going to NY would be the noise at night.... well is slept like a baby.

Staff where all pleasant and helpful... we would have a good banter with the breakfast ladies! Hot Breakfast was varied from day to day but could always get fruit and cereal, toast etc.. loved the orange juice! Unfortunately being a true Brit when it came to the tea bags they were a good make but I liked a good strong cuppa 😂.

title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
text: The rooms are small, as expected at this price range in NYC, but the hotel was clean and the check-in process was seamless. The staff was very friendly, and the breakfast was better than expected. We especially appreciated the staff who were running the breakfast, who went out of their way to be friendly to guests while making sure that tables were cleared quickly, and food / plates were replenished. Good location for activities, including Broadway shows and the Hudson Yards/High Line.

title: Family vacation
text: Overall great service and clean rooms. Complimentary breakfast was ok. Wifi great. Elevators are fast but are really busy during breakfast hours. Took us 20 minutes waiting for the elevator to go down from the 9th floor.

title: Overall good experience
text: Nice location, walkable distance to most attractions and Port Authority.  Very good breakfast options, warm and cold.  Nice rooms/beds, great water pressure/temp in shower.  Very good for the price considering you are right around Times Square.  Rooms are smaller, no room for queen beds, only full size, but that is New York City (space is at a premium) so price is right.  Staff very helpful.   Elevators can get busy during prime guest hours.

title: Discreta soluzione!
text:
Zona molto comoda per visitare l'isola!
Struttura pulita. Personale molto cortese.
Stanze piccole, ma a NY spesso lo sono.
Colazione improponibile ma la scelta dell'hotel non ne viene compromessa visto il rapporto qualità prezzo.
Soluzione discreta.

As stated before, everything was OK, except for the two previously mentioned things.  Service, appearance, cleanliness, all were satisfactory.  Good location, price was good for where we were.  Overall, a fairly good experience.

title: Comfortable stay near everything
text: The hotel has excellent breakfast. The check in counter cookies were scrumptious. The beds are comfortable. Walking distance to Port Authority bus station and Times Square. All kinds of eating options nearby

title: Eu voltaria
text: O hotel tem uma boa localização.  Os quartos são ótimos, bastante confortáveis e silenciosos, mas poderia ter um armário um pouco maior para que pudéssemos arrumar nossos pertences com mais conforto.  O café da manhã é muito bom, com sucos, smooties, cerais, frutas, chá, café, waffles, pão, bagel, dois pratos quentes, etc.  Os funcionários são muito agradáveis e atenciosos.  Só houve falha na arrumação dos quartos, ficamos nove noites e por dois dias não foi feita a limpeza e arrumação dos quartos (acredito que devido ao fato de ser alta temporada e o hotel estar lotado).  O hotel possui uma área com mesas, onde, caso esteja cansado e não queira sair para jantar, você pode trazer o seu lanche e comer com conforto.  Nessa área você encontrará café e chá o dia todo, e possui um microondas caso precise esquentar alguma coisa (isso, com certeza, é um diferencial).

title: Family New York Vacation
text: The location of the hotel was excellent.  Very easy to get around.  The staff was very curteous, pleasant and seemed to really enjoy their job.  Breakfast was very good.  Always had plenty of food even when the breakfast serving times were about to end.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Good hotel
text: Great location. Quiet. Hotel is very clean and staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is very bad, the food is terrible (waffles are different, not sure what they did here). Waffle makers are old and hard to work, burn hazard. Breakfast area is way too small to accommodate all the guests. Only two elevators so be prepared to wait for a long time to get a ride.

title: Convenient Location
text: This hotel is conveniently located close to Times Square, as well as Penn Station.  Super-accommodating morning breakfast room staff.  I knew I'd missed the breakfast timing but went down to get some coffee.  The breakfast room was still open, and the staff allowed me to get breakfast!  GREAT customer service.

title: Great stay!
text: I will stay here again. Clean room. I had one king bed and space was more than enough. Complete breakfast. Excellent staff. A lot of homless people near by but I felt safe all the time. Good stay for the money

title: Great hospitality and location
text:
I stayed here for a week during a leisure trip to NYC with family. At just a 4-minute walk to the nearest subway station and a10-minute walk away from Times Square and the theater district, its location was excellent for tourists wanting to discover what the city has to offer by foot or subway.

The entire staff (front desk, housekeeping, maintenance, kitchen) was among the friendliest I've ever encountered at a major hotel chain. They allowed us to store our luggage securely and free of charge for several hours when we arrived at 11 AM that morning and often inquired if we were pleased with our stay.

The seating capacity of the breakfast room was very limited for the total number of guests at the hotel, but the breakfast crew works hard to keep the buffet replenished constantly so, while the queue to serve yourself can take a while, the items don't run out during breakfast hours.

The elevator can take a while to reach your floor in the morning when you're waiting to go downstairs for breakfast. It was often faster for us to take the stairs up and down, even though we were on the 19th floor. It was good exercise, if anything.

I get the impression that the hotel has too many rooms and fits in too many guests for the capacity of its elevators, lobby, and breakfast room, so it feels like a very busy hotel at all hours, but even so, I would stay here again if I were in the area.

title: Friendly Staff
text:
Great free breakfast and friendly staff.
The location was good, rooms are small, elevators are slow.
I travelled with 2 teens and just found the hotel itself ok.
again the staff was amazing though I cannot say enough about them.

title: Great hotel would stay again
text:
We stayed her with our two older teenagers. The rooms were a bit small, but not uncomfortably so. It was very clean. They have a green policy where you can have a late checkout if you don’t get your sheets changed everyday.  We didn’t need the late checkout, but took them up on the offer anyways.
Breakfast was different everyday, which was nice. Turkey sausages was a treat!!!! 
The kids really liked the cookies available at the fri t desk.
It is close to Times Square and Madison Square Gardens. Staff were always friendly and welcoming whenever we came and went. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Hampton Inn stay
text: It was a great experience. The staff are wonderful and very friendly.  The location was great for my friends and I. The place is very clean and comfy. The breakfast was delicious. I highly recommend the Hampton Inn Hotel.

title: Ok
text: Buon hotel in buona posizione a 5 minuti a piedi da time Square e dalla metro.. E un ottimo hotel per essere a new York... Camere pulite, dove c è tutto per un soggiorno a new York... Tanto in camera nn ci sei mai. E per il prezzo che paghi è uno dei pochi che ti da Anke la colazione internazionale nn ricchissima ma giusta considerando che per lo stesso prezzo altri hotel nn offrono nulla. Lo consiglio vivamente

title: Familienreise nach NYC im Juli 2019
text:
Wir haben uns im Hotel sehr wohl gefühlt. 
Das Hotel ist sehr günstig gelegen (39. Straße zwischen 8. und 9. Avenue). Viele schöne Ziele wie Rockefeller Building, Central Park, High Line, Times Square kann man auch gut zu Fuß, z.T. innerhalb von 20....30 Minuten, erreichen. Auch zur Penn Station (Amtrak etc.) benötigt man nur 15 min zu Fuß.
U-Bahn Stationen sowie Citibike-Verleih sind nahegelegen.
In der 9. Avenue gibt es auch jede Menge Bars.
Durch die Nähe zum Lincoln-Tunnel gibt es allerdings recht viel Verkehr, wodurch es etwas laut ist. 
Zu der Zeit, als wir dort waren, wurde in der Straße auch an einigen Stellen gebaut.

title: Great Stay in NYC!
text: Chose this location based on our family plan to visit some of the main attractions of the city and the free breakfast.  I am an early riser so it was so nice to go have coffee and a bite while the rest could sleep a bit longer.  Wonderful staff and very friendly!

title: Great location & hospitality
text: I picked this hotel as it was 2 blocks from Port Authority, and we were comng in to see a Broadway Show. The staff was outstanding! They held our bags prior to checking in and after checking out the next day. Room was clean and an average size. Bathroom had a small shower, but it was clean and renovated.  We were on the 19th floor, and you could hear outside noise (sirens), but it did not hinder sleeping. We were in the middle of a blackout, but the hotel only seemed to be afftected ni terms of the elevator. They ran 1 elevator manually, and there were no issues with people lining up to get to their floor. The staff kept their cool.  It was my birthday, and they gave me a balloon with a small gift bag (with extra water and snacks)! Breakfast was a good selection (eggs, cereal, waffles, juice, muffins, smoothies, no breakfast meats). I would definitely stay again, mainly due to the excellent staff. Though location and room were outstanding as well. Price was competitive for the area (I paid $215 for a Saturday night). I believe parking is $65 a night.

title: Quality hotel
text:
Good quality hotel near the subway, location was a tiny bit rundown but the hotel itself doesn’t suffer for it. 
Close enough to points of interest

Staff. Was very friendly and went above and beyond during checkin

title: Perfect Location
text: This hotel was a perfect fit for our recent visit. It was within walking distance to Times Square and Subway/Metro stations that allowed us to maximize our sightseeing. Hotel staff were always willing to assist with any questions/concerns. Breakfast offered a nice variety but I would advise going early as there isn't a large seating area for the number of guests staying in the hotel.

title: Zeer slecht hotel. Muizen aanwezig!
text:
Twee kamers geboekt. Gekregen op de tweede verdieping. Muis in kamer 205. 
Omgeboekt. Tweede kamer 203 van dochters wilde men niet omboeken. Dag erna ook daar een muis. Het ergste was dat er twee muizenvallen onder het bed stonden. Dat wist men of had men kunnen weten. Nog nooit zoiets meegemaakt. Personeel is hier slecht mee omgegaan. Namen geen contact op. Kwamen afspraken niet na! Ontbijt zeer slecht. Te druk, te weinig eten, te weinig ruimte. Gasten zitten tot in de lobby met eten, of nemen het mee naar de kamers.

title: Great value ; no frills
text: If you are looking for the Ritz, or the Standard, don't stay here.  If you are seeking lodging that is reasonable, well located, clean with a great staff, this is the place. Easy walk from either Port Authority or Penn station. Adequate breakfast included enables you to get moving and  go explore the city.

title: 23rd wedding anniversary
text: We were there for a Broadway play and the hotel was in a great location for walking.  The staff were responsive to our needs and very friendly.  The outside of hotel was a little run down. Inside was nice.

title: Friendly staffs!
text: Even my 7 year old enjoyed the stay and commented how everyone in NYC was so nice (he meant the staffs at this hotel :-)). I was a lil unhappy with the breakfast choices that didn’t quite accommodate guests with dietary restrictions but kitchen staff was kind enough to offer us specially made omelettes for us. So that took care of it! :-)

title: Good stay🌺
text: It’s very good hotel with wonderful staff, very polite and respectful. Room was small but comfortable and very clean. Complementary breakfast was good, coffee and tea was all day for the public. Internet is good quality.

title: Never again!!
text: The rooms were way too small for my comfort and I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels in New York. The lobby area is very dumpy. I only used the stairs since the elevator looked run down. There were only 6 rooms to a floor and the hallway had very low ceilings and run down. The breakfast buffet was ok but was so crowded it was hard to enjoy your food. Normally I feel safe walking around NYC by myself at night but didn’t feel safe in this hotels location.  The only good thing about the hotel was the staff went out of their way to be helpful. Next time I will stay in a 4 star or above only!!

title: Great bang for the buck!
text: The staff made the experience. Everyone was super cheerful and made you feel right at home. The room was adequate and the beds were comfortable. It's close to Time Square so getting around is pretty easy. Elevators are a tad slow and the rooms were not done up until later in the day. On the other negative experience was having to step over some individuals with drug problems that were sleeping in doorways. Would not hesitate to come back here again. Breakfast room got pretty busy and catching an elevator became a challenge.

title: Wonderful vacation!  Excellent staff!
text:
Really liked this location.  All staff were cheerful, nice and helpful!
Some work going on in the garment district but it is not noisy or intrusive in any way.  Location was perfectly located and we had access to all kinds of food and metro locations.

title: Mal check out
text:
Tardan muchos días en regresar el deposito de 480 dólares por habitación. Van 6 días y contando...no es justo que retengan tanto tiempo el deposito.
Es un abuso, puesto que instantáneamente lo cargan y pasan más de 6 días y no regresan

title: First Class treatment
text:
I stay at a lot of hotels from 5 stars to two. In my many years, I’m somewhat of an expert where quality is concerned. 

I can honestly say this Hampton was simply amazing. The staff was very professional and kind. They even remembered my name. 

All the staff couldn’t be friendlier. And the cleaning staff was polishing areas most 5 star hotels don’t even clean. 

This place gave 5 star treatment and I recommend their hotel. Great location as well.

title: Friendly staff, clean, great location
text: Location was great, staff was friendly, hotel was clean. There are only two elevators to service 30+ floors which get very busy while the hotel has cleaning staff on site, so expect lengthy waits when trying to get to your room or leave your room. All of the staff was exceptionally friendly no matter how busy they were or what time, my friends and I came back to the room after 4am every day. One person really stood out as being very sincere and truly genuine with his conversation, James or Jim at the front desk (he goes by both) was always a bright spot when my group was greeted by him.  Congrats to the staff at this hotel for being a star with hospitality and bravo to Jim for standing out as our favorite employee of our trip.

title: Too small
text: The room was small, bathroom door hit the sink, the corridors on the floors are narrow and the elevators cannot accommodate the amount of guests.  All and all, not worth the price and did meet expectations for a Hampton Inn.

title: Nice Stay in NYC
text: I chose this property for its location. It is a great location only moments away from the heart of Times Square. Even though the room was small, it was clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The morning breakfast is typical of what you would expect and provides enough to get your day started.

title: Wonderful staff
text: The staff have been very kind and supportive from the moment we stepped in to the moment we left. Very friendly and helpful people. Rooms are a good size and the air-conditioning, though a little loud, is very efficient. Perfect for a hot June.

title: Terrible Breakfast!
text: Breakfast was horrible.  The only that we could eat was what was in containers like the yogurt.  Anything that was made was too gross to eat.  We were also overcharged for our stay.  We are in the process of getting that corrected.

title: Decent Hotel in Manhattan
text: This is a decent hotel for the price in NYC.  The place is clean.  They offer a nice breakfast with different items every day.  The rooms are very small.  There are only two elevators and with 32 floors that sometimes equals a little wait for the elevator.  The staff was very cordial and helpful.

title: Good price and location
text: My husband and I went to NY for a mini-vacation before work gets busy. I looked around and this hotel had fairly good reviews in a good location, so I decided to book. Because of location (Times Square), I had my doubts and low expectations. When we arrived, we were able to check in early. We also chose to do valet parking for ease of mind, esp in NY. FYI, you have to pay extra including tax. The room was small but it's what we expected and it was just the two of us anyways. The bathroom was very clean. Warning, for those of you who are big and tall, the shower may be small for you. Free wifi was a plus. Complimentary breakfast could be better, but wasn't bad. It's complimentary so who can complain. Overall, the staff was all very nice and welcoming. I would definitely come here again and recommend to others.

title: Tiny Rooms and LONG waits for the elevator
text:
The good: The staff was nice and helpful. They had cookies in the lobby, and the fathers day board in the lobby where you could write something nice about your dad was a nice touch. 

The bad: Where do I start?
* The rooms were tiny. We were constantly walking into each other and there was no where to put our luggage. 
* The elevators were awful. There are two, and they are not sufficient to deal with the traffic at the hotel. We had waits of 30-40 minutes to use the elevators in the morning. This is unacceptable when you are trying to get somewhere on time. 
* The kids like the breakfasts. The adults found the coffee to be insipid and the food mediocre. 
* The area needs to be cleaned up. There were homeless with kids hanging out downstairs hassling our family every time we walked by. One day there were dirty pads all over the sidewalk. We crossed to the other side of the street to walk as it was much cleaner and felt safer just across the street. 
* They tried to charge us an upgrade fee for being on a high floor. We did not ask for a high floor. There is no view, and the elevator takes so long that we would have much preferred a low floor where we could have taken the stairs. Instead of charging an upgrade, they should have given us a discount to pay us for the time we wasted waiting for the elevator.

title: Sister Getaway
text: Spent the weekend with my sisters and really enjoyed our stay.  The hotel is in a great location walking distance to subway and other attractions.  The complimentary buffet was excellent and one of my sister's was worried she would have to go to Starbucks everyday for her coffee, but was pleasantly surprised with the coffee at Hampton Inn. Amanda who worked the breakfast buffet was absolutely charming, welcoming and helpful.  I would highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Manhattan in the near future.

title: Ottimo hotel a 3 stelle
text:
Ci siamo fermate quasi una settimana in questo hotel e ci siamo trovate benissimo.
È un 3 stelle che in Italia forse potrebbe arrivare anche a 4 : stanza abbastanza spaziosa con un letto matrimoniale king size, completa di frigo bar, TV, ferro da stiro e cassaforte.
Il bagno è un po' piccolo, ma funzionale.
Il personale è molto cortese e sempre disponibile.
Si trova a 5 minuti da Times Square quindi in ottima posizione anche per i teatri di Broadway.

title: PARFAIT PLUS !!
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, proche de tout, personnel très accueillant et sympathique . Chambre spacieuse et très propre , SDB nickel et petit déjeuner bien copieux avec du salé et du sucré .Café et thé à dispo toute la journée !! Gentille attention, avec en plus des cookies dans l'après midi . 
Pour mon prochain séjour dans la Grosse Pomme , je ne chercherais plus ; j'y retourne les yeux fermés !!

title: Our trip to the Big Apple
text: Great place to stay. We stayed 4 nights. Everyone at the hotel we're so helpful from the front desk, to the servers of the breakfast, to the maintenance people. They were all so kind. Rooms were clean and plenty of room for 3 people. Close to the Subway entrance and just a few blocks from main area of Time Square.

title: Good hotel but ask for low lever floor
text:
This is a good standard of hotel.  The room was small but of a good standard.  The double bed was comfortable and very big, the flat screen TV was decent, the bathroom was a good standard.   There was air conditioning in the room.  A huge bonus was the fridge inside the room, which we used to store fruit, sparkling water and other drinks.  There was also an iron and an ironing board, which we used and a hair dryer. 

The location of the hotel is good.  It is located on a back street, which meant there was little street noise.  So we were able to sleep well.  The hotel is also located near the metro (42nd Street Times Square), about a 5-10 minute walk away.  We were able to get from the JFK airport to the hotel easily, using the Air Train followed by the metro.

The hotel has about 30 floors, and only has two lifts for the whole hotel which is not enough.  This means you can be waiting some time for a lift to become available, especially if you are on the ground floor and the lifts are on the top floors.  Our room was on the 4th floor, so we were able to use the stairs no problem if a lift wasn’t readily available.  But if our room was much higher than that, we obviously would not be able to do that.  TOP TIP: Ask for a room on as low a floor as possible.

The breakfast room is not very big, and it gets very crowded.  We stayed at the hotel for one week.  We had trouble finding seats on the Sunday, but had no problem on the other days.  The breakfast selection was ok, and included scrambled eggs or an omelette (there is one option each day), sausages or Canadian ham (one option each day), bagels, breads rolls, toast, sweet muffins, bananas, yoghurts, cereal, boiled eggs.  There is tea, coffee, hot chocolate, orange juice, apple juice.  There is also a waffle machine, where guests can easily make fresh waffles together with syrup, chocolate and cream.  What really shocked us, was that the breakfast only provides paper plates and plastic cutlery.  This is a Hilton hotel, so we couldn’t believe it.  It wasn’t a big problem, but we thought it was strange.

Guests can help themselves to free hot drinks 24 hours a day.  This can be found next to the breakfast area on the same floor of the reception. 

We had a few hours to use on our last day, so after checking out, the hotel kept our bags for us at the hotel which was appreciated. 

Another tip is the Upside Pizza takeaway near the hotel, which served really excellent pizza.  When exiting the hotel, turn left and you will find it at the next crossroads.

All in all, a pleasant stay.  But be sure to ask for a room on as low a floor as possible because of the lift problem.

title: Outstanding closet near Times Square
text: The rooms are closet-sized and feels very cramped for a family of four in a two double bed room.  Also, the two elevators are slow and crowded.  During the last breakfast hour and near checkout, expect to pass an elevator after 10 minutes of waiting because it’s completely full.  Then wait another 10 mins before another arrives.  Otherwise the location is convenient near Times Square and breakfast and all-day coffee and tea are awesome amenities.  Hotel staff are customer- focused and extremely friendly.

title: Tiny hotel great location
text: If your traveling for business this hotel will work well. It had a great location but no views and rooms are tiny.  It’s central to everything and easily accessible. Keep in mind parking is $67, no in an out service.  However there is 24 hour parking across the street for $50, no in and out access.  This hotel works with for a couple going to see a broadway show.  Plan to walk most places or take a subway. Uber or Lyft is avail but will take twice the amount of time to walk most places.  All in all it’s adequate considering the location.

title: Good location, bad experience
text:
I spent a total of 5 nights at this hotel, one night on my own and the others with a tour group.  This is my recap:  Two elevators for 32 floors just doesn't work during the busy times.  One morning around 9:00 one of the elevators was not working, and the other was overwhelmed with use, as a result I had to walk up 32 flights of stairs to get tickets we needed for a tour.  Once I retrieved them from my room I saw the manager in the broken elevator and asked if I could take it back down.  He said I could not, so I walked back down 32 flights of stairs.  However, at the bottom I see the manager had taken the elevator down.  
The breakfast staff was overwhelmed every morning and could not keep up with the customers coming in.  One morning all I could get was one scoop of eggs and a glass of water.  Twice we were not provided wash cloths, and once we had to go to the front desk to get hand and bath towels.
The staff was friendly and the AC worked very well, the bed was very comfortable.  
Overall the experience was not what I have come to expect from a Hilton property.

title: High School Drama trip
text: Great experience at this hotel!  Efficient and accommodating. Knew how to take care of a large group, plenty of friendly staff and efficient check in/out!  Well oiled machine with great customer service, clean rooms and amenities!

title: Excellent Service and Location
text: My family and I had a great time staying in this hotel. All the staff we met were very courteous and friendly, especially those front desk staff - Vina, Jena and Camille. The person who assisted us with our luggages and the staff from the dining were also really nice. They made our stay memorable. The location is very convenient, it’s only less than 5 mins from the subway/times square/port authority. Our room was very clean, normal size and beds were soft and comfortable. They have free buffet and 24 hours coffee/tea service. This hotel is highly recommended. We will surely stay here again when we come back.

title: Buen hotel precio/calidad/ubicacion
text: Buen hotel, buena ubicación en la ciudad. Prox a time Square y demás edificios turísticos. Solo que en la calle que está ubicado en la noche hay muchos drogadictos por qué hay expendio de drogas. Pero ese no es tema del hotel

title: Hampton Inn / Manhatten Experience
text: Excellent experience all the way around. We highly recommend this property. It was very clean & the staff was fantastic. Our room was much larger than expected. If we visit New York City in the future we will definitely stay with them again.

title: Good location and enjoyable stay
text:
I am writing this on behalf of my wife and daughter who had a short "girls" holiday in NYC. They chose the Hampton Inn because of its proximity to Broadway- seeing a show was one of their highlights.
They were able to navigate past US passport control at JFK without any delay  (unlike last year when long queues meant that it took more than a hour) so checked in far earlier then planned, but their room was ready. The room was a typical size for an city centre hotel, so not over spacious, but big enough, was clean and had everything that they needed. The included buffet breakfast was good enough and set them up for the day, although seating was limited. The only issue that they encountered was that the hotel has only 2 lifts, which are also used by cleaning staff, so on occasions getting to and from their room on the 26th floor was a hassle 
The hotel is within easy walking distance of restaurants and the 42nd Street subway, so they were able to get round and about easily. They had an enjoyable stay and would be happy to book again.

title: A week in the Big Apple
text: We spent a week in New York and stayed at the Hampton Inn in the Times Square area of Manhattan. From our arrival to our sad departure we received nothing but courtesy and friendliness from all the staff. Our room was ample big enough and the price included breakfast which was varied and very filling. This is an ideal location for a tour of the sights of New York. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: The staff make this hotel
text: We stayed here over Memorial weekend. We arrived early, 10:30 AM, knowing our room wouldn’t be ready, we just wanted to drop off our bags so we could start exploring New York City. This was our first time to NYC . David greeted me and my wife and told us he would take care of our bags. We told him we were going to Battery Park to see Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. We wanted to take the subway. He told us which train to take and we were off. All of the staff were amazing from housekeeping, breakfast staff, to the front desk. We averaged 10 miles walking every day and when we returned every evening, we were always greeted with smiling faces. The rooms were quite and the breakfast had plenty of choices. We were completely satisfied with our stay here and wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

title: Wonderful staff, small room
text: The hotel staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and appreciated. The room is smaller than the usual hotel room, perhaps because it's Manhattan.
