Only 3 small drawers, so unpacking for a 9-day stay was challenging. Shower felt cramped. Breakfast was mostly good--lots of variety. But the OJ wasn't cold. Cookies every evening in the lobby, but no variety--always oatmeal raisin. Good location, about a block from a subway entrance that led to many Manhattan routes.

title: Amazing
text: This hotel was conveniently located a few blocks from Times Square. It was amazing cozy and the service was outstanding. The breakfast was wonderful and well staffed. It was a short walking distance to everything my family went to NYC for.

title: Reliable Hampton Experience. Clean and Friendly with valet parking. Good Value!
text: This Hampton is within an easy walking distance of the Javits Center.  Traveling alone to attend an event there, this Hampton works. It's a good value for a quick stay. I chose the Park & Stay option. They Valet park the car when you arrive and return it when its time to leave. Very easy if you don't intend to use your car in the city. There are no in and out privileges, and it's parked a ways away.   My stay was everything I expected from Hampton right down to the folded cheese omelet and selection of bagels at breakfast. Rooms are clean and renovated. Euro-style small but its NYC after all. Bed and pillows very comfortable as always.  The front desk staff were helpful friendly and attentive. I'll be back next time I attend an event at the Javits center. Recommend if you're traveling and the location works for you.  Not the place I'd bring my wife to visit time square though.  Too basic.  Good Value in NYC.

title: Excelente localização e muito confortável.
text: Quarto muito confortável, excelente localização. Café da manhã muito bom, porém espaço do café muito apertado para o tanto de pessoas hospedadas. Elevadores demoram muito nos horários de pico por serem somente dois para o hotel inteiro.

title: Excellent Vacation
text: Everything was perfect.  The staff was so accommodating and friendly--very helpful giving directions.  Breakfast buffet had an extremely large selection.  Rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Super +++
text: 2ème séjour dans cet hôtel. Personnel très sympathique et professionnel. La chambre est spacieuse et la salle d’eau très bien. Le petit déjeuner est copieux avec du chaud et du froid. Un stand café et thé reste à disposition toute la journée. Emplacement parfait dans Times Square.

title: Not a brilliant start to our holiday. But good hotel for being in central New York.
text:
Stayed here in February 2019 with my family (4 adults). Upon arrival we were greeted at reception and told our rooms weren’t ready yet, so we were told to wait for 20/25 minutes. Which we did. 55 minutes later we were still sat in reception waiting, upon approaching staff we were then informed that one room was ready and that we could go into that until the other was ready, which would be 17 floors apart. My parents were furious as me and my sister would be 17 floors away on a family trip after we requested to be close especially being in a new place for the first time. Somehow they then managed to get a room on the floor below somehow and we took them. We were on the 11th and 12th floor of the hotel. There were 2 lifts which were super slow and often resulted in us taking the stairs (all 12 flights of them). 

Later that night we discovered that our room was freezing cold even with the heating on, it was the middle of winter which was understandable but it was freezing to the point we were close to tears it was so uncomfortable. The bulky heater was blowing out cold air so we rang reception and they sent an engineer up. He said nothing was wrong with it and provided us with a tiny portable heater which was really noisy and just not the best. The next morning after a very uncomfortable sleep and just wanted to enjoy our holiday, we complained again and somehow it got fixed that day. The room was still cold but more bearable and we just got on with it as we were in New York and Just wanted to enjoy it!! 

The room wasn’t brilliant and in the pictures provided you can see that. It felt rather dirty and not well kept. The bed was comfortable and clean thankfully. Our toilet was also really noisy and meant we couldn’t flush it during the night without waking each other up 🤦🏼‍♀️ 

Breakfast was good, and I couldn’t get over how small the dining area was, and bins were constantly full and overflowing. For the size of the hotel there was always queues just to sit down. We often took our breakfast back to our rooms. It was a buffet style and there was loads on offer including cereal, hot food, a waffle machine, a toaster and selection of fruit. It was paper cups and paper plates so did feel a little like a school canteen lol. But overall the food was yummy and it was enough to set you up for the day. 

Overall I wouldn’t stay here again, but the hotel is a short walk from the Empire State Building, madison square gardens and Times Square so it is very central. Also the daily fresh cookies was a lovely extra and they were yummy, and on Valentine’s Day they gave out free chocolates. The reception staff were brilliant and always greeted you each day with a smile no matter how busy and hectic reception was. Which was nice :) just a shame some things let the place down.

title: Great STAFF and location.
text:
This location was perfect for the Times 
Square and Garment District  in NYC
Staff were amazing.. friendly,efficient and welcoming
Our Handicap Accessible room had some serious concerns so nut sure this is a good location if those are your needs.

title: Excelente ubicación, cerca de todo.
text:
El hotel se encuentra muy bien ubicado, el personal es muy cordial, hablan varios idiomas (español, portugués, francés), la atención es muy cordial. Las habitaciones de buen tamaño (justo).
Lo que deben mejorar es el desayuno es muy pobre, poca oferta y faltan mas variedades de alimentos.

title: Family vacation
text: Great location, close to everything but quiet and relaxing. Breakfast was a great start to our day. Clean rooms and I liked how environmentally conscious they are. Would highly recommend for any traveler.

title: Ottimo hotel
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel con mio marito, e ci siamo trovati benissimo. La colazione ottima e varia, il personale molto attento alle esigenze dei clienti. Le camere belle, molto pulite e i letto grande e comodissimo.
La posizione e' molto comoda, vicina a  tutto e dista solo 10 min. Da time squere. Sicuramente ritorero' in questo hotel o in uno di questa catena se ne ho l'occasione.

title: Great place for a short stay in Manhattan
text: This was just what we expected for a relatively inexpensive hotel in the centre of Manhattan.  Room rather dark because of tall buildings all around and only a coffeemaker -no tea (and we Brits DO like our tea!).   But the beds!  SO comfortable -even more so than the Queen Mary 2 that we’d travelled to NY aboard.  So two wonderfully comfortable nights’ sleep which we very much appreciated.  Breakfast again was ok - fairly basic self-serve but perfectly adequate, and friendly, helpful, smiley staff even at 6am.   Very happy with our two night stay.

title: ...non proprio accettabile
text:
albergo a pochi passi da times square, quindi comodissimo per raggiungere qualsiasi destinazione ma unica cosa positiva.
camere molto piccole, abbiamo chiesto subito l'intervento della reception in quanto la cassaforte non si apriva e nessuno è intervenuto, colazione parecchio scarsa, poca scelta e l'ultima mattina mancante di parecchie cose perchè le avevano finite.
rapporto qualità/prezzo decisamente bassa

title: Super hotel
text: Great value for money. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. Bedroom very clean and beds comfortable giving us a good nights sleep. The complimentary breakfast had a good variety of hot and cold food each morning. Hot drinks available at anytime during your stay was lovely to come back to each day for a quick sit down and chill and talk to other quests to share ideas. Overall could not fault this hotel. We would definitely return. Great location too.

title: Good but noisy
text:
4 night stay in NYC and I was allocated a king room on floor 24. The room was small but clean and bed was comfy. Shower pressure was good despite the high floor room.

Each floor only has 6 rooms so noise from lifts and other guests was minimal. The issue however is the windows offer poor sound proofing and the noise of vehicle horns, trucks all night and construction going on until at least 2am was very intrusive. Ear plugs did help but not ideal for a $250 per night stay. A room on the opposite side of the hotel may be better than those on the street side. 

The hotel only has 2 lifts servicing over 30 floors so at busy times you could be waiting a while or annoyingly stopping on what seems like every floor on the way up / down. Due the type of building there is not a lot can be done about this but worth bearing in mind. 

It's location is ideal for central nyc with most places walkable, and the staff are pleasant and friendly.

Happy to recommend this hotel.

title: Hampton to the rescue!
text:
When we were planning our most recent trip to NYC, it was very difficult to find an available hotel for our dates that was also within our budget & offered the amenities we prefer (microwave & refrigerator). Our initial choice (the Element Times Square West) was a complete and utter disaster, as on the night we arrived, we discovered that despite a confirmation e-mail from them a few days before arrival, they had no room for us (which they attributed to "a computer glitch.") The end result was us being sent to a hotel in Queens, which we didn't get into until almost 2 AM.

We had NO confidence whatsoever in that hotel following this incident & did not want to return there for the remaining nights we were in town.Thankfully, after checking my Hilton Honors app, I discovered this hotel was available at a good AAA rate for the rest of our visit to the city. So after telling Element we would not be returning, we made a reservation here--and I'm SO glad we did!  When we arrived the next morning between 11 and 12, we were greeted by GM David & his awesome staff, who, after sympathizing with us about our unfortunate events of the previous night said, "We have a room ready for you; you can go on up and get settled."  Totally unexpected and most definitely appreciated!

We had a very nice, clean King room (1806) which was next to the elevator & offered a view of West 39th Street. Our bed was very comfortable! (I don't always sleep well when traveling, but definitely enjoyed some zzz's here.) Room size wasn't an issue for us & we didn't feel cramped in by it at all. 

While we missed having a microwave to warm up leftovers, it was great to have a mini-fridge for storing soft drinks, bottled water (and slices of Junior's cheesecake). Water pressure was good, although we did have to wait just a little bit for the warm/hot water in the shower. No issues with the complimentary wi-fi, either. 

We did experience some street noise due to construction on West 39th (Really?  Who thinks it's a bright idea to fire up a jackhammer at 8AM on a Saturday?), but if you bring some earplugs/earbuds, you shouldn't have any problems. 

Most of all, it was wonderful to encounter such friendly staff members! Every time we went out and came back in, we received a genuinely warm & friendly greeting from those on duty. 

So thank you, thank you, THANK YOU Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South for coming to our rescue! We look forward to visiting you again in the future.

title: Bello ma stanza minuscola
text: Posizione ottima a pochi minuti a piedi da Times Square. Noi eravamo in 4 in camera (viaggio universitario) e lo spazio era ingestibile, anche a detta di chi era in una doppia. Il bagno invece era più spazioso. Camera pulita. Colazione a Buffett abbastanza buona, sia dolce che salata. Possibilità di bere tè o caffè in autonomia su dei tavoli posti dietro la hall.

title: Great position
text: We were welcomed by the friendly reception staff. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is perfectly positioned for exploring New York sights and sounds and shopping. With a complimentary breakfast included it was a good way to start the day.. We had many conversations with the staff looking after breakfast who directed us to a shopping mall in Jersey. That was an experience to be recommended.

title: Perfect location, tiny rooms, free basic breakfast buffet
text:
The main interest of this hotel is its location.
Otherwise, beds are comfortable, full amenities are available on demand, rather quiet, free breakfast...
Don't expect too much from the basic breakfast buffet, but, hey, it's free !
Tea and coffee are available 24hrs in the dining room as well. Cookies are also offered in the lobby around tea time.
Great lobby and room service staff ! They will be reactive, meet your needs and give you plenty of advice if you need...
Downsides :
Extremely tiny rooms (won't accomodate for a flat opened large suitcase), without fridges, with very little storage space : packed New York style ! You can walk and turn around in the bathroom... that looks abnormally big in such a context, yet it is not particularly roomy either.
Don't expect either much natural light through the tiny windows and adjacent buildings. No windows in the dining room either.
The fitness room offers a very minimal equipment, it is in the basement, close to the unwelcoming service area.
Note that breakfast cutlery is 100% disposable plastic or cardboard, which does not show much environment care.

title: Localização/atendimento
text: Hotel com ótima localização e excelente atendimento de seus colaboradores. Próximo de pontos turísticos, Times Square, Biblioteca Municipal, Bryant Park, Grand Central. Quarto relativamente pequeno, porém limpo e com cama confortável! Recomendo

title: Parfait
text:
Hôtel parfaitement situé, très propre, personnel sympathique et serviable.
Salle du petit-déjeuner un peu petite pour la capacité de l’hôtel : privilégiez la tranche 7h-7h30
A réserver les yeux fermés

title: Perfect stay and NO RESORT FEES
text: Many NYC hotels now routinely tack on an extra (often undisclosed or poorly communicated resort fee of $30-$40 PER DAY on top of the ridiculously high room charges and NY and NYC taxes (and Javits Convention Center fee). Not this property! Great service. Nice rooms, Handy location (in the Garmet District). Walk to Times Square AND the new Hudson Yards! Breakfast good but room too small. 2 elevators not enough for the property so a bit of a wait. Nice business center. Highly recommended. Tell NYC hotels you will NOT pay a resort fee. Midtown Manhattan is not a resort.

title: terrific hotel!!
text: fun NYC trip, great hotel, wonderful staff and excellent location, good breakfast, easy parking, friendly and helpful staff, easy to walk to empire state, time square, central park, lots to see and do, thank you!

title: Un hôtel très bien situé et accueillant.
text:
Le personnel est très accueillant et sait vous renseigner dès que vous en avez besoin. La situation géographique est idéale pour visiter: proche de Times Square et une bouche de métro à proximité.
Le seul bémol: la salle de petit-déjeuner trop petit au vu du nombre de clients.

title: Family stay in NYC
text: I happened to find this hotel one morning for a great price so I immediately booked it. The location was great being only a few blocks from Penn station, Time Square, the Theater district and so many dining options. Well worth it & the Staff was kind and helpful

title: Great location
text: We like how close this hotel is to the Port Authority.  The check-in was very easy and fast- thanks Henry for being so welcoming and recommending the Irish Pub down the street for dinner - a nice place to eat after a long day of traveling.  Our room had a king size bed, but the room was not that big (hey, you are in NYC), still, there was plenty of room for our luggage.  The bathroom was very clean.  Overall, a nice and safe place to stay in NYC.

title: Business Trip in NYC
text: Κατά τη διάρκεια της οκταήμερης παραμονής μου στη NYC στα πλαίσια επιχειρηματικού μου ταξιδιού, διέμενα στο Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South. Η εξαιρετική τοποθεσία του ξενοδοχείου σε συνδυασμό με το ικανοποιητικό επίπεδο των υπηρεσιών που μου προσέφερε, έκανε τη διαμονή μου ευχάριστη. Το μοναδικό πρόβλημα που υπήρχε ήταν οι καθυστερήσεις στους ανελκυστήρες.

title: Very well run hotel close to Times Square
text: My second stay at this hotel. Courteous friendly staff which will hold your luggage if you arrive before check in. Breakfast is more than adequate for your needs before a long day exploring the city. Times Square, The Port Authority, Madison Square Garden, Radio Music City Hall, the 24 hour subway system are all within walking distance. Overall, I would definitely stay here again when visiting New York. Prices vary greatly according to season and which day of the week you are staying.

title: Fun NYC Trip!
text: I enjoyed my stay from beginning to end. Check in was easy and quick. Everyone on staff was pleasant and courteous. The room was set up very efficiently with a good shower and comfortable bed. Breakfast had a nice variety of choices.

title: Hospedagem de 9 a 15 de Abril de 2019
text: O hotel em si, 3 muito bom. Localização fantástica, perto de várias atrações turísticas, onde íamos a pé mesmo. Café da manhã bom, apesar de limitado. Há um bônus de cafés, chás e cookies a qualquer momento no próprio hotel também. Fora isso, há muitas opções de alimentação por perto, para quem não quiser o café do hotel. O ponto negativo do hotel é com relação aos elevadores. São 32 andares, cada um com 6 apartamentos. 192 no total. Apenas 2 elevadores para atender toda a demanda do hotel. Tinha horas que formava fila para poder usá-lo. Em horários de pico, chegava a 20 minutos de espera. O que compensava é que eles são rápidos. Mesmo com esse ponto negativo, recomendo a hospedagem.

title: Reasonable price, good location.
text:
3日間滞在。部屋は綺麗ですがホテルの前で建設工事中のためうるさくて眠れず。（2019/4)
朝食はワッフルなどがある。コーヒーは24時間無料。
ジムも併設されているが、機器は余りない。
マンハッタンのホテル価格を考えると、このホテルは良心的。

Staying 3 nights this hotel.Room is clean. Street is noisy, so it was difficult to sleep. Since construction is ongoing in Apr. 2019, in front of this hotel.
Fine breakfast, waffle, breads, muffins, beagles, ham, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, yogurt, and some fruits. Coffee is free 24/7 at 1st floor.
Small gym is also available. But equipments are poor.
Thinking about hotel price in Manhattans, this hotel is quite honest and reasonable.
I recommend it.

title: El mejor en calidad-precio
text:
Excelente ubicación, a tan solo unas cuadras de las principales atracciones como Broadway, Times Square, Museo de cera y el de Ripley. Áreas con mucha limpieza. Trato  amable de todo el personal. 
Habitaciones pequeñas, y hotel pequeño, pero es razonable en relación a lo que pagas. Un poco de humor ruido exterior en las habitaciones, aunque al final no lo notábamos por estar cansados de estar disfrutando la ciudad en el día.
100% recomendable, definitivamente me gustaría hospedarme de nueva cuenta ahí.

title: Ummmmm
text: Checked in at around 7pm room was ready. The staff on check in were friendly and asked did I prefer a lower or higher room. I had no preference so I said give me the best you have available, you got it she says. Room 2306. 2 small double beds, a wardrobe, small desk and chair great, new clean bathroom, window curtain ill fitting and very draughty window which we didn't notice till bed time as air con was on when we arrived. The room was a good size for us, a couple and a 7 year old. Returned from dinner after travelling 12 hours we just wanted to sleep but that window was soooo noisy it was louder than being on the 747! I put ear plugs in, no better. I thought maybe this is the way it is as it's very busy outside so I just got on with it. By day 2 I was sleep deprived. The constant low hum was driving me crazy. I reported it at 6am, nothing. Again at 8am, then a nice maintenance guy arrived and said he'd fix it when we were out if that was OK. If he couldn't fix he'd request a move for the next 3 nights. Perfect. Come back later on and there is a ridiculous effort of some grey insulation tape around the window which did nothing! I rang down again, they will send someone up... Nothing. I got fed up in the end and blocked the bottom with towels. How ridiculous but I didnt want it to spoil our stay so I just got on with it. At check out they didn't even ask about our stay just took keys! Positives-Geraldine the breakfast ambassador is fantastic. Lovely, friendly, helpful with tips and looked after us-thank you! Breakfast was really good, fresh, varied, and well stocked. Around 8am it gets crazy but we were awake early so had lovely breakfasts. Took fruit out with us and also little lunch bags in foyer with water, snack etc in. Elevators were OK for us longest wait was 5 mins. The complimentary tea and coffee were fine and a nice touch. The bell boy was very helpful too. The lobby was often frequented by odd people not staying at the hotel, one lady was definitely homeless using the computers, she had all sorts of bandages on her really didn't give a good impression and then moved to the seats, getting all her belongings out of her bags and Irish receptionist did nothing to remove her... Not good enough really. Housekeeping was fine, clean towels, beds made, toiletries replaced each day. But I Would not stay again. Felt let down by the duty manager, reception staff who have limited customer service skills. Booked with virgin as a package and it wasn't cheap so I'll be feeding back to virgin ASAP.

title: Hôtel accessible et tres bien situé
text:
Hôtel tres bien situé à deux avenues de Times square Metro à disposition qui permet de visiter efficacement les différents quartiers
Chambres agréables avec une belle vue sur l'empire state building 
Personnels très accueillants, polies et à disposition des clients

title: Super clean
text:
Stayed one night after a broadway show.  Hotel was super clean. Beds were so comfy and free breakfast in the morning was well stocked
100% would stay here again.  
Staff even set up a balloon and card for my sisters birthday.

title: Girls weekend in NYC!!
text: Accommodations at this hotel are excellent.  The staff is welcoming, friendly and helpful.  The rooms, although small, are very clean and the beds are so comfortable. The complimentary breakfast is great.

title: Nice hotel and convenient location
text: We stayed at this Hampton Inn during spring break 2019.  The room was rather compact but for 2 people it was fine.  The location was in easy walking distance to Times Square and other attractions.  The staff was very pleasant and accomodating.  We only ate breakfast a couple of mornings but the choices were good.  We stayed on the second floor so although we didn't have a view, it was convenient to walk up and down to our room and not have to use the elevator.   Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

title: Great stay!
text: We liked our stay at this hotel. We were greeted warmly, check-in was easy. Rooms are small but that was expected. Room was clean, comfortable beds. Location was great. Easy to walk to the things we wanted to do. Quiet street. We liked the 24 hr coffee/tea, cookies in evening, breakfast in the morning. Perfect NYC hotel.

title: NYC Springbreak
text: NYC springbreak/college visits. Stayed at this location 3 yrs ago. Room was clean, breakfast was ok, enough items to chose from to get enough to start the day. Elevators slow. Good location and value. Would stay again.

title: Very clean and great location
text: The hotel is very clean, friendly staff and a great location in Manhattan. I recommend using alternative parking across the street for much less than hotel parking.  My family and I will stay in this hotel on our next trip in November 2019.

title: Excelente staff e limpeza impecável
text:
Gosto da rede Hampton, principalmente pelos funcionários atenciosos. 
Material de banho é fornecido diariamente, a roupas de cama são limpas e cheirosas. O café da manhã atende bem aos brasileiros, além de terem sempre cookies no final da tarde e um chocolate quente e chá para os hóspedes.

title: Sehr gutes Stadthotel, das den Gast in der hektischen Stadt zur Ruhe kommen lässt - nächstes Mal wieder!
text:
Was zeichnet das Hampton Inn Manhattan - Times Square South aus?

Als allererstes die Lage, wenn man denn direkt "mittendrin" sein möchte. Das Hotel liegt in Midtown/Hells Kitchen an der 39th St., zwischen 8th und 9th Ave. Port Authority (Busstation und Subway) und der Broadway sind 1 Block entfernt und der Times Square ca 5 Blocks. Generell kann man vieles fußläufig erreichen, aber auch die Subway- und Busanbindung ist sehr gut. Die Umgebung bietet eine Vielzahl an Restaurants, Bars, Diners etc.. Es ist viel los auf den Straßen und Gehwegen. D. h., man steht sofort im hektischen "Gewusel", sobald man das Hotel verlässt. Andererseits bedeutet das auch, dass es auf den Straßen sicher ist und man auch nachts, ohne Angst haben zu müssen, zum Hotel laufen kann. In NY gilt im Allgemeinen, wo Menschen zu Fuß unterwegs sind, ist es sicher. Verlassene Gegenden bzw. Gegenden mit leeren Bürgersteigen sollte man abends/nachts meiden!

Das Hampton Inn ist ein Hotel der Hilton-Kette und bietet bzgl. der Ausstattung einen guten und verlässlichen Standard. Im Erdgeschoss befinden sich die Rezeption, ein Concierge, mehrere Sitzgelegenheiten, eine Ecke in der 24h kostenlos Kaffee zur Verfügung steht und ein kleines Business-Center mit 2 PC, die Hotelgäste nutzen können. Im Keller gibt es einen kleinen Fitnessraum. Auf jeder Etage befinden sich nur 6 Hotelzimmer, allerdings auf ca. 30 Etagen. Durch die geringe Anzahl an Zimmern ist es auf den Fluren sehr ruhig. Wir haben ein Standard-Zimmer mit einem King-Size-Bett gebucht. Das Zimmer (und auch das Bad) war ausreichend groß, sehr sauber und die Einrichtung war relativ neu und modern. Sämtliche Ausstattungsmerkmale, die auf der Homepage des Hotels aufgeführt sind, waren vorhanden. Zusätzlich fanden wir an beiden Nachttischen mehrere USB-Ports, um Handys etc. aufladen zu können. Mein Highlight aber war das große, wahnsinnig gemütliche und bequeme Bett - ich habe selten in einem Hotel so gut geschlafen! Im Zimmerpreis enthalten ist ein (für amerikanische Verhältnisse) großartiges Frühstück. Von 6 - 10 Uhr findet man auf einem Buffet Bagels & Toast inkl. verschiedener Aufstriche, Muffins, Rührei, Bacon, Omelettes, Obstsalat, frisches Obst, CornFlakes, Müsli, Säfte und 2 Waffeleisen, um sich selber Waffeln zu machen.

Als besonders positiv empfand ich die Freundlichkeit und Hilfsbereitschaft sämtlicher Mitarbeiter. Angefangen bei den Mitarbeitern der Rezeption beim ein- und auschecken, über die Reinigungskräfte  bis hin zum Concierge und den Technikern. Herausragend aber waren die MitarbeiterInnen beim Frühstück. Neben dem ständigen Auffüllen der Speisen und dem Wegräumen des Mülls der Gäste, hatten sie immer ein freundliches Wort und waren gut drauf.

Nur, um auch etwas Negatives zu sagen: Die ca. 30 Stockwerke des Hotels werden von 2 Aufzügen bedient. Das ist eigentlich auch völlig ausreichend, allerdings kann es zu bestimmten Zeiten mal zu Wartezeiten kommen (letzte halbe Stunde des Frühstücks, An- und Abreise von größeren Gruppen). Direkt gegenüber des Hotels befindet sich eine große Baustelle, deren Lärm bei geöffnetem Fenster natürlich zu hören ist. Allerdings wird in NY immer viel gebaut, das kann man nicht dem Hotel anlasten.

Fazit: Das Hampton Inn Manhattan - Times Square South ist ein perfektes Stadthotel, um sich erholt und ausgeruht am nächsten Tag wieder in die aufregende Großstadt stürzen zu können!

title: Excelente estadía!
text: Buena ubicación, cama cómoda, limpio y moderno. A tener en consideración, no tiene mucho espacio para guardar la ropa. Desayuno bien y el personal super atento y cordial. La espera para el ascensor puede llegar a hacerse un poco larga en horarios pico. Lo recomiendo totalmente!

title: Wheelchair accessible room
text: We stayed at the Hampton in February.  We were given room 501.  We first noticed how little room there was to get around.  The bathroom had enough room to get around and I was able to transfer to the shower seat.  The water was hot which was a welcome from the cold days seeing the sights.  The breakfast  choice was limited but a good start to the day.  The hotel is in a great position just a short walk to the centre of Times Square.  The front desk staff were welcoming and offered good advice on getting around.  Hot drinks are available all day long and there were cookies in the reception in the afternoon.  There were previous comments about the lifts which was a concern but we didn't have problem. There were comments about the breakfast room being too small but we always managed to get a table without waiting.  If you want a good location and an accessible toom I would recommend this hotel.

title: Nice Place to Stay in NYC
text: Hampton Inn, Times Square met all our expectations.  Price was reasonable, the staff was tremendous, the accommodations were perfect and the hotel is in a great location - quiet.  We truly appreciated the attitude of hospitality by the entire staff.  Well done team!

title: Sejour famille vac d hiver 2019
text:
Un rapport qualité prix exceptionnel. Nous y avons séjourné une semaine a 4. 
Propreté irreprochable, petit dejeuner au top mais surtout un personnel d une grande aimabilite et ayant un sens du service fortement développé. 
Un emplacement central et a la fois calme. 
Rien a redire!!!!

title: Sightseening mit Entspannung
text:
Super Lage, Leckeres abwechslungsreiches Frühstück, sehr sauber, sehr freundliches kompetentes Personal. 

Leider Plastilbesteck und Teller, Heizung viel kurzzeitig wegen schwacher Batterie des Thermostaten aus. Wurde nach ansprache aber in 5 Minuten behoben. Wenn dort eine regelmäßige Wartung der Beterien stattfindet also auch kein Problem.

title: Good value, close to theater
text: I always stay here. It’s very convenient and reasonably priced.  Rooms are small, but I don’t go to NYC to sit in my room. Breakfast room is always crowded when tours come through, but there is always a good selection.

title: Another good stay
text: 3rd time staying here and another lovely stay. The staff from front of house to breakfast staff are very friendly and welcoming. Even though some people have said about the elevators being slow at peak times and 1 elevator not working for a short period of time on one of the days I stayed I never had any problems with them. Tea and coffee 24 hrs a day just past reception is great, breakfast is good, room is good, clean, the bed is lovely and comfortable, and added bonus of having fridge in there also. No complaints here. Will keep continuing to book this hotel when I visit New York.

title: Excellent 3 night stay
text:
I stayed here for three night in early March 2019. The staff were professional and very helpful, always cheerful and keen to help and offer advice.
The hotel is ideally positioned close to Times Square and a three minute walk from 42nd Street Port Authority Bus Terminal/Subway station, everything is close at hand. 
My room was on the 31st floor and of good size (I had been told all hotel rooms were small in NYC so maybe I just got lucky). All facilities were good and I will definitely stay here again when I return to New York.
Thank you all.

title: Normales Hotel in NYC
text: Soweit alles gepasst, liegt zentral und man kann hier von Hotel vieles aus unternehmen. Lediglich das vor der Türe immer Stau ist durch Baustellen nervt da somit Uber und so weiter lange brauchen bis sie da sind, aber dies ist nur temporär.

title: Great find!
text: Great spot within walking distance to the Theater District, Times Square, Penn Station, Madison Square Garden among many others. Reasonable price and great breakfast. Rooms are small but not uncommon in the area. They even held our luggage since they could not accommodate an early check-in. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

title: A little gem in the big Apple!
text:
Myself and my new husband stayed in this hotel in the last week of February and we have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to other guests.
The location is great, a block from the port authority bus terminal so very central to Times Square and less than a 5 minute walk to Macy’s. Despite its central location, it was very quiet and we got a peaceful night’s sleep. 
The room was small but that’s to be expected in any central nyc hotel. The bed was comfortable, the a/c worked perfectly, good sized tv with all the satellite channels, and a plentiful supply of toiletries and towels. 
One of best things by far about this hotel in my opinion is the breakfast. They provide a great and varied range of hot and cold food, from bacon to waffles and cereals to fresh muffins and donuts. It was a busy spot in the mornings but the staff was constantly topping up the food to ensure there was enough for all. It really set us up for our day of exploring. Another massive bonus was the complimentary tea and coffee available in the lobby throughout the whole day, which was most welcome after a long day sightseeing in freezing cold temperatures.

Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and hope to see you again some day soon!

title: Bien mais ....
text: Rien à redire sur les prestations mais au moment de quitter l’hôtel, on nous a demandé une caution de 130 dollars qui n'a jamais été remboursée. J'ai fait de multiples relances depuis la France. Nous avions laissé la chambre sans aucunes dégradations et je ne comprends toujours pas pourquoi cette caution n'est pas remboursée ! ce fait terni fortement l'appréciation que je porte à cet hôtel. Nous y avons séjourné 1 semaine à 4 octobre 2018 et en mars 2019 , le différent n’est toujours pas résolu !!!!

title: Good accommodations
text: Easy access to all subway lines and walking distance to many of the places we wanted to go in Manhattan area. The staff at all hours was very friendly and helpful. Good vibe all the way around. Would stay again.

title: Cerca de Times Square
text:
El hotel es muy bueno y la cercanía a Times Sq. es ideal
Es la segunda vez que estuve y me parece que mejoraron la velocidad del ascensor ya que se amontonaba mucha gente. 
La cordialidad de las señoras que manejan el desayuno es excelente (hablan español) y el desayuno es muy bueno.
No la pasé bien en el check in con un señor a quien antes de ponerlo a atender clientes deberían mandarlo a una escuela para tratar con gente.

title: Perfect Stay
text:
We chose this hotel for our first trip to NYC due to its location and mostly very good reviews. The hotel did not disappoint. All the staff were friendly and professional. The room on the 30th floor was small, though clean and comfortable with a large bed. The bathroom had a large shower with everything you might need. Breakfast is included in this hotel. There is a good selection of hot fresh food and enough for the largest appetite. It does get very busy in the dining area at times.
The location of this hotel is ideal for a first time visit with a subway close by to access the attractions and some local bars and restaurants within walking distance. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would certainly recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Very Attentive Customer Service
text: I really liked the way the staff kept in touch with me to make sure all was well throughout my stay. Crystal is the staff member who really made my Birthday Getaway the most memorable! Thanks Crystal!

title: Great people make it a great experience
text: Busy week and elevator issues for 2 days, but staff was over the top considerate, trying to make everything good and just plain great. From the Breakfast room staff and front desk to maintenance, all very positive and professional!

title: Excelencia en todo
text:
Excelente servicio, excelente desayuno, excelente limpieza, céntrico: a pasos del Port Authority y Times Square, 
A pasos de Macys,, Empire State Building y el Madison Square Garden. Silencioso.
Lo recomiendo.

title: Super convenient
text: Nice hotel with a great room and comfy beds. Super close to the theater district and made walking to our show super easy. Nice staff and free breakfast in the morning. I would come back and stay here in a New York minute :-) loved our stay!

title: Excellent value
text: For NY, the city where a hotel breakfast is $22.00, this is a great deal. The rooms are modern, clean, nice. Maybe a bit on the smaller side but not by NY standards. A lot of amenities are packed into the room. Breakfast buffet is very good and the help attentive. Nice people at the desk. Grab an apple and cup of coffee on the way out.

title: Imperdible
text: la calidad de la atención personalizada, la ubicación estratégica para disfrutar sin vehículo, el desayuno y bar (todo el día) y la buena predisposición general hacen de este hotel una opción inmejorable en Nueva York

title: Very good
text:
Room was a bit small but other then that it was excellent.
Breakfast is OK but a bit poor. 
Location is great and the service was very good.
Highly recommended, especially when I consider the good money value.

title: No room to swing a cat!
text:
I’m here at the moment. My 6th trip to New York and by far the worse hotel I’ve stayed in. Arrived yesterday, was 4pm by the time we got to the hotel and our room still wasn’t ready, to be fair I would rather they didn’t have a room for us! 
We have a room with 2 beds, there are 3 of us. There is nowhere to store your clothes - fine we can live out of the suitcase, great when there’s somewhere to actually put them! Currently they live by the door when we are in the room - god forbid we need to get out in an emergency! As soon as we wake we move them onto the bed so we can try and get ready. Nowhere to hang coats - basically no storage at all! 
I spoke to reception and they advised that all the rooms are the same size except floor 9 which has slightly larger rooms. They said they would hold a room on there for us to come back to tonight to move - got back and they had put someone else in there! 
I know NYC rooms are notoriously small but this is ridiculous 
Reception looks tired. The breakfast room and food are ok but it’s a free for all. 
I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and if I hadn’t already paid I would be looking for somewhere else

title: Ok for 2 nights stay
text: Over all a Good inn to stay at in central New York With free breakfast and wi-fi . The beds were comfortable and no noise from the street. Nothing special just somewhere central to sleep, shower, and have a free coffee.

title: Amazing location!!
text:
Literally a 5 minute walk from Times Square.   Surrounded by restaurants. Sits in the heart of Manhattan with subway access , tour bus stops, and easy access to taxis within one block!
The staff is AWESOME!!!!
Nice breakfast selections each morning- and if you don’t like it, you have twoStarbucks and a couple other well known coffee shops within a 1-minute walk!!

title: Boa localização e qualidade/preço
text: Hotel bem localizado, perto de Times Square, o que permite conhecer toda a cidade a pé. O pequeno-almoço é bom e com variedade suficiente, as comidas quentes mudam todos os dias e tem uma máquina de waffles genial. Os quartos são confortáveis e têm o suficiente, incluindo frigorífico, tomadas usb nos candeeiros e acesso wi-fi. Existe uma estação de café/chá e chocolate quente disponível a toda a hora na receção. A única parte menos boa é apenas existirem dois elevadores de acesso aos quartos, pelo que por vezes pode demorar a conseguir apanhar um. Além disso, o staff de limpeza dos quartos utiliza os mesmos elevadores, pelo que é comum irem cheios de aspiradores e baldes/produtos de limpeza misturados com malas de clientes, o que diminui muito o espaço dos mesmos.

title: Nice location
text:
1 block from Port Authority Bus Terminal. Very close to Broadway. 10-15mins to Madison Sq.

Two lifts, 32 floors, so it can be quite a wait.
Free beverages,  brew coffee, teas, hot choc near the lobby. Sitting area for you to hang around.

Room size is good. Walkway to room was small. 
Good wifi. 
Small coffee maker in the room.
Shower is ok, but the sink tap took a while to get warm.

Checkin staff can be improve to be more attentive to Customer who are checking in

Waffles available for breakfast.

title: Perfect location
text: Great location. Rooms if a bit small are spotless and very well presented. Free left luggage facility is brilliant. Only criticism is the small breakfast area do the amount of rooms and guests sometimes had to wait for a seat

title: Perfect hotel
text: Amazing hotel great friendly staff perfect location to time square and you get breakfast to start your day off fantastic all round whilst we were there highly recommend very helpful when we asked for directions

title: Great hotel!
text: Great staff. Great room, large comfy bed. Very good breakfast with lovely waffles, bagels, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, omelettes, sausage patties to die for! Hope to come back one day! Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend!

title: Great location for decent value but small and seemingly overcrowded
text:
The hotel was always clean and the service was fantastic from all staff!

It was in an ideal location for transport links and for walking to major sights such as Times Square and Empire State Building.

The main downsides to the hotel were small room sizes (2 queen beds) and the wait for the elevators. Queues are very long for the elevators especially at breakfast times and waits can be up to 30 minutes which is quite ridiculous.

The shower door in our bathroom was coming off the hinges as well but overall the room was comfortable and clean.

Would consider this hotel in the future but would try alternatives for maybe a slightly higher price.

title: Excellent value for money
text:
Stayed for 4 nights. Excellent location, short walk from Penn Station (took the LIRR to there from JFK).Short walk to Times Square.
Staff were really friendly and helpful. 
Complimentary breakfast was ample, my daughter loved making her own waffles. It does get busy during peak times but we were up and out early so it didn’t bother us. 
Loved being able to help yourself to coffee at any time of day down in the lobby as well as the hot cookies which were served at reception daily. Special thanks to Jim who went in search of the cookies which hadn’t quite made it out to front desk when my daughter went down looking for them and he kindly supplied her with 3. 
Rooms are small as per the norm in New York but they are clean and the staff were brilliant. Always a friendly welcome back or a have a nice day when you were leaving. Would definitely return.

title: Great Stay at the Hampton Inn!
text: The front desk staff were extra-friendly and helpful. The hotel room was small (expected in NYC) but comfortable. I had no isues with the room size; the armoire and drawers held all of my belongings. The breakfast in the mornings was great; lots of food available, plenty of options, and I never had an issue with finding a place to sit. I wish the 'concierge' would have been a bit more knowledgeable. Both times I had questions about places to eat, the young girls had no idea what was around and had to use Google, which I could have done myself. The location was great, smack dab in Hell's Kitchen and bordering the Theatre district. I would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent hotel. Great location to Times Square and all the fun NYC things
text: This hotel was great! It’s conventiently located around Times Square and all thing fun in NYC. The checkin process was efficient and the staff was very friendly. The breakfast was good, and having something hot to drink during the cold NYC days was amazing!

title: 가성비 좋은 호텔
text:
1 FULL W/FRIDGE NONSMOKING 예약했으며 
가격 대비 객실도 만족스러웠고 (전자렌지는 없음)
아침에 호텔 도착했는데 너무 이른 시간이라 체크인 할 수 없어 짐만 맡겼는데
직원분이 조식 무료니까 밥 부터 먹으라고 안내해 주셨다.
또한 PABT과 가까워서 공항버스 타기에는 딱 좋았다.

title: Hotel bien placé simple et correct
text:
Les chambres sont extrêmement restreintes. Impossible d'ouvrir 2 valises en mêmes temps.
La chambre est confortable mais circulation compliquée et pas beaucoup d'espace pour y circuler.
Pour le petit déjeuner c'est assez varié et tout le monde y trouve son compte.

title: Very decent hotel.
text: Easy and pleasant check in. My son and I allocated decent twin room on 17th floor with two good sized, brilliantly comfortable beds. Breakfast included in the price, but to be honest not the most inventive selection on offer, although it filled a gap. Hotel is located in a fairly quiet side street only 7 minutes walk from the brilliant madness of Times Square or Madison Square Garden. By the way, we found no problems with both elevators at any time during our 3 night stay.

title: Kay Kay the best !
text:
The hotel is located in a great location . 

While during my stay the elevator broke down leaving only 1 lift working to serve staff and guest I was staying on the 28th floor , I waited in he lobby for over 6 mins and did not see the lift come down so I decided to walk up the stairs and took the stairs back down . When I came back to the lobby I saw the same people there waiting . 

All of my question I had about the area or every out of the area Kay Kay could answer , she was so helpful and always willing to help you out . 

My check out process was not the best the agent on and the duty manager that day where not helpful and they were very rude . 

It's because of the service I got from  Kay Kay I will give this hotel another chance .

title: Noisiest room in the hotel
text:
Stayed in room 1706, checked in good. Although I don’t agree with having to have $60 per day taken out of my account and only refunded 7 days after checkout. Got up to our room after a struggle at lift (area is far too small and too many congregate here) and settled down ok. Room was clean and functional. At night we heard an horrendous noise and found out it was the lift. This continued each night all night. On check out we were asked about our stay and explained it was very noisy. And the man replied well it is New York what was you expecting? He didn’t understand that internal noise was. Our issue and even after repeating to him he didn’t care. He dismissed it. 
Breakfast is included. But as the room is so small you can’t even get a seat. Tht is of course if there’s anything left. As they don’t replenish quick enough

title: Fantástico
text: Localização - fantástica (39st com a 8Av.)Staff - fantastico General Manager - fantástico Pequeno almoço - muito bom (cortesia)Internet - fantástica (mesmo no piso 29)Tem bolachas de chocolate todas as tardes... quentinhasCafé, chá , leite com chocolate 24h...Tem sala de exercíciosVale muito a pena. Preço vs qualidade é muito bom.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
This hotel's staff is by far the friendliest I have experienced! They were terrific! 

I enjoyed the free continental breakfast each morning. It was a great way to start the day!

The location of this hotel is perfect. I really enjoyed my visit to the Big Apple!

title: Trip of a lifetime
text: The employees at this Hampton Inn went above and beyond their necessary task to make sure everything was taken care of not only for me but other guests as well Tim was the nicest person from early morning greetings to late night good night wishes. The ladies in the breakfast area went out of their way to make sure everyone's waffles were made perfectly as well as cooking more sausage just before closing time to satisfy guests request. I am looking forward to returning to New York and staying at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square South. I can't forget to mention the employees surprised me with a birthday balloon and New York teddy bear that I will cherish the rest of my life.

title: Great stay , good price , friendly staff
text: Great stay , good price , friendly staff . Hilton Honors member welcomes with a snack which was good. Breakfast was good, kids loved the waffles . Rooms small but in this location i assume most are. 10 minutes walk to times square . Good tv , clean bathroom , Coffee and Hot Chocolate etc available all day. Minor issue was my flight was cancelled and i rang reception to be given an offer $100 more than other Hamptons in the area.i was a bit disappointed to have to move hotel after spending 4 nights there.

title: Good location and really friendly staff
text: Easy to reach either by cab or train/bus. Welcomed really warmly by two reception staff,David was super friendly and acknowledged us on a daily basis during our stay. We were on the 19th floor,our room was clean,the bed large and really comfortable. We always appreciate a fridge in the room,heating was easily regulated. Complimentary hot drinks are available downstairs and breakfast is part of your room rate which is hot and cold again the staff were really friendly. This is our first stay at a Hampton and definitely won’t be our last. Definitely recommend.

title: Fabulous hotel.
text: Good location, friendly staff, really huge comfy bed. Exactly what we were looking for.  Ask for a high floor as it was so quiet, not what you would expect in New York. Yes the lifts can be a bit of a wait but hey, we are on holiday so not an issue. Loved the cookies, so yummy and so nice when coming in from the cold to take a hot chocolate up to the room. Husband also popped down every morning for coffee, such a treat. Breakfast very much appreciated too.

title: Hotel was acceptable and a reasonable price,  but the precheckin service was poor.
text: Shortly before departure my wife broke a bone. We needed to cancel the reservation three days before arrival.  We called and asked if we could have an additional 12 hours to decide so that my wife could see a doctor first.  The request was refused.  We cancled the first night of the stay keeping the other three nights.  We stayed in another hotel for one night.  We felt that they could have extended the cancellation time for 12 hours in light of the broken bone.  My wife had surgery and we were able to enjoy the trip with the inconvenience of having to book another hotel.  Otherwise once we got at the hotel, the stay was pleasant and reasonable for the price.   Breakfast was ok, but crowded.  Staff were friendly.

title: Great Stay
text:
Hotel was really nice and staff were very welcoming. All staff acknowledge us and took time to speak which was nice. Check-in was quick and the room was big enough for the 2 of us. We had a fridge in the room too. I think we had a accessible room as the bathroom was a wet room and the shower kept flooding the bathroom. There was a quite a few towels we could use. The breakfast area was cold some mornings. Limited selection of food, but nice. It did change slightly daily. Could have done with having baked beans. They have tea/coffee/hot chocolate all day, but no milk only cream. Cookies available at some point during the day but we were never around to try them unfortunately.

We used the business room to check-in for our return flight. Check out was very easy and quick. They stow luggage too which is good.

We used the subway to get to this hotel from JFK. We got the air train and then used the blue A,C,E line to 42st street and walked to the hotel. It took about 5-10mins

title: Hotel is JUST OK
text:
I booked the Hampton Inn because I have stayed at plenty Hamptons with no issues. Plus, they offer breakfast and that's hard to find hotels that offer breakfast these days. When we first arrived, we were unable to get into our room because it wasn't ready. We left our luggage and explored the city. It is just about 10 minutes walking from Times Square which was nice. After 5 pm, we came back and our room was ready. The room is small which is expected in New York. We took a nap and went back out. Returned to the hotel about 10 pm. The shower head was broke. Water was spraying everywhere. It took 3 phone calls and over 2 hours for someone to come and fix it. It's late, we were rained on and had traveled that day so just wanted a hot shower. That was annoying. Then the shower itself is super small. There was a huge handicap bar that you can hold onto in the middle of the shower on the wall so you couldn't move around good. The water pressure was almost non-existent. 

The next day, we went to breakfast and the room was just so small. They need a bigger area for people to enjoy their meals.  We went out for the day, came back and asked concierge for some decent pizza places to order from. She was useless. A concierge should have a good idea of some decent take out. She had no clue. She just looked on her computer and did what I could have done, I would have done it better. So we ended up going out. Got back to the room and NO toilet paper! Sooooo, an hour later, we had toilet paper. Shouldn't housekeeping have checked that?

Overall, the experience was fine. I was irritated because simple things like a shower working and having toilet paper shouldn't be an issue when staying at a hotel. Those are the main necessities.

The location was good. The front desk help was good. Concierge is worthless. If you want a cab, walk down to the main streets because you won't get one in front of the hotel and there is no one there to help get one for you. Overall, it's decent for a place to sleep. The bed was comfy.

title: Good value and very comfortable
text: Would have rated this hotel as excellent if it were refurbished to a more modern standard.However you certainly get value for money.Check in/out experience was seamless.We found no problems with the wait time for lifts like some other reviews stated.The rooms are quite large, very comfortable and very clean.We had no problems at all with the complimentary internet speed.Breakfast was varied and certainly good enough to set you up for the day. Breakfast staff were particularly great, very friendly and helpful.Shower was lovely, hot and powerful.Overall I have no complaints, as I said, the hotel could do with refurbishment throughout. But if you need a well located comfortable base in NYC I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo albergo per una settimana a dicembre 2018 e subito è stato promosso per la posizione ( subito dietro a Time Square) e per la gentilezza del personale. Ampie camere, pulite e con ogni servizio. Buona colazione servita fino alle 11 dove era possibile quasi fare pranzo. Molto consigliato!

title: Hôtel simple mais correct
text: Hôtel simple, chambre bien équipée,manquant certes d un peu d espace de rangement pour les vêtements et pour les valises. Nous avons trouvé le personnel très sympa et à l écoute, ménage quotidiennement impeccable, petit déjeuner à volonté et copieux, proximité du métro, de la gare routière, times square, Broadway..... Nous avons passé un séjour bien agréable. !

title: Luna di miele
text:
Scrivo questa recensione mentre sono ancora ospite di questo albergo.. in una parola: FANTASTICO. Ottima posizione, camere pulite, abbastanza spazione, colazione inclusa anche fin troppo abbondante: frutta,cereali, muffin, bagel, uova, salsiccie, waffel, caffe the succhi.. e molto altro! No resort fee( risparmio enorme).
Fiore all'occhiello: il personale! Tutti gentilissimi e attenti..ci hanno fornito anche schiuma da barba e lamette che avevamo dimenticato a casa e gli ombrelli x la pioggia, superlativi!
Un ringraziamento particolare a YVETTE..essere a New York é gia fantastico di per se ma avere una persona come lei che al mattino ti accoglie con un sorriso coinvolgente e una cura amorevole di una mamma ti fa sentire veramente a casa.
Grazie di tutto Yvette, QUE DIOS TE BENDIGA!

title: Great Staff and comfortable rooms!
text: I took a group of 12  College students with me to NYC- and the Hampton was phenomenal in meeting everyone's needs. The staff at the front desk was fabulous. Also enjoyed the efficiency and friendliness of the breakfast staff.

title: Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South
text: Centrally located - short walk to MTA or any entertainment venues.  Lots of places to eat. Its a very nice walk on 8th to Central Park, and a little more to Lincoln Center.  The nearest MTA is 42th/PABS - catch the A or E line and you will be at the Airtrain. Cant get any simpler coming and going from JFK.

title: Great location and very helpful staff
text: I did a lot of research on this hotel before staying here and read so much about the "bad elevators". It was barely a problem at all. Sure, there were only 2 elevators but it's not really a big hotel. The longest we ever waited was a few minutes, maybe 5 at the most and that didn't occur often. Sometimes we waited only seconds. Don't let this feature turn you off staying at this hotel. All of the staff were very friendly and accommodating. When we first checked in I could smell vomit on the carpet in our room near the aircon so the smell was being blown around the room. I mentioned it the next morning and that night we were moved into a new room and given a Macy's gift voucher for the trouble. We had free use of the laundry facilities in the hotel next door which was extremely handy. The rooms were a bit cramped but that's common in New York apparently and we got a good price as we booked 10 months in advance. The price of our room 1-2 months was almost double what we paid. The location was great, just a five minute walk to 42nd St subway and to Times Square. The staff would make fresh cookies each evening to grab on the way back through the lobby and they'd always say hello. The only disappointing thing I would say was the breakfast but I found this at a lot of the hotels we stayed at on our trip around America. It may have just been the budget we were sticking to also. There wasn't a lot of variety in the breakfast and it wasn't all that healthy. Maybe it's just the difference in cuisine. At least it was something to fill our bellies with before setting out each day. Depending on the time you went to breakfast, it could be busy but we never had nowhere to sit. There was 24 hr free coffee/tea/hot chocolate which was good at night. The rooms were clean too. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The breakfast is the only reason I've given it 4/5. There was a bit of construction noise too that occurred at weird hours. The floor you stay on doesn't really matter as I think you could hear traffic and other noise so matter what floor you stay on.

title: Love The Consistency
text: I generally stay at Hamptons since I am a Hilton Club member, and it's nice to expect and always get a well maintained room, great customer service and good breakfast. New York is the annoying limited space thing going on and this hotel's lobby and rooms are a result of that, but it still had the wonderful attributes of larger Hampton's in Texas!😁

title: Städteteip NYC
text: Lage des Hotels Top. 5 min bis zur Metro (fast alle Linien) und 10 min. Bis Times Square. Andere Attraktionen (Empire State Building) ebenfalls gut zu Fuß zu erreichen. Hotel war sauber, Mitarbeiter freundlich und zuvorkommend. Preis-Leistung super.Würde das Hotel wieder buchen.

title: Holiday.
text: The hotel is located a short walk from Time Square. The majority of places we visited were all within walking distance. The staff are very friendly and are happy to help if required.  Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Location!
text: Hotel is close to Penn Station, Subway on 35th or Times Square. A nice selection of eating establishments on the street hotel is located on, really adorable Irish pub, unusual, Included breakfast was a nice extra.

title: Hôtel basique
text: Hôtel bien situé et propre, chambre petite mais suffisante pour dormir. Déjeuner pas mal, mais peu varié. Personnel très gentil ! Chauffage de la chambre très bruyant, quelques minutes d’attente pour l’ascenceur ...

title: Family Holiday in Manhatten
text: Nice hotel with good service and excellent location. We had a family room for 4 people so was very tight.  Breakfast was very busy and challenging to get a table.  There are 32 floors with 5 rooms per floor and only two lifts so there is a long wait for the lift in the morning - up to 15 minutes.

title: Hotel muito bom
text: Adoramos o hotel, super bem localizado, funcionários super atenciosos, os quartos não são muito grandes, mas muito limpo e tudo funcionado perfeitamente. O hotel tem café da manhã muito bom e não cobram taxa de resort .

title: Séjour très agréable
text: Très bon emplacement à proximité de Times Square. Personnel très réactif et agréable. Chambre simple mais efficace. Petit déjeuner varié et très complet. Je recommande vivement cet hôtel. Nous super pour un séjour en famille avec un bébé.

title: Great Hotel and location
text:
Really nice homely hotel 5 mins from
Times Square . Rooms a bit small , however in NYC it’s really only a bed for the night you need . 
Kids loved the 24hour hot chocolate that was free of charge . 
Breakfast included was great , it meant we could hit the ground running with the attractions we had booked and didn’t have to look around for breakfast venue . 
Reception staff were really friendly . 
Bathroom was a bit dated but what it lacks in modern decor it makes up for in location and the free breakfast .

title: All you need!
text: Excelente localização! Apenas duas quadras da estação de metrô e a 5 quadras da Times Square, este hotel -  Hampton In Manhattan - Times Square South - têm tudo o que você precisa! Hotel limpo, novo, e com ótimo atendimento da staff! Quartos pequenos, mas com camas confortáveis e chuveiro bom!Ponto extremamente positivo, em minha opinião, e que fez um diferencial quando fui reservar esse hotel foi a oferta do café da manhã inclusa na diária do hotel, além de disponibilidade de café, chocolate quente e chás a vontade no lobby do hotel! Parece besteira, mas ter um café a sua disposição todos os dias com frutas (normalmente maçã e banana), iogurtes (light e normal), variedade de pães, bagels e muffins, geleia, manteiga, pasta de amendoim, waffles, syrup, chantilly, ovos mexidos ou omelete, batata e linguiça, e sucos e água e geral, é um economia de tempo e dinheiro! Como se não bastasse, final do dia você diariamente é recebido de volta no hotel com cookies fresquinhos e deliciosos para adoçar a sua chegada! Academia pequena, mas com duas esteiras, um elíptico, banco de apoio para musculação e alteres com pesos variados! Da para fazer exercícios todos os dias! Tive duas questões para serem resolvidas no hotel e eles prontamente me atenderam (ralo no chuveiro) e um hóspede que fez barulho de madrugada no ano novo. Demais dias, sem queixas! Apenas elogios! Enviei itens pelo correio e eles seguramente guardaram minhas encomendas! Recomendo e certamente voltaria a me hospedar aqui! Parabéns Hampton Inn Manhattan- Times Square South! Faço questão de mencionar que se trata desse hotel em específico, pois em NYC existem outros Hotéis da mesma rede, inclusive com o nome Hampton!

title: hotel bien situé
text: Bonne situation pour visiter Manhattan. Personnel très disponible et aimable. Petit dejeuner copieux. Cafe à volonte la journee. Lit extra large. Propreté impeccable..Chauffage et ascenseur bruyant .

title: Good price for location
text:
Good location within easy walking distance to Tines Square, Empire State Building, the metro and most of the main tourist attractions in the city. Even Central Park was only a 30 - 40 minute walk away. 

The rooms were comfy but on the small side, not an issue for us as we spend no time in our room , it’s only to sleep!

Breakfast is included  and there is coffee and hot chocolate in the foyer all day which is awesome!

title: Excellent costumer service.
text: All the staff has excellent costumer service, so clean and good location, close to Subway, Time Square, Broadway Street and Fifth Avenue.  You can go walking everywhere, restaurants and bar are so close too.

title: New Year’s Eve trip
text: New Year’s Eve trip. This hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely accommodating and very friendly. The location was great. The price was a little high however we did stay there over the New Year’s eve holiday season. My only complaint would be the quality of the breakfast. But that certainly want to hinder me from staying here again.

title: Good
text: I was being cook all the night, because the air condition doesn’t looks like work the time. I called the reciption, they find it next day. But still a little bit cook for me. Because the temperature can not justify. But people working at front desk is good. So l think this is good recommendation. Recommended.

title: Great location/great hospitality
text: You don't expect in NYC to get friendly, courteous service, but at this hotel it is their goal to provide that, and they certainly do.   Neat and clean, easy access to the theatre district, a helpful staff that gives you a smile all the time, what more could you ask for.

title: Great spot!
text: Our third stay at this hotel. Great location and friendly staff. Rooms are clean and the breakfast is good. Can easily walk to Times Square, theater district, Macy’s, 5th Avenue shops, etc. Highly recommend!

title: Great Stay
text: Great staff, location and clean hotel. We were very pleased with our stay. Everyone in the family enjoyed it. Great breakfast. We love the Hilton brand. Both of our rooms were very nice. Slept well. When you come to NYC bring your walking shoes.

title: Christmas
text: Just stayed here in December.  Nice hotel and very close to everything without being kept awake by all the outside noise.  Nice free breakfast if you want every morning and also had free cookies throughout the day.

title: Excellent staff.
text: I had a great experience with the friendly staff and the cleanliness of the room.  I would go back to this hotel.   There was a varied selection of breakfast and the eggs were delicious.   Again, a wonderful experience.

title: I can't believe they let people stay in a hotel where they've found Legionnaire's disease
text: Two people who had stayed in the hotel in the last year had come down with Legionnaire's disease.  The health department investigated and found traces of the bacteria in the water in 6 of the rooms, so warnings were placed in rooms that if you have certain conditions, don't take a shower, etc...  Why didn't they shut the place down until they were 100% in the clear?

title: Gutes Hotel für einen Stadtbesuch
text:
Die Lage des Hotel liegt perfekt. In wenigen Minuten Laufdistanz erreicht man sowohl den Times Square als auch die Penn Station. Sämtliche New YorkerMetros sind somit einfach nutzbar. 
Es befinden sich viele Restaurants und Pubs in der Nähe des Hotels,die Möglichkeiten auch ein günstiges Essen und ein günstiges Bier zu bekommen sind in den Pubs gegeben. 

Zum Hotel selbst: Das Hotel ist okay. Die Zimmer waren sauber und ordentlich. Allerdings auch recht eng und mit wenig Möglichkeiten den Koffer auf dem Boden zu öffnen. Wir hatten ein Zimmer im 29. Stockwerk. Schöner Ausblick auf die Stadt(wegen Baulücke vor Hotel). Ich fand es relativ ruhig für New York und hätte nie das Problem einer Ruhestörung. 
Das wirklich negative an dem Hotel ist der Aufzug. Es gibt zwei davon. Allerdings,wenn man am Morgen zwischen 8-10, gemütlich zum Frühstück möchte oder einfach runter in die Lobby fahren will dauert es einfach eine Ewigkeit. Da zu dieser Zeit jeder diesen Aufzug nutzen will (auch der Room Service) ist er einfach komplett überlastet. Wir hatten Wartezeiten bis zu 30 Minuten. Das ist auf die Dauer schon echt nervig. 

Das Frühstück:
War ganz nett. Typisch für Amerika wird alles in Plastik angeboten. Teller, Besteck, Becher, Marmelade etc. Das Angebot war überschaubar. Es gab Toast, Bagels, Rührei, Speck und Müsli. Dazu diverse Säfte, Kaffee und Tee. Nennen wir es mal Grundausstattung. Da hätte ich mit mehr erwartet. Allerdings gab es dafür den ganzen Tag über eine kostenlose Kaffee und Tee Station an der man sich nach Lust und Laune bedienen konnte. 

Das Hotel bekommt die vier Sterne von mir weil, es sauber war und die Lage einfach Top ist. Das Personal ist sehr nett und hilfsbereit und man wurde bei Fragen und Problemen super unterstützt. Bei Regen könnte man sich Regenschirme mitnehmen(kostenlos) und die Porter haben einem klasse Tipps für die Stadt gegeben.

title: Family Half Term Visit
text: We visited this hotel as 2 adults and 2 daughters aged 17 and 12 at the time of visit. I'd read mainly good reviews with the odd negative review. Yes, the rooms are a tad on the smaller side but if you're from the UK or Europe they are equivalent to a London, Paris or Rome hotel on a similar budget. I personally thought the rooms were very good. If you're in New York staying here then the room is a base. It's a really good base. The lifts can take a few minutes but just have some patience. I emailed prior with a couple of minor concerns and got prompt and very reassuring replies. We arrived at midnight local time and the staff are brilliant. The reception was busy but we felt like we were the only guests. I got up at 5am the next morning, got hot coffee from reception and wandered into Times Square at 530 on a Sunday Morning. Safer than walking in Central London at a similar time.  If you complain  about breakfast at this hotel then you aren't on the right budget. The food is fresh, loads of it, and the staff are really friendly. You may have to wait a few minutes for a table but so what. It's New York and won't take long. My wife emailed  ahead saying out visit was for my 50th. I want to say a belated thank you to all the team at Hampton Inn for your fantastic gift it meant a great deal. I'd you want a good hotel, friendly staff, great food, Times Square about 7 minutes walk, subway 4 minutes and have a budget then this hotel fits the bill.  My only criticism is the lovely biscuits available at reception 😂😂 Great stay and great Hotel. Thank you to all the team.

title: Great Value/Staff
text: Excellent staff, very friendly and accommodating. Coffee and breakfast bars were very well stocked. Bed was nice and comfy, came equipped with a refrigerator which was nice and the bathroom had a nice and relaxing shower.  Would definitely visit again.

title: My Christmas Eve
text: My christmas eve stay with my Family. Was everything... My son got to spend his 16th bday there.It was a great feelin spendin time at the hamptons Inn hotel.... Would like to go again with the Family..  Thank you

title: Great hotel
text: Just returned from family trip and didn’t know what to expect. However this changed on arrival with the very friendly staff. Hotel and room very clean. Breakfast was good as eating out can be expensive. Location tucked away down 39th street was nice to get away from the main avenue. Would definitely recommend. Thank you

title: Stains, old duvets, maintenance issues
text: Stains on sheets, curtains and pills on duvets.  Room seemed old.  Maintenance entered without asking or letting us know they had been there. $60 hold per day for “incidentals.”  Crap shower head.  Found an old note in the room about people having legionaries disease and that they were replacing the shower heads.  While we were out they entered the room with a Do Not Dusturb sign on the door and removed the shower head and left it.  Maintenance using the same elevator as guests with mop buckets full of nasty water.  Elevators are tiny and slow.  Location is good if you like to eat.  Staff was decently friendly but unforgiving concerning the $60 hold per night they put in your card for incidentals aka the snack bar in the lobby.  Heat worked but smelled, tv good, internet good,  beds comfortable,  not a bug in sight.  Check in was easy,  no reservation issues.  Location is great for Hell’s Kitchen and theatre district.

title: Friday Night Stay
text: Stayed Friday night to catch an early morning flight Saturday , close to Penn Sration, took me about 35 min from hotel to AirTrain by LIRR. Convenient location to bars / restaurants, walkable to Times Square /Penn Station and subways

title: Not good
text: Terrible elevators, had to BEG for the cleaning service to come make the room most of the days, they shut down the hot water for THREE days, the room’s phone wasn’t working properly, slow internet and the list goes on and on and on. Avoid at all costs!!!!!!

title: Great location and staff!
text: We were treated incredibly well from check in, to breakfast, to check out. I would definitely stay here again. It felt like the staff went out of there way to be friendly. Loved it! The location is excellent and within 2 blocks of two subway stops. We walked and ride the subway everyday. Also a quick walk to Broadway shows and Times Square.

title: FD does not know what they are talking about
text: When we checked in we request a different room type but FD says its not available. When we looked at HH App they are still selling the room. Plus, breakfast say we can have it untill 11AM but when I arrive like 10:30AM they are not refilling meat anymore.

title: Fabulous, friendly hotel
text:
If you want somewhere away from the bustle of Times Square this is the place to stay.  A very short walk from Times Square which is great for getting a good nights sleep.  

We cannot praise this hotel enough !  Every single member of staff should be proud of themselves.  They are so welcoming and friendly and nothing is too much bother for them.  

We stayed there for 4 nights for our honeymoon.  The staff left a lovely gesture in our room which was much appreciated.  The rooms are very clean and comfortable with a fridge, coffee maker and good sized tv.  The breakfast is great with a good choice whether you want hot or cold and you can fill up with as much as you want before venturing out for the day.

Can’t fault anything apart from sometimes having to wait a while for the lifts !!  The staff are what make this hotel the perfect place to stay in New York.  We loved the free cookies every afternoon on return to the hotel and you can access free tea and coffee anytime in the lobby.  Friday afternoon whilst waiting for our airport transfer was made more bearable by the friendly staff who provided free hot chocolate, brownies and Xmas biscuits.

All in all an excellent place to stay in New York!!  Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so comfortable and welcoming

title: Excellent
text: Always great smiles when you check in and  great breakfast.. Never disappointed me .. Has coffee tea stations along with large rooms with bathtub!  Beautiful clean rooms!! Friendly stuff and great locations!

title: Great Location!
text: Just 2 blocks from 2 subway stops and the Port Authority terminal.  Only 2 elevators so that was kind of a pain when a bus load of people arrived to check in.  Breakfast is included. Be sure to ask for a room with a city view on a high floor.  I was with my sister and the room is a little tight for 2 double beds (which were very comfortable.) Small refrigerator in the room.

title: Worked very well for a quick business trip
text: New York hotels can be tricky but this stay was affordable and convenient.  Room was a bit dated but if you manage your expectations and get a room that serves the purpose while being in the heart of the action then you are all set!  Free appies on Wednesday night in the main floor lounge was a treat and staff were very nice.

title: Awesome Hotel in NYC!
text: The room and staff here were amazing.  Location was great!  Bed was comfy!  Elevator was a little slow but really if that is the worse thing I can say about this hotel...  I will be staying here again.  It was a great recommendation from a friend of mine!

title: A Great 4 Day Stay in NY
text: Stayed 4 day for the Macy's parade . Its 2 block from the parade route. This hotel is very well located in manhattan, we had a double room that was clean, well appointed and very comfortable. I can not say enough good things about the staff they bent over backwards to see that all the guest were happy. The complimentary breakfast was very good, also available 24/7 is coffee, tea and hot chocolate and in the afternoon warm cookies are in the lobby . This is a Great Hotel with a Great Staff it is a DEFINITE Stay Here

title: Great place to stay
text: A friend and I stayed here for 4 nights recently and we had a great stay. While the room was smaller than some other hotels, we found it to be perfectly acceptable by NYC standards. Our double room was clean, comfortable and well-appointed. As mentioned in other reviews, the elevators can be a bit slow first thing in the morning but it was never really an issue. While the space did get busy, breakfast was always decent and hot and the staff did a great job keeping things clean and stocked so it wasn't an issue. All the staff were very friendly and helpful - lots of "hello!" " have a great day!" and "Welcome back!" as we would pass through the lobby or run into a staff member in the hall. We were walking distance to the subway and to most midtown attractions so the location was excellent. I would not hesitate to stay here again on a future visit to New York. Thanks for the great stay!

title: 3 Day stay in Manhattan
text: Very well run hotel, perfect location for a conference at the Javits Centre. Very friendly and helpful staff.Good complimentary breakfast, small but adequate fitness room, guest room was clean, very comfortable bed. Highly recommended.

title: Great Hotel Near Times Square/Broadway Theaters
text: We picked this hotel given the proximity to the theater we saw a play at.  I have never stayed in New York, and had my kiddos with me, so was nervous not knowing what to expect.  But we were very happy with the hotel!  It was relatively quiet, even though we were near the elevator.  It was so conveniently located, within walking distance of Times Square, our theater, and some great restaurants.  We felt safe the entire stay.  And the people there were wonderful - very friendly and welcoming.  The icing on the cake was a hot chocolate and brownie bar after a long day walking in the cold and rain.  The rooms are a bit small, but considering it's New York, and given the price, it was all good.

title: Love this hotel, great location, the best customer service!
text: Staying for 3 nights with my son, left today. Came to see a play in Broadway and we are very glad that we found this hotel. Clean rooms, excellent customer service and the best complimentary breakfast in NYC. Shout out to Camila in the breakfast room who is very kind and was always trying to help everyone! We had no problem with the waiting time for elevators. Was a perfect NY weekend!

title: Handy for most attractions
text: Pleasant staff, very helpful. The rooms were very comfortable and clean good choice of food for breakfast. Walking distance of most attractions and open top bus agents on the corner so it was easy to get around.

title: Fabulous location
text: If you are going sightseeing, this is your hotel, excellent location, extremely clean rooms, and friendly helpful staff.  Breakfast was included and was fabulous, thanks to the wonderful Yvette I can now make a mean waffle, with Amanda also there helping when needed.
