You could come in at any time and make yourself a cup of coffee, which was so welcome after a long day in New York.  The only small thing our room was a tight squeeze for 4 of us, but as this same size would be used for one bed instead of two, then there would have been plenty of room.  Having said that, I’d highly recommend this hotel, maybe just take two rooms next time.

title: Great Service
text: I travel and stay at many hampton inn properties. This one provided me with exceptional service, ALL of their employees were very friendly and provided exceptional attention to my needs. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: NYC base
text: Good breakfast to set you up for the long days sight seeing.... rooms small but as we only slept in them at night as out all day fitted what we needed.... good shower... fridge...safe and TV.... usb charging points etc .  . ... room 205 faced the flat roof and noisy air con / generator which was annoying if you woke in the night bit our other higher floor rooms not an issue ....would use this hotel again

title: Amazing place to stay!
text: Every aspect of my stay was truly amazing.  Henry and the front desk staff welcomed me with open arms, my room was impeccably clean, and Amanda and the breakfast staff took the time to chat and make me feel at home.  I should also mention that the breakfast was delicious!  I stay at many hotels with my work, and this was a breakfast that had something for everyone, and had nutritious and delicious food.

title: Buena opcion
text: El hotel cumple con el estándar de la marca. Lo malo es que el espacio para el desayuno colapsa para la cantidad de huéspedes que hay y que en horas pico los ascensores son insuficientes y hay que esperar un buen rato a que lleguen.

title: Amazing stay!
text: Myself & friend recently stayed here for 4 night & we had a brilliant time. The hotel is in a good location only a few minutes walk to Times Square, bars & restaurants. Our room was on the 32nd floor & had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building. The room itself was lovely, very clean & comfortable. We had 2 double beds which were really comfy. The only downside was there wasn’t enough wardrobe space which wasn’t a problem for the 2 of us but I can imagine if there is 4 people in the room it would be. The breakfast was really good. A selection of hot food, cereals, fruit & a waffle maker. There was also hot drinks available all day. The staff were all very polite & friendly, thank you for making our trip to New York amazing!!

title: Had a great stay.
text: The night shift clerk was fabulous! Very attentive and great at her job. The only thing I can complain about is the fact that Hilton honors didn’t give me points for my other nights I spent here. I love it otherwise!

title: Ritorno a New York
text:
Buon hotel in ottima posizione a 10 min a piedi da Times square, camere piccole come quasi ovunque, doccia spaziosa, buona colazione con thè e caffè disponibili tutto il giorno e biscotti freschi nel pomeriggio.
Buona pulizia, personale cortese.
Unico particolare negativo la lunga attesa degli ascensori all'ora di colazione. 
Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo, almeno nel periodo da me scelto, 16/22 novembre 18.
Sicuramente da consigliare.

title: Great Hotel and Location at a Very Good Price
text: Stayed here for one night post cruise in late October.  The hotel is a few blocks from Times Square on a quiet side street close to the Cruise Port and about a 35 minute cab ride from LaGuardia in normal traffic. Make sure you have the exact address as there are several Hampton Inns in NY.  Staff are friendly and very helpful.  The lady at the Concierge was pretty useless and not nice.  Considering that as a traveler new to the area they would staff the Concierge with a better person. Rooms are small, typical for New York, a very compressed area, however comfortable.  The beds firm with lots of pillows.  Storage is in a small cabinet with little space.  This is a tall thin high rise building and unless you request a top floor room there is little to no view of the city.  The bathroom was adequate for our needs and the room very clean with plenty of towels.  Due to the size of the building the rooms are very close to the elevators and are noisy at times.  Elevators are a joke.  We were on a higher floor and sometimes it took 15 minutes to go up or down with the foyer space being a tight squeeze to wait.  Breakfast is included and offers a good selection of hot and cold foods.  Suggest getting there before peak times as seating is limited although tables turn over frequently. Considering the price and location The Hampton Inn Times Square is an excellent value.  We would stay there again.

title: Buena ubicación
text: Buena ubicación, buen hotel a metros de times square, buenas habitaciones, aunque con poco espacio para las maletas y guardar la ropa, ascensores muy escasos, una tortuga subir o bajar hasta el piso 28 donde estaba la habitación. Desayuno corrrecto. Escaso lugar para desayunar sin embargo el desayuno es bueno

title: Great experience!
text: I traveled with 14 college students for an overnight in NYC.  Henry and his staff went above and beyond to make our stay special - assisted with directions when needed, stored our luggage before and after check-in and check-out, easy and seamless check-in..  Hotel is clean, modern and up-to-date.  Delicious breakfast choices.

title: An amazing place to stay
text:
Just back from a 3 night stay and I can't praise this hotel enough. 
Location is excellent, which was one of the primary reasons we picked it, along with price and the fact it doesn't charge an extra resort fee like some other hotels. 
On arrival we were greeted by such helpful and friendly staff, checking in was a pleasure and our room was delightful,clean and modern with everything you could need. 
We took advantage of the hot breakfast every morning, food was lovely and set us up for the day. 
Being from the UK the time difference meant we were early risers so pretty much had the breakfast area to ourselves, although we did notice it got busier later. 
We can't fault this hotel and would definitely stay here again.  
Thanks to all the staff for making this a great place to stay.

title: Henry, Robinson, Steven - WONDERFUL!
text: Very clean hotel; loved my small NYC room; and definitely look forward to returning again.  Henry, Robinson, and Steven made our stay a smooth transition from check-in to valet parking to storing our luggage to checking-out.

title: Small
text: Although the hotel was central to everything, extremely clean and most of the staff helpful we did find the room a little small for 3 adults. Nowhere to put your clothes except a single wardrobe, no drawers so we had to live out of our cases all week. We asked twice for extra large towels but never got them. The lift was a nightmare sometimes having to wait up to 10 minutes to get back to your room after breakfast.

title: Times Square Hampton Inn group trip for BDNY Convention.
text: Henry was excellent! I had a great experience working with him. He was professional and extremely accommodating. Will definitely visit this location again! Looking forward to next year's BDNY group trip!

title: Sale, manager de l'hôtel malhonnête
text: Hôtel sale (poussière plein les meubles), salle de petit déjeuner bien trop petite, petit déjeuner servi dans des assiettes en carton et couverts en plastique (amis de la nature, fuyez!), attente interminable devant les ascenseurs le matin: 2 ascenseurs pour 32 étages x 6 chambres! Les prises de la salle de bain ne fonctionnaient pas. En plus de ça, le manager nous a accusé d'avoir fumé dans la chambre, car il dit avoir trouvé des cendres de cigarette: il s'agissait de poussière tombant de la fenêtre lorsqu'on l'ouvrait. L'hôtel nous a pris 250€ pour "nettoyer la chambre" or elle n'était pas plus propre après.

title: Super indico
text:
Hotel muito bom, aconchegante, funcionários super atenciosos , café da manhã muito bom, sempre variado e com muitas opções, tivemos um problema com a reserva do Booking mas que foi prontamente resolvida por eles, guardaram nossas malas até que os quartos fossem liberados, limpeza ótima, super indico e voltaria com toda certeza
Estão de parabéns

title: Sparkling service, central location
text: I really can't say enough about how great the staff was for my stay.  Handled a noise issue immediately, helped me map out the area for some work supplies I needed ... greeted me with a smile and really left me feeling like I had a whole support structure for my stay!  Location-wise it's near all the Midtown transportation hubs - Port Authority is a block or two away and Penn Station is about 10 mins with luggage.   9th Ave has great quality ethnic shops that are much better price points than the chains on Times Square or any of the hotel restaurants.   Small business center is adjacent to the lobby and in my case, perfect for when I had a question.  Rooms are normal for the area and had nice side tables.  Really this is a place to stay for the staff and location.  Breakfast hours are LONG so that was great to be able to grab a yogurt on my way out after having eggs and sausage a few hours earlier.   Stay here for a hassle-free experience in MidTown.

title: Friendly, Clean and Efficient!
text: I was in town with a group from Baltimore for a design conference that took place at the Javits center. The location was perfect and the staff was friendly. The room was spotless and breakfast was delicious. I was greeted anytime I came and went from the hotel. They even held our bags, free of charge, so that we can get them out of our way before check-in. Once we checked in, all our bags were provided to us and the stay was very pleasant.  They also have valet parking which was very convenient.

title: Great stay near Times Square
text: We had a wonderful trip to NYC.  Loved that this hotel was within walking distance of Penn Station, Broadway and Times Square!  The staff was extremely nice and breakfast was above average! The room was comfortable and very clean.

title: Ottima soluzione
text:
Si può solo che parlare bene di questo Hotel gentilezza e cortesia ne fanno da padroni. Wi fi operante in tutta la struttura, camere pulite e dotate di tutti i confort An che se piccole. 
Colazione super per essere in Usa. 
CONSIGLIATO

title: Great location
text: I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights to see a show. The location is great, it's outside of Times Square so a little less busy but close enough to easily walk to lots of different areas. There are great restaurants nearby and also close to Penn Station. The rooms were definitely the smallest of any Hampton Inn I stayed in, but this is probably a city thing. The breakfast was typical, there was a gym and standard amenities in the rooms, along with a fridge. I would definitely stay here again when staying in New York City, I liked the area and the staff was friendly.

title: Ottimo hotel in posizione centrale
text: Hotel situato in ottima posizione, vicino a tutto (locali, ristoranti, metro...);stanze non grandissime ma pulite e confortevoli, ad ogni piano si trova un distributore gratuito d'acqua. Colazione abbastanza varia e abbondante. Personale gentilissimo. Unica pecca... gli ascensori, lentissimi e sempre strapieni. Consigliato!!!

title: Good overall
text: Located very close to Times Square, Hampton Inn by Hilton is an excellent property on various fronts - very warm & helpful staff members, nice spread at breakfast, freebies (tea / coffee / fruits) throughout the day et al. However, the one area where the hotel can do better is the size of the rooms & storage space. Overall, a very good experience.

title: Good hotel inMidtown
text: Very friendly, helpful front desk.  Room was clean and design updated.  If on an upper floor, elevator can b slow as only 2 and housekeeping uses them all day as well.  Otherwise a good place to stay.  Standard fare for free breakfast.

title: Family trip to New York
text:
Just returned from a great trip to New York with our grown up kids. 
The hotel was really good value. Location is pretty good, close to Times Square. 
Rooms are fairly small and there is very little wardrobe space, however the room was fine, linen changed a couple of times during our stay and always lots of clean towels every day. 
Bathroom was fine and always stocked with toiletries. There’s a fridge and safety box which is handy. 
Check in and check out was veru quick and efficient.
The staff were helpful and very friendly. 
Lifts were a bit of a problem during busy periods and if you’re on a high floor you often have to wait a while. 
We didn’t bother with breakfast as the room was always crowded and not much left.
Would definitely recommend this hotel as a great base. Good value and lovely staff.  Would use this hotel again.

title: Ottimo soggiorno a ny
text: Hotel in pieno centro, a 2 minuti da Times square, vicino alla stazione metro, bus, treno.Belle stanze, staff gentile e disponibile.Colazione buona con scelta..magari ci potrebbe essere più scelta tra i salati.Sicuramente da suggerire ad altri.

title: Hotel staff very friendly and helpful.
text: Very close to Times Square, walking distance. Rooms were not large but very comfortable. Breakfast was very good and lady in charge was friendly and interesting to talk to. When in the Lobby the consiere was very helpful, had lots of suggestions and found good deals for Broadway shows. Also the Hampton was only a few blocks from Madison Square Gsardens, we walked there to see basketball.

title: Great experience at this hotel!
text: We enjoyed our stay so much. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and bright. Complimentary breakfast offers several hot and cold food choices, It’s a 10 minute walk from Times Square, Broadway and 20 minute walk to Central Park.

title: Great place to stay when visiting NYC!
text: Courteous staff, very attentive to a guests needs, extremely welcoming staff, great place to stay when visiting the city. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable, highly recommend, wouldn’t hesitate to book again.

title: Stay at Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square South
text: The most appropriate place to stay as is convenient to many place of interest; esp Times Square. Also near Empire State Building and Amazon book store is also opposite the Empire State Building. Good location

title: TOP of the... District
text:
(we are French) 
Really pleased by our 4 night stay (included Halloween) in this newly renovated hotel. 
Room & bathroom extremely nice CLEAN COMFORTABLE (thanks++ room staff). 
But (my star off) Room quite small (difficult w/ big suitcases) and 24th floor = long waiting for the lift. 
GREAT continental Breakfast w/ waffles, eggs, bread, dairies, hot drinks every day. 
Staff very kind. Ideal location. 
Deco, make-up candies for Halloween so funny 
My only star off is also the price, but central location worth !

title: Lovely staff, great breakfast, comfortable rooms
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleased. The staff were what made the hotel- so friendly! There was a great range of food at breakfast- bagels, toast, sausages, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, cereals, cakes and a waffle maker! There was a 24 hour drinks station open which also supplied fruit to eat. Complementary cookies on reception at 5pm each day too! 

Our room had two double beds which were good size and comfortable but didn’t leave a lot of room for our cases. We had a tv and WiFi was free too. 

Very happy with our stay and would visit again.

title: Absolutamente recomendable
text: Genial, en todos los aspectos, no dudaria en volver, el desayuno magnifico, cafe, te y fruta las 24 horas a tu disposicion, la habitacion amplia, la cama super comoda, el baño genial. en definitiva de 10

title: Strategic Location
text:
Nice hotel in a strategic location.  You can eat in Hell's Kitchen and see a play near Time's Square.  The location on 39th street is quiet.  Nice rooms and relaxing bedding.
The reasonable price and central location make this a great hotel for visiting Manhattan.
The E train is very close.

title: Buena ubicación
text: Esta muy bien ubicado y el precio es normal pero la atención del personal del hotel podría ser mejor. ElDesayuno de cortesía está bien, si bien se puede mejorar el café que estaba frío. Cubiertos metálicos sería otra buena sugerencia.

title: Best Value near Time Square NYC
text: Stuff are amazing at this hotel.  Room was very nice with two queen beds which very rare find near Time Square or Manhattan in general.  Complimentary breakfast was good with some fresh New York bagels.

title: Marathon experience
text:
Our stay at the Hampton inn/times square was very pleasant from the moment we walked in and were greated by Farrell. 
Our room was clean and comfortable.  The staff was beyond efficient. The location was very convenient for our plans.
We would definitely stay here again.

title: Decent hotel on economy budget in theatre district.
text: The Hampton Inn is located just off Times Square South tucked away on a quiet street but close to all the action. It is a tiny hotel but has all the amenities of a larger establishment. The complimentary breakfast is exceptional with tons of choices to satisfy the hungriest of morning people to those who prefer a lighter meal. The rooms are small but adequately works for a couple or 2 friends needing separate beds. The beds are very nice as in the linen and towels provided. Lastly it is the staff who really make the difference with everyone at the ready to help answer all your questions with a smile. Would highly recommend this hotel if looking for a good deal in midtown Manhattan.

title: Great budget hotel in a fantastic location
text:
I have stayed in a number of top hotels around the world (I tend to stay mostly in 5 star properties - the last time I was in NYC my wife and I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria).
This visit was with the kids (aged 16 years and 13 years) so we needed a reasonably priced hotel in a good location.
After much researching we settled on the Hampton Inn Times Square South.
We arrived on a Saturday around 3.20pm and we very quickly checked in - all the staff were friendly and very customer friendly.
We booked a room with two double beds - the room was clean and the bathroom was also well presented - the size of rooms in big cities such as NYC and London are small so you have to factor that in. The Neutragena toiletries are a nice touch as is the compliments wi-if.
We stayed 4 nights and the location was excellent - off 8th Avenue and a short 10-15 minute walk to Times Square.
The complementary breakfast is a good addition as this saves money and it is plentiful as are the complimentary all day tea and coffee in the lobby.
The free sweets at Halloween was a nice addition .
The staff are generally very friendly and helpful - so why is one star knocked off? Well we had a blocked sink and despite twice bringing this to the hotel’s attention it remained blocked.
However despite this we really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

title: Fijn hotel, goede locatie
text: Zeer vriendelijk personeel, goede bedden, uitstekende locatie.Op 5 minuten lopen van bus terminal, 10 minuten van Time Square, veel eetgelegenheden in de buurt.  Supermarkt op de hoek. Basic ontbijt was prima. Tip: ontbijt rond 7 uur, daarna wordt het druk.

title: Way to small
text: Rooms are to small for more than one person. There is no where to put a suitcase. The room was not cleaned when we returned to the room. Elevators are a problem as they are frequently full and you end up waiting for awhile.

title: Convenient location and helpful, friendly staff
text: The hotel is in a convenient location - walking distance from Penn Station and close to many subway lines.  Also, there are many great restaurants right near the hotel.  The staff was very friendly, proactive, and helpful.  There is a free breakfast and coffee in the hotel.  The business center is also very convenient.

title: Superb Service! Great location!
text: We recently spent 4 nights at the Hampton Inn Times Sq South and cannot recommend it highly enough! We travelled to NYC to celebrate my daughter’s 21st Birthday and could not fault any part of the stay here. The front desk and management team are super friendly and welcomed us brilliantly! They had laid on a lovely surprise in the room for my daughter and we were all blown away! The room was spotless,  beds super comfy, enough room for 3 ladies and luggage (& additional shopping!) Fridge and safe in room were much appreciated and daily housekeeping faultless! The location was excellent for us and we felt safe coming to and from hotel at all times. The breakfast room is a fantastic bonus and really well stocked, yes it does get busy but we never had to wait very long! Ok...we are British so really don’t mind a little queue...we were expecting issues with the lifts but once again...had none! The hotel even loaned us umbrellas on our last day when the weather turned from Sunny to torrential! Thanks so much to David, Harry & all the staff for such a fantastic stay! We will be back! 😀😃

title: Ottimo posizione
text:
Buona posizione, abbiamo fatto tutto rimanendo in centro vicino Times Square. Vicino c’è tutto e puoi prendere la metro comodamente per girare Manhattan.La colazione è abbondante ed è vera (in molti hotel danno una colazione finta nel senso che ti servono solo cibi e bevande confezionati).
Una settimana intera abbiamo speso in 2 1585€ (per i prezzi di NY va bene).
Consigliato perché buono il rapporto qualità prezzo.

title: Fit our purpose
text: We stayed 6 nights here and found everything comfortable, smallish room although to be expected in NYC. Great location, close to Times Square, right next to Port authority bus terminal, breakfast was nice but gets really busy most mornings  we were there (8-9am). The kitchen and breakfast staff did a fantastic job in keeping everything topped up. The only negative is the noise from the building site opposite, woke us up 5am! Thanks to all the staff for being friendly.

title: Loud. Smelly. Bad.
text:
Checked in very late (1AM) and was given the last available room. Not sure if it was bad luck, or a front desk strategy to wait as long as possible to assign this room, but it smelled. Badly. Had a very musty odor. Like if you leave you clothes in the washing machine too long and don't dry them, kind of smell. I went to the front desk to ask about moving rooms, and they were 100% full. To their credit they offered me a refund if I wanted to change to a different hotel, but it was 130AM by this time and we were tired.
Not sure how this one gets the 'Hampton' name on it. Relatively old, barely adequate cleanliness (besides the smell), elevators were HORRIBLE (as others have pointed out). I understand that my expectations need to be different in a hotel in a major urban center, but I still have a basic expectation of a hotel that carries the Hampton brand.

title: Basic and noisy
text:
Staff were friendly. 
Rooms were small
Lifts were a nightmare, waiting ages to a lift to come.
Breakfast was nice although not enough room to suit 32 floors worth of people. 

The noise from outside was ridiculous. We were on level 5 and each night/morning we were woken up by construction workers outside at 4:30am.

title: Custox Beneficio
text: O Hotel é limpo, organizado, café da manhã OK!, Quartos pequenos, camas e travesseiros confortáveis,localização central, perto de metro e terminal de ônibus  e recebem encomendas sem cobrar.Destaque para staff Deina, sempre prestativa!!!

title: Raton en comedor y cocina
text: Muy desagradable experiencia sanitaria. Salio raton de comedores y cocina y hotel se desentendio. Hay estabamos comiendo y reclamamos a dos turnos y sus supervisores. Esperamos una disculpa o atencion al pesimo rato vivido. NADA

title: A Big Thank You!
text: I cannot say enough about the management and staff at the Hampton Inn Times Square South! They were extremely kind to me on my recent visit to New York City. Due to hurricane Florence I was stuck in New York for three extra days due to my travel arrangements home being cancelled. I was already booked there for two days and had to hastily add 3 more. Henry, the manager on duty, was more than helpful by allowing me to keep my room, instead of having to check out and wait for the new reservation to take effect. He showed genuine concern for my situation and could not have been nicer! The same can be said for the other manager David, and the entire front desk staff. Whether it was a friendly hello or wave as I came and went, or a bag with an apple, water, and granola bar when I missed breakfast, they truly could not have been nicer! Aside from their kindnesses, the hotel was neat, clean and the room was well appointed, up to date, and very comfortable! So again, a BIG thank you to Henry, David and the entire staff for all their help and kindness to me!

title: Great location!
text: Needed a hotel with easy access to MSG and Broadway - this fit the bill perfectly!  Overall, staff was pleasant and helpful (concierge needed some help).  Rooms were clean and quiet.  Breakfast was easy.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Multiple Stays at Hampton Inn Times Square South
text: This Hampton Inn consistently provides friendly, helpful staff, comfortable, updated accommodations and a convenient location within walking distance of Times Square, theaters and many NYC attractions.

title: Fab hotel in excellent location!
text:
We are a family of 3 our daughter is 15yrs & we stayed at this hotel for 8 nights & would stay again!
All the staff are amazing & friendly, the hotel is spotless & a great variety of breakfast choices every morning!.
Also free hot chocolate or tea/ coffee every day in the lobby & early afternoon free cookies,there is also a microwave!
Our room was fab the size was ok for NYC & we had a fridge, safe & free Wi-fi!

I would pick this area anytime over staying in Times Square which is so busy day & night with some really annoying characters bothering you at every available minute!  
Also right around the corner from the hotel there is loads of restaurants & food places & you are close to the bus station!.
We felt very safe here we went early & late at night!

title: 3 Star Hotel with 5 Star service
text: Very nice hotel in great central location.  We stayed for over a week.  Rooms were nice, clean, thoughtfully equipped and well laid out.  The breakfast buffet is excellent and the continuous complimentary hot drinks available behind reception, plus the warm fresh cookies daily on reception, were a very welcome bonus.  However, the star of our stay was the extremely warm and friendly staff.  ALL the staff, porters, cleaners, maids, reception, caterers, made us feel welcome each and every day.  They weren't just polite and helpful, they were genuinely warm and welcoming.  It made our stay really special.  Thank you.

title: ....alla scoperta di New York!
text:
Ottimo albergo per una vacanza all’insegna della scoperta di New York..albergo davvero molto comodo a tutto,in una taversa della 8th street e quindi leggermente fuori dal traffico caotico e incessante. Personale davvero molto molto gentile e disponibile,per non parlare della pulizia ogni mattina si vedono ragazze che puliscono ovunque.
Colazione con tutto dal dolce (waffels fai da te) yogurt,scones,pane,muffins e porridge caldo ma anche angolo salato che varia di giorno in giorno tendenzialmente omelette,french toast,uova strapazzate e delle mini salsicce. Avere colazione compresa non è da poco perche comunque se si esce un muffin mwno di 3 $ non costa.

Direi esperienZa molto positiva,camera matrimonile al 9 piano pulita e confottevole...quindi MOLTO CONSIGLIATO per un soggiorno di piacere e di scoperta della citta.

title: Hôtel bien situé
text: L’hôtel est très bien situé, à 3 rues du métro et de Times square... petit déjeuner sympa sans être exceptionnel (le plus: ce sont les gaufres!). Il y a du café disponible toute la journée. Prévoyez les boules quies si vous donnez sur la rue. Je mettrais un bémol sur la taille des chambres et le manque de rangement mais sinon lit très confortable et salle de bain propre.

title: Great location, Helpful Staff!
text: Stayed there with my family this past weekend. Our room was on the 29th floor. Well equipped with Micro-Fridge, Room Safe and a Coffee Maker! Within walking distance to Times Square and many restaurants. Guest room was on the smaller size but well designed! The complementary Breakfast Buffet was well stocked and replenished! Staff are professional and friendly! Will stay there again.. Thanks a lot!

title: Over charged, but loved the actual stay!
text:
I booked this hotel through a website set by my company. It said one rate, but I was charged a higher rate. I called and they tried to tell me it was taxes and fees. It wasn't. I only added up room rates and came up over charged over $100 more. When I called again, I was told that they would look into it and i would receive a refund on my card. When that didn't happen within the expected 5 business days, I called again. They didn't even have the refund recorded.
I will say I had an extremely pleasant stay here. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room, while expectedly small since it's NYC, had plenty of outlets and amenities. I even used their business center while there and was pleasantly impressed. The breakfast was varied enough that I didn't get bored with the food. The 24/7 coffee bar had tea, hot cocoa, and a microwave, which I was able to use for my delicious Italian leftovers. The hotel itself does not have room service on site, but there is an outside room service available (be prepared for about an hour wait) which was convenient and reasonably priced.
If it wasn't for being overcharged and then being given the run around about refunding, it would have gotten 5 stars for me, but I feel as if I've been cheated.

title: Very friendly, helpful staff.
text: Very nice hotel, not far from Times Square.  The rooms are a little small but clean with nice beds and shower.  Clean and neat, everyone on staff smiles, friendly and helpful should you have questions.  Continental breakfast is good and, although the room can get crowded, the staff is quick to clean tables and help you get seated.  A little expensive, but what isn't in NYC.

title: Lo recomendamos
text:
Buen hotel cerca de Times Square. Personal muy amable. Muy buen desayuno. Durante todo el día café y te a disposición en la planta baja. Asimismo, todas las tardes en la recepción convidaban a los huéspedes con cookies o tablas de fiambres y quesos.
De acuerdo a lo leído en otras opiniones, ibamos pensando que los ascensores eran lentos, pero no fue así, no demoran mucho. La habitación cuenta con plancha y tabla de planchar. Muy buenos amenities. La limpieza diaria de las habitaciones fue excelente. La habitación un poco pequeña para tres adultos, pero igualmente volveríamos a hospedarnos.

title: 2 nights in the city
text: Stayed for two nights to attend a Broadway show and visit the 911 memorial site.  Staff was so helpful giving directions and assisting us with any questions.  Room was small but typical Hampton - comfortable and clean  Complimentary breakfast was good!

title: Buen hotel en NY, céntrico
text:
El hotel se encuentra cerca de Times Square, como a 5 min andando, y también cerca de la plaza Columbus (esquina de Central Park), por lo que también tienes opción de ir andando sin problema hasta allá. En general, no es necesario coger mucho transporte público, nosotros cogimos para ir al WTC y toda aquella zona, lo demás andando, que es lo bonito para ver NY. Todos los días ponen galletas en la recepción, de 15 a 17h. Decir que las galletas están buenísimas, y vuelan! por las mañanas también tienes unas bolsitas de picnic que incluye agua, fruta, barrita, magdalena, totalmente gratis! un gran detalle!! Y siempre hay disponible té y café para tomar. Los desayunos buenos, no con tanta variedad como en otros sitios, pero bastante aceptable. Hay pan para tostar, bollería, fruta, cereales, zumos, revueltos, huevos, hamburguesas u otra cosa (van variando) y siempre hay gofres que tu mismo puedes preparar. El personal amable, no todos hablan español, pero hay algunos que sí y te resuelven cualquier duda.
La habitación, grande, muy espaciosa. Una cama inmensa, yo diría de 1,80-2m, una pasada. Tv de al menos 50", escritorio con máquina de café, mini nevera, un sofá, una mesa baja...vamos muy buena habitación. Hay secador de pelo, plancha y mesa de plancha. Todos los días te cambian las toallas y te dejan geles y champús.
Si fuera a NY volvería a repetir de hotel, no es que sea de lo más baratos, pero viendo las opciones que hay, me parece buena calidad-precio.
Enfrente del hotel hay una pizzería que se llama Gotham, pizzas buenísimas!

title: A work dinner stayover
text: I had a work dinner for my husband in Times Square, and this hotel offered a great location.  It was a quick walk into Times Square.  I've stayed at other hotels in the city, and this was comprable.  The rooms are not overly large, but offered a nice amount of space.  Bathroom was tiny, and had a stall shower.   Overall, the hotel seemed to be pretty well kept up, and we did not have any issues.

title: It’s ok. Location is it’s best feature
text: We liked the location of the hotel in proximity to the theaters and Times Square. The hotel was overall well kept. We did find mold in our shower though and a cockroach joined us for breakfast. Wouldn’t stay again based on those things and nothing taken off the bill for it. Management never contacted us after reporting

title: Sehr gute Lage
text:
Bei der Auswahl eines Hotels in NYC sollte man sich zuvorderst die Frage selber beantworten, ob man mittendrin (sprich in Manhattan Nähe Times Square) sein möchte, oder ob man ggf. täglich größere Strecken mit der U-Bahn fahren möchte. Entscheidet man sich für mittendrin, muss man ca. 300 USD (eher mehr) für Mittelklasse investieren - oder deutlich mehr für gehobenere Ansprüche. Hat man sich für Mittelklasse entschieden, sollte man wissen, dass die Zimmer allesamt deutlich kleiner ausfallen, als bei einer ähnlichen Kategorie woanders. Dafür kriegt man halt die Lage für sein Geld mit. 
Exakt auf der Grundlage dieser Kalkulkation erfolgte die Auswahl dieses Hotels. Die Lage ist klasse - es ist wirklich nahezu alles zu Fuß zu erreichen (bis auf die Südspitze von Manhattan - die ist etwas weit weg). Im Umkreis gibt es unzählige Restaurants und Bars - die U-Bahn und der Busbahnhof sind unmittelbar daneben.

Zum Hotel selber möchte ich positiv erwähnen, dass ich dort nur äußerst freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal erlebt habe. Es gibt ein kleines Frühstück, was Zeit und Geld spart. Mein Zimmer im obersten Stockwerk war geräumig, aber spartanisch möbliert. Hinsichtlich Sauberkeit konnte ich mich nicht beschweren.

title: Great Central Location
text: Great location within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, Bryant Park, NYC Public Library, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Right around the corner from Port Authority Bus Terminal. Hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They let us check-in 3 hours early, and held our bags for 6 hours after check-out! Room was small but very clean and comfortable. Good breakfast. The breakfast staff was extremely friendly and accommodating! Wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again.

title: Location not as good as you'd think
text: The location is NOT great for those who are walking or riding the subway. It's not really even in Times Square, but it is only half a mile away, so that's not the main problem. The problem is that 39th street, between 8th Ave and this hotel, is really sketchy. 39th is your walking route to get to the subway or Times Square. Once you get to 8th, it's less sketchy, but you first have to walk past homeless people sleeping on the street at all hours of the day, others openly smoking pot, and various other R-rated situations. Not our first trip to NYC and we know what to expect, but this area was definitely worse than expected. The closest subway stop is 2/10 mile away, the 42 St - Port Authority Bus Terminal and subway station. Unfortunately, this station only serves the A-C-E trains, which are not the main trains for tourists. We found ourselves mostly walking 1/2 mile to the Times Sq - 42 St station, which services the N-Q-R-S-W-1-2-3-7 trains, which will take you virtually anywhere, and this station is actually linked underground by a VERY LONG passageway to the Port Authority station, which can be extremely HOT, but can be very convenient, especially if it is raining -- duck underground at the nearby Port Authority station and walk to this station. The subway is expansive and you can purchase a 7-day unlimited pass for $33, which is a bargain. Regarding the hotel ... there's only 6 rooms on each floor, but it is 30+ floors tall. Our 2-double bed room was extremely small, even by NYC standards, based on our experience. The staff were very nice and accommodating, especially the staff serving breakfast. Breakfast was nice each day. One day Housekeeping did not service our room at all and another day had not serviced it by 5 pm, but the front desk sent towels when requested. In retrospect, I wish we would have stayed elsewhere -- location of the Hampton Inn Times Square Central appears MUCH better and worth a few $ more.

title: Very friendly staff
text: Great location. Friendly staff. Small rooms but the friendliness of the staff made up for it. Breakfast was ok but could definitely use some upgrading.Bedroom and bathroom were very clean. Cleaning staff were very helpful and friendly.

title: Great Location
text: We enjoyed a clean room, friendly helpful staff, and good complimentary breakfast. This location was within a reasonable walk to Times Square, The Highline, The Circle Tour at Pier 83, and the Theater District. Plenty of good restaurants close by too.

title: Excellent location and service
text: Took my niece (13) and her mom for girls weekend. Location was so easy to get to the many places we explored. Front desk staff was very accommodating and friendly. Breakfast on par with other Hampton Inns. Nice to have that included. Our room was away from elevator. If you're sensitive to noise I'd suggest that because halls are small and some rooms seem like the open onto the elevator. Beds comfy. Rooms smallish but in good shape.

title: Good Location and Price
text: Basic hotel with small rooms but hey its NYC. Rooms are clean and functional but we had a family room and it was literally a double room but with two double beds squeezed in, we had to sit on the bed so the other person could stand up - didn't bother us as we were hardly in there and just a base for us. Fab location on 39th ,  5 min walk into Times Square. For the price could not complain , but please remember it is a base and not a luxury hotel. Breakfast was awesome as came FOC with the booking.

title: Great experience
text: Our stay here was great! The rooms were kept clean. It is centrally located. We walked to everything. The service was exceptional! Very friendly and helpful staff. Always greeted coming and going. They went out of their way to help you.

title: hampton inn times square south
text: our stay here was good..great location..central for all the sights..fab staff will do anything to help you...good breakfast.good variety hot or cold.good clean rooms.free beverages on 24 hours  .we recommend this hotel.. 26.09..2018..

title: Hotel bien ubicado, con personal excelente.
text: Todo el personal fue muy amable y respondían todas nuestras consultas. Tanto el personal de la recepción, cocina, limpieza, etc. Todos hicieron muy bien su trabajo, logrando que nuestra estadía fuera lo mejor posible. El hotel esta muy bien ubicado, incluso para llegar desde el aeropuerto en metro quedas a 1 cuadra.

title: Great hotel for visiting NY!
text: We were only in the city for a night and this was the place to stay! It’s right off main Times Square so you’re not hearing the noise from the street but being so close it’s an easy walk! Concierge was great (wish I could remember her name) she was very helpful though with our one day of “touring” the city. Breakfast was good, go early though, it get CROWDED

title: Posizione eccellente,il resto nella norma
text: Come già stato detto la posizione è eccezionale a 2 passi da Times Square e dalla metro!la colazione discreta con qualcosa di salato e qualcosa di dolce...niente di che ma più che accettabile!il problema più grosso per noi è stato il rumore che la notte veniva sia dalla strada sia dall’interno,forse perché eravamo al quinto piano,ma era veramente fastidioso!personale della colazione molto educato ed efficiente!

title: Good location excellent staff
text:
The hotel itself is in a good location - pretty easy to get around and close to Time Square. The facility is clean and well kept and the rooms are standard NY size - comfortable beds. 

What made this property stand out for me was the staff. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. My one night stay and experience was awesome.

title: SIN DUDAS UNA EXCELENTE OPCIÓN EN NYC
text: Claramente la hotelería en la ciudad no es barata, pero una buena ubicación reemplaza automovil o gastos de transporte.... en este camino, la ubicación del Hotel es BRILLANTE! Comoda para todo lugar a visitar! Las habitaciones son algo pequeñas, pero el Desayuno, Ubicación & Amabilidad del Personal, lo reemplaza! La relación PRECIO | CALIDAD es mas que JUSTA!

title: A solid hotel in a good location
text: Good location on a quiet street near Port Authority. Only a few mins from the heart of Times Square and a few mins walk from the Herald Square/Macys area. Staff were friendly. Beds were very comfy. However I do think the carpet could have been cleaned better. Free tea/coffee in the breakfast area which is a nice touch.

title: Bien placé
text:
Très bel emplacement, intérieur sympa. Le personnel multilingue anglais américain est très pratique sauf quand on parle français. 
Salle de petit déjeuner petite donc y aller de préférence a l’ouverture.  Le petit déjeuner est complet, de bonne qualité ( sauf les chocolats chaud) mais le personnel est vraiment top. 
La chambre située au 31 eme étage est agréable avec magnifique vu sur le building d’en face. La chambre possède un réfrigérateur (si vous ne le trouvez pas, soyez sur de l’entendre la nuit). La climatisation fait un bruit terrible mais impossible de dormir sans. Le coffre fort de notre chambre ne fonctionnait pas. 
La salle de bain est correcte, le ménage n’est pas top ( cheveux dans la douche et sur le sol à notre arrivée. 
Literie très grande et confortable, un vrai plus pour une nuit réparatrice. 
Très mauvaise insonorisation entre la chambre et le couloir (qui reste allumé 24h/24). Les distributeur d’eau et de soda sont très pratiques. 
Pour résumer hôtel de bon standing avec juste quelques points a revoir.

title: Perfect location
text:
Last minute booking, we were able to get a room which was great! Upon arrival we were able to leave our luggage as we were too early for check in . 

Location is outstanding very convenient! Staff was friendly.

title: Excellent service
text: Very quiet.  Staff personable.  Super clean.  Nice quality furniture, sheets, towels, carpet, and fixtures.  Food was outstanding with hot food selections different each day such as omelet, eggs, fried potatoes, baked French toast sticks.  Always fresh.  One day there were even Boston cream donuts even!  What I like best about the hotel was the staff was professional and helpful, the hotel everywhere I went was clean and that is important to me.  Not only that the hotel is close to everything.

title: Downtown
text: We were driving down the east coast and had two nights in New York. This is walking distance to many restaurants and stores. Remember this is New York, so real estate is more expensive. This hotel was not up to what we normally expect from Hampton Inn. That said for the area and experience, this is probably a good option. Valet parking was good, ample breakfast area and good location. Remember this is downtown NY so you would probably take Uber or taxi to get around. One night we watched people walk faster down the street than our taxi cab during rush hour. Areas not to miss: World Trade Center, Chelsea Market, Times Square.

title: Compact and efficient
text: We stayed at the hotel over the Labor Day holiday. From our arrival to departure, the experience was excellent all round. This is a very “compact” Hampton Inn with all it’s hallmark features in a small footprint. 6 rooms per floor and 32 floors makes it a good sized hotel that uses all available space very efficiently. Staff are very friendly and helpful, were very welcoming of all guest and helped everyone move right along. The location is optimal for a visit to NY city. Less than 15 minutes walk from Penn station and Times Square right close to great food in Hell’s Kitchen this property is in a perfect location. A lot has been said about the elevators in other reviews, patience gets everyone to their destination floor without too much delay. A slightly cramped lobby area and room size is the only drawback but remember it’s the center of NY city. The friendliness and efficiency of the staff and familiar Hampton features overcome any concerns. Great value for the price. Highly recommended.

title: Great location and good size room
text:
We had a great stay at the Hampton Inn. The room and bathroom was a good size, the bed was huge and there was a very good air conditioning unit much to our relief. The staff were friendly and helpful too.

Location is great! Between 8-9 Ave. so 10 mins walk from Time Square, 10 mins from Macy’s, 20 mins walk from Central Park, close to Penn station and the tourist bus rides. Having Hell’s Kitchen on 9th Ave with a huge range of bars and restaurants was a big plus. The walk along 9th between 40-54 street is lively in the evening and should have something for everyone.

Some people have complained about the renovations happening; to be honest we didn’t get affected and they were painting through the night in reception to try to avoid disruption. 

The only downside to the hotel is you can wait a little while for the lifts particularly after breakfast. Also be prepared for a possible wait for the breakfast buffet if you get up the same time as everyone else - there is a nice / tasty range of food and the waffle maker was fun to use!

title: A disappointment...
text:
Let me preface this by saying I still in Hilton Hotels roughly 30 nights a year. In my opinion this hotel does not meet Hilton Standards. I was a late check in on Friday evening, I called the hotel at 9pm to let them know I would be arriving late. Upon my arrival the front door was locked, and the front desk refused to let me in without a room key, so tell me, how was I supposed to check in? I had to actually CALL the front desk from the door to have her let me in. I utilized my E-Check in service from my application to speed up my check in time, NOPE. I spent 35 minutes standing in the lobby waiting for the person on the desk to HAND ME KEYS. That is all they needed to, my credit card had already been authorized, and I had already verified my information. The point of E-Check in is to expedite the check in process, and this certainly did not happen. The person on the front desk did NOT follow E-check in protocol at all. The hotel advertises itself as recently renovated, while this may be true for some the furniture, the carpet in my room was stained, and looked dirty, and the bathroom mirror was chipped and scratched. 

The hotel is also crammed into a very tight building, elevators are hard to access, they are in a weird spot, and they move extremely slow, if I was not on the 23rd floor, I would've used the stairs. The neighborhood isn't very nice either, I have stayed all over Manhattan, and this was one of the few hotels I did not feel comfortable walking to late at night.

As a loyal Hilton Honors Gold member, I would not stay at this hotel again.

title: PR
text: Good locationProperty is under construction, which is an inconvenientRooms aren’t good: too smallAppearance on the hallways  aren’t pleasantBreakfast was OKStaff were somehow helpful My room was facing the street and the curtain didn’t cover the glass window at all.

title: Bon rapport qualité prix pour l'emplacement
text:
Nous avons choisi cet hôtel pour son emplacement,  les chambres familiales, le petit déjeuner et le wifi inclus dans le prix. Séjour de 10 jours avec 2 enfants de 10 et 13ans.
Très bien situé (39eme)  à 2 pas de de la station bus terminal, donc pratique pour le métro. Comme indiqué sur d'autres avis salle pour petit déjeuner un peu petite, mais délicieuses gaufres et le personnel est très gentil et serviable ( Junior, etc) + ascenseur le matin qu'il faut attendre parfois longtemps.
Bonne insonorisation chambre/chambre, moins bon avec le couloir.
Chambre petite mais suffisante. Savon et non gel douche pour la douche ( + shampoing/ après shampoing/ creme)
Réfrigérateur dans la chambre.

A noter :
La chambre 1301 est située en face du distributeur de glace et l'appareil fait un bruit terrible !
La chambre 1401 a un problème au niveau du climatiseur ( Rétention d'eau stagnante) qui dégage une odeur de moisi. Signalé 2 fois à la réception mais je ne pense pas qu'ils aient regardé le problème. 
Chambre nettoyée tous les jours et serviettes changées même si elles n’étaient pas par terre.
Plusieurs fois le réveil a du être activé par mégarde lors du ménage ( on s'est fait avoir une fois).
Indication monté - descente au niveau des ascenseurs douteuse et des boutons récalcitrants.
Dommage pour tant de vaisselle jetable (notamment, gobelets pour les gaufres) qui finit à la poubelle sans être sur qu'elle sera recyclée car pas de distinction entre les 2 poubelles de la salle du petit déjeuner.

title: Great location and friendly, but a bit tired
text: This was a great place for our vacation in NYC. Great location. Family enjoyed the breakfast. The buffet was busy but overall well managed. The room was a bit tired looking. Wall paper coming off in the bathroom and the doorframe starting to rust. Tiny flatscreen TV that was acting up repetitively. Room cleaning ok, but again not great. Bottom line: great location, friendly staff but needs some TLC

title: Affordable Hampton Inn Located Walking Distance to Times Square
text:
I researched hotels in Manhattan for several hours before selecting the Hampton Inn Times Square South and I was not disappointed with my selection.  I wanted a nice, modern hotel at a reasonable price that was centrally located and included breakfast. I got the room at a price that was better than any of the 3rd party websites by going to Hilton.com and requesting the AAA rate. Also, Unlike many of the larger hotels in the area, there is NO Resort Fee, which would have been a dealbreaker!  

This place was just what we wanted and it was topped off by the most amazing staff!  
We were welcomed by Jim when we arrived.  Jim’s humor and smiles were refreshing after our long trip.  Next morning at breakfast we were greeted by a pair of magicians, Junior and Amanda. I call them magicians because a swarm of guests would wipe out the food and in a few minutes the buffet would be restored !   The always smiling Leticia would help out at times while still supporting the front as well!  After things calmed down, supervisor Mabel stopped by our table as she helped the other staff to recover from the breakfast crowd. 

Because this guests at this hotel were mostly tourists, most of us would sleep in a bit later than the business guests, there would always be a swarm of guests between 8 and 10 am that would overwhelm the elevators and breakfast area. The staff handled this amazingly well!  I would also like to thank the management for continued breakfast service after the 10 am posted closing time. So many other properties that I have visited will start dismantling the buffet 30 minutes before closing time so that everything is gone at closing. Not at the Hampton Inn!  And this is one of the many reasons that I will stay here the next time I visit NYC!  

I almost forgot a few other things.  The hotel has a fairly small footprint with only 6 rooms on each of the 32 floors and the rooms are smaller than I have experienced at Hampton Inns elsewhere, but the rooms are great!  It had at least 9 USB charging ports and a dozen 110v outlets all within easy reach. There is storage behind the mirror in the bathroom AND the cabinet has a mirror on both sides of the door! 

It’s a great affordable hotel that is convenient and centrally located in Manhattan. Can’t ask for much more!

title: Couples Get Away
text: This was a surprise getaway from my bae. Though we always try to get out NY, he decided to try something different. Never thought I/we would have enjoyed the city so much. Minutes or should I say a short walk to Times Square and also 34th Street Herald Square. This location is close to shopping, food etc. The hotel is very clean and staff is friendly.  For those who want to visit NYC I would suggest this location.  There is so much to do in the city but when you live and work there you just don't want to be bothered - we were actually very relaxed. Looking forward to the next city getaway. 😄

title: Dez dias em New York
text:
Bom hotel, camas excelentes, silencioso porém falta espaço para o café da manhã! São 32 andares, apenas dois elevadores e a capacidade do salão é para 65 pessoas.

Localização excelente, próxima ao Port Autority (deslocamento rápido para outlet New Jersey)
a Times Square, Hard Rock Café, Bubba Gamp e vários restaurantes e lojas.

title: Great value, friendly staff and clean room
text:
The location is good with a quick walk to Times Square. Great to launch your New York adventures. 

Room were clean. 

Shower was great.

Bed was comfortable 

Wi Fi was great and the rooms had usb Potts which help of you do not have a USA plug or adapter.

Breakfast perfect to start the day off with. Cereals, oatmeal, egg, sausages, juices, etc.

Great friendly staff.

title: Amazing staff!
text: That is the biggest thing - the staff, they are kind, friendly, just plain lovely people. They made the experience fantastic. The location is also good - close to Times Square and transit of various sorts. The gym is small and hasn't any windows, but never was busy (had it to myself). The room wasn't big, but there was nice space downstairs int he breakfast area where I could sit (no windows there though).The breakfast has a variety of options, and they even had almond milk for me!The TV was difficult to figure out - we couldn't find any TV listings, so just had to flip through (the front desk didn't know anything either).

title: Bom custo beneficio
text:
O hotel é bom, sendo o quarto o ponto  alto, para os padrões de NY e pelo preço o quarto é ótimo! Tem um bom tamanho (23m2), frigobar, microondas, máquina de café e secador. A limpeza do quarto é ótima, o banheiro tem tamanho bom, com troca de toalhas diárias e mimos neutrogena. As diárias incluem café da manhã. O local do café da manhã é pequeno mas um pouco de paciência tudo se resolve, tem sempre 2 itens quentes (ovos, omelete, salsicha, rabanada), 3 tipos de suco, pães, cereais, muffins, waffles feitos na hora, uma salada de fruta estranha, geleias, manteiga, cream cheese, ovos cozidos, café, leite e chocolate (alias café e chocolate grátis 24h). Não é um café glamuroso mas da para sair já alimentado e sem gastar. 
A localização é boa, 10 minutos a pé de Times Square, porém longe o suficiente para o barulho nem ser notado (o que é ótimo). Tem um Pret A Manger na esquina (amo).  Tem estação de metrô a 5 minutos (boa sorte pois esse metro de NY é mega confuso). Fiquei 6 noites, saia de manhã e voltava a noite para dormir. Foi ótimo. Recomendo e ficaria novamente.

title: Convenient  location and friendly staff
text: Although the room was very small, it was clean and had everything we needed.  I was on vacation from California with my 13 year old granddaughter and the location was perfect for what we wanted to do.  The breakfast was good and well-stocked and enough to get us going for the day.  Typical continental breakfast but clean and fresh.  Front desk staff were always attentive, friendly and available.

title: Molto comodo
text: Abbiamo trascorso tre notti in questo hotel. Posizione molto comoda a cinque minuti da Times  Square. Personale molto gentile e disponibile. La prima notte abbiamo avuto dei problemi tecnici con lo scarico del lavandino e con la  doccia, ma il personale ha provveduto prontamente a sostituirci la camera. Camere pulite anche se non grandissime. Colazione abbondante e variata nei giorni. Sala un po’ affollata nelle ore di punta. Buon rapporto qualità prezzo

title: Ottima soluzione
text:
Hotel a buon prezzo in zona Times Square 
Colazione inclusa cosa non frequente a New York, tra l’altro ottima e piena di scelta, puoi farti i wafel da solo , apprezzato dai bambini 
Sala della colazione troppo piccola ma ci si gestisce 
Acqua gratis ovunque e acqua aromatiche sempre in reception 
Camere pulite , Wi-Fi gratuito, anche questo non comune 
A 200 metri da Times Square e dalla metro

title: Horrible horrible horrible
text: Too crowded. Breakfast doesn't even have basic scrambled eggs for kosher or halal food. Eggs with ham only? What the hell. Theres only 1 washroom in the basement. Rooms are tiny and very small. Never again I will come back to this hotel.

title: Friendly Staff!
text: We stayed here for 8 nights while my daughter attended a Broadway workshop. The staff was always smiling, asked often if everything was ok with our stay. Hotel was very quiet. Rooms were very adequate. Had a fridge for leftovers, drinks, snacks. Not every room had a microwave though. The only thing that was troublesome was the elevators. They are slow, and only one was running most of our stay. We started on a higher floor, but spent most of our time on the second floor, so used the stairs. Others in our party who were on upper floors waited sometimes 15+ minutes for the elevator depending on the time of day. Otherwise, it’s a great place to stay. Close to Times Square and all the theaters. We only needed  transportation to go to the World Trade Center.

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Nous avons séjourné 10 jours dans cet hôtel avec nos deux enfants (16 et 13 ans).
Chambre pas très grande mais au calme, bien équipée et très propre, un seul bémol la moquette au sol un peu vieillissante qui dégageait une odeur pas très agréable... 
petit déjeuner très simple et peu varié et suivant les heures il y a beaucoup de monde... 
personnel sympathique et accueillant.
2 Ascenseurs mais souvent 1 seul à la disposition des clients donc beaucoup d’attente... 
emplacement parfait à 2 mn de la station métro/bus/train (parfait si vous envisagez d’aller à washington car il faut se lever tôt) et à quelques pas de times square !!! 
Commerces, petits supermarchés à coté...

title: Buon hotel nel caos di Times square
text:
Hotel in ottima posizione praticamente ad una sola Street da Times Square e 200 metri da stazione metro 
Personale gentile e disponile alle richieste 
Area caffè, the, acqua gratis a tutte le ore
Sala colazione piccola e un po’ troppo affollata

title: 추천합니다^^
text:
힐튼 멤버라 여름철 비싼 뉴욕에서 그나마 저렴한 편이어서 이용했는데
다음날 옮겼던 뒷블럭 더블트리보다 시설이 좀더 작긴 하지만 가성비를 생각하면 훨씬 나은듯해요. 조식무료에 1층에서 24시간 커피 마실 수 있으니 ㅎㅎ 
다만 엘리베이터 붐비는 시간에 짜증나는 건 감수하셔야 해요!

title: Good location;  good breakfast; helpful staff
text: We found the hotel to be a good central location (in The Garment District) to all the activities (close to subway as well) we wanted to do, especially at night as we went to plays nearby.  Breakfast wa good and changed each day—scrambled eggs one day; omelets another—-toasted potatoes, sausage; waffles, bagels muffins and cereal everyday.  The free breakfast wAs a nice way to start each day—and wait for the rest of the people in my room to wake up.  Some days the elevators were quite challenging (4 out of 5 day days only one was running).  Expect a wait at peak times.  The staff was friendly and quick to respond to requests though!

title: Wouldn’t recommend if you want good customer service
text: Don’t expect customer service to know what they’re saying. I was given mixed information from the beginning and had to call back several times to clarify. Each time, different information. Called and left voicemail for manager and no one ever called back. Booking this reservation and understanding the policy was difficult and no one was helpful. But overall, stay was ok. The hotel room was clean. The elevator was broken when we were there thank God we were only on level 2, my other family was on level 18 and had to walk up 18 flights of steps. Breakfast was good. FYI: there IS a security deposit, when I called to make the reservation they told me no security deposit required

title: Elevator issues
text: As others have mentioned, the elevators seem to be a huge issue at this location. For most of our stay, only one elevator was working for 32 floors, and on the last day, none were working and we had to haul our luggage down 27 floors of an extremely narrow stairwell. Bathroom shower did not drain and issue was not addressed after three requests. Although the location was very convenient to subway and Times Square, I would neither recommend this location nor stay there again.

title: Terrible Service, Flies in the shower, and rip off.
text: I'm never staying here again. The room was small and the high floor city view is a complete rip off as the only sights is another tall building next to it. To make things worse they only have two elevators in a 30 floor hotel and when I was there one of the elevators was working and the other was not functioning. There was long lines for the elevator and always crammed. To top it all off, on my last night there, there was flies in my shower. This hotel is hot garbage and if you are appealed by how cheap it is, it is cheap for a reason. It is the literal the worst Hilton I've stayed in my life and I use to travel and stay in Hilton's so I have been to at least 10+ different Hilton's. Stay away.

title: Nice price, ok accommodations
text: The good highlights, good value, clean room, nice and friendly staff, good complimentary breakfast. The downside the rooms are small, an elevator was out of service, the bathroom especially the shower was tiny - can’t turn around in shower, FYI I’m a normal size man.

title: 紐約市中心漢普頓客棧位置好
text: 去紐約玩，地方大，若住得遠每天進出費時。住市中心一般客棧型飯店，因為沒有游泳池、餐廳、健生房、會議室之設，價格就實惠。選擇有品牌的飯店，較有保障，住在距時代廣場咫尺之遙的西42街，希爾頓集團的漢普頓客棧Hampton Inn，位置絕佳價格合理。進門櫃檯邊就有免費咖啡冷熱飲，任由自取，展現好客之風客。房間雖不算大，早餐簡而可口，有鬆餅烘烤機，可以自製格子餅，操作法看圖就會做。

title: Great place to stay
text: Clean and comfortable.  Very professional and friendly staff. It's classic New York real estate: small, compact spaces but 32 floors high!  Good breakfast, not much of an exercise room but it's there if you need it.  The best part is the location, comfy beds, mini fridge and microwave, and the staff are attentive.

title: Opinion
text:
Hoy, 7/8 me fui del hotel. Estuve desde el 1/8
Al 2 dia de estar se rompio un ascensor y hasta q me fui seguia igual. Imaginen las filas que se hacian para subir sin contar que tambien lo usa el personal. El cuarto de tamaño normal pero habia olor, creemos q era la alfombra. Dos dias no vinieron a limpiar el cuarto y tuvimos que reclamar. El personal muy amable. El desayuno muy bueno y la ubicacion excelente. A dos cuadras de la terminal de la 42. Tienen que mejorar esos detalles

title: Would Not Stay Again
text:
I can't even select the number of issues we had. Our stay was not horrible, but it was not as described and expected. Breakfast was great each morning, although items were not refilled in a timely manner with a hotel so filled with guests. Staff was not visible or helpful. 
When we arrived on Sunday, having been delayed over 8 hours by our flight, we were told our originally booked room was not an option. 2 floors had apparently flooded? We were exhausted as it was 1 in the morning. When we arrived in our room, it smelled HORRIBLY of must and mold. The carpets were dirty, a few pillows had stained or dirty pillow cases, and the bathroom repairs had been sloppily done with hot glue. No sooner had we climbed into bed, than we began smelling smoking. Someone on one side of our room was heavily smoking cigarettes (non-smoking hotel). We did report this in the morning. 
Additionally, the hotel had only 1 elevator working and it was almost never available. We used the stairs, climbing 16 floors nearly every time we had to go up or down (though we tried to remain out so as to avoid the trouble). 

The second night, as the AC came on, we noticed again the horrible musty/moldy smell. We were more than happy to check out the next day and move to another Hilton property.

title: Winter Vacation in NYC
text:
Location was very accessible, walking distance to subway stations, and about 20 mins walk to Macy's and Koreatown (where my wife and I had great Korean food for dinner). Room was comfortable and warm for winter time. I liked it that even after breakfast hours we still had coffee and hot chocolate available to us (lifesaver for winter time outings). Only concern I had was the lift: only one functioning and very small lift, and it gets full easily and we gotta wait for the next trip. 

Overall, a very pleasant trip and will come again despite the single lift.

title: Good hotel, terrible manager
text: This is a pleasant hotel near to everything. The rooms are small, but clean and functional.  My issue is with the manager.  I have sent him two emails, one while a guest there and one a week later. I have yet to hear directly from him.  I checked in and then realized the room rate had been changed on line.  There was a decrease of almost two hundred dollars. I was told, by the person who checked me in, that after checking in, the rate could not be changed. I asked to speak to the manager, but was advised to email him.  I emailed him. Then I was told he was off for the week and to contact the front desk manager. I did and she said that she could not adjust the rate.  I then waited a week and resent the email to manager. I find it rude to not answer an email. So, I am giving the hotel a five for my stay and a zero to the manger.

title: good location, elevator issues
text: 32 story hotel with 1 working elevator.. be prepared to wait 15-20 minutes to get an elevator. don't call uber or lyft until you're in the lobby.. seriously.. room was good, shower very small. views were awesome! we were on 30th floor.. so if elevators are still an issue, look for a lower floor.

title: First time in NYC
text: Fantastic location a couple of blocks away from Times Square.  The hotel staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was small, as is normal for city centre hotels, but larger enough for our short stay, with all the amenities required.  Breakfast was a little chaotic, but we have experienced this in other city hotels too.  Good offer and really attentive breakfast staff who kept all the food levels topped up, the hotel was really clean and in good decorative order.  I would stay at this hotel again.

title: Strategico e pulito
text: Centralissimo proprio vicino a time square e port authority, nel caso si decida di prendere un bus x andare in altre città. Colazione buona e varia. Stanze un po’ piccole ma molto pulite. Wi-Fi gratuito e presente in tutta la struttura. Lo consiglio

title: Great Value
text: Great value. Excellent breakfast and amazing customer service. Valet is expensive but its NYC. Rooms are neat. Friendly staff. Close to Times Square and the Piers. Perfect for a family getaway. Great!

title: Clean with great breakfast
text: This location had the same quality we expect from hampton with perfect for access to theatre and all the west side offers. Yes the rooms were small, reminded me a lot of Europe. The room and workout room were exceptionally clean. The staff were hardworking, very nice and helpful. There was a large pitcher with fruit water at the front desk which was wonderful as we returned from walking in humid warm weather. I was very impressed with the variety of breakfast offered. Fresh bagels! The only negative was the elevators which seemed slow and crowded at peak times. I would return to this location.

title: Nothing to talk about
text: Not great.  Elevators are slow and the hotel is small.  Not easily seen from the street.  Staff was fine no one talks much.  Rooms are very small.  I would not go back based on my stat at other Hilton properties.

title: Hotel superbe
text:
Hotel très bien situé proche Times squares, personnels très aimables, serviables et d'une grande gentillesses, chambre et salle de bains spacieuse et propre, frigo pratique, petit déjeuner excellent ( gauffres, muffins etc... )
 et café à disposition la journée pratique, la salle de sport est agréable, literie confortable, changement serviettes tout les jours excellent.
Encore merci pour votre accueil, le recommande vivement 
christophe, Fabienne , Manon, Gauthier de FRANCE

title: Hôtel bien situé !
text: Nous nous sommes retrouvés ,par erreur de notre agence ,dans cet hôtel et sincèrement le personnel est sympathique et serviable, les chambres petites pour 4 et pas assez de rangements mais propres, un peu d attente le matin devant les ascenseurs au moment où tout le monde descend déjeuner mais sinon la rue est calme pour dormir et proche de Time Square, de restaurants etc...

title: Great Location
text: The rooms were very very small.  I had a room with two double beds.  There was hardly any room for your luggage.  I must however say it was very clean and that's the biggest concern that I have and they passed the test.

title: Serviço de quarto jogou fora sacolas com comida e dinheiro.
text: Fiquei hospedada por 5 dias no hotel. A localização era perfeita, café da manhã foi ótimo, as acomodações eram bem confortáveis, mas tive problemas. O serviço de quarto do hotel jogou fora, sem minha permissão, sacolas de compras com dinheiro, comida e doces. Nada foi resolvido pelo hotel. Fiquei extremamente decepcionada com o gerente que garantiu que iria me ressarcir até o ultimo dia da minha estadia e não me deu nenhum retorno. Fui embora com prejuízos.

title: Great NYC Vacation
text: Summer in NYC was great with quality and location of hotel adding to the experience.  Nice to have breakfast before busy day & walking distance to the public transit areas. Hotel was quiet and staff was very friendly.

title: Nice hotel
text: The room are small but I think that’s every hotel in Manhattan, the hotel was clean, breakfast good, great customer service, convenient location close to Times Square, we had a view to Empire State, elevators  are fast.

title: Great location but some things need work
text:
First of all, I would like to say that the location of this hotel is very good. While it may not be at the center of all the stores, it most certainly is convenient that many of the stores and theaters are just of walking distance.

Next, let us break down what I think of the hotel. 
1. Rooms - are of a decent size and with confortable beds. In my case, the aircon was not functioning as well as I thought it should as I needed to remove the controller to move it nearer to the airconditioner.
2. Amenities - great business center, small fitness center. I experienced the elevator breaking down on our way up to our rooms. This was bad for me because we went up at around 1 to 2 am already so the elevator traffic isn't as bad and shouldn't be breaking down as much during those times. On the one hand, I liked that the response time to our problem was quick and efficient.
3. Staff - the staff are friendly and helped us through our time in the hotel.

title: Great hotel for the money
text: Great hotel for the money; convenient location to everything.  Front desk staff were very helpful.  Complementary breakfast was excellent.  The room was a little small. I think that the Hampton UN was a larger room.

title: Why did I make this reservation?
text:
This room is only suitable for one person.  The door was stuck so we could not enter.  The toilet paper holder fell off of the wall three times.  The cleaning crew failed to leave enough washcloths for two people, and the breakfast was so bad that we did not bother to eat breakfast at the hotel, and decided to pay for breakfast at a restaurant.

Although I used 95,000 Hilton Reward Points, I would have gladly bypassed this hotel in order to use my points wisely on a more plush establishment.

title: Clean hotel... not so nice location.
text: Clean hotel... not so nice location. Staff very nice but not that knowledgeable. Breakfast was okey. Food was limited. More cereal choices would be nice. A/c unit a bit loud. Room was very clean and the bed was fine.

title: Great stay
text: Polite, helpful staff. Yummy breakfast with many options. Breakfast staff was always present and attentive. Room was clean and housekeeping was polite and cheerful. Located near the subway so easy access to the city. Sometimes we waited for the elevator but find me one in nyc you don’t have to wait for. Concierge was helpful booking travel back to airport. If I hadn’t taken her advice I’m convinced we’d have missed our plane.

title: NYC
text: Great location easy walking distance to office and resturants and time square. Shopping is nearby as well. Valet service and luggage hold is great on check out day. Fruit infused water in the lobby tasted refreshing at end of day.

title: Just Average
text: The hotel staff was the best thing about this hotel. Very nice and helpful. The location is further away from all the places we wanted to visit. We’ve stayed right in the heart of Times Square and that would be our preference in the future. Our room was on the 6th floor right next to the elevators and we had the elevator noise throughout our stay along with the noise of some obnoxiously loud guests in the middle of one night. Rooms are clean but dated and no views to speak of. Breakfast was mediocre but free and appreciated and everyone is correct in saying the elevators take forever and having been right next to them we could hear the other guests frustrations in waiting for them! Will pass on this property next time.

title: In and out
text:
We used this hotel to stay overnight for three nights during an event at the Javits Center. While it was well located, if you ended up at high tide for the elevator, you would wait for a long time to use one of the two that supply this hotel.

We spent the time there in March, which was a big student visit time, and the place was quite crowded.  While the rooms were quiet and comfortable, like you would expect in a Hampton Inn, the time to get to your room if coming back when everyone else was, would mean a long line to wait to get into the elevator.

The room was clean and small but worked for two busy people who did not spend much time in the room.

If you need a place to sleep, not much more, than this is a fine hotel, with Hilton Points, was the only reason I booked it. 

Location is in the middle of the block between 8th and 9th Ave. a walk to anything you might want to do.

title: Family trip
text:
Hotel is nice. Free tea ,
Coffee and water at front desk . Elevators are slow but we were there on 4 th of July week . Rooms are a bit small but heard this is normal for NewYork . Room was clean , bathroom was clean . Free breakfast was good . No fridge or microwave in rooms and no room service that I could see . Overall a good hotel though . Would stay here again .

title: A nice relaxing stay in a bustling city
text: My husband and I recently took an anniversary trip to New York City and stayed here. Everyone was so kind and courteous and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The rooms were a little small, but I think that’s on par with the city- not much room anywhere! We had a king sized bed (also hard to find in NYC) and they even brought us extra pillows. There was a refrigerator and a microwave in our room- not something I had expected to find there. It saved us money because we were able to save leftovers from some of the wonderful restaurants in the area. It is a couple of blocks from the actual Times Square and close to subways. The only criticism and why I didn’t give 5 stars was the housekeeping staff. Our housekeeper wouldn’t leave 2 full sets of towels every day and we had to call downstairs to have someone bring them up. We were almost out of toilet paper, and she didn’t leave another roll, once again, causing us having to bother the front office staff for it. But the front office staff was always very apologetic and took care of things as quickly as they could. I just wish we didn’t have to do that in the first place. But we will certainly stay here in the future!

title: NYC
text:
Very good overall.  Nice breakfast. Clean room. Comfortable bed   Good location   Would stay again
Lots of good things to do relatively close by.  It took a bit of a long time for the cold water to come up to the floor for a late afternoon shower

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: This is an excellent hotel to stay while in NYC! Free hot breakfast was great way to start each day. Location is nice... close to subway and Times Square. A/C worked great especially for how hot it was outside.

title: The room is not the one I booked!!!
text: I booked a king size room, however, when I checked in, I was told and nothing but assigned a double room. When I called to ask what's happening, I was told that I booked a double room. Then I checked the Hilton app, I saw that what they say is right. Interesting, when I check the email booking confirmation, it says I booked a king size room successfully. I don't understand why. And I didn't receive any further explanation.

title: Nice hotel with good service
text: The hotel location is walkable to both the convention center (Jacob Javits) and Times Square for shopping. The staffs are nice and the hotel is always clean. The breakfast and drink is always ready for the guest.

title: Good hotel for family
text:
Hotel is small - 6 rooms per floor with 2 elevators and 31 floors.  Elevators are fast but will make a lot of stops at peak times (mid to late morning).  Breakfast was decent variety and good.  The eating area was always full but only found people having difficulty finding a seat when a large group was eating at once (like a 20-person tour group).  Concierge was helpful; desk employees were helpful and efficient.  It is less than 2 blocks from the blue line, which is at the edge of Time Square.

We found 3 negatives: 1. Room air conditioner did not remove humidity well - keep fan on in bathroom when showering and open window of nice (and door if bad enough for cross breeze).  2. Hall noise was very loud, but room to room noise was very quiet and there were only 6 rooms on floor (so rarely had to put up with noise).  3. Elevator noise was noticeable (at least in room next to elevator) - we got used to the travel up and down, thought it was loud car on the street at first.

I would have no qualms about staying here again if the price were good.

title: Functional Hotel close to NYC Times Square
text:
Hotel is on West 39th Street and is in a great location close to Times square, Penn Station (trains) and Port Authority (buses).
