It was easy to get everyone just by walking down to 8th Ave and using the Metro, Hop-on,Hop off Bus Tour or simply walk.  The hotel was clean although the rooms were small.  We had a family room where the beds almost filled the room.  Bathroom was clean with a good shower.  It was serviced each day and cleaners did a good job. The size of the room meant we mostly lived out of our suitcases.  However you are in New York and large rooms are not to be expected.
We had breakfast each morning.  Breakfast is a buffet of cereal, yogurts, breads, muffins, juices, some fruit and waffles (make them yourself) and some hot food (eggs, bacon, potatoes as an example).  It is a functional breakfast, not as formal as some other hotels but certainly worth the extra you pay for it.  Breakfast is served between 6am and 10am.
Negative point was the lifts - only 2 lifts service the hotel and a 15 minute wait in the morning wasn't uncommon. We got stuck in the lift on our first morning when more people crammed in and so the lift jammed for an uncomfortable 15 minutes.  Worse still, the engineer complained to my family when we were the first on!

title: CENTRALISSIMO
text: Hotel in ottima posizione vicinissimo a Time Square e alla fermata della metro. Camere spaziose nella media di New York,  ottima  pulizia,  cambio biancheria bagno/letto ogni giorno ed estremamente silenziose.  Colazione varia ed abbondante a buffet e possibilità di cenare nel pub a fianco, dove si mangia proprio bene,  mostrando il biglietto dell'hotel che determina uno sconto. Strategico!

title: Ottima posizione
text: L'albergo si trova a due passi da Times Square. La camera dove eravamo, non era grandissima, ma comunque confortevole. E' molto pulito, silenzioso e la colazione a buffet è varia. Il personale è cordiale e simpatico. Consigliatissimo.

title: Pas mal.
text:
Le personnel de cet hôtel est très aimable.
L'hôtel est assez bien placé, près de Port Authority station et Time Square.

Il y a du café et du thé en continue à l'accueil, le petit déjeuner vous pouvez vous faire des waffles.

L'hôtel m'a assez plu mais les draps de mon lit m'ont grattée, et du coup j'ai dormi sur le lit sans me mettre dans les draps. (Je ne sais pas si les femmes de ménage posent les draps sur le sol quand elles changent les draps).

C'est dommage car cet hôtel est sympathique, et je voyais même l'Empire State building de ma chambre.

Egalement, problème d'ascenseur, un seul ascenseur pour tout le monde, il est petit et les employés, femmes de ménage le prennent aussi, vous attendez longtemps.

title: Room to small
text: Excellent but room was to small for price nice location excellent service nice employees excellent customer service but for the price the room was extremely to small I checked out the same night and went to a family member house too too small

title: Smelly
text: Rooms are a bit smelly, but if you’re out and about, I guess it’s not too bad. Everything else was ok, besides the elevator taking forever during morning hours. You could wait up to 15min on the elevator.

title: Strictly average
text: We stayed at this property which is on 39 th street. The only advantage of the hotel is that it's closer to times square. The location is crowded most time of the day. I would recommend people to stay in uptown area near Central park, which is a better area. Hotel is in an old building with old elevator. Many times we had to wait for 15 minutes to get an elevator to come down. A very small reception area with very tiny dining area for breakfast considering the number of rooms it had. One has to wait for atleast 20 minutes to get a seat in the breakfast area. With not many vegetarian options other then fruits and cereals, the breakfast was very ordinary. Also the breakfast was offered in paper plates and cups which is not expected from brand like Hampton by Hilton. I have stayed at Hampton even in central London where the breakfast was very nice comparatively with baked beans, cheese, breads, hash browns for vegetarian guests. Also the plates were not of paper. However the staff helped us in re heating our own food items carried with us. The rooms were very small with no place to move around with luggage. Bathrooms were also very small. Overall our stay was not very comfortable.

title: Small and tall, centrally located and comfortable
text:
We stayed here 1 night pre-cruise.  The hotel is in a great location just a couple of blocks away from the theaters and Times Square.  
The staff were so friendly and helpful, always had smiles on their faces and provided advice for our night on the town.
The hotel is very tall but narrow, so there were only 6 rooms on each floor, with 2 elevators in between.  The hallways were tight especially with a lot of luggage.  There could sometimes be a long wait for the elevators especially during breakfast and at hotel check out time.
The rooms were nicely appointed, clean and everything was in good working condition.  The beds were comfortable and they provided extra pillows upon our request.
The bathroom is very tiny, they even had to carve out the door to get it to shut and not hit the sink.  The shower stall is long but it's width is narrow, we kept hitting our elbows on the shower door and wall handlebar.  
The gym is small, if you use it, go during off hours so there won't be a wait.  
Overall, we enjoyed our time there and would stay there again.

title: Great base for Broadway shows
text: I stayed here for one night after wrapping up a business trip to NYC, and was pleasantly surprised by how quiet this property was, considering how centrally it's located. I had a room on the 22nd floor and maybe heard one siren during the whole night. I had a 2 block walk to my theater, which was perfect as it started to rain during my short walk back. The room itself was quite small (two people would have been a squeeze) but it was perfect for a solo, one night stay. If you are just looking for a base to do some sightseeing and take in a show, this is a great place to pick.

title: Bueno para pasear
text:
El hotel es lindo, las habitaciones y lugares comunes pequeños
Tiene una ventaja, es con desayuno y es muy completo, hasta te envuelven la fruta para que la lleves
En NY hay pocos hoteles con desayuno y a pesar que el hotel es chico, vale la pena si lo vas a utilizar solo para dormir
La ubicacion muy buena

title: SMALL HOTEL
text:
This hotel is in NYC so I wasn’t expecting an inexpensive room and I was not expecting a large room. So paying a bit and the room size was not an issue.

The hotel is SMALL in size. The bedroom, the shower is EXTREMELY tight. 

The biggest issue aside from the wet carpet and leaking shower were the elevators. YOU NEED MORE ELEVATORS IN THIS HOTEL. The place was packed and there were TWO elevators servicing 31 floors. That’s crazy. You wait so long for an elevator, sometimes Having to wait for another one due to them being full. 

I wouldn’t stay here again because of how small/tight the hotel is and the elevator situation. 

Breakfast was ok...but again, not a lot of room to move around bc they hardly even have space for the tables which do not accommodate nearly enough people. It just feels crammed in the all the time. 

The staff was fine. I had no issues with them and found them to be quite nice. I didn’t complain about these issues bc there is really nothing they can do about it, it’s mostly due to location.

title: Housekeeping eh
text: Spent 3 nights here. Lovely hotel in a great location. Housekeeping could have been a little more on top of their game. They left dirty sheets on the bed which should have been changed. That was the only bad experience but it was enough to color my opinion.

title: Nice stay
text: Very nice & helpful staff! Very comfortable beds. Room & bathroom small but both very clean. Fantastic location, near all main attractions. Just 25 minutes from JFK airport. Quiet street. Good choice of restaurants. Overall a good experience!

title: Small but very decent place
text:
I was in New York few days ago and stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South because of its proximity to everything, its good price (compared to many other hotels in that area) and also because it is way quieter at night

The Hotels is about 10 minutes walk from Time Square and close the Lincoln Tunnel and easy access to most of the subway line in NYC.

I really like to have a breakfast in the morning. To my surprise, the eggs were very good and the coffee was ok.

The staff is great and very polite. I would totally go back there.

title: 4 jours en plein centre de Manhattan
text:
Très bien situé, près de time square, en plein centre de Manhattan.
La chambre était un peu petite pour 3, mais pour 3 nuits, on avait pas besoin de plus.
Très bon petit déjeuner. Personnel gentil et agréable.
Chambre propre et bien équipée.

title: Hotel cómodo y bien ubicado
text: Un lindo hotel ubicado en una zona atractiva, la única queja es el ascensor pues siempre tarda demasiado en llegar por la cantidad de personas y los pisos que tiene el hotel, de resto agradable estadía

title: Ottima posizione
text: L’hotel è in posizione centralissima, a due passi da Times Square e dalla fermata della metro. Molto pulito, camere un po’ piccole ma a New York non si può trovare molto altro allo stesso prezzo. Consigliato!

title: Short walk to Times Square
text: We chose this hotel because it was in walking distance of Times Square, Broadway and even to Rockefeller Center--and it offered free breakfast! The room was clean and we had a great view of the Empire State Building. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Would stay again! We've always had good experiences at Hampton hotels.

title: Nice stay but could be improved
text:
Just returned from a stay here June 7th-13th. Nice welcome at check in and was given a room on the 26th floor. Room cost almost $2000 for total stay. A $50 a night charge was held on my credit card. The room itself was average size with 2 double beds squeezed in to it. There was only 1 single wardrobe which was ok for us 2 but if 4 people shared this room they would struggle to put their clothes away and there wasn't much floor space either, but as I understand it, it is common for New York hotels to be not so big. Room had a fridge, safe and a good air conditioning unit. View out of window was the back of another hotel. 

The one thing that hankered our stay was there was a smell in the room that we couldn't fathom where it was coming from. The smell would hit you as you walked in the room but after blasting the air-con for 10 minutes it would go away. I can only describe the smell as being like smelly feet but we packed all our footwear away one day and the smell would still be there when we got back from being out. 

Breakfast was on the ground floor at the back of the hotel. It wasn't a very big breakfast area and was busiest between 9-10am. There was hot and cold options as well as a crepe and waffle maker. I was disappointed to see that there was paper plates and plastic knife, fork and spoons. I didn't expect that for a Hilton branded hotel. 

The most annoying thing about our stay here was the lifts. There are only 2 lifts in this hotel for 32 floors which are also used by housekeeping. Some mornings when everyone is going down for breakfast we would wait in excess of 10 minutes for the lift to arrive on our floor.

Despite our frustrations the hotel was in a good location just off 8th Avenue and a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and Penn Station.

Hotel also provided tea and coffee at eh back 24/7.

Its difficult to judge whether this hotel is value for money as this was my first time in New York and don't know what else to compare it with but I would probably try another hotel if I ever return to New York.

title: Charges
text:
We stayed here for Memorial weekend this year and when checking in they insisted they take $60 per night for the 4 days we stayed there. This they said would be returned once we had checked out with no extras to pay for. We have been home in the UK for over 2 weeks and the $240 has still not been returned to my card???
This is very unsettling and more than annoying

title: Great staying
text: I had a great experience in Hampton. Hotel was really nice and clean, and Staff was friendly and welcoming their guests. Only thing I did not like was the air freshener which was little strong for me (I do not like scents).

title: Very good hotel near to Times Square
text: My sister, daughter and I spent 5 days here recently in order to explore New York.  Great location close to subway, Times Square and Theatre District.  We had a room on the 20th floor with 2 double beds.  Rooms slightly too small for 2 double beds, so we were glad there was only 3 of us.  No where to store cases and not a lot of space between each bed.  However, beds comfortable and room clean.  Breakfast was excellent every morning with a large variety of food and friendly and helpful staff around to replenish.  Didn't have to wait too long for lifts as previously mentioned in reviews but there are only 2 lifts for a small hotel with 32 floors with 6 rooms on each floor.

title: Great Location
text: My friends and i stayed here for memorial day weekend. It's a great location for times square and you are close to 42nd street train station. The front desk was very helpful with info on how to ride the train to different areas especially Clarence. I definitely will stay again. Thxs again for the hospitality

title: Good value near Times Square
text: The location is good, but the rooms are small, though the value is still good for NYC. Staff was friendly and helpful. If there is one downside to this hotel, it is that there are only 2 elevators for a 30 story hotel. This is a problem if you are on a mid-level floor during peak morning hours.

title: High price for low quality
text: very friendly and helpful staff, they changed our room due to the smell and unclean bedcovers. In the 2nd room the smell was not so strong. The room was next to an ice mashine and was very loud. Room was too small, the photos do not reflect the reality. Breakfast was the unhealfiest and worst I ever had in a hotel. breakfast room too small.

title: Last Minute Memorial Day Trip to NYC
text: Great location coming out of the Lincoln Tunnel.  Walking distance to Times Square, Broadway Shows and Johns Pizza!! Super staff, comfortable beds, good complimentary breakfast!  Great choice with easy access to just about everything.

title: Nice room small hotel
text: The room was very nice. The elevator however is a nightmare!! There are only two. It takes about 20 minutes to get on it. I would use the stairs but they don’t go down to the main level so that is kind of scary!! What would you do in case of a fire??? The breakfast area is too small and there is not enough seating at all. Most days we just had to go out for breakfast which was an added expense but the amount of people in the tiny breakfast area is just too much. I realize it’s New York and overall the room was perfect for what we needed to sleep and shower. I have yet to be able to eat breakfast in the hotel due to the massive crowd no matter how late or early you go. You get 3 stars because safety is a #1 priority and stairs should absolutely go to the main level. This would be a better way to get to your room too instead of waiting for a very slow elevator and don’t forget we all know emergencies happen!!

title: Above our expectations
text:
This hotel is great for the visitors to New York who wants a good location but wants to save a little on the bill. Great breakfast buffet. Within 10 minutes walk to times square and 5 minute walk to the nearest subway. I would pick this hotel again for my next visit. Great all around service form all employees that i dealt with. The beds are narrow and most rooms do not offer much floor space. There are only 2 lifts and 32 floors so you can expect some waiting, especially if you run in to a group checking in. Just be patient and you will get to your room. The longest i waited were 5 minutes.
I can only recommend this hotel to any one looking for a great hotel at affordable prices in a fine location

title: Très bon emplacement
text: Tres bon hôtel situé à 3 rues de Times square. Demander de préférence une chambre qui ne donne pas sur la rue. Chambre tres propre avec frigo, coffre fort, petit déjeuner copieux ouvert dès  6 heures pour les lève tôt.  Possibilité de prendre un café ou un thé toute la journée. Personnel très aimable. Rapport qualité /prix comme il faut

title: Great hotel and great location
text: My friend and I visited for a short break last week. The first thing I must say that prior to our trip we had issues with our booking as our flights were cancelled however Henry the front office manager sorted out new dates for us free of charge very quickly. So firstly a bug thank you to Henry.  Hotel was spotlessly clean and the beds were probably the most comfortable I had ever stayed in. Breakfast was very good especially the scrambled egg which was cooked to perfection. Location was the best you could hope for and staff very friendly and helpful. Had a great trip

title: ポートオーソリティのすぐ近く
text: ポートオーソリティのすぐ近くのホテルです。角にセブンイレブンもあります。無料の朝食は毎日メニューが変わります。焼きたてのワッフルも食べられます。スタッフもフレンドリー。今回女子旅で三人で利用しましたが、ダブルベッドが2つの部屋でした。バスタブはありません。シャワーも固定式です。部屋はかなり狭いです。お部屋にコーヒーメーカー、電子レンジがあります。コーヒーは毎日補充してくれますが、下のレストランに行くと24時間コーヒーは無料で飲めます。

title: Great location
text: Clean room, nice staff, decent breakfast, walkable to Times Square & Theater District. Elevator a bit slow, but will definitely come back. Enjoyed our stay, a good place for families and a good deal for NYC.

title: Mediocre for any Hotel especially a Hampton Inn
text: Hotel is extremely tired. There is a constant  musty damp humid smell in the rooms that never goes away but I guess you eventually get used to. Rooms are typical NYC small but the furnishings leave a lot to be desired with scratches on the frame of the mirror and a stained desk chair. In addition, I left one day at 930 and housekeeping hadn’t made up my room at 330, I called the front desk, left again and came back and they were cleaning so I stood in the hallway as there was no way I was going back down to the lobby, which brings me to my final point. How a hotel with 32 floors and 6 rooms per floor can only have 2 elevators. Be prepared to wait A LOT for an elevator, I was on the 27th floor, I recommend a lower floor. Staff was fine but there are too many other hotels to stay in a place like this again. Although it maybe cheaper than others, the aggravation with the elevators and condition of the rooms makes spending more money on a better hotel worth it. I mentioned my housekeeping problem when I checked out and the front desk person claimed that they didn’t start cleaning until 10...if that was the case then it should’ve been taken care of and she made it sound like my request was unreasonable...

title: Disappointed
text: No greeting upon arrival and only one person to help check in. Room was humid and had smell of mildew or mold. AC didn't help. Bathroom was infested with gnats not overwhelming in number but there should not be insects in the room. Breakfast food was subpar. Runny eatery eggs and old fruit.

title: BEWARE - bugs, no sheets, couldn’t pull out bed, Due to their mistake checked us out Day early
text:
After making reservation for one night, several weeks before our stay, we called to add a second night to our original one night stay.  On the phone, the clerk fully understood that we were now staying two nights.  Morning after first night, on our way out the door at 10am, they informed us we must switch rooms and second room was not available.  Again, this was THEIR mistake.  They told us another family had just shown up and paid for 3 nights and wanted our specific room.  Instead of inconveniencing the second family (many hours before their check-in) they made us go back to our room and pack up our stuff.  This fiasco caused us loss of at least an hour of our sight-seeing and a lot of unnecessary stress.  I left my number for Henry, the front desk manager, who never called me.  The compensation we got for this inconvenience - three $1 ponchos and three bottles of water.  The only advantage we got to moving to the much smaller room was that the flying gray gnats, stained carpet, and bad smell of the first room were not present in the second room and we were more comfortable in a king bed than the two doubles.  Both rooms had comforters that were pilling (showing you how old they were).  We couldn’t use the queen pull out in Room 209 because the furniture blocked it from opening and, after we moved the heavy couch, they never brought us the sheets for it after we called the front desk and they said they’d be right up with them.  We had far superior experiences at Marriott’s Fairfield Inns.

Stay here at your own risk of ruining your trip.

title: Very Tiny
text: There were 6 rooms on each floor which took a while for me to get used to. My room on the 30th floor had a great view and was quiet. The premium internet wasn't the greatest but I was still able to use my Roku in my room. The breakfast was standard and I love the fact Hampton Inn has waffles. The staff was great and very much on top of things and it was nice to see staff deep cleaning the carpet in the hallway. The room was expensive in general especially when compared with other parts of the country, but when focused to Manhattan it was actually a little less expensive than similar sized rooms in the same part of Manhattan.

title: Bonne situation
text:
positif : bonne situation. personnel a l'écoute. petit déjeuner copieux. fruits, thé, café à disposition toute la journée
négatif : 2 ascenseurs seulement !!!!! nous avons attendu jusqu a 25 min. taille des chambres.

title: Looking forward
text: Really looking forward to staying but please beware folks..if you get a problem with your date they won't help at all. Flight company cancelled our flight and changed our dates. We now have to spend our last day in the airport cos we can't afford the extra night - even though we won't be there for the first night...... Very upset.

title: Albergo pulito e comodo.
text:
A due passi da Times Square. Vicino alla metropolitana, per andare ovunque in città.
Albergo pulito, silenzioso e colazione spettacolare.
Il wifi in camera prende molto bene.
La camera non era molto spaziosa, ma a NYC é la regola un po' ovunque. Consigliatissimo.

title: Management
text:
We stayed at the Hampton TS South a few weeks ago for a long weekend of "touristing". Upon checking out early Monday morning, I realized that I left my nicest, newest sport coat at a bar down the street the previous night.  Problem: the bar didn't open until much later in the day, and we had to be at the airport at 7am to catch our flight back home.  (I guess I'll just have to write it off, right?)  
We had a couple of hours to kill during a layover, so I called the bar to see if they even had the coat . . . and when someone finally answered the phone, they confirmed that they did, but they would only hold it for someone to pick up.
I called the hotel and spoke with Henry Lattarulo, the front office manager.  He told me that if I emailed him a prepaid FedEx shipping label, he would personally retrieve it from the bar and ship it to me.  
Well, Henry made good on his word, and I received my sportcoat last week in perfect condition.  How's THAT for outstanding customer service?!?

title: Padrão Hampton
text:
Sou muito fã dos Hotéis da linha Hampton Inn. Seguem um padrão de qualidade e conforto com bom custo-benefício.
No caso do Hampton Inn Times Square South, o mesmo fica muito próximo do burburinho de nyc. O quarto, apesar de pequeno, é super aconchegante e limpo. O staff é cordial, café da manhã muito bom, com diversas opções. 
Para os hóspedes são disponibilizados vários tipos de bebida o dia todo no hall - café, leite, chá. Além de frutas. 
Considero que o Hampton Inn próximo à ONU tem uma qualidade um pouco superior, mas de toda forma este vale a pena, e tem preços mais interessantes também.

title: Hampton Times Square
text: This Motel was awesome.  The rooms were clean and neat.  The staff was the best I have ever experienced.  We were concerned since this was our first trip to NYC but they made the trip memorable.  They were there for all our needs and so accommodating.  We would definitely recommend this motel to anyone going to NYC.  It is within walking distance of times square.  Broadway Shows and anything else NYC you want.

title: Excellent
text: We moved to this hotel having been originally booked in an awful one on 7th Avenue.  The difference was amazing.  We were welcomed to the hotel with smiles.  Our bags were taken (free of charge) to hold until it was time to check in and we were invited to breakfast even though we were not yet residents.  We stayed for 4 nights. The room was clean, very comfortable beds with good heater/air conditioning unit.  Bathroom was clean with plenty of towels, etc.  The staff were all very helpful and the concierge was great booking shows, etc. for us.  Tea/coffee/hot chocolate and fruit available 24/7.  Just a 5 minute walk from Times Square this was a great location as only a 10 minute walk to the river also.  Hells Kitchen about 10 minutes away also with lots of restaurants.  I cannot speak too highly of this hotel

title: An Option To Consider
text: Don't be scared off by the location a block south of the Port Authority bus terminal, if you'd like to get a better deal on a hotel room.  Just keep in mind that this tall, skinny building means that the higher your room, the longer your elevator wait.

title: Bad Service
text: I booked 4 rooms in Sept. of 2017 for a stay in April of 2018. When I arrived at 1PM in the afternoon for my one double and three single bed rooms, only one was ready so we put all of our luggage in the one room which was a double and said we were going out and wouldn't  be back till late for the other three rooms. When we got back at around 10 PM the night person said all we have left is two single and one double because we were the last ones to check in that night when clearly we were there just after lunch. He was very rude and said I don't have the rooms you wanted nothing I can do. I showed him the reservation from months ago and he said you shouldn't have checked in so late, are you kidding. We had the breakfast one morning and then the whole place was shut down for renovations, no one warned us of this. You had to walk down the street to a pub for breakfast with sometimes 30 min wait in line.

title: Great location
text: It was in a great location. Just a few minutes from Times Square.  But the room was very very small. There was a small cabinet.  Room was ok for 2 people for a few days may be.  We were in the front side and in 26 th floor. It was fun. We had an Empirestate view from the edge.  There were only 2 elevators;  we have waited long to go up or down.

title: Nice Night at Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South
text:
We stayed at the Hampton/Times Square South on our trip to see Hamilton. We chose it for convenience, as it is midway between Penn Station and the Richard Rogers Theatre. It was about a seven block walk from Penn Station. Though this may seem like a trek to some, especially carrying a bag, it was probably faster to walk than taking a cab, Uber, or Lyft, given traffic. Likewise, it was faster to walk to the theatre.
The room itself was small, and the only available option for the rate we booked was a room with two beds, which made it seem a bit more cramped, but for a night it was fine. Compared to the Hampton/Times Square North, where we have stayed previously, the South building is taller (39 floors versus 11 or so), but narrower (6 or 7 rooms per floor). Also, we were on the second floor, but had to wait for the elevator as the stairway does not have an exit on the first floor.
The breakfast area is nice, and the breakfast was up to Hampton standards. The staff were uniformly cordial and helpful, in the breakfast area as well as the front desk.

title: Terrible, terrible custom service and violation of written policy
text:
I had booked a room for three nights at this hotel. There was not requirement for a minimum stay and the confirmation I got said I could cancel or change the reservation up until May 2nd at no costs. My travel plans changed and I need to check in a day later than original planned, so I only needed 2 or the 3 nights. I called to modify the reservation yesterday (4/17/18), and they refused.  They said that the hotel was full and that I could not modify my reservation because they would lose money for a night.  I spoke to customer service and they said the same thing.  Note, I was not asking for any night I had not originally booked, I just wanted one less night.  The confirmation policy I received said nothing about this and had no minimum staff critiria, and it is clear violation of their statement that said the following:  

Rate Rules and Cancellation Policy:
•	Your reservation is guaranteed for late arrival.
•	If your plans change please let us know – it’s free to cancel or update your reservation by 11:59 PM local hotel time on May 02, 2018.

I ended up having to cancel my reservation and book at another hotel for 2 nights. It is the WORST customer service I have ever experience, and I am a Hilton Honors member. If this is how they treat their frequent customers, I can only imagine how they treat less frequent customers.

title: muy buena ubicacion. desayuno bastante completo. excelentes camas. Buena atención y limpieza
text:
todo de acuerdo a lo ofrecido. ni siquiera hemos tenido problemas en el ascensor como he leido muchas opiniones.
Muy buena opción para NYC. Limpio y cómodo. Las habitaciones, si bien pueden parecer pequeñas tienen todo lo necesario

title: Disappointing
text: This particular Hampton is not the normal Hampton standard. Carpet squares lifting posing a tripping hazard, room extremely small, hallways very narrow, 2 elevators that are very slow. Oh, and my city view was of the side of the next hotel.

title: Nice Stay!
text: This hotel is located not far from Times Square (maybe 5-6 blocks) so was very convenient to that, subways and the Convention Center which was a focal point of our visit.  While it was very full during our stay with several groups there, I must commend the staff at this hotel for their consistent effort to minimize any issues with accessing the elevator upon check-in, accommodating requests at the front desk, clean rooms, nice dining facilities with fresh, hot and good food (breakfast is what I ate daily).  Also, the complimentary coffee was greatly appreciated particularly because it was quite cold there last week so it was nice to have that available.  For the value of this hotel chain in comparison to what can be seen as very pricey at other establishments, this property definitely met and exceeded my expectations and I would stay here again.  Very accessible to restaurants and bars too.

title: Top
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, au calme et à proximité de tout. Transports (bus,métro) 3 min à pieds, restaurants, supermarché 7eleven...Times square a même pas 10 min à pieds.
Hôtel très propre et literie au top.
Petit déjeuner correct et boissons chaudes disponible la journée.
Personnel à l’écoute et très agréable.
Service de bagagerie gratuit disponible le dernier jour.
Pour avoir passé du temps à chercher parmi toutes les offres d’hôtels sur New York dans cet game de prix nous ne sommes vraiment pas déçus et nous le conseillions sans hésitation.

title: Very dissapointing spring break
text: Room are overcrowded,  hallway was to small, elevator too slow, overcrowded all the time. Brand new but None  functioning ice/water machine. Ask for room with a view but in stead view of construction and garbage piled street

title: Lacked quality of service. Two elevators for 30+ floors. Housekeeping didn't clean the room
text: I was disappointed with the overall service. The elevator system was a nightmare. Large high school group dominated the spaces such as the breakfast room and the lobby. One day, housekeeping skipped my room and were notified with no attention to correct the matter.

title: Not up to Hampton Inn Quality
text:
We stay frequently at Hampton Inns and the Times Sq. South does not meet the usual standard. It’s an older hotel and while it does appear to have been renovated, the “updated” look cannot disguise its overall below average quality. The walls are paper thin. Despite being on a higher floor, it sounded like the traffic was outside my window all night long. I was glad to be away from the elevator, but each floor has only 6 rooms and we were cursed with a noisy ice machine in the hallway. The heating unit was also noisy, as was the fridge. 
The room itself was extremely small, although it was clean with most of the usual amenities,i.e. fridge, coffee maker, nice TV, toiletries, etc. They only provide paper coffee cups in the room, not glass or plastic, which is not optimal for drinking wine.
The two elevators cannot efficiently handle all the guests. Several times we waited 10 minutes to board. The breakfast area also can not accommodate the number of guests, so hit it early or you may not find a table.
On the plus side, the staff was friendly and helpful and the location was very good, walking distance to the theaters and many fantastic restaurants.
We come to NYC several times a year and this was our first stay at this hotel. It will likely be our last.

title: Muy buen hotel!!!
text:
Me hospede una semana en el hotel, esta muy bien ubicado, con varias alternativas para comer en la zona, el personal muy atento, el desayuno muy bien con variedad de cosas, y van cambiando cada día.
Nos dieron una habitación con 2 camas dobles en lugar de una sola, pero no fue problema.
El único detalle que tiene es que son 30 pisos con 2 ascensores, pero nunca espere mas de 5 minutos
Volveria sin dudarlo.

title: Excellent location, need to work on service
text: Excellent location, OK complimentary breakfast. Great internet service. Construction site across the street made it impossible to sleep. Mixed up our reservation and we had to wait for almost 2 hours to go to our room.

title: Hampton Inn Times Square
text: The hotel is located in the garment district adjacent to Times Square. The staff was excellent and made my family and I feel appreciated for staying at the hotel.  The complimentary breakfast was good and the Wi-Fi worked well.  The rooms were small but clean and had a refrigerator which came in handy (bought some cheesecake from Junior's and was able to save some to bring home). Overall, an exceptional experience at this hotel with staff that truly seemed to care about the guests.

title: Nice Stay.
text:
We were greeted promptly and even though we were a bit early, our room was ready. We were on the 2nd floor and easily walked up and down to access our room. No waiting for the elevator. 

The rooms are small by Hampton Inn standards but not for the location near Times Square. In fact, the location is great for accessing the sites we wanted to visit and it is very near the subway. The room was clean and tidy. The breakfast is very Hampton Inn and that's what you expect. It was fine and plentiful.

All in all, a fine place to stay and we recommend it.

title: ❤️NYC
text: Nice reasonable room near Times Square. The staff is responsive and helpful. They assisted us with directions to the areas we wanted to visit. Check out time is noon. Parking is $80. They do serve a hot breakfast.

title: Typical NYC room
text: One must keep in mind that most hotels in NYC offer smaller rooms than usual.  This hotel offers clean and very quiet rooms with standard NYC sized rooms.  What's interesting is that this property has 32 floors and only 6 rooms per floor!  Surprising to come out of the elevator and have 3 rooms to the right and 3 to the left!  Lot's of power outlets to charge laptops, phones, etc.  There are 2 parking garages across the street - $70 for overnight parking if no special rate.  Walking distance to restaurants, Times Square, etc.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Muy buena ubicación, cerca de todo, el hotel muy limpio y cómodo a pesar de haber pagado por una habitación pequeña. El personal super atento tienen gente que habla español y los que no lo hacen, intentan comprenderte. El desayuno muy completo y esta incluido en el precio de la habitación. Excelente todo!

title: Good location, bad hotel
text:
I am a regular Hampton visitor because of the Hilton Honors program.  This hotel is in a good location and the price is fairly good for the location.  It states the hotel was recently renovated which is true.  The rooms are comfortable and clean and up to the normal standard.  However, please be aware that the entire time we were there, only one elevator was working.  We were on the 30th floor and had to wait up to 10 minutes for an elevator.  It was also really frustrating when people staying on the 2nd floor would use the elevator.  Everyone else would give them dirty looks when they got on or off.  There were large groups of kids staying there and the line to get on the elevator went out the front door at one point!  As for the digital key, I used it once and then it stopped working so we had to wait 10 minutes to go back down, get a regular key, and then wait 10 minutes to go back up.  The front desk was very nice and asked if I was 3-5 feet away from the door when I tried to use the key.  Um yeah, there are only 5 rooms on each floor so as soon as you get off the elevator, you are 3-5 away.  Also, all the rooms will hear the elevator all night long.  It is LOUD!  We didn't hear anyone from any other rooms though.
The breakfast was actually pretty good for Hampton standards and the staff was attentive which is usually the case wherever we stay.  I just think the elevator issue would be a serious deal breaker for most people.

title: Poor service,Small room!
text: Room was very small, like we couldn’t even use my daughters pack n play crib in the room. She had to sleep in bed with us. And they are double beds... Concierge had no idea about any thing, I was wondering if he actually worked for the hotel.

title: Friendly & helpful staff, clean rooms, very convenient to many places of interest
text: I came to NYC recently with a group of high school kids, many of whom had never been to NYC. The hotel was perfect for our stay. It is conveniently located and we were able to walk to so many places - Times Square, Broadway, the subway, shopping, street vendors (food and merchandise), the garment district, etc. It is on somewhat of a side street and a bit quieter, but there is still some noise - part of the NYC experience! The staff was always very friendly and always asking if we needed anything. There was a concierge to give us suggestions on places to visit and restaurants. You could buy snacks and drinks at the hotel, but so many street vendors and restaurants were within two blocks of the hotel so that you had a variety of food available. The hotel breakfast was wonderful - eggs, sausage, waffles (make your own), cereals, fruit, yogurt, pastries and breads, juices - there was something for everyone and is included in the price of the room. There is a coffee/tea/hot chocolate station 24/7. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The two elevators are very fast, but you can have a bit of a wait if a group is using them to come or go. Another thing I really loved is that they have more than enough outlets and chargers in the rooms for phones, computers, etc. I definitely will stay there on my next visit to NYC.

title: Great location!
text: Spent 3 nights there and the staff couldn't have been friendlier. The breakafast was good with plenty to choose from. The room was on the smaller side but adequate with all amenities necessary for a great stay. If definitely stay there again.

title: Hampton inn standard
text: La struttura è situata affianco a Times Square. Lo standard è tipico del Hampton inn. Ho soggiornato in una giornata ventilata e nei piani altri si sentivano spifferi a iosa. Buon rapporto qualità prezzo per New York.

title: Clean and quiet
text:
Rooms are small, but average for NYC. But the HVAC was the quietest I’ve had in a long time. WiFi was easy to connect and the night light was a nice touch. 
Breakfast was typical Hampton, well stocked, nothing elaborate. 
Overall very good value.

title: Great Location and what you expect from a Hampton Inn
text: Very pleased to find this hotel in the heart of the garment district. We had a good sized room for Manhattan. The breakfast was varied over the five days we were there and the staff was very friendly. We like to stay at Hampton Inns and this one was totally as expected - will be back!

title: très bon hotel
text: je suis allée avec ma sœur, 1 semaine au mois d'octobre, tout s'est bien passé, hôtel très propre, personnel très gentil, petit déjeuner copieux ce qui permet de tenir la journée. possibilité de prendre du café, thé et chocolat tout au long de la journée, bien agréable après une bonne journée de marche.

title: Great place!
text: This is a great location. Super easy to get around from this location. Great friendly staff! Clarence was so helpful with everything we asked of him. He is a great source here and friendly as well.  All the staff was very friendly. Breakfast can be crowded at times and not a lot of choices but still good

title: Hotel honesto e bem localizzado
text:
Estive nesse hotel por uma semana no mês de fevereiro, quando cheguei, achei meio confuso e pequeno demais, já que a recepção estava lotada, porém, após conhecer melhor o mesmo, fiquei muito satisfeita.
O quarto é super confortável, com cafeteira, que acho bem importante.
O café da manhã é muito bom e os funcionários bem simpáticos, sem contar a localização que é excelente.O que eu achei bem legal também, é que deixam à disposição dos hóspedes, café quentinho, bem importante com o frio que estava fazendo e maçãs bem fresquinhas.Recomendo e voltarei com certeza!

title: CEO
text: The service by Eliana was amazing. She went above and beyond to help us with a reservation issue the was not the fault of the hotel. Words can not describe the magic she performed but we are deeply thankful. 5 stars!!!!!

title: Excellence!
text: Fantastic location, excellent customer service and wonderful breakfast! I highly recommend this hotel. The room was decent sized for NYC and the bedding was exceptional. The helpful staff made it an awesome stay.

title: Good hotel with unprofessional staff
text: We stayed there in Hampton Inn for 3 days(02th-06th March).Our room no was-1101.Though the  location of the hotel was very good but the rooms are very small.They have only two elevators and it was a great problem for us during the busy hours. Breakfast was ok.  One thing I want to share that I have lost my wrist watch in that room.  One lady of housekeeping(fair and fat) had cleaned our room and after that I lost it.So it was bad experienced for us  in Hampton Inn.

title: Nice place
text: I arrived with friends several days before a conference and we stayed two nights at this hotel. It is a lovely hotel and have great service and very polite and professional employees. The service was very good. I will definitely recommend it to my friends. The hotel is near the subway and has restaurants nearby.

title: Clean, comfortable, and great staff
text:
My trip to New York was extended for a night due to a snowstorm. I couldn't stay at my original location so I booked a night at this hotel. I made the trek (about 10 blocks) in the rain/snow and arrived halfway soaked well before check in. 

Upon arrival, the staff were super helpful about checking in my luggage while my room was being prepared. Alex, who took my luggage, even went out of his way to get me a towel and made sure I knew where the hot beverages were. All my other interactions with the staff were great. 

The room was extremely clean, the bed was comfortable, and everything was up to date. Moreover, the location is excellent; it's within walking distance to Times Square but the street is relatively quiet. 

I'm so glad I ended up there (there weren't many options left). Would definitely stay at this location again.

title: Dear God No! The pics nothing like real life.
text:
Despite MAJOR reservations, I stayed here for what was supposed to be 4 nights for a conference. Our parent company put everyone up in this hotel, and I suspected it would be bad but didn't want to be that diva who insisted no staying somewhere else .... so I convinced myself it wouldn't be that bad.

IT WAS WORSE.

First of all, I have NO idea where the photos you see on TripAdviser came from (at least, those provided by the property). Even though they aren't much to look at, they're a lot better than what I got. I checked out a night early and went to The Andaz because I just couldn't handle this anymore. This was my experience:

1. You could LITERALLY TOUCH THE DOOR TO MY ROOM when standing INSIDE the elevator. No.
2. The drapes were a shiny dark purple. The carpet was purple. The weird, stained decorative blanket thing on my bed was purple. No, no, no.
3. There were weird stains and marks on everything. I wouldn't exactly call it dirty, but it was worn and just felt ... not good.
4. No mini fridge or beverages or room service. Not that I would have gotten room service at a place like this, but still. 
5. The front desk staff isn't rude, but they aren't exactly helpful. It's like...they'll put up with you if they have to.
6. I got a call to my room late at night from someone claiming to be the front desk, saying that there was an error with my credit card and they needed a new number. I almost gave it to them since they called my room directly, and last I checked, you can't dial a hotel room direct (don't you have to go through the front desk)? At the last second I thought better of it, hung up, and called the front desk to tell them what happened. Their response was: "Oh, yeah, that's been happening...." then just kind of trailed off. What?!?! It seems like this must be some sort of scam among employees since the phones are supposedly closed-circuit. COME ON!

Ugh yuck no thanks. I don't care who is paying for this room in the future or how much other hotels are - I won't stay here.

title: Settimana stupenda
text: Salve ho soggiornato una settimana in questo hotel con la famiglia dal 28 febbraio al 5 marzo . Ottimo hotel, pulitissimo, molto cordiali, tutti gentili. Al mattino ottima e super colazione c'era di tutto. Quanto bastava per saltare pranzo. Posizione centrale, si attraversa e si è subito sulla metro. A 200m. Dal central park. Ragazzi ke dire ottimo tutto. Camere molto pulite e profumate.  Asciugamani puliti tutti i giorni come altrettanto le lenzuola. Grazie di cuore a tutti lo staf

title: Great location and nice for the price
text: As other have noted, this hotel is very close to the subway, theaters, and all the action of Times Square but on a quiet block.  It is also close to the less touristy restaurants on 9th ave and not far from Madison Square Garden and 34th street shopping.  The rooms have been renovated and look great with lots of outlets although I found the beds a bit too firm.  Walk in showers only.  Included breakfast was convenient and decent but a little stressful with so many people in such a small area.  Staff does a good job keeping up with it though.  Overall staff was excellant as was the general manager who clearly takes pride in leading such a friendly and helpful staff. Elevators were generally okay but we did have a 10+ minute wait for elevators one day and the location of the elevators on the first floor is terrible - lots of flow issues due to how the building had to be built in that space.

title: Inn Manhattan and comfortable
text: I had never been to New York, so I booked this Hotel taking a chance. What a nice surprise. The hotel has been recently remodeled. It is nice and clean. The Hotel staff are great. There is a breakfast included and it is a nice way to start your day. The supplies are constantly replenished with the people looking after this very friendly and helpful. It is located mid-street so I don't believe it is as noisy as some hotels might be closer to the "action". We were able to walk to all the places we wanted to visit. There are hotels closer but we really enjoyed ourselves here. Also, a special thank-you to Yariela - the check-in person. She was great! (I hope I have the right spelling) A fantastic stay. There are no tubs - but the beds we found were very comfortable.

title: Ideal pour passer quelques jours à NYC sans se ruiner, en etant bien placé.
text:
Nous avons passé 4 nuits dans cet hôtel pour un week-end prolongé à New-York.L'hôtel est étroit (il ne comporte que 6 chambres max par étage) sur 32 étages.
Les chambres de base peuvent accueillir jusqu'à 4 adultes, avec des lits 120. Elles sont petites, et il est difficile de loger ses valises. La salle des petits déjeuners ne comporte pas beaucoup de tables au regard du nombre de clients. Il est donc assez compliqué de trouver une place vers 8h/8h30. Les propositions salées (omelettes, saucisses, etc ...) ne sont pas très variées mais changent tous les jours. Cet hôtel dispose d'une salle de sport (mais je en sais pas si elle est correcte ou pas)
A quelques rue de Times Square, cet hôtel n'est certainement pas le plus luxueux, mais pour passer prendre un douche et dormir il est amplement suffisant, l'intérêt d'aller à New-York est de visiter

title: Newer Hotel, Comfortable and Affordable
text:
This is a brand new hotel with they typical Hampton quality. Rooms were of modest size which is expected in New York. It was very clean and well cared for and the staff was excellent. Wifi worked well but you have to log in at least daily which is a pain. Breakfast was the typical crowded affair with very average food. I wouldn't bother with it when there are so many other options nearby.

The location was great, a few blocks from Penn Station, Times Square and Herald Square. Close by the subway and bus terminal. Many food options within an easy walk. Overall a good place to stay.

title: Excellent staff, very good choice for the area, reasonably priced
text: Yes, the rooms have recently been renovated, wide screen TV's, refitted bathroom, carpet, etc., etc., with a high rate for  cleanliness.  The standouts of this King Room were the excellent  heating/air conditioning system, the bed, and the bed linens/pillows. Hampton spent some money on the first rate comforter, sheets and pillows in this room.  A very welcome addition and very much appreciated  The  only downside was it seemed to take forever to get hot water in both the sink and shower early in the morning.

title: Wonderful experience all around
text: This was my mum & I 1st time in New York, and this hotel was excellent in all aspects, 2 double bed room was very comfortable, only fault is no bath which would be useful to have a nice long soak in, in the evenings after all day walking, breakfast was excellent with varied hot choice changed daily. Within walking distance to times square, esb and totr. Also nearby is Port Authority and subway connections. Staff were wonderful, especially one of the breakfast staff (not sure of his name but he has dark hair and wears glasses?), it was lovely to see a very friendly, cheerful smiley worker who always greets guests with a "good morning" and always asked my mum and me if we were ok, and to have a good day. I would recommend staying here and I wouldn't hesitate in booking this hotel again. Thanks Hampton Inn Times Square South for part of a wonderful 1st stay in New York!!

title: Great Hotel
text: Would definitely stay here again! The staff were very helpful, the breakfast was amazing, the rooms were comfortable and the location was perfect distance to time square. Special check out accommodatations were made for us.

title: Wonderful experience for 1st time New York City visit
text: I had to go to New York City for  work. First time there. The hotel was fantastic! Yes, the rooms aren't as large as in other places across the country, but it's Manhattan! Room was large enough for king bed and wide aisles on three sides. Plenty big. Staff was great & so was food!

title: Great experience all around!!
text:
Hotel is in a great location to see Time Square and any other tourist destinations in the area. Close proximity to Subway connections if looking to travel by subway. 

Rooms were very clean, staff was friendly, and the hot breakfast in the morning was always great each time we went - they provide various options and change it daily.

Using the amp to check in was great and they have a good check out time too (noon). Only thing is there beds were more on the FIRM side for sure and took adjustment.

I work in Hospitality and have high expectations, this hitel met them!

title: Generally a positive stay
text: Great location and felt completely safe in the neighborhood, amazing how an area can change in 20 years. Front desk staff was very pleasant. Rooms were larger than I expected and it was clean. As mentioned in other reviews, be aware that the elevator wait time can be significant during busy times. Breakfast room was a bit small at the times we chose to eat. Food was standard Hampton breakfast. The real issue was hallway noise through the door sweeps. I have had a e-mail discussion with the general manager about the fact that air gaps exist in the door sweeps and it seemed to let in a lot of hallway noise. We had almost no noise from adjoining rooms so wall insulation was pretty good. 7/11 store nearby for snacks including by the bottle of craft beer. Very good value in January.

title: Gem of a hotel in excellent location
text:
This was a great little find, from the complimentary breakfast to 24h tea/coffee we really couldn’t fault it.

The room were fresh, clean and tidy (not at all dated like some hotels).  They are quite small but nicely compact as oppose to squashed.  Space is well utilised.

Breakfast was great, as was the complimentary tea/coffee station.

The staff all seemed lovely but we didn’t really have to speak to them as everything was great.

Location is great, well located for Times Square but also great for the lovely, cheaper and more authentic eateries on 9th Avenue.

Would definitely stay here again.

title: loved it!
text: good location, price range and overall very good hotel.rooms were very clean, vending and ice on accesisble floors. complimentary breakfast, coffee and hot chocolate 24 hrs. Definately will come back.

title: Friendly staff
text: This hotel is very close too times square and the subways staff are very friendly and helpfull breakfast and the free drinks though out the day are very nice beds very comfortable but we stayed in a family room and they are too small for 2 beds in them nice views from our room tho 9nky thing is don't think the room was cleaned well before we came as there was a dirty pair of lady's pants down the side of one of the beds

title: City break
text: Recently stayed here for a four night break. Very good safe location with a few bars & restaurants nearby, 7/11 store on corner close to hotel,short walk to Times Square. Room was big enough for two adults, very clean and light. Toiletries in bathroom too. I like the Hampton inn hotels because of the little extras they give you like free breakfast buffet in the mornings, which was very good, free coffee in the lobby, newspapers & apples. Staff were all very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay here again, I did find New York very expensive this time compared to my last few visits. But still had a great time.

title: Great base for sightseeing trip to New York
text: This hotel makes an ideal base for getting around. The staff were all so friendly and helpful and the breakfast was great.  We found both the bedroom and bathroom to be of adequate size and to be well equipped.  We enjoyed our stay so much that we will definitely choose to stay here next time we visit New York.

title: In for N.Y. Times Travel Show again
text: 2nd time here. Would stay again. Great location for shows or Convention Center, bus or train. Staff is great. Breakfast is decent and plentiful. Love the coffee. Rooms are small but Still very comfortable.

title: Great value in a great location!
text: Our room was a decent size and clean. We arrived early and were allowed early check in. Complimentary breakfast was decent. Staff was friendly and attentive. Used our AARP discount. Would defiantly stay here again.

title: Disappointed Hilton Gold member
text: I can’t say enough about the staff.  The staff at this hotel are so sweet and friendly.  They are working with what they’ve got.  They are the only reason I’m not giving it a lower rating because I don’t want to bring them down.  Also, the breakfast was really great so that compensated a bit also for my disappointment in the room.  The staff at breakfast, Jessica and company, and the front desk, Clarence (who was always working, every shift it seemed!) really made this stay more enjoyable than it would otherwise have been.  Also on the plus side, there was a microwave and refrigerator in the room.  Instead of drawers, there are nice wire baskets.  Nice touch. The problem is That this building was not meant to hold this many rooms!  The rooms are the smallest I have ever stayed at in my life. Even smaller than some European cities.  You can’t even move in the bathroom.  No counter. Your items go on a shelf over the toilet and you hope they don’t fall in.  It was clean, though.  The beds are full, not queen.  Too small for a couple to share. As a Hilton gold member, I used many points (I think 70k) for this two night stay. I just don’t think it was worth all those points since I saw online they were only charging something like $92 per night on travel websites. Also, as a gold member, I was pretty disappointed that we had a view of a wall.  I asked the woman when I checked in if it was at least a nice room and she said it would be.  I knew it would be small, I just didn’t know how small. Location was good, but one last thing I wish I heeded...I read all the reviews about the elevator and for some reason I thought they were exaggerated. Well, they weren’t.  You can wait up to 10 minutes, then when it comes it’s full so you have to wait for the next one.  God forbid you forget something in your room like my son did....he ran back up 25 flights to get his convention tag because we waited 12min for the elevator.  If you get a good price and you just need somewhere to sleep and have breakfast, this is fine.  I know I spelled out a lot here, but the basic problem was the size of the room and slow elevator.

title: Perfekte Lage
text: Insgesamt empfehlenswert. Die Lage ist perfekt, ein idealer Ausgangspunkt für die Sehenswürdigkeiten. Die Lobby ist einladend, das Personal beim Check In sehr freundlich, beim Check Out hätten wir uns über etwas mehr Kooperation bzgl. eines Late Check-Out's gefreut, am Ende hat es aber gepasst. Der Frühstücksbereich wird sauber gehalten. Es gibt rund um die Uhr Kaffee und Tee. Die Sitzplätze sind knapp bemessen. Die Aufzüge (2) reichen zu den Stoßzeiten nicht und es kommt zu Wartezeiten. Das Zimmer ist nicht riesig, ich habe in New York aber auch schon deutlich kleinere Zimmer erlebt. Bad auch ok und sauber. Das Bett fand ich sehr bequem. Klimaanlage hat zum Heizen nicht ganz optimal funktioniert.

title: Small rooms but I’m told to be expected for NYC
text: Super close to time square, we walked almost everywhere. We could walk to Time Square, Bryant Park, our Broadway show and multiple dinner and bar locations. Warning he showers are tiny! We could barely turn around without hitting the walls.

title: Lovely place
text: Great service! Great location! Lovely rooms with views ! The staff was very helpful! Breakfast was quick and easy! No rush no hassle. In the city elevators are slow. These ones were super! Overall great experience front desk staff. Fantastic

title: solid value near times square
text: small rooms but clean and comfortable beds, decent hot breakfast included - easy walking district to broadway shows and times square. lots of construction going on across street made it a bit noisy at times.

title: Great stay at a great location
text: CONVENIENT LOCATION in midtown. Walk to Times Sq. Minutes from the Port Authority Bus Terminal and Metro. We used the subway quite a lot so this was real convenient to walk only a couple hundred yards. Hotel is nice, clean and some of the rooms have an amazing view of NY. I'd stay here again.

title: Déçu de l enseigneb
text:
Nous connaissions a l occasion d autres voyages de pratiquer la chaîne Hampton ( sous marque de Hilton) pour la qualité de leur literie et le concept pdj etc .c est ainsi que pour passer une semaine a NYC nous avions fait notre choix .
L accueil déjà m avait un peu surpris sourire ,personnel peu aimable et accueillant nous avions une chambre au 15 ieme étage , il y en avait le double ,avec 2 ascenseurs aussi bien pour les clients que le service du personnel ,temps moyen d attente 10 mn aux heures de pointe ( pdj , départ etc ) .
Chambre propreté ras , pas forcément refaite le soir quand vous rentré de vos balades et qu a 20 h le ménage n est pas fait ? Ce n est quand même pas le client qui va devoir se mettre aux bons vouloir du personnel d entretien !! Chambre pas très grande mais le m² est compté , SDB pas de radiateur , ou d ampoule radiante au plafond puissance insufflante pense ,chauffage de la chambre par clim réversible intérieur , bonjour le bruit !! .vue par la fenêtre de la chambre sur rue , en sachant que vous avez devant un chantier de construction d un hotel , de bon matin réveil au marteau piqueur , toupie de béton , coup de marteau , quand vous réserver vous n avez pas l information bien entendu quand ce n est pas dans l hotel ( déjà donné a Miami dans un Loews ) .
Nous sommes arrivés pour le réveillon du nouvel an il faisait un froid pas possible , ébène émets climatiques habituels a NYC , dans le hall de l hotel ,avec des portes automatiques , ouvertes toutes les mn il faisait presque aussi que dehors , ce que je reproche provisoirement n était il pas possible de mettre un soufflant électrique pour palier a la temp . D autant que la salle du pdj se trouvait dans l enfilade de l entrée avec pour agrandir la capacité d accueil une véranda accolée au bâtiment avec pas de chauffage et une couche de neige sur la toiture .
Il ne fallait pas penser venir en polo , de surcroît personnel insuffisant , il faut fournir en produits je ne parle pas de la propreté et le sol laissant a désirer ,pdj gratuit mais bon pour la variété sur une semaine ? Enfin très déçu literie satisfaisante . Vous êtes pas très loin de Times Square et du metro  mais essayer de prendre autre chose

title: Nice Location
text: Close to central park, Broadway shows, and Times square. Breakfast is typical for Hampton Inn. The room is a small since it is NYC. The staff was friendly. The elevator took a long time. We would love to stay here again.

title: Battered, Crowded and Noisy
text: I usually find Hampton Inns to be comfortable and convenient.  This hotel is old, crowded, with a mess of noisy construction in front of it, inadequate small elevators used by both guests and full laundry carts.  Don't get a room at the front or on lower floors--noise is awful from construction.

title: Perfect
text: Great location.  top notch.  The room was clean, the breakfast was ok, The staff was very helpful.  Being close to times square was perfect. If we come to NYC again I would definitely stay here again.An enjoyable couple of days.

title: Well located and on the reasonable side!
text:
Our room was clean and well appointed. The breakfast was typical Hampton Inn and very appreciated as a money saver! We had a problem with the hot water in our room and the manager was very responsive to our needs. They truly want to please their guests and they care.
If you want to be near the Broadway theaters and Times Square, this is a wonderful location. The train is also two city blocks from the hotel and Port Authority is one block from the hotel.

title: Good value
text: Stayed here Jan 1-5, 2018. 2 teens and 2 adults. Convenient location-was able to walk to Times Square and to the metro. Safe area. Free breakfast was great but hotel was very busy so it was crowded. It is a tall building so elevators take some time. Overall service was great and the rooms were kept well.

title: Localização perfeita!
text:
Localização esplêndida! Estação 42 Times Square que faz conexão com varias linhas de metrô e Bus Authority - da pra ir ao Outlet de The Mills em NJ pagando apenas $14 ida e volta por pessoa tranquilamente.
Ficamos na opção de quarto Corner com vista para Times Square, o que é incrível, mas o tamanho é pequeno, e como estava bem frio ( -15graus), sentimos falta de aquecimento no banheiro - acredite tomar banho não foi fácil! 
O hotel disponibiliza café da manha- sobre taxa- não tentamos, pq tem varias opções na rua. 
No Lobby eles deixam capsulas de cha e cafe, que são boas para fazer quando voltar de passeios e com o corpo frio.

title: New year stay
text:
A good and easy check in , rooms good size. Breakfast was very good but the room itself was very cold. Always a hot drink available day and night. Lifts , had to sometimes wait a while for one but understandable due to size of hotel. 
Would like to say a huge thanks to the two lads that tried to get us a taxi to the airport on the day of the snow storm, they tried for quite sometime but apologised when they failed.
We returned to the hotel after not being able to get home for a few days , my only grumble was when we were finally going home we asked the concierge if he could organise a taxi for us his reply was to go and get a yellow cab ! After a few chaotic days of coming backwards and forwards his attitude was the last thing we wanted to hear !

title: It was average
text:
I used to be a front desk agent a few years ago. Here's everything I found unacceptable here: 
When you get into your room, there is a heater with knobs ripped off, leaving you to think your heater doesn't work. My boyfriend was immediately stressed and I called the front desk. I was told there are buttons for the heater on the other wall! Cool thanks! Hard for a new guest to spot though. "There's supposed to be signs" I was told on the phone. Huh ok. I could tell I wasn't the first person to call and ask about this.

There is NO MICROWAVE to use whatsoever. I even looked in the breakfast room. Nada. How hard is it to get a microwave? We are in NYC and I would like to heat up my leftovers. I ended up eating a lot of stuff cold in my room. Ugh. Never again. My boyfriend and I even walked past a microwave on the street and we joked about bringing it back to our room.

I also noticed there was only 1 front desk agent around the desk a lot of the time, during busy check in and check out times? Long lines whenever I wanted to ask a quick question? What a drag.

This is where things started to go downhill fast. The hot water in the lobby was empty 2 nights in a row when I attempted to make hot chocolate. Really guys??? Thanks for the tease. I guess I'll just go up to my room. 

I was excited to see there was oatmeal at breakfast, but then I put it in my bowl and it was so runny and watery and gross! Threw the rest away.

There was also a night I asked the front desk for a comb. The lady said something like "No I'll have to get that sent up to your room." My boyfriend and I watched hours go by in our room and I never got a comb. The next day I go to the front desk to once again ask for a comb. Jim pulls one out effortlessly. Thanks! I wish the girl did that for me. 

My boyfriend asked housekeeping for another roll of toilet paper. We never got it. Ended up using napkins on our last day there. 

The housekeepers do not service rooms until way later in the day. Basically by the time we wanted to go back to the room and relax from walking around all day. A good tip is to ask for earlier service while you're out of the room.

The housekeepers also have to share the elevator with the guests :) what a nightmare. You will be waiting for the elevator a very long time. Then get cramped inside with 10 other people and cleaning supplies. 

The icing on the cake. On check out day I wanted to print my boarding passes in the business center. Everything's going fine until my passes print blank with no ink. Just another problem I wanted. I went up to my room for a minute to wait for the ink to be fixed, then came back down to see maintenance working at the door and they just said "sorry out of business". I was boiling at this point to say the least. Pretty unacceptable to put the business center out of business during check out time when I need my passes the most???? You could of at least gave me a warning???? I never got my passes there. Thank god I got them at the airport. At this point I could not wait to leave this place. My boyfriend had to talk me out of it and calm me down on our last day in NYC. It seemed like every small thing was a hassle. We finally checked out and I couldn't even understand the girl helping me because her voice was too soft and quiet. Boyfriend turned and said to me, "What did she say?" "I don't know." The girls seemed clueless and unhappy. Super monotone with no personality. Seemed like they didn't want to be there. But you gotta fake it til you make it!!! Peter and Jim were way more helpful and friendly though even when I saw them in high stress situations. 

On the upside! The bed was very comfy and I enjoyed the view! The 19th floor was very quiet and I loved it, despite being close to the elevator.

title: MIXED BAG!!
text:
Difficult to review either as totally positive or negative.
On the plus side the beds were really comfortable,the shower was really good and the free wifi excellent.
There was tea and coffee available in a small seating area 24hrs or you could take it to your room.
The down side of the room was there was no living space and it was too small for three adults and two double beds.
We have never lived in a hotel room that has absolutely no drawer space anywhere.
Living out of a suitcase can be normal but there is usually a few drawers for everyday items.
The free breakfast would have been ok but the area was too small and the constant line simply offputting.
There was never any seats if you were willing to wait for food so it was easier just to get coffee and take it to the room.
A major negative was only two lifts to service 32 floors each with 6 rooms and no service elevator so quite often cleaning trolleys and maintenance staff dictated the time spent waiting.
We were on the 26th floor but if you can take a low floor so the stairs can be used.
Location was good but we would not stay there again and honestly would not recommend it.

title: Excellent View and Location
text: The hotel was pricey but I think it was just due to New Years' holiday. The location is fantastic, 10 mins walk from great shopping and Times Square. Staff very friendly, clean hotel and comfy bed. Would definitely recommend!

title: Good location but small and noisey
text: Check in was great.  Housekeeping lacks in customer service and follow through.  Breakfast was great, but if its cold out, bring your parka.  There is not a good source of heat in the dining area.  Given the size and location of the hotel - noise is a big issue.

title: nice staff, great location
text: very nice hotel, clean new rooms, friendly staff, very nice breakfast offerings. Plenty of food options, great location, right in the heart of the main Times Square tourist area. I would definitly recommend for families

title: Great place to stay
text: This hotel was a great place to spend Christmas. The location was convenient to many attractions and the subway. The room with 2 beds was comfortable, not too crowded. Santa showed up for breakfast and the lobby cookies were the only Christmas cookies we had this year. Thanks for a great time.

title: Family get away
text: Hotel location was great, room was tiny but clean. Heater was loud, woke us up a couple times a night. We would rate our stay as average. Was not as pare as the our Hampton inns we stayed at in the past in other states.

title: New Year stay
text: Booked this hotel for a week´s stay over the New Year. The location is very good. Close to Times Square and the Subway. Good location also for most tourist places on Manhattan. Plus for the complimentary breakfast and free faultless wifi service. Coffee and tea available all the time. Quiet and newly refurbished room. I stayed at 26th floor.

title: Great location and service!! A few nuisances though!!
text: The hotel service and location was amazing!! Close to times square, Broadway, and lots of other attractions. Beware of a few nuisances. First, this hotel has 32 floors and only 2 elevators. Second, the room we stayed in had two double beds and no extra room to move. It was tiny!! Lastly, the breakfast are was small and overcrowded. Not a big selection.

title: stay for NYE
text: picked this hotel based on its price and location to times square. check in was easy polite and helpful... room was huge! I think they upgraded us to a junior suite. breakfast was the normal bagels etc.. tea and coffee in the reception 24 hours was good... the only negative was that the room was quite cold especially the bathroom. I had to use my shoe as a door stop to keep the bathroom door open to warm it up. apart from that everything else was perfect... 5 minute walk to 42 street and the famous times square!

title: Gostei! Voltarei!
text:
Pontos positivos: localização boa, perto do metro e Rodoviária do Port Autority, e próximo a Times Square, pneste metrô você encontra todas as linhas do metro para ir aonde quiser, café da manhã com pão de forma integral, item raro nos hotéis.... cama muito macia (depois de passar o dia caminhando, não tem coisa melhor)... chuveiro maravilhoso, limpeza do quarto feita diariamente, todos os dias com troca de toalhas. Cafe, chá e etc... sempre disponível, muito raro encontrar nos hoteis ...Recepção todos atenciosos...

Pontos negativos: local para o café muito pequeno e não dá vazão para todos, muitos acabam pegando o café levando paro o quarto. O Elevador sempre cheio no horário do café, tivemos que descer escada ...Quarto bom mas o tamanho é pequeno. 

Tem mais qualidades do que defeito!
Voltarei com certeza!

title: El hotel es pesimo
text: Le pongo dos estrellas únicamente por la ubicación, porque está cerca de todo. El hotel es el peor hotel que fui en mi vida, la habitación es más pequeña que un baño, hay solo dos ascensores y a las 10am podes estar 40 minutos esperando para bajar. El desayuno es horrendo. No vengan

title: Hampton inn
text: La ubicacion es excelente cerca de time square el personal del hotel es atento muy servicial.las habitaciones estan limpias grandes y la cama es muy comoda. El desayuno muy bueno y es variado todo esta perfecto para quedarse en este hotel

title: Hard to sleep
text:
The rooms are clean, but very small. You’ll wait a long time to use an elevator most of the day. The staff is friendly and attentive. 
    My only real complaint is that the rooms are very loud. We could hear the room above us opening their squeaky door day and night. Also, lots of construction during the weekdays directly across the street which is pretty loud ( understanding the hotel can’t control that) 

   The location is good only a few minute walk to Times Square, and major subway accesses.

title: My great Christmas stay at Hampton Inn Manhattan
text: It was a great trip to Manhattan and the Hampton Inn was a perfect place for me to stay. I really enjoyed being there. The only complaint I truly have is that they charged my credit card $60 per day of my 3 day stay for incidentals that had not even occurred yet. It was a shock!  No bad reflection on the hotel per se; all hotels do it. It's just I didn't expect $60 (that much) per day to be charged for something that hadn't happened yet. They charged my credit card $180 immediately. What's up with that? I think that is truly a very bad practice by all hotels and car rental companies. The charges were dropped from my card within 2 days though. So that was good.

title: NYC stay - Christmas weekend
text: Hampton Inn on 39th Street in NYC was a great place to spend the weekend. Convenient to the Bolt Bus stop & easy walk to Times Square, theaters, restaurants, & Macys. Free breakfast was excellent and had warm drinks available 24/7. The hotel room was clean & the staff was very helpful & friendly.

title: Bring your patience.
text: Long waits for the elevators at prime times. At least 10 min and the same for breakfast lines. The elevators are really loud at night and with only six rooms to a floor, you hear them even furthest away from the elevator. I used ear plugs and was fine, though. Know there is tax on parking and SUV parking is more. So the expected $60/night ended up at $82/night. Rooms are small but clean and beds are comfy.

title: Amazing time....!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
text:
I book this hotel and I'm  so happy. The location is close to everything, subway , times square,empire state etc .. 
the staff very friendly , breakfast was good. i would recommend this hotel for sure. and i will coming back to book this hotel again. the staff of this  hotel is very friendly and helpful.

title: Max trip
text: Must go to New York amazing.So much to see and such an experience.Hotel situated near Times Square restaurants and shops.Hotel good but would have been nice to have a restaurant so at night be able to have a drink and relax.It was help yourself continental but was sufficient as restaurants such big portionswemostly shared a meal.Christmas  at Maceys is a must and Central Park.

title: Great hotel!
text: Location was great, we ordered Uber from location. Staff is very helpful and super efficient. Can't wait to go back again soon!  I'm aiming for the top floor one of these days.  Free USA Today paper was a bonus!

title: Pres de Time Square sans le bruit et la foule
text: à 5 minutes à pieds de Time Square, près de tout, très propre et confortable. Hampton Inn une valeur sure qu'importe où l'on est dans le monde. Tres bon accueil et très bon service. Petit déjeuner dès 6 heures am. Café thé eau chaude disponible ds le lobby 24hr/24

title: Prize of a lifetime
text:
I won a trip to NYC for my husband and I, all expenses paid. They booked us in to the Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square South for the accommodation and we were not disappointed. Front desk staff were super friendly and incredibly helpful. The room (1103) was spacious, had everything we needed, with an incredibly comfortable bed and good shower. We weren’t disturbed at all by street noise or other guests (the room is tucked into a corner at the end of a corridor). 

We found breakfast a little hectic but that’s to be expected at this time of year (16th to 19th December), so even when we didn’t get a chance to enjoy it, made good use of the 24 hour coffee facilities. 

The location of the hotel is excellent for Times Square and also Empire State Building, with two very close subway stations (Port Authority and Times Square) within easy distance offering trains to get to virtually anywhere you’d want to go.
