We honestly couldn’t fault the hotel, they could just do with a bigger breakfast room to accommodate the number of guests. Would definitely return and recommend to friends.

title: Mother Daughter trip
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Our room was ready when we got there.  The room was clean and the bed oh so comfortable.  The location was perfect and allowed us to walk to most everything we wanted to do.  A wonderful value for the quality of the room and the employees.

title: Good option in an expensive city for a reasonable price.
text: Hamptom is always a good and this one is really well located.  The 39th street (between the 7th and 8th Avenues) is a good location.  Close to everything in Manhattan but in a relativey quiet street (if there is anything quiet in NEY city :-).  The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room is smaller than most Hamptons but it is NY.  Breakfast is Hampton-style with everything you need.

title: Our Stay In NY
text: Hampton Quality all the way, hotel located in great location with in walking distance of a lot of good stuff, hotel staff did a great job and were very attentive, yes I would recommend , nice stay, only disappointment was room size, 4 large folks a little tight,

title: Christmas time
text: Great location to time square an 42nd street. We could walk to everything we had planned.  Being on 39th street between 8th an 9th got us out of the big crowds on the sidewalk. There was also a great Irish pub two door down from the hotel that has very good food.

title: Good Location for Times Square Actvities
text: Hotel is walking distance to pretty much anywhere you will want to visit in the Times Square Area.  It is a large hotel (32 floors) so housekeeping is very slow and may appear very late in the day to get to cleaning the room.  Hot water is evasive.

title: Great experience!!!
text: We would definitely stay here again! Great hotel & good location to most everything. The staff was so courteous & helpful from the time we checked in to arranging a car to take us to the airport when we checked out. The room was clean & the beds were comfortable. The breakfast bar had a big selection & we were satisfied every day. The concierge was helpful in directions & places of interest. We enjoyed our stay in New York & the Hampton Inn was a big part of making it so great! Overall I give this hotel a 10!!!!

title: Don't expect much
text: I have already outlined my complaint that myb room was not cleaned, and that it appears to me the staff simply lied about trying to gt it cleaned. If they had said it could not be done I would have been upset, but shrugged it off...the lying is what really bothers me

title: Consigliato
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel in occasione del ponte dell immacolata con la mia famiglia per 5 notti . Posizione ottima , con una breve passeggiata si raggiungono i luoghi strategici di New York ... dalla bellissima Time Square  al Rockefeller ... alla sixth avenue ....
Colazione  buona sia dolce che salata e varia ... durante il giorno a disposizione bevande calde e frutta. 
Unica " pecca " camera quadrupla troppo piccola  dotata di frigo- bar , armadio inesistente , le valige impilate una sopra L altra con i vestiti dentro ..... bagno discreto con piano doccia largo .
Pulizia ottima

title: Good Hotel in mid-town NYC for Quick Trips
text: Clean, comfortable rooms for business travelers need a well-located lower priced hotel in mid-town NYC. Free breakfast and good WiFi connections. Fitness center, easy access to mid-town restaurants, theaters, and business facilities. Friendly, helpful hotel staff.

title: Convenient but watch out for pricing.
text: I always stay here because I can walk to Port Authority and theater district easily. Usually it’s a good deal for the price but watch out when they jack up the prices for holidays or events. Not worth $400 for a tiny room. Also the elevators are bad so dont stay on a high floor.

title: Excellent for short stays in Manhatten
text: I stayed there for 4 nights and thought it was great.  The location is perfect for Manhattan, walking distance from Times Square and everything else.  The staff were friendly and the room, although one the smalll side but normal for NYC, was clean and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet choice was a bit limited but still do a good job of filling us up before starting each day. I would highly recommend it.

title: Weekend at the Hampton Inn
text:
I stayed 4 nights at the Hampton Inn Manhattan - Times Square South. 
Checking in was easy. The front desk employees were very nice and professional throughout our stay. The hotel provides free breakfast and there is always coffee, tea, and hot chocolate available throughout the day. The bagels at breakfast were not the best NY type bagels, but tasted like Panera instead. The breakfast potatoes were amazing! Whole and skim milk with choices of cereal were available as well as yogurt. Juice was available - orange, cranberry, and apple. The hotel was clean and our room was kept clean daily by the maid service with towels replaced daily. Plenty of towels, comfortable bed and pillows! Loved having a refrigerator. Air and heat ran well in our room. Plenty of wall plugs to charge electronics as well as USB port charging areas. 

The hotel is set in the Garmet District which isn't the nicest area. Lots of homeless and fake homeless around and a run down area, but it's close enough to the subway and central enough to be a good location for travel. It's next to Hell's Kitchen and near many restaurants and several good pizza places to get a slice or two. 

Things to improve on: 

The walk way that runs in front of the elevators is much too narrow for the amount of traffic the area sees, especially during breakfast and check in and check out times. 
9/10 times at least one of the elevators did not work. The wait for an elevator was always long as there were so many people using the 1 working elevator. (Don't tell me it has been fixed like previous replied to other reviews - it's not fixed and even your staff knows this.) When both elevators were working, they were always full and we had to wait several passes before there was room to get on. The maid service staff uses the same elevators as the guests which is unprofessional and uncomfortable. Dresser Drawers of some sort would benefit guests that stay longer than a weekend. The bathroom shower was quite narrow, the bathroom very small, and no counter space other than the counter that goes immediately around the sink. All of these things an be lived with and worked around. 

However, the concierge on Monday morning was frazzled and unprofessional. She didn't appear to know what she was doing at all. We were scheduled to take the shuttle to the airport and we had been told the night before to arrive 10 minutes early for the shuttle. We did. We saw no one else waiting for the shuttle, so we asked her what we should be doing. She said our shuttle was around the corner, but we needed to wait on others. We did not want to wait. We wanted to go on to the shuttle to wait there and to get settled. She rudely told us that we must wait for her and that we could not go to the shuttle and we must wait on others. As we walked outside anyway, she continued to insist that we stay inside the hotel and remain with her. We continued to go outside. Another concierge from the next door sister hotel was outside and asked us if he needed help and we told her we were just looking for our shuttle. We walked us down to the shuttle where we found that everyone was already on the shuttle and was ready to go!! Had we wanted for our concierge, we may have missed the shuttle. The shuttle should have picked us up in front of the hotel like the other shuttles were doing, but instead it was practically parked in traffic and we had to maneuver around on coming traffic to get on the shuttle. Other guests on the shuttle commented about the disorganization and unprofessional behavior at the hotel from this shuttle arrangement and the unprofessionalism of the concierge on Monday morning. She seemed stressed and maybe things were out of her control, but more organization for the morning shuttle routine would help. 

Other than these things, it was a wonderful few days in New York!

title: Convenient location
text: Hotel was short walk to most locations we wanted to see.  Close to subway for our other jaunts around the city.  Staff was very accommodating and informative about things to see and do and how to get around.

title: Front Desk Lacking Customer Service Skills
text: I arrived at the hotel much earlier than expected and knew the chances of an early check-in was unlikely. However, a large group of people had checked out (9am) prior to my arrival which I found had the same room types as I. Anyone would assume that a room could have been cleaned prior to the 1pm timeframe which she gave me as being the earliest....ESPECIALLY since I had already told her of my travel issues and illness. I even offered to upgrade if needed. I asked the young lady at the desk to call me when my room was ready....NEVER HAPPENED! EXTREMELY disappointed!   We took showers upon check in after walking around town and traveling. The shower did not drain correctly and we stood in our own bathing water. I totally understand that this is not something that might have been known. However, we notified the staff of this issue prior to leaving for the evening and when we took showers the following morning....still the same. After the shower drained the first day, it left a nasty film and I just assumed they did not clean that up after fixing it....I was wrong. It was so disgusting by the time we were done showering that I took a picture.   I called the front desk after we arrived back to our room around 11pm about extra towels and the fact that our remote was not working. Maximo came with towels quickly and then maintenance followed shortly after with several remotes to ensure they could correct the problem which was great.   The breakfast staff was GREAT and friendly even with so many people in and out! I really appreciated this.  All the gentlemen that assisted with storing our bags were great!   I PAID OVER $400 TO STAY AT THIS LOCATION AND TO SEE THE STAFF WEARING HANDWRITTEN NAMETAGS IS REDICULOUS. I COULD NOT EVEN MAKE OUT SEVERAL OF THE NAMES. HAMPTON INN IS PART OF THE HILTON BRAND AND I KNOW WE ALL HAVE BUDGETS TO KEEP IN LINE BUT COME ON PEOPLE HANDWRITTEN....EXTREMELY TACKY!!!!!!

title: CENTRAL LOCATION
text: More than happy with the hotel, particularly the price for the location. Very close to most of the action, but far enough away to not be hassled. A small hotel with a basic breakfast included in the price, but enough to start the day. 24 hour tea and coffee available which is nice instead of having to have your hand in your pocket all the time. Found staff to be friendly and helpful. Room size was quite reasonable and very clean. Bathroom was very clean. Would definitely stay here again as we were able to walk to Times Square, Broadway even to Central Park (a bit of a walk, but good exercise). Could walk down to catch the ferry only about 10-15 minutes. A number of bars and restaurants nearby.

title: Horrible stay
text: Horrible service did not even help with finding adequate parking. Will not be staying there again and recommend others to find a better place.  Front desk was rude and not helpful at all.  Parking is overpriced

title: Dit hotel overslaan !
text: Slecht hotel, met niet-werkende liften. Zeer kleine kamers, tegen relatief hoge prijs. Het ontbijt is slecht (niet aan beginnen) en lekker in de stad een ontbijtje nuttigen. Genoeg andere hotels in de omgeving

title: Great Stay!!!
text: I stayed at this property over the Thanksgiving weekend and I had a very enjoyable stay.  The location was great, rooms were clean and staff was extremely helpful...especially Anthony at the concierge desk who went above and beyond to get us a cab.

title: Razoável
text:
Atendimento ruim no café da manhã , precisa de mais funcionários .
Os outros Hampton Inn da área são bem melhores .
Os elevadores não dão conta do número de hóspedes. Impossível descer até 11hs .
Serviço de troca toalhas a desejar

title: Hotel
text: Nice Hotel and centrally located. Walk to every place. Good breakfast, friendly personnel. Only drawback is the elevators. You have to use stairs at pick times, or you will be late for everything . We were in floor 13, so if wasn’t bad going down, If one is down, you have to wait over 30 minutes. Stay in lower floors and you are Okay

title: Fantastic value & location
text: We were pleasantly surprised with the comfort, location, and overall accommodations at this hotel. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable, the bathroom a little small but it was clean. We were not disappointed with the free breakfast- it's NYC nothing is free or cheap.  The service at the front desk was top-notch! I will definitely come back to this hotel.

title: Great base for exploring NYC
text:
Stayed here with my partner whilst on a long weekend break in New York City. I’ve stayed at Hampton’s before & am a Hilton Honours card holder so got a small discount. 
Location is very close to central Times Square & ideal for exploring NYC. 
When you stay at a Hampton you know what you’re getting & this one is no different. Not luxurious but well appointed, clean & very comfortable. WiFi signal was strong. All staff were very friendly & helpful. Recommended.

title: Super professional and kind staff
text:
This hotel was great, it was clean, everybody was very nice, everybody responded positively to any discussion or questions that we had. The rooms are a bit on the small side but it is New York and that is to be expected. 

This hotel is so close to so many subway lines just a short walk up the street. It was also a great location to be able to walk to off-Broadway shows. 

I have to give kudos to the breakfast kitchen staff they were so good and helped us anytime we needed anything for our trip - we traveled with a large group of high school students and parents. They helped us organize a simple rotation to make sure that every student had an opportunity to eat a hearty breakfast.

title: Location,Location,Location
text: Location is excellent! Everyone on the staff is very helpful and friendly. Rooms are comfortable and plenty of room. The hotel was very quiet for the most part...doors close loudly.  I️ would definitely stay here again.

title: Customer service always exceeds expectations
text: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel several times a year since 2015. The cleanliness, location and staff are among the reasons we return. We stayed for two nights last week and would like to thank three staff members who went above and beyond to accommodate our needs. They were Henry, Yariela and Jessica. Manager Henry and Yariela were at the front desk to facilitate a special request which greatly helped our stay and Jessica prepares and serves the breakfast with friendliness and professionalism. Each of them should be chosen to provide customer service training to other staff members as they are a credit to the Hilton brand.

title: Great stay!
text: the Staff was friendly and the room was clean. Looks like the hotel had been updated recently. Close to restaurants and Time’s Square. The breakfast was an added bonus. Easy to get an elevator also. A positive experience!

title: A week in NYC
text: The location of this hotel is great, very close to subway etc and in a relatively safe part of town (in all honesty, all of NYC felt safe while we were there). Room was a bit small, but, this is to be expected with such a central location. Room was tidy, lobby was tidy and staff very helpful. I'd recommend this hotel.

title: Good location
text: This hotel is average, but the location is good. The room was clean. The breakfast was okay, but not so tasty. Do not expect a nice view, but that doesn't matter because you will be exploring the near surrounding than the room view, right ;) Special thanks to the friendly staff!

title: Great location and clean!
text: The location of this hotel is great for the NYC Marathon.  Not far from expo, NYRR center and finish line.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Only 2-3 blocks to bus stop for airport transport. Plenty of options for restaurants and a couple of smaller groceries stores nearby.  All hotels are expensive in NY so no deal there but location and cleanliness helps make up for the price.

title: A good location for this busy city
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Times Square South.  The location was especially good because it was convenient but also relatively quiet in comparison to busier streets.  The staff was excellent and helpful.  The breakfast workers were efficient and friendly and always brought plenty of food out.  The housekeepers were great and the room was very clean.

title: Above average little hotel in NYC
text: We stayed here on a recent weekend trip to NYC, and overall, it was great.  Staff were friendly, the room was clean and quiet, and we had fast and free wifi.  The included breakfast was a bonus - fresh and tasty.  Recommended.

title: Great pre-cruise stay at NYC Hampton Inn 10/15/17
text: Stayed at the Hampton Inn pre-cruise leaving 10/16/17.They kindly stored our luggage so that we were able to catch a Broadway show that afternoon.In fact my Kindle was just placed with my luggage and returned to me without any problems.Nice honest staff!Room was great,quiet,great view,interesting neighborhood.Able to take a healthy walk to and from the Eugene O'Neill Theatre and enjoy the city at night.

title: Close to subway station and far enough away from craziness of Times Square
text: A bit off the beaten path, it is worth the walk to have some privacy and comfort.  In a row of hotels and a cluster of nice restaurants, this Hampton Inn has all the usual amenities and a very accommodating staff.  Peter was particularly helpful on two occasions, especially when I checked in and my company's credit card had been hacked/did not clear such that my reservation was cancelled.  He coolly and quickly made a new reservation and reassured me that my stay was secure.  I only  took the elevators to move in and out, as they warned that they could be slow, but the stairs were just fine for my 8th floor room.  Typically Manhattan-small, the room was everything I needed with adequate lighting and outlets.  I particularly liked that the TV goes right to channels rather than trying to sell movies.  The bathroom had been upgraded with a zero-entry style often found in Europe.  I think the room was meant to be wheelchair accessible.  A/c and heat worked well.  Breakfast buffet was above average, and one of the servers even went to every table to hand out Andes chocolates, just because she liked doing it.  Loved the 24/7 coffee.

title: Group from Houston
text: I was initially surprised at how small the rooms were but the price, location, and friendliness of the staff made it worth it. There was an issue with one of our double rooms prior to checkin, so they accommodated us with 2 king rooms.

title: Great Hotel. Great value.
text: This property was in close proximity to almost everything. The staff was awesome and the property was clean and kept. All of these great things added with a reasonable price makes this property an awesome choice.

title: 25 year anniversary trip
text: Poor service, double bed instead of queen that I paid for. Loud AC that was never fixed. Employees didn’t care about issues, just offered to relocate to another hotel. Only 6 rooms per floor with 32 floors, so elevator was slow.

title: Family Vacation
text: Family Vacation - PROs: great value, friendly and accomodating staff, awesome breakfast included, convenient location, street traffic quieter than usual, nonexistent on a higher floor. CONs: one of two elevators almost always broken causing long wait times. If you don't mind the marginal street noise, get a room on a lower floor.

title: Elevators don't work
text:
If you stay here make sure you stay on the lowest floors as they can't seem to keep both elevators working at the same time, and on a 32 floor hotel, expect to wait 20 minutes for an elevator. The best is the staff is so use to it they just joke about it "building character".   And I got to pay $400 a night for non working elevators!
And I use to be a Hilton Diamond member. Marriott here I come!!!!

title: very good experience in NYC
text:
I really loved this hotel, it has great location in center of Manhattan(pretty close to time square). the rooms are nice and clean(from mine room at 27th floor I could see empire state building).the breakfast was pretty good, it's included waffles, fruits, cereals, good coffee and more stuff. 
on weekend elevetor ride for having breakfast can be busy, on Sunday we waited almost 20 mins for elevator to 27 floor.
Also wanted to add the near by the hotel, on 39th and 9th st there were some homeless people living and going through there want not so pleasant experience(guess hotel cant do anything about it anyway)

title: Reasonably priced and well located
text: Decent hotel with nice efficient staff.  Many foreign tourists and student groups - lobby often crowded with people and luggage.  There is a concierge in the morning.  Hotel room was clean with  large flat screen TV, refrigerator and free wifi.  Mattress was not very supportive and had a polyester duvet (I am picky about bedding).  Decent size bathroom could use more counter space.    Shower  cramped but had lots of hot water.  Only 2 thin bath towels.  Could be a wait for elevators as there are 29 floors and one behaved erratically during our stay.   On the plus side: Walk to theaters and many restaurants.   Good free breakfast with crispy bacon, waffles, tasty muffins.  Coffee, tea, hot chocolate offered all day.  Room at back of hotel very quiet with view of back of new condos.  Even though check-out time was very crowded, I only waited a couple minutes.  Overall, I'd say Hampton Inn is a bit below quality compared to HGI or Doubletree but still has some nice amenities.  Great for a couple nights stay!

title: Good Hotel and a Good Price
text:
This a good hotel that we stayed at for one night.  Most reviewers have stated that there are only six rooms on a floor and the rooms are compact.  I have been in smaller rooms in NYC and these are not even close to the smallest.

The staff was very friendly, I had a short wait at check-in and the front desk clerk was very apologetic.  The rooms were clean and the bed was fine.  Remember in a Hampton Inn you will have paper cups and less amenities than other Hilton properties.

The elevators are a drawback to this hotel, not enough not to stay here, but be forewarned.  Only one of the elevators was working during our stay and on Sunday morning the wait for the elevator was a little taxing.  On the plus side you meet a lot of nice people when you need to cram into a small NYC elevator and ride 29 floors.  For the one night we were there it was fine, but if I was staying a week, it would be a challenge.

Overall a convenient, affordable hotel.

title: Great Experience
text: Wonderful helpful staff, cleanliness of hotel and location was great! Enjoyed the breakfast every morning. Lots of variety to choose from. Great experience with a big group of us traveling together. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Good deal
text: Great stay. Small rooms. But it’s NYC. so I expected it. Great location. Front desk was friendly. Free breakfast and when you’re traveling with kids it’s nice to have one less meal to pay for. Great location. Near subways.

title: Buena ubicación
text: Ubicación muy buena, el hotel reciclado muy lindo nada de lujos, habitación chica pero bien estuve alojado con mi señora.Aire acondicionado excelente, baño bien, hay disponible hielo y agua en algunos pisos, excelente. El desayuno normal, tiene a disposición las 24 hs café, agua caliente, podría tener algunos snacks, la atención de los chicos del desayuno excelente, hay una señora, no recuerdo su nombre, rubia, muy atenta me conseguía agua caliente siempre desde la cocina, y en recepción fueron todos atentos salvo una chica que tenia muy poco onda, se llama Yariela creo.

title: Best Hampton Inn in NYC
text: This is our go to hotel in NYC.  Super clean rooms combined with a terrific hotel staff and easy location make this our favorite NYC hotel.  Larger than average rooms that are very well maintained.  We love the staff- they know their neighborhood, restaurants and subway maps!  Breakfast is a typical Hampton Inn but they have good NYC bagels.  The location is terrific - close to subway lines, Port Authority and Times Square but far enough away to provide a break from the madness! We love this hotel!

title: Great location and complimentary breakfast!
text: Tiny little rooms but clean. Don’t be in a hurry and plan ahead because elevators are slow/busy. Location is great, within walking distance of broadway shows, good restaurants, Times Square and public transportation.

title: Great place!
text:
First trip to New York chose this hotel based on price and location. Great choice. Hotel was close to Times Square, Broadway shows, Empire State and MSG. But far enough away that it was quiet at night. 
We stayed on 29th floor and could see Empire State Building from our window. King bed Room was not huge but well thought out. Comfy bed and great AC. Plenty of outlets and USB ports. Wi-fi was fast. 
Breakfast had eggs and waffles as well as fresh fruits and danish. 
Staff was really friendly. Everyone that we came in contact with was awesome. 
Had a few issues at check in with keys and some items not in room. Staff took care of them quickly and credited our bill for the trouble. 
Only six rooms per floor so elevators can be a bit slow during peak times but not that big of a deal. 
Would definitely stay here again!

title: Flying insects in bathroom
text: Hotel is in a great location close to lots of attractions. My room is ok but the bathroom left a lot to be desired. When I turned on the lights I immediately noticed the bathroom was infested with dozens of little flying bugs that looked like fruit flies. Gross.

title: Muito bom
text: Localização excelente, perto da Times Square e de estações do metrô, boa limpeza dos quartos e ótimo atendimento dos funcionários. O único detalhe é que em horários de pico os elevadores demoram um pouco ou chegam lotados, mas não chega a atrapalhar. Preço justo pelo que oferece. Café da manhã incluído. Possuem serviço de transporte para o aeroporto e outros destinos da cidade (terceirizado - pago a parte).

title: Outstanding Hotel
text: From the moment I arrived I was catered to as if I were the only guest that night. Check in was quick and easy and the staff were all very friendly and eager to help. My room was clean and well appointed.Great place to stay , I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great value and amazingly helpful staff.

title: Great but not cheap
text: Overall the place was ok, some issues with key card access in older door hardware, however there were lots of outlets and USB ports throughout the room which was awesome.  Especially near the beds.  Only criticism was that it was tremendously expensive for the type of room and quality of the hotel.  The staff however were great.

title: Not great fun but acceptable
text:
Positives: Clean, good location
Negatives: This hotel is a small area hotel (6 rooms on each of the 35+ floors) with two elevators with a long waiting period. Some of the staff not friendly. Front desk cramped and very busy at most hours with visitors checking in and out. Breakfast OK but food not that great. Our room was not cleaned during the mornings, twice during our stay. Some of the small and thin towels were unpleasantly spotted. While we rested in the afternoon the cleaning staff was noisy and door slamming. The air conditioning worked only on a single fixed temperature. The free WIFI was very weak and was off during the night hours.
Overall: For a fun NY holiday choose elsewhere

title: Good hotel near famous areas
text: I stayed at this hotel for families. The Staff was very nice.The room was cozy and comfortable. I had 2 queen beds in my room. The beds were really comfortable. There were 2 pillows which was good for me, but if you need more I recommend that you ask for them at the time of booking. The bathroom was cramped but had all the necessities. Although, it did have plenty of towels and wash cloths for a family of 5. The breakfast was good, but it ran out fast, but food came out quickly. Overall, I recommend this hotel and it was above average for something at this price.

title: Great Hotel Experience
text: They could not be more accommodating. Cozy nice room, very clean, best breakfast!  Incredible coffee and I’m a native New Yorker very fussy about coffee and food.  I would come back just for the breakfast!  Very comfortable beds pillows!

title: Almost Perfect
text:
Perfectly located hotel with VERY clean rooms and a staff that could not be nicer if they tried. Everyone was friendly, helpful and clearly were there to make my short stay enjoyable. 

The morning breakfast was superb. Lots of fresh variety and the hot food was hot and the cold food cold. 

But there needed to be more people at check-in. One person cannot check in a hotel's worth of guests. The wait was too long.

The room was VERY clean and well laid out. A little small for me but fine for most. I would absolutely stay again.

title: Normal hotel, fine for NYC standards
text: My wife, mother-in-law, and I stayed for 2 nights in NYC at this hotel and the experience was just so-so. Sure the breakfast is free, but it is so crowded during that time and the food & service is below average compared to other Hampton Inns I've stayed at around the country. The location is very close to all of the tourist attractions, so if that's your deal you'll be set. We've had better experiences staying at Hamptons and Hiltons outside of this general area of NYC.

title: Great Stay
text: Nice location, convenient to everything I needed, friendly staff. This is the second time I've stayed at this location and I'll be back. Rooms were extremely clean, bed was very comfortable.  I was able to check in a little early and was greeted with a friendly smile. Great experience.

title: Great Location for Broadway
text: I love this location. It is so close to the broadway shows. I also love the breakfast in the morning. The waffle maker is divine and everyday the breakfast is different. The staff at the front dest is always friendly and helpful.  I have been staying at the Hampton in for years.  I'm a Gold Member Hilton Honors Member and I enjoy the benefits that it gives.

title: Hampton New York
text: good location, efficient staff and friendly.  Hotel is near many restaurants as well as penn station is within walking distance.  look forward to staying there again on my next trip to new york.      wifi was good as well

title: Great location, service and location!  Affordable, with  large rooms (by NYC standards).
text:
I have stayed in many hotels in the Midtown Manhattan and this one has much to recommend it above others in its price range (about $300 per night with taxes included).  1.  It’s location couldn’t be better. Walkable to everything in Times Square area.  And subway. 2.  Staff at front desk and lobby area were polite, responsive and well-trained. 3.  The rooms (at least the one I stayed in) were much larger than just about all of the comparably priced rooms in the area. King Study, AAA rate. It was clean and well-kept.  And I did not hear any traffic noise (floor 10).  

For price, location, room size and service, you’re not likely to find better!

title: Nicht zufrieden
text: Ich war mit meiner Frau in diese Hotel und ich kann nur sagen das Hotel ist eine Katasophe!Es stinkt in Zimmer,die Klimaanlage ist dreckig. Es gibt kein platz für Koffer.Die Tepiche sind sehr schmuzig..Ich kann dieses Hotel wirklich nicht empfehlen.

title: Perfect Location; Quite Decent Hotel
text:
Just spent three nights at the Hampton. This was our first time at this hotel and we were quite satisfied. By New York standards, the room was quite large. Two Queen beds, comfortable chair, refrigerator, closet and safe. Though we were on the back of the building, the windows were large and there was plenty of light. Staff was helpful and friendly. And while the breakfast wasn't lavish, it was fine. 

For us, location was perfect. Close enough to Times Square and the theaters. But enough away to be out of the craziness. And there were literally hundreds of restaurants within a stone's throw of the hotel.  We walked everywhere; totally safe no matter time of day or night.

title: Dejlig centralt hotel
text: Har boet der 3 dage og stedet er perfekt til teater besøg og selve miljøet er super der. Super flinkt personale og ok morgenmad, dog skal der være mere styr på gæster ved morgenmaden, da der er et stort virvar ved borde og buffeten

title: Would not stay there again
text: Great location and easy to walk to many places. Lots of food outlets nearby. We arrived by train at Penn Station and it was an easy 10-minute walk from there. Although our booking had been confirmed by a large booking agency, when we arrived there was no record of the booking (still sorting this out!), which resulted in an inferior tiny room with no view and no space to even open our cases properly. Clean room though. Breakfast was very basic with disposable plates and cutlery but a reasonable variety. Only two elevators servicing 32 floors and almost 200 rooms which led to bottlenecks in the very narrow foyer (not helped when one of the elevators broke down!). This hotel was not up to the usual Hilton chain standards.

title: Ok hotel.
text: Typical NYC Hampton Inn. Smallish rooms, cramped bathroom with small sink and 2/3 shower. Only two small elevators for over 26 floors so always a wait. Location is good though. Breakfast was typical but crowded. It's NY I guess.

title: NYC 2017
text: Clean, comfortable room with excellent staff. Great breakfast  options. Walking  distance from many fun attractions. Great price for weekend vacation. Close easy walking distance  to many attractions. We will be back :D

title: Beautiful, affordable hotel in the heart of New York City.
text: The wife and I decided to get away for the weekend. Beautiful, clean, comfortable rooms & beds. Great staff, concierge was amazing & very helpful. We were able to walk down a few streets to Time Square.

title: All Requests Fulfilled.
text: This past weekend my daughter and I traveled to NYC and stayed at this Hampton. I am a Hilton's Honor client and except good service since I generally only stay at Hilton Hotels. I have a problem with fragrances and request nothing with a harsh odor be used in the room. I also have a problem with sleeping so I request a room high and not near an elevator. Lucky for me all was fulfilled. The breakfast served was very good. All staff was extremely helpful.

title: Decent hotel in the south of Time Square
text: I like the hotel because it was so close to everything but the room is small.  The rate is decent though so I can't complain.  They don't have an in and out parking privilege and had to pay $65 everytime we take the car out.

title: You get what you pay for.
text: A great location for tourists as it is close to transport and Times Square is a short walk. A number of cheaper restaurants nearby as well as beer and wine shops. The room was small but clean with a good bathroom. Breakfast which was included in our tariff was a real hit and miss affair. On our first morning there were more people in the small dining area than it could cope with. The choice of food was limited and of only average quality.  The other mornings had better numbers but the same food. Things are obviously done to keep prices down e.g. paper plates and plastic cutlery. There are signs warning about the lifts being slow but it was never a real issue for us. Overall if you don’t set your goals too high, it is a reasonable place to stay.

title: Disappointing Hotel in Manhattan
text: I was told that this was a nice hotel, but it turned out to be very disappointing. I do not think this should be part of a Hilton brand, as it seemed disorganized, impersonal and not well maintained. It seemed like a low-cost hotel for tourists from other countries with kids who were on a budget, yet it cost me as much as a fancy hotel.

title: Average hotel
text:
Our main problem was the staff- they were not friendly.  The room size (3_03) worked for a group of four.  No view even though it was the top floor.   The elevator was a challenge but it was fun to bet how. Any times we would stop on our way up or down.  A cleaning cart was left or stored outside of our room. Which made  it difficult to get in and out due to the small hall a the closet door did stay closed we would have to squeeze in.  Called the front desk but was still there 2 mornings.  Had to turn and lift our luggage to get by.  
Avoid using 9th ave especially at night lot of people "hanging out" on the corners.

title: Great Experience at Hampton Inn
text: The hotel is conveniently located in lower Times Square area. It's attractive and modern. Rooms are on the small side but have great bathrooms (big glass shower) and decent closet space. The entire staff was friendly and professional. We had a very pleasant weekend stay. A great breakfast is included with the room. There was hot and cold food available.

title: Good experience at Hampton
text: I was booked at the Hampton through booking.com the Hotel offer first class quality services ranging from staff, cleanliness of rooms and room service, ease of travel round NY, etc; it was a excellent 10 days and would recommend this hotel for people on a business trip or holiday who was an experience of a good quality hotel at the heart of Manhattan

title: Hotel nicht zu empfehlen
text: Ich bin gerade im Hotel Hampton Inn Manhattan und liege bereits seit einigen Stunden wach, da die Betten sowie Kissen unglaublich unbequem sind! Das Hotel ist das Geld nicht wert und wer hier schreibt Hotel top kann ich echt nicht verstehen. Wenn man ins Hotel reinkommt erschlägt es einem fast vom Gestank der Teppiche. Die Handtücher sind gewaschen stinken jedoch ebenfalls und riechen keineswegs als hätte man Waschmittel benutzt. Das Zimmer ist klein und man hat keine Möglichkeiten seine Kleider unterzubringen. Ich bin wirklich enttäuscht und bereue es dieses Hotel aufgrund der restlichen Tripadvisor Bewertungen gebucht zu haben und freue mich wenn ich morgen wieder schnell aus diesem Hotel raus darf.

title: Hampton by Hilton Times Square South
text: Enjoyed my New York experience and stay in this hotel.  Htel well located near TImes Square but not so near that it was noisy.  Our room was moslty very quiet. Staff were excellent and very courteous and willing to assist. I would recommend the hotle for a vist to the city.

title: Well located, quiet
text: unlike some equally star rated hotels this one didn't have noisy air-con and poor soundproofing. They did replace the towels and cleaned up, though the beds and sheets could be better quality, on the cheaper side

title: Good Location, Clean and Modern
text: The location is central to most everything. The rooms are clean, decorated modernly and roomy for the price. My room had a decent view of the city, street side. The staff was very friendly and aimed to please. I will definitely be back on my next visit!

title: Déception...
text:
hôtel très décevant 
.. Accueil dans un hall bruyant, bondé,staff indifférent voir excédé ce samedi là. 
Que sommes nous venus faire dans cet endroit ? 
Certes, chambre correcte, sdb fonctionnelle, mais tellement de bémols : impossible quelque soit l'heure d'accéder au petit déjeuner, sols et tables très sales, queue impossible notamment pour les gaufres (comment y accéder quand la personne devant vous en prépare 10...)   Nous avons tenté 2matins puis avons renoncé. Donc petits dej à nos frais à l'extérieur.. 

Ascenseurs désespérants, prix démesurés
A fuir... 
Ceci a quelque peu gâché notre séjour à NY.

title: Good
text: Rightly placed in the town, Bit expensive but if the price is not a problem definitely a nice place with good food, banks and Penn and Grand central stations around.  One of the accommodations to people visiting time square and shop around

title: Business trip
text: Not sure if this is a fair review as this is only the second time that I stayed at a hotel in NY.  Guest rooms are small but maybe it's just very typical in NY.  The hotel does serve breakfast which is not bad   You can hear street noise when you try to get some sleep but again, maybe that's just what it is in the Manhattan area.  Compared to other Hampton Inns in other states, I am not totally impressed.  I think you will just have to spend some serious money to get something much better.

title: US Open trip
text: Came for a three day trip to New York for the US open tennis tournament. The hotel has great value for its location.  The rooms are a little tight but of course this is Manhattan. The breakfast was appreciated.  There's a lot of construction on the block so going in and out in taxis or Uber took a long time.Would stay again for the right price.

title: Good value
text: This was a last minute business trip for three prople. Market prices in NYC were very high and this property offered great value. The hotel was Clean with friendly staff, Decent centric location, but small rooms/shower spaces.

title: Hotel in the Hell's Kitchen area.
text: Really liked this hotel.  It is in a bank of hotels.  Staff friendly, accommodating and the breakfast was very good.  Hot and plentiful. Have to admit the corners of 8th and 9th Av made me feel unsafe.   9th Av near Port Authority so the neighborhood is a bit seedy.  There were drunks on both corners of the street.  I would choose another Hilton not in that area if I could.  Because it was a holiday weekend, the price for the room was high.

title: Rude staff, unhelpful
text: I stayed 2 nights , vending machine did not work, breakfast area small, staff did not give soft drink until I insisted, one staff lies to me about tape being on fridge because it didn't work, she told me to go to holiday inn next door to buy drink, another staff member told me drinks are only for gold members, but it is not clear how he determined I was not  gold member.   They did not  supply new soap the second day.  They were disorganized and did not follow through valet parking.   I always stay at Hampton Inn but this one I am not happy with.

title: Nice room
text: There are about 31 floors with only 6 rooms on each floor. The elevators get busy especially at breakfast time which is from 6-10am. The room was spacious and well appointed, with an alarm clock, iron, phone, desk and a large tv. It is very close to the theater district and the bus terminal.

title: Ganz in Ordnung
text: Das Hotel hat eine gute Ausgangsposition. Die Zimmer sind sehr klein aber sauber. Sauberkeit im Frühstücksbereich könnte besser sein. Bereich war sehr beengt. Das ganze Personal war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.

title: Un buon Hotel
text: Abbiamo soggiornato cinque notti, l'hotel è buono, la colazione pure! La posizione è centrale, molto comoda. L'unica nota negativa è stata la stanza poco spaziosa, ma a NYC è spesso così. Io lo consiglio. Molto carina e gentile la ragazza che ci ha dato consigli preziosi su come organizzare la nostra visita.

title: Bad experience with this location. Found rotten cake in my refrigerator booked 2 rooms one room lock did not work
text: Bad experience with this location. Found rotten cake in my refrigerator upon arrival. Booked 2 rooms one room keys did not work till 1030pm that night waste of that room. They finally figured that the problem was with the battery on the lock for the key meantime I am locked outside. Manager Jim and engineer who finally showed up at 10pm was very rude. Would not recommend

title: Good location
text: Good location for theatre district. We stayed on second floor to avoid using elevator which was busy during peak times. Good breakfast with make your own waffles and excellent banana bread. Room was small but perfect for our stay. Looked like it had recently been renovated.

title: Okey...
text: OK hotell and service  Did not care for paper plates and plastic knifes and forks in the breakfast hall. Breakfast room was way to small and sometimes we had to take the breakfast with us to the room because there was no space left to sit...and we where not the only once - defently a room the should expand

title: Small  room & extremely small bathroomSmall Bathroom
text: I felt very cramped in room.  I weight 209 lbs and I touched the shower wallk. I didn't not like that feeling f touching the shower walls.   I didn't like the idea, the room attendant knock on my door prior to I checking out of the room at Noon.

title: Meh
text: I need to be up front about the fact that I really wanted in a booked-full Doubletree on 36th and in a phone call earlier in the week  I thought I made this clear but when a room opened up and I tried on a Thursday to change my Saturday reservation from this Hampton to that Doubletree I was informed that I would be charged the full amount if I changed. It's 2017, Hilton, and that's what's so great about technology: a few keystrokes and the change could have been made. I would have been happy instead of still stewing about all this. So here we go. The lobby here is TINY and the room attenuates in front of the elevators then widens for the coffee and tea station then further widens for the breakfast room. The girl at the check in desk was polite and capable, took our bag and tagged it and assured me she'd text me when our room was ready. Never happened. We arrived back after dinner and took our room on the 22nd floor. Nice enough, clean but I probably would not have sprung for the "upgrade" which brought our little sojourn on 39th to over $300 for a decidedly average stay. The vibe at this hotel is reserved, even a little cold. Compared with other NYC Hilton properties, it is my least favorite. I did enjoy the Canadian bacon and bagel I had at breakfast and the apple was very good. Just nothing memorable about the experience and I would not return.

title: Short stay @Hampton
text: Lovely stay at Hampton. Between 34th street (Empire State Building) and 42nd (Time square), close to shops (Macy and others). Truly centrally located. Pleasant staff and good cleaning crew. Nice breakfast and tea and coffee available 24hrs 👍🏾

title: Mejor imposible
text:
Super céntrico. Muy limpio. Habitaciones amplias y camas muy cómodas. Personal muy amable. De los pocos que incluye desayuno buffet. Disposición de café y te gratis 24h. Aunque está muy bien ubicado no se siente en las habitaciones el ruido de la ciudad. Aire acondicionado perfecto. Baño limpio y cómodo. Relación calidad precio estupenda. 
Volveré sin duda. Lo recomiendo.

title: Great hotel for the price
text: This is a great hotel for the price. A good location, close enough to Times Square but not noisy. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly and helpful. Our only issue was the elevators sometimes take a long time, which can be frustrating. That said, I'd still recommend.

title: Pleasant weekend stay in NYC Close to Times Square
text: This Hampton Inn is within a reasonable walking distance to Times Square and a subway station. The hotel and rooms were clean. They also provide hot/cold breakfast options which was good to have. When we arrived the front desk staff warned us that after 8:30 am the breakfast room would be very busy. During our first morning we learned that he was absolutely right. Not a lot of room to sit and eat at that time. This is NYC so yes the rooms are small compared hotels in other parts of the country. We had a room with two double beds and it was pretty tight. The room did have a small closet and the bathroom has a single sink, a toilet and a shower. There is a medicine cabinet so you can store toiletries there as well. There's only two elevators which are small so be prepared to wait during busy times such as breakfast or check out. We had a room on the 31st floor so noise wasn't an issue for us. Although the room was small, we knew that this is mostly the case in NYC, plus we were spending our time walking in the city so this was not a big issue for us. Finally, we did learn that the street this is in is the only one that leads to a major tunnel in the city, so it gets very busy with traffic. If you're trying to catch a taxi or an Uber it is best to walk to one of the streets perpendicular to 39th Street.

title: Hampton Inn Times Square South
text: This Hampton Inn is in a great location, convenient to Times Square.  Rooms were clean, Internet worked, and the staff was very helpful in many ways.  The only issue was the two elevators which were very busy during the mornings, so we simply walked down the 16 flights of stairs.  Not a really big deal, but the wait time was long.  But during the day time, it was not a big deal.

title: Hampton Inn - Manhattan/Times Square South
text: The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. They provided recommendations and tips for navigating NYC. The kept our bags after checkout so we could continue to explore the city before our departure. The location was amazing; we were within walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do. The rooms were very clean and because it's on a side street, it was quiet.

title: Not worth the price to stay near Times Square
text: You would think this is a typical Hampton Inn, it isn't.  The rooms are cramped (double bed room we stayed in), the bathrooms shower stall is unthinkably narrow, hallways are tiny and narrow.  The rooms aren't soundproof with any one talking in hallway could be heard as clear as a person in the room and thinking vice versa.  Hotel staff isn't caring for even HHonors members.  In short, not worth for the money you pay.  I would rather pay a little extra and stay at other hotels in the chain or outside Hilton chain.

title: Hampton Manhattan 39th ST
text: Good trip A little culture shock Rooms are very compact Not good for family with children No exact space for nothing. Two elevator working on the same circuit as Only one elevator  Breakfast was good Employees were very helpful.

title: 3 night stay
text:
This hotel was brilliant! A stones throw from Times Square, it offered complimentary breakfast each morning and whilst it is busy and hard to get a seat in due to its business, I can't fault the staff for their customer service!

We had a lovely guy called John help us with our stay, giving us advice on the bus tours and his great personality was really lifting in a strange city we had never been to before.

A great hotel room with all the amenities you could ask for and a wide range of TVs channels not that you need them in the big apple!

Loved our stay and would happily go back again if given the chance in the future!!

title: It'll do - Safe and clean, would stay again if the price is right..great pub next door!
text:
I won't rehash prior reviews, but in short this is a nice Hampton Inn, safe and workable for someone needing to be in Midtown.  Right in the garment district, the neighborhood is safe but not as sanitized as the areas right by Times Square.  

Lobby is tight (it's weird how tiny the waiting area for the elevator is), and the breakfast area gets packed, but that's can be the case with any Hampton property.   

My advice is to stay on low floors - there's no great views to be had, and the elevators are small and you end up waiting 5-10 minutes on the upper floors.  Would be nice to be able to bail out to the stairwell if you're in a hurry.

Also, there's an AMAZING pub just a few doors down with a great menu and fantastic atmosphere.  I'd stay here again just to eat at Tir na Nog - the best!

title: Surprise, surprise
text: I must say that we were very surprised and impressed with the Hampton Inn. The room was the right size and it was very clean. The early morning breakfast was excellent (they added different items every morning, not the same basics). It is close to everything, we parked and walked everywhere. I will stay every time.

title: Absolutely Horrible
text: I was give one towel, there was no internet, and when I tried to use the business center, I would constantly get kicked off after 5 minutes of use.    What takes the cake is that I had lost my ATM card and was paying for it with my temp card and the front desk agent didn't want to accept it because my name wasn't on the card.

title: Cramped with unresponsive service
text: Cramped room with no space for our suitcase.  A/C was extremely noisy, sink did not drain, toilet paper holder pops off the wall.  We were only provided with 2 bath towels for family of 4 despite requests for extra.  Inadequate space in breakfast area, had to bring food up and eat on our bed.  Problems were not dealt with when brought up to staff.

title: Great for proximity to Time Square
text: The location is an easy walk just a few blocks to Time Square.  The room was small but nice, modern, comfy king bed, fridge; we were in 2304 so didn't hear road noise and its just out from time square so not all the lights and sounds; Small bath but functional.  Mostly we were out in the city so the room size was fine. The hotel was recently renovated. The breakfast was popular so the selection was limited the later we arrived; saran wrapped apples were nice to take with us for the day; waffle maker is good.  It's all what you would expect from Hampton Inn.  The only issue was that the elevator was slow and the hallway from lobby to elevator is very narrow so there can be a back up of people waiting with luggage.  We paid with points and cash so it was a good rate compared to most NYC hotels in the area so we were happy with our choice for this trip.

title: Great hotel!
text: This hotel was in a great location - on a road I would consider a side street - you couldn't hear the road traffic (29th floor).  Easy walking distance (a few miles maybe) to the museums, Central Park, Times Squar, and other Manhattan highlights.  Close to the subway and the port authority.  The rooms were small and cramped, which we fully expected for NYC so not an issue.  I normally do not like staying near the elevator but our room was very quiet.  The staff was very friendly from the front desk to the housekeeping staff and the concierge.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Manhattan weekend...
text: Found this hotel to exactly what in says on the tin. It's very close to Times Square and all that has to offer. We had a very nice weekend with 4 persons staying in a twin bedded room. It was cosy but for Manhattan I expect nothing different. The breakfast was typical "free hotel fayre" bagels, waffles, toast, cereals, fruit, yoghurt and a couple of hot options (bacon and 'ready to eat' omelettes one day and sausages and scrambled egg the next). Staff on the front desk were efficient and pleasant. Only six rooms per floor so the two lifts were adequate for the 32 floors - sometime there as a wait but it was never very long. It wasn't cheap but it was ok value for a weekend in August in New York.

title: Séjour de 4 nuits à New-York
text: Hotel bien situé à 2 pas de Times square et à quelques rues de la 5th avenue. Metro à proximité. 32 étages, 6 chambres par étage . Chambre King side au 29 eme étage avec une belle vue. Chambre confortable avec frigo,café, climatisation, bornes de rechargement USB, produits  de toilette NEUTROGENA. Service de conciergerie à disposition. De nombreux restaurants à proximité. Personnel efficace et souriant. Petit déjeuner copieux et varié compris dans le prix de la chambre. Je conseille cet hôtel, il m'a totalement donné satisfaction pour un premier séjour à New-York.

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. It was conveniently located in the heart of Time Square and very close to the subway.  A short walk would get you to Broadway.  Restaurants were close as well. We felt very safe.  The rooms were nice with all the amenities we needed.  We loved it.

title: Hampton Inn Times Square
text: long wait for a room at check in, poor staff attentiveness, long wait for elevators, overcrowded lobby, overcrowded breakfast room, small rooms, found items in the room broken, staff slow to respond. Check out was the only thing that was normal. Staff not real helpful in helping to arrange a taxi.

title: Excellent place to stay in NYC on a Budget!
text: This hotel was extremely clean, very well appointed and apparently recently remodeled.   Couldn't have asked for a nicer experience.  The icemaker on the floor also provided water and ice for our water bottles everyday!  Very small hotel (6 rooms per floor) but convenient to Times Square.  They kept our luggage upon checkout, which was a great relief to us, and they were ready when we checked in earlier than expected!  Rooms are very small, as expected for NYC, but the bath cabinet was a great addition to solve the storage and space problem!

title: buon hotel
text:
ottima posizione , ottime  stanze , piccolo il bagno e non tanto grande la stanza .
colazione allo stesso  livello degli altri hotel concorrenti .....ascensori insufficienti per un hotel di 32 piani , per il resto tutto a posto

title: Pleasant stay
text: Very good location.  Not quite near times square, but within a short walking distance.  Excellent service. Courteous staff. Nice room and amenities. Breakfast was good with nice selection. Reasonable price for peak season. Will definitely visit again.

title: Centrale pulito efficiente
text:
Della catena Hilton. Nel pieno centro di Manhattan rimane un hotel comodo e con prima colazione inclusa molto soddisfacente 
Camere non grandissime ma pulite 
Unico problema solo due ascensori.  Nelle ore di punta si aspetta un po'. Non prendete piani alti. Internet a disposizione e Wi-Fi in camera

title: Nice Hampton and Helpful Staff
text: This was a nice typical Hampton.  We picked this location to be in the heart of Times Square, but Times Square was a few blocks away.  The breakfast was good with a variety of options.  This is a tall hotel with only 6 rooms on 32 floors with only 2 elevators, so be prepared to wait.  Peter at the front desk was very helpful.  We were pretty disappointed with the Concierge located in the hotel.  We assumed the concierge was employed by the Hilton and the hotel and there to help the guests.  It turns out they are just there to make a sale and not employed by Hilton.

title: Centrally located
text: This Hampton is centrally located and close to many NYC sites. The rooms were clean yet small. The staff was helpful and welcoming. The food was basic and what you may expect from a Hampton. The street could be loud but not unmanageable.

title: HVAC Units From Hell
text: As a previous Road Warrior averaging 100-150 night's on the road a year for nearly 30 years,  I thought I had found the worst of everything. WRONG! The heating / cooling unit in the room never  stopped cycling on and off every 10-30 seconds for 2 days and especially night's! Impossible to get a good night's rest. I have stayed in this hotel before and unfortunately I keep forgetting why I did not make this place my first choice. I have experienced this same issue in this same hotel, nut nit neccesarily the same room more than a couple if times. Have complained about it at least once before. This time  I will not forget it. These two hot noisy nights will stick in my mind forever. Great location. Great staff. Horrible sleepless nights!

title: Horrible! BAD BAD BAF
text: Hilton booked the wrong type of room in the wrong hotel! Horrible Costumer Service! No one could take ownership of the mistakes they made! Ruined our vacation! This is a whole in the wall - should not be approved with Hilton/ Hampton Inn Standards which are not elegant but you always get good service and cleanness! The room was horrible did not have a closet and was named "Suite"

title: Aliza was rude and unconcerned!
text: The service at the front  was rude and they all had bad attitudes. They all were not helpful. The hotel has a very small area for the breakfast area. It was about 50 people in one area. They only had 2 waffle machine.

title: No complaint
text:
Hotel was very nice and very clean. This hotel is in a great location. Times square and broadway  is a short(5 to 10 minutes) walk away and subway is even closer. Room is small but that's to be expected in N.Y.C. 
Breakfast was good. Especially the light and fluffy waffles. No real complaints here. Would definitely return.

title: Excellent location!
text: Staying in the Garment District was fun but still super close to Penn Station, Times Square and easy access to the subway.  The only complaint was they don't sell stamps or offer to mail your postcards.  Thankfully the biggest, prettiest Post Office is across from Penn Station!  The rooms were efficient and clean and we had a great city view.

title: Great location, small but clean.
text: Had a good time at the hotel. Stayed there for 3 nights from 7/4-7/7. Staff is helpful, rooms are clean and the location is great. Few things that they can work on include fixing the elevator. The wait is long as there are only two elevators. The breakfast is great. Would surely go back

title: Good Time in Times Square
text:
Spent five nights at this Hampton.  Clean, comfortable, nice staff and good breakfast selection.  Rooms are small by most standards, but fairly typical for the mid-level chains in NYC.  

Hotel is a quick 5 min walk to the Port Authority Bus Terminal, Times Square and multiple subway stops.  Easy 5 block walk to Penn Station.  Close to Javits Center.

Will definitely consider staying here again on my next trip into NYC.

title: Hotel clean , neighborhood so so
text:
Small hotel, it is clean , but tje rooms are very small . Very hard to walk around . Very difficult for a family of three.
Shower is so small it is,hard to fit in.
Had to shower sideways .
Wouldnt recommend for families

title: Great
text: Good location for Times Square, great staff and rooms, lots of extras - free hot/cold drinks in reception, fresh cookies daily, breakfast bags etc. Would return to this hotel and recommend to friends.

title: buena experiencia
text: aceptable hotel. muy buena atencion en frontdesk. cerca de todo. desayuno con las limitaciones de los estados unidos. Diferentes a los nuestros. Habitacion confortable.No es barato. es una razonable opcion

title: Could have been a much better stay
text:
I arrived about 2:10 and while my king room was not ready, the reception staffer helpfully offered to put me in a different room with two beds. Unfortunately, the room had a very bad smell -- something like wet carpet and/or mold and/or sweat. The room appeared clean -- except for something left behind in the safe -- but the smell was just not pleasant and did not go away, even with the window open. WiFi was okay, but not really fast enough for serious work -- complimentary WiFi only got up to about 3 mbps, and didn't work quite as well on the side of the room furthest from the door. The shower's water pressure was OK, but not great. Bed was comfortable and linens were very clean. TV worked fine. Room had tons of outlets and USB ports, which was nice.

One REALLY annoying thing was that I was awoken at 5:50 AM in the morning by the room's alarm. It should be on the housekeeping department's check list to turn off the alarm when a room is turned over, so other guests aren't "treated" to a former guest's early wake-up time. This was really annoying and I couldn't fall back asleep.

Another problem was that, when I arrived, I thought to take advantage of the free coffee/tea service, but when I went to grab a cup off coffee, I saw that fruit flies were all over the coffee containers. I could have still drank the coffee, of course, but it was disgusting and I'm sure the health department wouldn't approve either. 

In the morning, the hotel was fixing an elevator, so there was only one elevator for the 30-story hotel. The hotel put the elevator on manual operation, though, and staffed it with an assistant, so it wasn't actually that bad. 

Breakfast was a normal Hampton Inn breakfast -- eggs, pork sausage, bread, yogurt, etc.

I specifically chose the hotel for the location close to the Port Authority, but I wouldn't encourage visitors to NYC to choose this location. Times Square is increasingly terrible with the sidewalks full of "artists" and the streets full of filth. Tourists would be better suited to choose a hotel in Chelsea or Union Square or the Lower East Side. Times Square is the worst of New York, unless, as in my case, I just needed a hotel between the Port Authority and Penn Station.  

I suppose I wouldn't be upset about returning to this hotel, but if I did, I would hope that I would receive a pleasant smelling room.

title: Great location
text:
This hotel is in a great location to Times Square. There is a new hotel going in across the street so there was some confusion at check-in, but they were good to make up for it.

Breakfast was the same as other Hamptons but they did keep there breakfast area very clean and stocked considering the busy times

title: A Good Choice.
text:
This hotel, as you can tell from the name has a great Manhattan location and was so easy to get to after a delayed flight and problems on NJ Transit which I was very grateful for.

As I arrived I was a little put out by the fact that there were no staff at the front desk to check me in. Then I looked at my watch and realised it was, surprisingly past 11pm and I was immediately more understanding. The gentleman who checked me in was lovely and professional and this can be said for all staff I encountered during my short stay. 

The room was spotlessly clean and had everything I needed. A comfortable shower, clean, soft towels and a lovely large bed. I was very happy with the room and as it was on the 32nd floor even had a nice view, although nothing spectacular. 

Breakfast in the morning was basic however it was absolutely all I needed. Nice, cute little omelettes, potatoes with pepper and a bakery selection. I believe there were also waffles and pancakes. There were juices and hot drinks on offer also. For me this was a great start to the day and my time in the big apple. 

Overall I really liked this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend or stay again. This hotel offers genuinely good value for money and ticks all the boxes.

title: Good location but very small rooms
text: The location is great because it is on a quiet street. The staff is super, super nice and accommodating. Paola and Peter at the front desk were really great. Francisco was too and a super thumbs up to the staff working the breakfast area. It gets really busy in the mornings and they are working non-stop and very nice. The breakfast is delicious and has a lot of variety. The only bad thing (which I knew when I made the reservation) is that the rooms and hallways are super small and narrow. The elevators are kind of slow especially in the mornings with everyone going down for breakfast. Housekeeping never got it right and they didn't leave the right amount of towels any of the days, not sure why. The a/c in the room was kind of crazy, it was either super cold at 68-69 but if we put it on 70-71, heat started to come out. I never bothered to call front desk about it so we just kept it really cold. Overall very good, especially if you aren't a big family or have a lot of luggage!

title: Perfect for our needs!
text:
We stayed 3 nights!  We were greeted with a friendly welcome and 2 bottles of water, which was refreshing considering it was quite warm.  The lobby was clean, employees were well dressed.  They have warm coffee, and chilled water in a  water dispenser with fresh oranges to cover the chlorine taste of NY water.  

Our room was clean and of nice size!  There were 2 double beds for my wife and I and our 2 upper teenage son's.  Bed's were comfortable.  I am not a fan of passive air movement in bathrooms which this has.  (I just wish hotels would have bathroom fan's for showering.)

Breakfast is provided at no extra charge.  There was your normal fare of fruit, yogurt, pastries, waffle maker, cereal, as well as eggs and sausage.  

There is a fitness center with 4 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, a recumbent bike and an upright bike.  Dumbbell weights in 5# increments from 5 to 50!

Across the street is an entrance to the metro system and there is a shuttle service bus to Newark airport 1 block away!  We walked easily to time square and our broadway show!

There is also a washer and drier in the basement for laundry.

title: Excellent value
text: Although the location is a few blocks out of the action, the service and value are excellent!  Get the parking package if you are driving your own vehicle onto the island. If you can get a high floor on the south side for a great view.

title: Hilton Honors NY Experience
text: Had a good experience in my stay. The room was comfortable, the toilets clean and the staff were friendly. The quality of service was good and the speed was also commendable. My only recommendation would be that the staff should promote the HH membership more by ensuring that every customer that comes check in is asked if they have the HH membership.

title: Great Location and Value
text: This hotel is just a few minute walk from Times Square, Penn Station, and many other points of interest. I stayed for business, and despite being in NYC for less than 24 hours, the location allowed me to spend a little down time enjoying the sites. I'll likely return for a personal stay.

title: I've stayed here 4 times
text: I've stayed her 4 maybe 5 times for work trips in the last 2 months. Nothing bad to say about it. It's not the Ritz but they do their thing well. Rooms are clean. Staff is surprisingly friendly. Definitely my go to place.

title: This is a solid C-  to D+ hotel
text: The rooms are so very small, even by NYC standards.  My husband and I really had to coordinate getting dressed or moving about the room in general as there was no room for anything except the bed.  I think my college dorm room was bigger than this one.  The room was clean, but the two towels in the bathroom would have ended up in the maid's bin if we were at home.  I asked for more towels and was told I needed to call, but we never received them.  I'm guessing my husband must have air-dried after his shower since I must have two because my hair is long.  Never made it to the free breakfast, so no comment there.  Buyer beware - you get what you pay for...very loud neighbors with young children.  The AC unit was very strange: unless the temp was adjusted to 66 degrees or below, the heat came on.  Consequently, the room was either way too cold or way too hot, but at least I got to practice the two extremes of my Goldilocks imitation.  That part was fun.

title: Great staff. Great value for locations
text: Very convenient  location only a few blocks from 42nd St.  Subway.  Extremely efficient and helpful staff both at front desk checkin, for storing bags and valet parking,   Simple but plentiful breakfast and very helpful staff.

title: Great Hotel location, Fantastic Staff
text: The location of the hotel was good because I had a show to do at Javits Center. Staff was helpful, rooms though small were very clean, good restaurants with in walking distance. The breakfast was excellent and the staff kept if filled and they were very helpful.

title: Good for Javits but other things to think about.
text:
This is a Hilton/Hampton so it meets their standards. It is clean, modern, and the breakfast is OK. The 4.95 upcharge for hi-speed internet is fair and Hilton generally does a better job with internet than Marriott. Speed was around 5mbps which is OK for a hotel. Price was reasonable relative to other choices. It is about a ¾ mile walk to Javits.

However, the area south and east of the bus terminal is pretty gritty; would not be the most attractive for casual travelers or families visiting New York. The rooms are small with limited storage (drawers/closet space). Vanity is tiny—not much room to place anything. Very nice large TV but does not swivel.  6 rooms per floor. Not much sound insulation. Ice machines on 4, 7, 10, 13, 16, and 31. Can be noisy; across from rooms numbered 1 and 2.

title: Great location, nice room!
text: Only stayed for one night at this location for a birthday get away and I would definitely stay again! I loved the location, close but not too close to Times Square, sights and tons of delicious restaurants. We came in on the Amtrak from Penn Station which was an easy 10 minute walk away.  The room was a really nice size for NYC - we had 4 friends over before dinner and it was not overly crowded. We were able to drop off our bags easily before check in (since we arrived well before the room was ready) and after check out. The room was clean, bathroom was also clean. I can never go wrong with Hampton Inn & Suites!
